aboue theyr merytes punyſheth yll men vnder theyr deſeruynges power sunne declared whan ſurmountynge rygorous ſtormes ſturdy wynter moſt dilectable progreſſe luſty ſprynge tyme ſheweth worlde planete lykewyſe kynge whiche gouerneth weale countreye beholdynge benygnely ſtudyouſe occupyed aboute thynges vertuouſe onely doth animate gyue lyfe theyr courage alſo rendreth theyr wytt •••• ſharpneſſe prompt dexteritie armed hardines ther •• 〈◊〉 meruayle great kinges haue counſayles moſte wytty perſon •• ſeinge makyng great wyttes theyr puiſſaunce although vertue procedeth immedyately god ſapience lykewyſe yet sapience oftentymes hydde thoſe perſones whome eyther malyctouſe wyttes hateth enuye purſueth fortune contemneth ſayd power annexed vnto kynges maieſtie moſt noble prynce mooſte gracious ſoueraygne lorde amonge dyuerſe haue good experience aboute two yeres paſſed farre aboue myn expectation receyued wordes procedyng mouthe hyghneſſe comfort incredible ſettyng forth dictionary whyche tyme lately begun ſengly lyttell ſtudy inflāmed ſayde comfort dyd afterwarde procede therin moche exactly dyd ampliate warke aboue purpoſed ſo maieſtie infourmed dyuerſe commended diligence withſtandyng ſayd comfortable wordes hyghnes contynually reſortyng vnto remembrance ceſſed prouoke reade ouer eftſones reuolue ſayd warke fearyng god ſhall iudge leſt neglygence eyther ſome wordes lackyng ſom interpretation myſconceyued labor ſhuld vnprofitable vnto reders alſo vnworthy moſt benygne fauourable report excellent maieſty therfore moſte feruently ſtyrred gracis comforte pervſyng ſayd dictionary haue proceded correction amplifycation therof ſuche fourme hereafter foloweth fyrſt ſequeſtrynge ſelfe buſyneſſe onely except wherein bounden ſerue hyghneſſe aſſembled ſuche authours thought ſhulde neceſſary achieuynge whiche toke enterpryſe whoſe name immedyately folowe proheme layenge onely dyd ſeriouſely dilygently trye examyne euery worde eyther ſygnification fourme ſpeakynge called phraſe moughte make doubt ſhulde reade ſame author dyd truely correct lernynge wolde ſerue alſo newe ſpirite hardyneſſe receyued often remembrance gracious ſayde comforte folowynge exaumple suidas greke aduentured make generall collection order letter notable countrays city mountaynes ryuers theyr true deſcriptions boundes commodity name nature ſundry beaſtes foules ſerpentes fyſſhes declaration great number herbes tree fruites gummes precyouſe ſtones metalles whiche neuer man declared ſette forthe englyſhe true definition ſyckeneſſes kyndes maladyes whyche commonly happen men cauſe wherof procede fynally name moſte notable perſonages fyrſt man adam vntyll thre hundred yeres incarnation christe dyd thynge worthy ſpeciall remembrance expedient neceſſary moderation actes procedynges hyſtoryes lyues ſayd perſones compendyouſely gathered haue omytted fable inuentions paynymes eaſy vnderſtandyng poetes alſo thought neceſſary enterlace deteſtable heretykes theyr ſundry hereſyes concernynge ſubſtance catholyke faythe iuſtly condemned hole conſent true chryſten men intente thoſe hereſyes beinge wyſe diuulgate may ſooner eſpyed abhorred ſuche bokes craftily enterlaced holſom doctrine ne knowlege hereſyes may indamage man conſcyence ſome men haue ſuppoſed cōmune knowlege ofte recitation treaſons fornication felony contriued practyſed ſundry facions moche theſe thynges requyre leſſe ſtudy maynteynynge erronious dyuellyſſhe opynyons wherfore knowlege thereof moche daungerouſe yet knowlege bothe one ryght expedient ſens euery thynge neceſſary aforeſee ſhall brynge damage vnto v contrary wyſe mought founden good cōmodiouſe well parte hyſtories fable haue ſette computation tyme callid chronography wherin appereth longe perſons eyther incarnation christe howe longe alſo haue declared auncient coynes weyghtes meaſures conferryng thoſe whiche currant vſuall amonge v haue planted prouerbes callyd adagia ſuch founden latyn authours theyr expoſitions alſo proper termes belongyng phiſyke ſurgery dyuers ſundry artes ſcyences ouer haue declared dyuers greke wordes whyche vſurped latyne author fourme haue fynyſhed warke glorye almyghty god lyttell porfyte truſte englyſhemen whiche ſhall deſyrous doctrine whyche ſhulde neuer haue enterpriſed haue brought concluſyon ben inflamed comforte receyued royall maieſty appereth benygnitie pryncipall gouernours extended whiche honeſt exercyſe dothe ſtere vp greatter ſpiryte wherby theyr wyttes courage appere abundant witneſſes therof great numbres wonderfull lerned men moſte valyant polytyke capytaynes tymes great alexander octauian titus traiane hadriane bothe antonines alexander seuerus moſte noble emperours dyuerſe aduanced dignity many enryched none vnrewarded truly gracis realme great numbre chapleynes honour men famouſe lernynge ſuche wordes hyghneſſe hath openly ſpoken comfortyng alſo commandyng yonge gentylmen enbrace good letter occupied readinge good author fewe yonge men ſtate clergy flouryſſhe doctrine hyghneſſe procedynge ſettynge vp good lecture lyberal ſalaries likely happen right ſhortly realme englande lyke maye compare realme chriſtened temperate ayre abundance thynges whiche neceſſitie man nature requyreth ſo partes honour ſuretie ſhall ſurmount countrays maieſtie gouernynge almighty god hath abundantly endowed principall gyftes grace nature fortune fynally may lyke moſt royal maieſty receyue ſymple labour ſtudy haue eftſones dedicate vnto hyghnes lyke benignitie receyued fyrſte edition whyche neyther dilygence ſyncere exposition copy wordes abundaunce matter ſentence wyſe hereto compared may perceyue hygheneſſe pleaſed fourme exercyſe god gyuynge helthe gracis aſſiſtence fauoure lyuynge quietneſſe neceſſitie intende imploy reſte tyme ſuche ſtudy maieſty ſhall haue cauſe take leſſe thankfully yf ſerued hyghneſſe affaire wherin ſhuld moche trauayle body suche truſte aſſured iudgement haue gracis moſte excellent wyſedome whiche onely botreaux helianus arrianus polybius titus liuius cornelius nepos suetonius valerius maximus quintus curtius iulius capitolinus lampridius ammianus aemilius probus iustinus eurropius cosmographi strabo pomponius mela ptholomeus americus veſputius petrus martyr antonius sabellicus raphael volaterranus recentes chronographi philosophi plato ariſtoteles xenophon theophraſtus plotinus porphyrius proclus philo alexander aphrodiſcus xenocrates seneca cenſorinus boetius iulius firmicus hyginius avthores ſacri moſes agiographi euſebius tertullianus hieronymus epiphanius auguſtinus gennadius avthores ambigui tituli graeci varro plinius solinus aulus gellius macrobius vitruuius vibius sequester frontinus vegetius ludouicus coelius hermolaus barbarus iouianus pontanus eraſmus rotherodamus gulielmus budeus lazarus baph • u georgius agricola robertus senalis de ponderibus menſuris medici hippocrates galenus dioſcorides paulus aegineta alexander trallianus conſtantinus affricanus serapio mesu • h io ruellius io manardus antonius muſa braſceuola io agricola georgius agricola legvm interpretes pandectarum authores andreas alciatus vldericus zaſius claudius cantiuncula fabularum ſcriptores homerus hesiodus ouidius diodorus siculus pauſanias grammatici svidas iul pollux eustathius homeri interpres ariſtophanis interpres priſcianus seruius donatus porphyrio acron pompeius feſtus pedianus angelus politianus pomponius laetus beroaldus bononiensis antonius sabellicus vitellius baptista pius baptista egnatius recentioribus ro stephno ac steph doleto gallis aliquid traduxi linguā nostrā neutrum tamen u que adeo imitatus quin diuersitatis utrius que lingua rationem habuerim ❧ bonis aeqve ac doctis viris constantiss amicis eliota iacta est alea prodit medivm opv non tam recens quam uarium ac multiplex que ob id criticorum stylis ac morſibus uehementer obnoxium nimirū à uobis nihil eſt quod metuam nempe qui alieno ſtadio cum plumbeis pedibus aequis paſſibus incedere ſolebatis non ignauorum hominum hinc inde ſaltuatim procurrentes uerba uellicantes quae litera uel accentu perperam inuertantur igitur tabula prius à uobis perlecta quam errores ac uitia quae crebro soleant inter imprimendum contingere bona fide collegimus lectionis curſu mox ad eandem tabulā uitia corrigetis authoris que nomen ac dignitatem quandoquidē incredibili ſtudio ſubueniendae reipub id opus occeperit aduerſum illiuſmodi fucos▪ crabrones fortititer defendetis caeterum pro mutua beneuolentia inter no ſtudiorū ac uoluntatum similitudine comparata si quid uobis interlegendum occurrerit quod ueſtris eruditis oculis minus ſatisfecerit aliquantiſper ſtilum continebitis quouſ que collecta obfirmata que memoria ſcribentis uoluntatem ac diligentiam cum illis authoribus à quibus aut uerbum aliquod uel ſententiā ſeu cuius quam rei deſcriptionem coepiſſe uideatur mature contuleritis traductione uerborum ac ſententiarum eloquentiā ullam non expectabitis illa quicquid mihi nimium feſtinanti interciderit concinnabitis tum legibus amicitiae tantum tribuetis ut amicum dormitantem seu uerius oneri ſuccumbentem ab inuidorum dentibus obiecto quopiam honeſto elogio uindicetis ſi non alio ſaltem iſto eliota uir equeſtris ne ullo malo otio pernicioſouè negotio uitam infirmaret ut que aliqua ex parte de repub bene meritus eſſe uideretur aliis rebus omnibus neglectis quae tum opes maximas tum ſummas dignitates polliceri ſoleant id oneris aſſumpſit quo tū literas latinas ſcire cupientes facilius inſtrueret tum iiſdem literis mediocriter imbutos uaria uerborum ſuppellectili multip lici que rerum cognitione locorum que hominum spectaculo magi illuſtrium ad ſtudium capeſcendum acrius incitaret quod cum effecerit se uoto liberabit tam arduo negotio ſi ab eo quic quam imprudenter exciderit quod ſolidae doctrinae fraudi non fuerit uel puritatem lingua latinae minus infecerit ne dum probitati morum offecerit nec ſanitati corporis quic quam nocuerit eſſent medius fidius nimium ingrati ne dicam improbi qui labenti non potius manum porrigerent quam inſultando gratiam imminuerent id genus elogii uobis amici non minus honorificum quam mihi iure amicitiae debitum quippe quod non ſolum humanitatis laudem ſed uerae ſapientiae apud homines opinionem ſit uobis allaturum humanum quidem eſt labi errare decipi labantem non ſuſtinere aut errantem uiam nō reducere aut deceptū consilio aut opera nō iuuare si poſsis amicum praeſertim non modo inhumanum exiſtimatur uerum etiam bonis omnibus execrandum moribus nihil habere commune cum beluis bonis que fauere prorſus ſapientis eſt que ab omnibus amplectendum modicum officium eſt quod à uobis peto que parua re quam nec inimico ne dum aduerſario ipſe pernegarem tam chara ſemper mihi fuit respub ut quem eam nouerim inſigne quoduis beneficium molientem hunc non potuerim honorificis uerbis non proſequi laudare extollere quamuis mihi caetera uita ac moribus minus probaretur hoc opere ut ab omnibus bene audiam equidem non laboro cū id ne que platoni ne que cicerone ne que deo illi maeonio contingere quidem potuerit gaudebo ſanè ſi mea beneuolentia rempub nobilitatem amor charitas plebem tum à rege doctiſs tū à uobis ueſtrum que ſimillimisita comprobentur ut haud indignum exiſtimetis quem ueſtro patrocinio aduerſus calumniatorum impetum defendere uolueritis hoc tandem uos neſcire nollem tam uerbalia nomina quam etiam participia à plaera que praetermiſſa quod uerbis primigeniis ex literarū ordine facile compertis leuiore negotio quae ab eis deriuentur inuenire poteritis ne uobis ineptire uidear longis logis hoc tandem breuiter capiatis si meū hoc labore qualemcun que conatū à uobis liberaliter acceptum defenſum que cognouero à longe maiora molimina opera que ii multo praeſtantiora breuiter expectabitis salveti erratum obsecro te amice lector ne quic quam ex hac bybliotheca tuum uſum capias prius quam erratum typographi nimium feſtinantis ex hac tabella caſtigaueris ne author de ſua patria bene meritus immerito gratiam illi debitam amittat ac tu itidē ſpem ac fortaſsis laborem imprudenter perdideris aijt reade abijt abiudicauit put adiudicauit auita put aulta acer wyche reade reade tricôlon turricula lyttell towne reade lyttel towre veritanus ager ſelde reade fielde veromanditi rede veromandui vertere fugam uertere plyght rede flyght vitiſator ſelleth vynes reade ſetteth vrua reade vrna vſucapia reade vſucapio ante b signifieth ab ab ſame ſygnifycation goeth word begynneth cō ſonant ab ab goth word doth begin vowel alſo amonge olde romaine note marke acquital tranſgreſſours therfore cicero called litera ſalutaris letter ſaulfgarde aaron ſonne amram brother moſes worde ſignifyeth mountaigne fortitude ſtronge hyll man tribe leui fourthe hym lineall diſcent proper tongue eloquent electe god fyrſt byſhoppe iewes lyued lxxiii yeres dyed people mount oreb whan ben byſhop xxxvi yeres afore incarnation chriſte mcccclxxi yeres ab accidentibus officer vnto belongeth wryte ſuch thynges chaūce abacus table inbowed wheron pyllars ſtande abacti officer depoſed ſuche conſtrayned reſigne theyr authoritie abactor ſtealer cattell abactores theues ſteale cattell abactus tus theft cattell abactus magiſtratus depriued office abacuk epiphamus prophet whiche trybe simeon propheſied lamented takynge hieruſalem nabuchodonoſor afterwarde caryed meate drynke herueſt men aungell toke hym vp heare head caryed hym babylon broughte hym dongeon daniel prophet amonge lion beinge fed relieued hym ofteſones caryed home ſame day dyed ii yeres iewes retourned abhorrynge odious abſynthites wyne wherin wormwood hath ben infuſed ſodden abſynthium commonly called wormwood howe therof thre kyndes seriphium whiche ſemeth oure wormewood santonicum wherof commeth hylle occean ſea agaynſte spayne whiche called oone hercules pyllars abyſsus auguſtin depenes without bottomeambroſi ante c ac ſygnifyeth ſometyme doctus ac iuſtus e thou arte hunnynge iuſte sometyme taken haud secus ac iuſsi faciunt none wyſe commaunded sometyme ſignifyeth superbis perinde ac ſi rex eſses thou arte proude thou kynge acadaemia vniuerſytie whiche toke name place nyghe athene plato table alſo liinge woman chyld ſomtyme ſyttynge broode byrdes foules accubitores ſyt table accubitum bed couche lye daye tyme maner olde romaynes eate lyenge theyr beddes accubitus lyinge ſayde maner maketh mattier conuenient ſerueth purpoſe ad rem pertinet belongeth purpoſe ad rem ſuam ſapere plaut trucul wyse owne profytte ad reſtem re redijt thynge diſpayre❀ eraſ chil 1 cent 5 whiche prouerbe came whiche dyd hange ſelues bycauſe ſo good fortune loked thynges happened accordynge vnto theyr expectation ad ſummum moſte ad ſapientiam huius nimius nugator fuit regarde wyſdom fole ad tempus ſeaſon ſomtyme according tyme alſo tyme ad tria millia thre thouſande ad uerbum worde worde ad uiuum reſecare • cic de • mic de finib towche quycke prouerbe taken paryng nayles vntyll bloud dothe appere ſygnifyeth touche thynge nerer nede requyrethplaut bacch ad unguemcicer de amicitia perfitely ad unum one left one vnto laſt ad unū idē ſentiūt al one opinion ad calendas graecas plinius ſygnifieth neuer olde grekes kalendes ad horam tyme appoynted adad syrian tongue ſonne alſo ſygnifieth onely adactio compulſyon adactus ta tum compelled put forth adaeque ſemblably ſo moche moche adaeque miſer ſo moche wretche adaequo make equall adaggero rare gather lay togither adagia olde wyfe late chylde adagum prouerbe mought ſay olde ſayd ſawe adam fyrſt man created dothe ſygnify man redde erthe dweller lyued ixcxxx yeres byble mention made thre ſonnes one doughter cayne abel seth delbora whiche philo callyd noaba ſame philo reherſeth xii ſonnes viii doughters borne seth adamas adamantis dyamonde wherof dyuers kyndes one founde inde lyttell bryght heuy ſo hard nothing may breake except bloud gote found arabia whiche leſſe paler colour som found macedonia haue color yron made bryght founde aethiopia mooſte darke colour ſome found cypre theyr color draweth towarde colour ayre ar ſoft vertues ſtone ar theſe reſyſt agaynſt poyſon witchecraft putteth away feare cauſeth hym weareth vanquyſh contention helpeth lunatike phrenetike haue proued dyamonde layde nedelle lode ſtone myght drawe hym vp hym adamanteus adamantinus dyamond harde dyamonde adamaſter gyant whiche incredyble greatneſſe adamitae heretykes whyche toke theſe begynaynge pycard came lande boheme ſayde ſonne god named hym self adam cōmanded al men woman go naked ſo deſyred company carnally woman animum gyue courage addere gradum make hym go faſter addico xi c • ſay iudge appoynte depute addicere animū gyue apply minde addictus iudged appoynted deputed bounden addictus ta tum openly ſolde alſo addicere whan iudge olde tyme delyue red dettour credytours doo hym lyſted addiſco didici diſcere lerne welle adde lernynge additamentū thing added augmētatiō additus ta tum added put additus vergilius alſo enmy nec teucris addita iuno u quam aberit neyther iuno ennemye troyans ſhall lacke away addo gyue one addo didi dere adde ioyne put addoceo cui cére lerne addormio miui ire ſleape addormiſco ſcere idem addubito tare doubte adduco xi cere brynge brynge forth ſometyme drawe plucke togyther alſo meue perſwade adduci meued perſwaded adducta frons frownyng forheade ſomme tyme adducere extende thruſt adduplico double thynge adedo edi • ere deuoure adelphi bretherne alſo name comedy terence ademptio ciuitatis banyſhement adeo ſo moch moreouer ſurely without dout ſometyme ſignifieth euen tute iam adeo eius audies uerba thou thy ſelfe euen nowe ſhalt wordes sometyme ſignifieth intra moenia que adeo senatu uidetis cicero catil ye ſee hym citie ſenate hath dyuers ſignifications harde perceyued example adeo mihi uiſus eſt lepidus ſemed ſo pleaſant felowe adoleſcens tuus que adeo noſter te ſalutrat chylde myn cōmendeth hym vnto aliquid que adeo multa addunt de ſuo ſom adde moche theyr owne id adeo ex cognoſcite thus moch take ye id adeo ſi placet conſyderate hytherto pleaſe conſyder haec cicero terent nihil herclè aut ſi adeo bidui aut tridui eſt haec ſolicitudo fayth nothyng moſt ſorow care wyl laſt paſſynge two thre dayes adeo re redijt mattier come poynte adeo iui ire goo demaunde attempte make aſſaulte adij te heri de filia came yeſterday talk thy doughter adire diſcrimen put hym ſelfe peryll adire haereditatē entre īto inheritāce adire inimicitias enter diſpleaſure adire ad pactionem comme poynte concernynge bargayne adire periculum take dangerous thing hande adeor paſſyue adeo adeouſ que vntyll adeps adipis fatte thynge adeptus opteyned gotten founden ader place bethlem aungels dyd ſynge byrthe chriſt iacob kept ſhepe adeſdum teren come hyther adeſſe ſignifieth ſometyme preſence ſomtime ayde otherwhyle fauour adeſſe animo haue mynde lybertye take good harte hym good courage adeſſe praeſens preſente adeſſe coram idem adeſſe coram praeſentem corā aderit praeſens tibi ſhall come adeſſe alicui defende helpe one adeſſe ad iudicium appere adeſſe iudici aſſociate commiſſion adeſt hande adeſt ei animus hath good courage adeſto iſtic tary adeſus um conſumed ad exitam aetatemfeſtus ad ultimam aetatem vttermooſte age adfabrum wel wrought adnabito aui dwelle ad haec moreouer adhaereo cleane faſt ſet ſure ioyne holde take thynge adhaereſco ſcere idem quod adhaeteo adhaeſe gell ne que adhaeſe locutus eſt dydde mumble ſpake adhaeſio cleauynge togyther adhaeſus um cleaued adhalo aui blowe breathe thynge adhamo aui bynd tye grappel adhibeo ui • put haue adhibere animū take hede ſpokē adhibere aures harken gyue eare adhibere conſilium aliquem aſke coū fſayle one adhibere modum vſe moderacyon temperaunce adhibere parſimoniam ſpare adhibere ſermonē deuiſe talk togider adhibere teſtes bryng forthe wytnes adhibere uim doo thynge violence inforce celeritatem adhibere make haaſte vſe dilygence coenae aliquem indyfferent ad • ides ſhort battes cubite longe halfe hauyng pykes yron tyed lyne whan throwen dyd caſt mought plucke theym ageyne hym hurlebattes adigo egi igere procure ſtyre bynde othe promyſe brynge dryue faſten ioyne ſommetyme compelle dryue one thynge adijcio ieci ijcere caſte adde put increaſe adijcere album calculū approue thingplinius epiſt adijcere animū ſet mīd loue one adijcere oculū haereditati planè uidebant adiectum eſſe oculū haereditati cicero ver ſawe playnly went get inherytaunce adimo emi imere take away diminiſhe animam alicui adimere ſlee one adimereius prohibyte adimere ſuum alteri take mannes goodes hym adimere uestem pull garment ciuitatem adimere banyſhe one adindo didi dere putte adineo iui ire idem quod adindo adinstar lyke adinuenio inuent thynge adinuentum inuention adipales feſtis priſtes wōt make adipatus ta tum larded baſted adipiscor adeptus sum get optayn ioyned perſon ſignifieth ouertake adipiſci ſenectutem cicer de ſenect come age ❀ admeti naenia prouerbe ſignifieth heuy ſorowfull ſongeeraſ chil 2 cent 6 lamentable complaynte admetus kynge people callyd pherei vnto whome apollo beynge exiled oute heauen iupyter came reliefe kepte cattelle crafce cauſed euerye cowe brynge forthe two calues whyche thynge adinetus thankefullys takinge entertayned hym honourably beynge welle conſydered apollo opteined deſtenies callyd parcae whan day deathe admetus ſhulde wounde vpon theyr ſpyndels ſhuld eſcape death vpon condytion yf coulde fynde wolde wyllyngely dye hym hym ſelfe ſhoulde eſcape deathe tyme whan day come admentus ſhulde kyng wyndes aequabilis equall aequabilitas uitae wherein noo varietie trouble aequabiliter equally euen partes aequaeuus one age aequalis equall playne lyke age ❀aequales calculus euen iudgementes prouerbe applied vnto theym whiche lacked lytel condemned aſmoche olde tyme iudges gaue ſentence openly diuers opiniōs dyd put pot lytell ſtones ſundry colour moſt numbre ſentence preuayled equall numbre accuſed acquyted whyche ſtode good reaſon ariſtotle ſheweth problemes aequalitas equalytie aequaliter lykewyſe aeqnamentum indyfferency aequanimis neyther extollyd proſperitie diſcomforted aduerſitie aequanimitas takyng good parte aequanimiter moderatly paciently coldly aequatio equall diuyſyon thynge one thyng made equal aequare ſolo beate downe ground aequator tôris lyne diuideth heuen myddel callid alſo equinoctiall lyne whiche whan ſonne commeth dayes nyghtes ben one length aequè iuſtely well euen well ſometime wyllyngly aeque ambo pares one greatneſſe aeque pauci euen fewe aeque utrius que neceſſarius moche frende one aequi boni que facio take good part recke care aequidiale tyme whan dayes nyghtes one length aequidium varro idem quod aequinoctium aequilanium ſeu aequilaneum half deale holle aequilatio euen largeneſſe aequilibris bre ſame weyght aequilibrium euen weyght poyſe aequimanus vſeth oone hande well aequimentum hyre horſe beaſt aequinoctiale adiectiue aethiopia great countrey affrike conteinyng many region callyd aethiope wherin founde people beaſtes ſerpentes meruaylous forine hath weſte mountayns callid athlantes eaſt extendeth march egipt ſouth hath ſea occian north part encloſed ryuer callyd nilus aethiopem lauas thou waſheſt moren moore prouerbe applied hym praiſeth ❀a thyng nought teacheth naturall foole wyſedom prouerb grew one bought mooren thynkynge blackeneſſe ſaynne happened neglygence fyrſte mayſter ceaſſed waſſhe mooren contynually ſuche thinges thought wold make hym whyte whiche labour waſhynge ſo vexed poore ſlaue brought arme retayneth child womās time com ſhe dothe trauayle beinge taken away bounde thygh ſhe ſhall forthewith delyuered without peyne alſo yf piece ſtone put bread pouddynge gyuen vnto oone yf thefe exerciſe agitator dryuer carte beaſtes agitur de capite aut de fama dangier lyfe credence bene mecum agitur val max de militia terent wel eaſe well content good condition agitur re capitis queſtion matter debate concerneth lyfe aglaia one thre gracis whiche interpreted bryghtnes clerenes beaultie pleaſure maieſtie aglauros mayden daughter eritheus kynge athene whome ouidius fayneth turned mercurius vnto ſtone agmen hoſt men ſomtyme violence courſe water agminalis perteyninge hoſte agnaſcentia membra member whiche ſuperfluous • one hath thre legges ſyxe fyngers one hande lyke agnati kynſmen father ſyde ad agnatos gentile deduci commytted kynſfolke madde men lawe ciuile wherof made prouerbe applyed whiche thynges madly without circumſpection ad agnatos gentile deducantur❀ agnatū byrthe cōmon courſe nature vſeth bryng forth agnellus yonge lambe agnitio knowledge agnomen ſurname haue father agnoſco noui noſcere knowe recogniſe knowledge agnos tree kynde wyllow commonly called agnus caſtus englyſſhe parke leaues hath leaues lyke wyllowe alwaye grene hath ſo ſwete ſmell floures fyrſte purple whyte ſede lyke pepper kynde therof whiche hath braunches leaues whiter ſomewhat moſy floure purple growe ryuars called agnos whiche englyſhe chaſt ſayde man woman haue vnder theyr beddes ſhall kepe chaſte agnus lambe ago egi agere leade dryue labour ſpeke pronounce fain go nudi agunt go naked extend ſprede radix agunt pom • ſprede theyr rootes treate thynge gyue ago gratias giue thankes bring forth alſo expell venena membris agit expelleth poyſon member agolum ſtaffe dryue emperour caſt priſon liued miſerably ſpace vi monthes afterwarde tiberius beinge deade emperour caius caligula toke hym ſodenly pryſon made kynge iewes ſettynge crowne golde heade chayne yron wherwith boū den gaue hym chayne golde like weyght extreme miſery ſodainly came hyghe proſperitie beinge retourned countrey fyrſte liued honorably dyd many good dedes dyd amplyate adorne citie hieruſalem buyldynges moſte magnifikelye laſte beinge eleuate pryde ſufferynge hym ſelfe honored wondred god ſyttynge hyghe trone citie cacſaria apparailed glyſtring golde ſodeynlye ſtryken angel preſence infynite number people wherwith body ſwelled wormes iſſued therof intollerable peynes horrible ſtenche whiche tormentes loked flatterynge counſaylours ſeruantes ſayde lo ye called god nowe peynes deathe wyſe dyed whan age lvii yeres notable perpetuall myrrour whiche flowe proſperitie forgettynge ſelfes mortall reioyſynge commendation flatterer agrippae borne theyr fete forwarde agrippina mother nero emperour whoo daughter noble germanicus ſuſter caius caligula emperour tiberius fyrſte maryed noble man called gneus domitius ſhe nero emperor deth domitius brother caligula abuſed cōcubine deth claudius beinge emperour whan hadde cauſed wyfe meſſalina ſlayne moſte abhominable avoutrics toke agrippina wyfe excellente beaultie afterwarde crafty ſhrewde wytte cauſed huſbande claudius mary daughter called octauia ſon nero alſo make hym companiō ſucceſſion empire ſon called britannicus leſt britannicus lyfe father ſhoulde growe ſtate man able receyue empyre incontinent •• er deceſſe expell ſonne nero fyrſte poyſoned huſbande claudius afterwarde ſonne britannicus falſehoode abhomynation crueltie left vnpuniſhed ſoone owne ſonne nero notwithſtandynge ioyned hym equall autoritie ſome men ſuppoſed abuſed carnally hauyng moſt mortal hate cauſed put barge vpon ryuer tyber vnder colour ſolace ouer whiche barge hanged great poyſes whiche ſodeynlye ſhoulde haue ben letten fall haue kylled alſo barge certayne hole cloſed tyme whiche beinge open veſſell ſhulde haue ſunken fortune tyme wyſe prouyded poyſes fel ſlewe barge beinge ſunke ſhe ſwam lande tyme eſcaped wherof nero heryng ſent capitayne hundred men ſlee entrynge houſe ſhe repoſynge ſelfe withoute warnynge ſtrake head ſhe holding forth bealy cryed ſtryke ſtrike place whiche bare monſter worlde ſtory maye iudge hebrew man great ſtrength valyant courage equal ſtrength aptneſſe bothe handes man ſlewe eglon kinge moabites meanes whan eglon longe tyme warred iewes taken theym dyuerſe city kepte moche myſerye aioth came hym hierico bryngynge vnto hym certain preſentes whiche lyked hym well deſyred ſpeake hym priuely whiche graunted vnto hym cō maunded auoyde aioth ſodeynlye ſtrake eglon vnto harte twyſe laſte tyme ſuche puiſſaunce knyfe hyltes remayned wounde aioth ſo leauynge hym dead departed without ſuſpition came people declared done gladde armed theym fell moabites ſlewe ten thouſand draue al reſydue theyr countrey ſo iewes beinge delyuered wyſedome vertue aioth made hym theyr iudge prynce gouerned peaſablye 80 yeres dyed olde man moch honour incarnation chriſt 1399 yeres aiutamininon houſes walles called leſſe hath lyttell rounde leaues thycke called engliſh pricke • ame called portulaca ſylueſtris wild purſelane eueryche colde thyrde degree ante l ala lae wynge byrde wynge name emperour albion moſte aunciente name yle conteyneth englande scotlande beginninge whiche name haue benne ſundrye opynions one late fayned hym whiche fyrſte prynted englyſh chronicle wherin neyther ſimilitude trouth reaſon honeſtie meane fable fyfty daughter one diocleci kynge siria neuer hiſtorie made mencion kynge siria beinge ſo named alſo name greke part language siria ouer commynge habitation ſuch inuentours opinion whiche hath hone ſte ſimilitude named albion ab albis rupibus whyte rockes bycauſe vnto theym whiche doo comme ſea frome eaſte ſouthe bankes rockes yle doo appere whyte opinion haue moſte meruaile bycauſe wrytten great lerned men fyrſt moche albion latten word hath analogye ſaye proportion ſimſlitude latine hath founde ſyllable ende latine worde ſhulde haue ben ſo called whyte colour rockes men wolde haue called alba albus album yet italye townes called alba aſia countrey called albania neither one toke theyr begynnynge whyte rockes walles ye maye rede bokes geography water ryuer called albis ſemeth noo whyter water aunciente remembraunce begynnyng thynges lacketh may lefull men vſe theyr coniectures coniecture may aſwel accepted coniecture plinie althoughe incomparably excelled wiſedome doctrine ſpecially may appere coniecture ſhall approche nere ſymilitude trouth wherfore wyll alſo ſet forthe myne opinion onely intente exclude fable lackynge ſlayne pallas alcidamus auncient oratour grekes alcides idem quod hercules alcinous homerus odiſſ name kynge people called phaeaces excellent iuſtice fayre magnifi • e palayce orchardes whiche bare moſte plentuouſely fruytes twyſe yere alcman famouſe poete alcmenes cunnynge grauer alcmeon philoſopher ſcholer pythagoras whiche fyrſte wrate nature thynges alcon good archer creta beholdinge dragon redy deuoure ſonne dyd ſhote ſo craftily dragon imbracynge chylde arrowe paſſed vnto hart hurt ſonne ſo dragon immediately dyed alcoranum boke mahumet wherein myxte moſte ſhamefull lye abhominations ſome part ſcripture neceſſary lawes thoughe theſe feweſte gyueth libertie men haue great number wyues concubine without nū ber imagineth angelles loue commyt aduoultry mortall woman auaunteth hym ſelfe went vp god receyue lawes borne thither aſſe ieſus lent hym founde god beatynge aungell betwene whoſe browes ſpace iourney many hundred yeres ſuche lie gret number fayned withſtandyng ſame boke doth prohibit aduaultry commaundeth ſtraitely kepynge promyſe thinges diſprayſed alcybiades name noble man athene comen bloude aaiax thelamonius man beaultie goodly perſonage artiuitie proweſſe eloquence ſharpneſſe wit exceſſed al men time ſo moche countrey ſo euer came ſo adapted hym ſelfe maners therof euerye wonderfully beloued honored ſpecially wyſe man socrates moſte entirely loued hym thoſe moſte excellent qualyties ioyned ſundry vice ſaye vntemperate diſſolute lyuinge lethery ryote deceyte vnconſtancye ſo moche men meruayled one man moughte ſuche dyuerſe nature acheued many great enterpryſes well countrey agaynſte finallye beinge exiled meane liſander kyng lacedemonia phrigia hous wherin laye pourpoſe ſet fyre whiche eſcaped beinge halfe naked valiauntly defendynge hym ſelfe againſt ennemyes laſte ſlayne head brought pharnabazus capitain perſians man flouryſhed afore incarnation chriſte 428 yeres alcionae name two lady wherof one wyfe ceiſis ſeinge body huſbande caſte lande threwe ſelfe ſea poetes fayned tourned byrde name daughter euene called alſo marpeſia alcyonium ſpume fome ſea indurate alduaſdubis caeſar countrey fraunce called ledoux alea dye playenge dice somtyme ſignifieth chaunce alea fortunae chaunce fortune ſomtyme perill aleator dyſar aleatorium dice playing dyſyng hous suetonius calleth aleatorium forum aleatorius um belongynge dice alebria thynges whiche nouriſhe well alec ſauce made liuers fiſhes alſo fiſhe called hearynge alecto one fury hell alectoria ſtone founde cockes gyſar mawe greatnes beane colour chriſtall alecula ſprote alemani people germany called almains aleo oni diſar diſeplayer alephanginae ſpecies barbarous worde vſed moore wherby ſignify poulder ſote ſpices gynger peper cloues mace nutmigges cynamome lyke alere bellum mayntayne warres ale alitis byrde sometyme ſignyfiet • ſwyfte fleinge runnynge alite plan ta ſwyfte fote aleſco ſcere growe fatte aletudo fatnes body alexander name many noble prince amonge one moſte excellente whiche ſonne philip kynge macedonia whoo chyldehoode brought vppe ariſtotle lernynge wherin profyted wonderfully ſuche courage deathe philip father beinge xx yeres olde toke hym enterpriſe conquere al worlde fyrſte gatte illiria nowe called slauonia ſubuerted citie thebe brought ſubiection al grece entred aſia vanquiſhed ſundry iourneys great puiſſaunte kynge darius kynge perſia mother wyfe daughter priſoners neuer wolde company withſtandyng moſt excellently fayre finallye conquered india eaſte parte worlde al dyd lyttell xii yeres whan pacified world al rebellion fel ſuche crueltie pryde ſleing moſte truſtye counſaylours furye commaundynge hym ſelfe callyd god became ſo odious owne people deſyryng deſtruction laſt beynge moſte glory citie babylon abode ambaſſadours al realmes ſouper one phiſitions poyſoned drynkyng cup whiche ſuppoſed made horſes houſe whiche thought doone deuyſe ariſtotle ſometyme mayſter antipater lieutenant macedonia lyttell greuouſly thretened thus alexander aboundynge bothe excellent vertues notable vice moſte happy fortune outragious pryde crueltie ſhortened lyfe beinge deathe lyttell aboue xxxiii yeres olde afore incarnation chriſt 322 yeres alexander ſeuerus emperour rome yere lorde 224 man frome chyldehode wonderfull grauitie prudence ſo moche citie rome brought couſyne monſtrous emperour heliogabalus abhomination lyuynge dyſſolution maners man vertue prudence contynual iuſtyce reduced vnto perfecte publyke weale reformed order army ſtablyſſhed lawes reſtored honeſtye expellyd vicious perſones brybours aduanced men vertue lernyng great offyces dignity renewed ſenate prepared alſo great noble coū ſayle perſon ſo hated corrupted iudges dyd onely put theym tourmentes whan came preſence redy two fyngers put theyr eye yet noble gentyll prynce falſe treſon one maximus mulettour made great capytayne ſodayne commocyon ſlayne owne people moguntia germany mother mammea wyſe ladye vertuouſe somme ſuppoſed bycauſe counſayle becomme auaritious ſo lyberall emperor bene alexandria name dyuers cyties whyche one egypte buylded greatte kynge alexander 320 yeres afore incarnation chryſte ſpace ſeuentene day althowgh conteyned within walles ſpace ſyx mile length yt made fourme mantell dyuided two broode wayes oone croſſyng ouer eaſy conueyeng caryage euery way beyng bredth hūdred feete whyche wayes lay ſuche wyſe holſome wyndes dyd blow abundantly citie refreſſhed ayre cite ſet betwene fennes nilus ſea nyghe vnto noble hauen pharus whych citie euery kyng egypt alexander buylded royal palaice wherby ſhewed ſoo beautyfull magnifyke lyke therevnto worlde moreouer manye excellente lerned men borne brought vp cytie philo iewe callyd ſeconde plato origenes clemens antonius dydimus maximus theophilus athanaſius byſhoppe alſo ſaynte marcus euangelyſte preached ordeined biſſhop apoſtles deſtroyed romaynes reedyfyed traianus emperoure afterwarde yere lorde 1230 peter brother vnto kynge cyprus certayne frenche men catalones eftſoones diſtroyed robbyd ſoo vnto day neuer reducyd vnto fyrſte eſtate nowe ſubiection turkes nother cytie callyd alexandria lumbardye alexandrinuscaeſar um alexandria alexa countrey fraunce nowe callydde lauſſoys burgoyne allſoo towne callydde arras countye artoyſe alexicacon remedy put away myſchefe ylle thynge alexipharmacon properly medycyne agaynſte poyſon alſoo taken ſuche thynges vſed hange aboute mennes neckes theyr armes howſes defence agaynſte poyſon ylle ſpyrites greuous diſeaſes ſoo doothe theophraſtus vſe nynthe boke treateth pylgrimages habite pore man moche pacyence longe pouertie retourned father howſe beynge vnknowen vntyl death dyſcloſed letter founde hande buryenge god ſhewed many wonderfull myracles beynge preſent honorius arcadius emperours rome yere lorde 410 alga reytes wedes ſea algenſes fyſhes callyd alſo purpurae algeo ſi gêre peyn properly cold chylle colde algidenſe kynde radyſhe long clere algidus therfore callyd alumen catinae made pure herbe lyke herbe iuc bourned aſſhes lye made therwith ſorte callid alumen zucharinum whyche made alume relented roſewater whytes egges facyon ſugar lofe whyche outragious pryde bycauſe mardocheus iewe vncle queene heſter wyfe aſſuerus dydde humbie reuerence hym whan paſſed cauſyd commyſſyons kynges name ſente vnto countreyes beynge vnder domynyon kynge aſſuerus iewes euerye countrey ſhoulde ſlayne almyghty god beholdynge malyce crueltie aman gaue grace vnto vertuouſe queene heſter preuente vengeable appetyte wherfore ſhe boden kynge aman dyner ſhe ſuche ſpyryte declared kynge cruelle vengeaunce aman hadde preparyd doone countreye men kynsfolke ſhe ſoo ſtyrred kynges indignation agaynſt aman commaunded incontynent aman ſhulde hanged gybet whyche lyttell cauſed rayſed hang theron mardocheus whyche gybet fyfty cubytes hye howſe poſſeſſyons goodes gyuen vnto queene heſter moreouer letter sente pooſte countreyes iewes ſhoulde lyue alſoo ſhoulde alſo callyd sampſuchꝰ amaramis ioſephus father moyſes amaranthi people countrey colchos wherein ſheepe bare golden fleeſe amaranthos heliocryſos al one herbe ſuppoſed whyche commonlye callyd stoecas sticados citrina therof two kyndes flowre one yelowe hath ſoote ſauoure hath purple flowre whyche hath noo ſauoure yelowe layde amonge clothes kepe mothes therfore ſomme callyd tinearia callid flos amoris floure loue somme ſuppoſe gylofer gentylle floure gentylle amarantus herbe whyche groweth fote heyghte hathe leaues lyke baſyll hathe flowre faſſhyoned lyke eare wheate crymoſyn colour whyche neuer dyeth frenche callyd paſſeuelute whiche doo ſuppoſe callyd englyſhe baldare amare bytterly amareſcoſci ſcere waxe bytter bytter amarico make bytter make angry amarillis name ſhepeherde bucolicis whiche ſignifieth people ſpareth lyftinge vppe people name noble manne ſonne abigail ſyſter dauid alſoo capytayne whome ioab ſlewe kyſſynge ſalutynge hym vnder coloure frendſhyppe amaſias name hebru ſignifieth ſtrēgth lorde name one kynge iudea ſonne ioas 853 yeres incarnation chriſt reygned xxix yeres man eloquent begynning reigne moch humanite towarde men obſerued competently commandementes god yet dyd vtterly take away ydolatrye longe tyme fortunate waxed ryche laſte forgat god became prowde content aſtate wrate vnto ioas kyng iſraelites commandyng hym people vnder ſubiection ioas wrate vnto hym letter defyance wherfore gathered army went agaynſt kyng iſrael whan battayle ioyned ſuche feare ſodaynly came amonge men tremblyng fledde euer came vnto ſtrokes amaſias wolde haue fledde taken broughte vnto kynge ioas thretenyd kylle hym except cauſyd gate ieruſalem openyd agaynſte hym whiche done withſtandynge ioas cauſyd cccc cubites walle beaten downe entered cytie waye charyotte leadynge amaſias hym pryſoner toke al treaſure temple kynges howſe cauſyd brought samaria afterwarde beynge delyuered owne people conſpyred againſt hym ſlew hym citie lachis amaſenus ryuer italy amaſis noble kynge egypt whiche made lawe euery yere eche man ſhuld make reckenynge heade offycers realme lyfe ſhewe whereby lyued occupation ſuſteyned dydde make ſuche accompte ſhulde put deathe amaſius amaſia ſhe loueth louyd amaſſo idem quod amauero amaſtris uel amaſtrum pryncypall citie paphlagonia amath ioſephus ſonne chanaan amathus untis citie cyprus dedycate venus alſo name yle ſea concorde ſodainly voyce infant herde men whyche cryed ambroſius worthy byſſhop whiche voyce people ſo feruently ſtyred togyther conſenced ſhulde theyr byſhop although yet baptyſed newely inſtructed laſt falleth great ſpayniſhe ſea anabaptiſtae ſect heretikes began yere lorde 1524 germany wherof firſte author one balthazar taught baptiſme dyd nothynge profyt vnto chyldren ought eftſones baptiſed whā come yeres diſcretion wherefore ſect heretikes called anabaptiſtae whiche ſignify rebaptiſours anabaſius rydeth poſt horſes hieronimus contra rufinum anabathrum iuuenal pulpit lyke pla • e whiche haue excedynge care cuntrey poyntyng vp heauen fynger alſo whan ben longe countrey eftſones returned beheld poſſeſſions diſtroyed waſted ſayde hadde ben ſaulfe except theſe thynges ben loſte anazarba towne cilicia dioſcorides noble phiſition borne anaxarcus philoſopher whiche fallynge indignation tyraunt called nicocreon kynge cyprus hym apprehended put greatte morter ſtone beaten pounde yron anaximander philoſopher whiche fyrſte founde deſcription compaſſe ſea lande made fyrſt ſphere anaximenes philoſopher diſciple anaximander ſayde begynnyng thinges ayre ſters • e dydde moue infinitely ouer erthe ancaeſa grauen veſſell anceps itis doubtfull ſometyme ſignifieth double alſo cuttynge bothe ſydes anchialea citie cilicia builded sardanapalus alſo ſepulture anchilops gal definition ſuperfluous fleſhe greater corner eye wherevnto humour gathered anchiſes father aeneas anchora anchore anchorarius um pertcyning anchore anchyle inciſion cuttynge cordes necke ioyntes wherby vſe member let ancile ſhielde without corner ſuche one tyme numa kyng rome ſene fall ſkye ancilla mayden ſeruaunt properlye taken bonde woman ancillor ſerue humblye diligently ancillula lyttel poore wenche ſeruaunt anclabra vyſſels whiche prieſtes vſed anclare ſeu antlare empty veſſell ancona noble citie hauen italye countrey called picenum whiche ſtandeth vpon ſea called mare hadriaticum ſoo called bycauſe ſea bankes bende fourme lyke arme elbowe fyrſte buylded people siracuſis citie sicilia afore incarnatiō chriſt 179 yeres hauen augmented noble traianu • emperor rome deſtroyed ſaraſins efteſones buylded inhabited nowe famous citie ancones coynes corner wall anculi anculae goddes goddeſſes ſeruynge woman anchuſa herbe whoſe roote commeth red iuyce wherwith ſanguine colour dyed ancus hath croked elbowe ancus martius fourth king rome ſon daughter numa pō pilius ſucceded tullus hoſtilius afore incarnation chriſte 642 yeres prynce well martiall prowes cyuile policie equall hym alſo enlarged citie made brydge ouer ryuer tiberis alſo priſon middes citie terror offendours whiche dayly increaſed ancyra name ii cite one phrigia galatia andabatae certayne menne foughte ſwordes winkynge andegauia countreye fraunce called angewe andes people aniewe fraunce alſo village mātua italy wher vergil poete borne wherfore ſomtyme called andinus uates andianum uinum wyne aniewe andrachni greeke latine portulaca englyſhe purſlane andrago woman hauynge man harte andreas one xii apoſtelles brother peter preachynge citie called patrias countray achaia impriſoned beaten laſt hanged croſſe wheron preached ii day died andricus hyll cilicia androdamanta ſeu androdamas pretious ſtone harde ponderous colour bryghtnes ſyluer fourme diuers lyttel ſquares foūd ſande red ſea putteth awaye fury yre rage lechery androgeus ſon minos kyng crete whiche enuy ſlayne athenienſes many yeres ſonnes athenienſes ſente crete delyuered monſter called minotaurus whiche afterward deſtroyed theſeus alſo name noble briton whan iulius caeſar came hyther realme brytain androgynae people aſia beinge bothe kyndes one perſon man woman androgynos man hauynge bothe member man alſo woman andromache wyfe valiant hector andromede wyfe perſes whome ſaued monſter ſea andron chaumber wherinto men onely come woman alſo ſpace betwene two houſes wherinto rayne falleth andronitis idem andronae feaſtes whervnto onely men doo come andros yle betwene greece aſia directly agaynſte citie epheſum androſace cordus ſome ſuppoſe whiche alſo called cuſcuta englyſhe withwinde whiche wyndeth lyn hempe muſa maynardus thynke contrary beleue ye lyſt dyoſcorydes deſcrybeth hym wyſe androſaces bytter herbe ſpreadynge abrode ſmalle ſtalkes lyke ruſhes withoute leaues hauynge lyttell coddes toppe wherin ſeedes groweth ſea coſtes siria androſaemon herbe called ſayncte ihon̄s worte andruare olde wryters vſed recurrere run agayne anellus lyttell rynge anemonae wylde popy red floures growynge corne fieldes anethum herbe called dyll aneuriſma cuttyng ſonder ſinew whiche conteyneth receptory bloudde takynge away matter wherin ſpirites conteyned anfractus wyndynges tournynges ſpecially grounde angaria conſtraynt compulſion angariae arum ſome expounde prouiſion poſtes ſundry place ſpedines meſſages angarij poſtes currours whiche go meſſages angario aui conſtrayne one doo thynge angelica called alſo smyrnium taken mainardus called alexander io tanſtetterus well lerned man tyme ſuppoſeth whiche dioſcorides calleth morrida angelica angelus angell greeke properlye ſignifieth meſſager anger certayne ſerpente whoſe ſtyngynge hapneth intollerable peynes angerona called goddeſſe pleaſure called alſo volupia angilae people affryke whome woman fyrſt night wedded accompany men whiche come weddynge euer chaſte angina greekes called ſynanche inflammation muſcule inner gargil dyſeaſe thre kyndes fyrſte synanche wherin appereth neyther ſwellynge rednes bodye waxeth leane member leuſed breth ſtopped ſeconde called vtiſynanche apereth rednes ſwellyng let ſpeche yexinge thyrde called paraſynanche wherein onely chekes doo ſwell token folowe angiologia poynte ſurgery vaines temple hyd deuided temple temple depenes angiportus great hole erthe many tournynges whiche hath none iſſue lane towne whiche leadeth nexte waye ſtrete whiche lyeth hauen wherby marchandiſe caryed water recaried angleria nowe caſtell lombardy whiche ſometyme citie forty myles frome myllane ſet hyghe mountayne anglia royalme englande part yle called britannia people called angli people saxony whiche tyme moſte reputation therfore theyr name lengeſt continued well people countraye reade hereof britannia ango anxi angere tourment vexe angon inner parte elbowe angor anguyſhe body mynde anguilla fyſhe called ecle whiche beſt autors affirme commeth without generation ſpawne neyther kynde eyther male female ingendred whiche called bowel erthe whiche claye myxte moyſte erthe apereth ſtandynge pooles erthe hath ben throwen cleane dyuerſe ſhoures rayne eeles haue ben founde drye wether increaſe thoughe ryuer whiche fyndynge littell thynges lyke heares eaſis ioyned ſay yonge eeles deceiued ryuer ganges india haue ben founde eeles xxx feete length anguimanus olyphant anguinus um ſerpente wyndinge crepynge lyke ſerpent anguis ſnake angularis cornerde angulatim corner wyſe anguloſus full corner angulus corner anguſte aduerbe ſignifienge ſtrayghtlye naroly peynfully anguſtia ſtraytnes perplexity mynde anguſtitas ſtrayte ſtrayt place anguſtus um draweth breth peynfully ania romayne woman whiche faire yonge huſcbande deade counſayled take ſhe wolde conſent therto ſayd ſhe ſhall hap haue good haue wyll feare loſe hym ſhall haue yll huſbande ſhall nede good manne ſuffer ſhrewe anicetum idem quod anethum dyll anicula lyttel olde woman aniliter lyke olde foole anima auguſt li definito ſubſtaunce created inuiſible moſt lyke vnto immortall god hauynge none ymage figure onely creatoureit called englyſhe ſoule ſomtyme taken lyfe alſo ſygnifieth breth otherwhile wynde ſomtyme water animā adimere uel extinguere kyll animam debet oweth thanne worthe oweth ſo moche hath lyfe lone dic amabo foetet anima uxoris tuae tel good feloweſhyppe dothe thy wyues brethe ſtynke animam comprime plautus holde thy brethe si ſitulam iamiam caepero nun quam aedipol tu mihi diuino quid credas post hunc diem ni ego illi puteo ſi occepſo animam omnem intertraxero take bucket neuer beleue prophete daye drawe cleane one begynne water well animaduerto animaduerſi whiche punyſſhed corrected animaduerſio conſideration punyſſhmente ſometyme ſtudy animaduerſor puniſheth animaequius um pacient ſufferinge animal thyng hath lyfe ſenſible commonly taken beaſte animalis le wherin lyfe animans idem quod animal ſauinge larger maye ſignifie thynge hath ſpirite lyfe animatus um hath ſowle lyfe alſo hauynge fantaſy fauour thynge dyſpoſedplau ••• ita animatus fui que nunc sum ut ea te patera donem hadde ſuch fantaſye yet haue wolde gyue cup amabo ſi quid animatus eſt facere faciam ut ſciam diſpoſed thynge let knowe animitus ſowle lyfe animo aui gyue courage boldenes quicken animos addere make one bolde prycke hym forwarde thynge animos comprimere abate one courage animos retardare idem animos efferre loke highe proude animos lactare drawe mennes harte fayre promyſes make fooles fayne bryng men fooles paradiſe animi pendere doubte animi cauſa pleaſure cur eam emit animi cauſa plau ••• wherfore dyd pleaſure animo male eſt greueth hym harte animo praeſenti bolde ſpirite courage animo bono eſſe good chere animo iniquo pati ſuffer vnpatiently animo obsequi take pleaſure folowe appetite wyll animo morem gerere idem animum adijcere ad greate antiochus whyche afore commynge chryſte 212 yeres alſo callyd hierax whyche ſygnyfyeth fawlkon rauenye vſyd takynge frome euerye manne theyr poſſeſſyons goodes kynge camme hannyball duke carthage cytie carthage delyuered appoyntemente whome antiochus ſhewed armye gatheryd agaynſte romaynes whyche wonderfully rychely armyd golde ſyluer reioyſynge therein demaunded hannyball yf thoughte antipater name dyuers kynges well macedonia iudea alſo noble capytayne whome great kynge alexander made ly • utenaunte macedonia whyles conqueſte dyd many valyaunt actes abſence alexander kepte royalmes domynyons mayſter good ſtate wyſedome proweſſe beynge dyſcention queene olympia mother great alexander wrate many great complayntes ſonne agaynſte hym fynally dreadynge crueltie welle alaxander mother ſuppoſed conſented poyſonynge maiſter antipater phyloſopher borne cytie tirus ſecte stoici whyche tyme byrthe vntyl death alwaye feuer withſtandynge liued tyll olide antipater alſoo herbe whiche hathe harde ſtemme leaues lyke roſemarye broder ſoo longe propretie therof flowres whiche growe laſte ſprynge vp hygheſt therefore pandecta calleth filius ante patrem ſonne afore father antipathia repougnauncie naturall contraryetie antipelargeſis one good tourne antiperiſtaſis thynge wherby heate commethe colde expellyd colde heate expelled well water wynter tyme warme foraſmoche hygh partes ayre beynge colde heate withdraweth hym loweſte partes lykewiſe bodye man ſpirite kepte feruente outwarde colde ioynt conſent tolleration partes body antiphonae • e interpreted antemnes whiche ſongen pſalmes theſe fyrſte ordeyned ſongen churche saynte ignatius dyſcyple ſaynt iohan euangelyſte archebyſſhoppe antiochia yeare oure lorde 109 antiphraſis worde ſentence hauynge contrary meanyng parcae myniſters deathe ſoo callyd bycauſe ſpare man antipode people whyche doo inhabyte parte worlde reſpecte roundneſſe therof vndernethe v ſeemeth theyr feete agaynſte feete antiquarius ſercheth antiquity redeth olde warkes vſeth ſpeake wryte wordes ancient tyme whyche haue bene longe cuſtome antiquatio abolytion lawe antiquitas atis auncientye antiquitus auncient olde tyme antiquo aui make voyde reduce fyrſte ſtate repell antiquare legem abolyſhe lawe antiquus um auncyent olde ſometyme ſygnifieth noble worſhypfull alſo ſignifieth moche ſet nihil antiquius nothing ſette fauoured commynge chriſte socrates wente euerye daye feete frome pyreus athene whyche fyue myles fyue myles home fyrſte beganne ſecte callyd cinici dyd ſuppoſe chiefe goodneſſe vertue antiſtita abbeſſe ſette olli illi antitheton fygure wherby one contrary ioyned otherouidiꝰ metamor frigida pugnabant calidis humentia ſiccis mollia cum duris ſine pondere habentia pondus colde thynges contended theym poumpe lyke thynge drawe vp water antonius name whyche callyd dyuerſe emperoures rome amonge oone callyd antonius pius whyche ſucceded hadryane yere oure lorde 141 reygned two twentye yeres three monethes aurelius lucius progenytours spanyardes capytolinus ſaythe meruayllous good manne emperoure gouernyd ſuche moderation gentylneſſe therefore callyd pius father countraye neuer cruelle pryuate commune cauſe vſyd often ſayenge hadde leauer ſaue oone ſubiecte thanne dyſtroye thowſande ennemyes deuoute lyuynge ſweeteneſſe maners mercye iuſtyce temperaunce compared numa wherefore manye kynges pryncis dyuerſe nacyons layenge warre aparte commaundemente commytted theyr contencyons vnto iudgemente helde theym therewith contented bothe loue feare hym cauſyd theym exchewe warres honourynge hym vertue god yet ſoo deſyrous glory rycheſſe wold attayn thervnto men damage dyed age 70 yeres antonius muſa phyſition octauyane emperoure whome delyuered daungerouſe ſyckeneſſe therefore emperoure cauſyd image made braſſe ſette vp image eſculapius nowe lyuynge phyſytion name ferrare ryghte lykely ſette forthe wonderfulle knowledge phyſycke welle ſpeculation alſo practyſe yf ambition auarice ſo ſodaynly hapnyd apud te ſis thynke thou haſte doo remember thy ſelfe apud ignem saluſt fyre apud aquam water apud quem whome apud cum hym apud te exemplum experiendi habes plautus non eges foris ye haue experyence home ye nede ſeke abrode apuleius phyloſopher borne aphrica withſtanding floriſhed athene wrate latin diuers ſtiles de uita moribus platonis de deo socratis ryght eloquent temperate octauian delyted principally repayre thyther often afterward dyſtroyed gothes inhabitantes fled thenſe fyrſte whiche beganne buylde citie venice nowe ſoo ſymple none dwell fyſhers fewe ſhepherdes arabia arabes ſyngular noumber arab • people arabia arabia ſundry ſortes people whiche haue dyuerſe name sabaei charaeni • taceni gebbanitae edumaei atramitae achomeni troglodytae saraceni uel syraceni arabia hebrew named saba countrey aſia whiche diuided thre region petream deſertam felicem petrea whiche ſignifyeth ſtonye marcheth aegypt iudeam plinius called nabathea chiefe city wherof petra whiche nowe called arach holy ſcripture called petra deſerti countrey paſſed chylderne iſraell whan went egypt strabo wryteth playne enuyroned rockes greate heyghte whiche many ſpringes freſhe water without circute towarde iudea parte countrey deſerte without water grete mount hyll sina called ptolomeus melanes olde lawe gyuen moyſes alſo body holy vyrgin ſayncte catharine buryed alſo mounte called caſius great pomp • ius buryed arabia deſerta whiche strabo calleth saenetis hath ſouth mountaygnes arabia foelix north meſopotamia weſt petrea people countrey haue certayne habitation dwell tentes hauynge houſes arabia foelix ſouth lyeth betwene two ſeas arabicum perſicū whiche ſo plentyful bryngeth forth corne fruites twyſe yere hauynge plenty fruite cattell excepte horſes mule ſwyne foules excepte geeſe cockes hennes alſo groweth kyndes ſpice ſwete gummes frankenſence myrre townes vnwalled bycauſe people doo alwaye lyue peace arabrica towne portugall arachne name woman whiche fyrſte inuented ſpynnynge lynnen makynge nettes alſo taken lynnen yarne woufe clothe arachneus lyttell beaſte whiche goeth ſofte pace arachnion fyne threde arachoſia countraye aſia arachthus great ryuer vttermoſt border epirus araciae ficus fygges brode whyte whiche growe lyttell ſtalke aracynthus mountain boeotia grece minerua ſpecially honoured aradus citie yle tripoli towarde siria poſſidonius writeth ſene ſerpent lye deade lengthe one hundred xxv pacis ſuche greatneſſe moughte deuoure man horſebacke euery ſeale ſkynne greater ſhylde aram brother abraham aranea copweb ſomtyme ſpyder araneolus yonge lyttell ſpyder araneus ſpyder alſo fyſſhe greatneſſe gougeon coloure dyuerſe hauynge backe nyghe head iii prickes arar countrey fraunce called sone araris ryuer fraunce called nowe sagona whiche commeth ryuer rone farre lyon ryuer ſo quiete vnneth maye perceyued whiche way runneth ouer ryuer iulius ceſar made brydge ſouldyars one day ararus ryuer scithia whiche runneth throughe realme armeny arath countreye armeny wonderfull fertyle arator ploughe man sometyme plough oxe aratro aui ploughe eftſones land ſowen make grounde fat aratrum ploughe aratus poete aſia yere incarnation 246 amonge dyuers warkes wrate certayne verſes heuen ſterres whiche warke tranſlated tulli alſo germanicus ſon adoptyue tiberius emperour araxes ryuer armenia ouer whiche great kynge alexander made brydge lyke wyſe dyd auguſtus emperour arbea citie iudea adam three patriarhes buryed arbela countrey perſia great alexander vaynquiſhed kynge darius kinge perſia arbiter tri arbitratoure arbitrarium arbitrabic arbitratus tus arbiterment iudgement arbitratu meo iudgement ſometyme ſignifieth pleaſure arbitri whiche preſente sometyme wytneſſes arbitris remotis mecum loquebatur whiche preſent beinge commaunded awaye talked arbitrium idem quod arbitratus arbitror trowe iudge awarde arbor arbos tree arborator lopper tree arboreſcere waxe tree arboreus um tree arboſes olde wryters vſed arbos arbuſto aui ſet fielde tree arbustum place tree ſet properlye elmes wythy ſalowe maye taken orcharde hopyarde vine yarde vynes growe vp tree alſo vyne runneth vp heyghte pole arbutum appull called wyldynge arbutus wyldynge tree arca coffer arca noe greatte veſſell whiche god commanded noe make intent wyfe thre ſonnes theyr wyues mought preſerued vniuerſal beynge ſyxe common cubites breade 50 perch depeneſſe frome hatch bottome thyrty perch hatch vpwarde one perche noe tyme fynyſhinge arc age ſyxe hundred yeres beroſus writeth floudde arke remayned mountayn armenia called cordiei tyme ſawe parte therof arca teſtamenti coffer cheſte made moyſes deſerte wherein put table olde lawe rodde moyſes wherwith ſhewed meruayles parte manna whiche god rayned deſerte art made ſtronge wod ſoote keuered well within without fyne golde top two ymages aungelles cherub whiche ark lengthe fyue cubites brede thre cubytes alſo called arca foederis archades people countraye arcadia whiche alſo called proſilini lycophron ſaythe ſignyfienge afore mone moche tyme floudde deucaleon ſaued theym ſelfe mountaynes therfore acompted moſte auncient people arcadia countrey greece ſet myddell peloponeſus morea ſoo called arca ſonne iupiter whoo reigned alſo called pelaſgia parrhaſia lycaonia fyrſte inuented bagpyde alſo greatte fenne callyd lernea monſter hydra ſlayne hercules greate ryuer called erymanthus mountayne ſame name alſo founde ſtone called abeſton whiche beinge one het maye neuer quenched colour yron arcadicus um arcadia arcanè ſecretely arcanum thinge ſecrete fewe knowē archas ſonne iupiter caliſthona doughter lycaon fyrſte kynge archadia incarnation 1470 yeres man herynge mother beinge virgin conſecrate defloured iupiter whan begotten therfore expelled vingines wolde haue ſlayne mother aferde fled wilderneſſe hyde ſelfe tyll laſte ſhe ſonne reconciled iupiter afterwarde bothe beinge deade paynim fayned tranſlated amonge ſterres ſet nigh pole artike mother called vrſa minor ſon vrſa maior arcâtus um bent lyke bowe arceo cui cêre ſtrayne put dryue awaye arcera horſe lytter arceſilas philoſopher ſecte academici ſcholer crantor alſo famous menne one philoſopher diſciple anaxagoras borne miletum mayſter socrates fyrſte broughte naturall philoſophy ionia athenis name dyuerſe kinges cappadocia alſo one kynge macedonia plato calleth tyrant ſlayne one cratena minion man theſe thynges remē bred whan hyred famouſe payntour zeuzis paynt palayce socrates ſayde meryly dyd prouoke men reſorte vnto hym althoughe wolde come ſake leaſt waye ſhuld gladly come beholde fayre houſe alſo whan hym ſoupper dyuerſe lerned menne poete deſyred hym ſumme moneye cauſed brought hym forthwith gaue euripides dyd aſke ſayinge thou arte worthye take deſyre archemorus ſonne lycurgus kyng nemêa ſlayne adder noryce layde hym gras ryuers ſyde whoſe ſake made playes called nemêi alſo called opheltes archeptholomeus charyot man hector troy archeſilaus philoſopher countreye acolide fyrſte inuented vſed fourme diſputation oppoſynge anſwerynge nowe vſed brought ſecte called medium academica althoughe wyſe man yet dyed immoderate drynkynge wyne toke hym wyfe maryed manne ſo rated hym verſis compelled hym ſorow indignation hange ſelfe afore incarnation chriſt 650 yeres archimagirus chiefe cooke archimedes famouſe geometricien siracuſis sicile arte reſyſted longe tyme marcellus captaygne romaynes beſieged citie siracuſis fynally citie beinge wonne ſente marcellus founde drawynge fygures geometry grounde wherto ſoo attentife whan boden come marcellus aunſwered whan hadde finiſhed fygure whiche makynge wolde come whiche aunſwere meſſager diſdaynynge ſlewe archimedes whiche marcellus excedyngly ſory ſuppoſe fyrſte inuented makynge archiontici certayne heretikes whiche affyrmed vnyuerſall ſtates thynges made god prynces alſo denyed reſurrecton body arcirna lyttell carte whele barowe arconicum minorall called arſenyke arctium io agric great burre arcto aui ſtrayne often tymes arctophylax certayne figure ſterres folowynge charles wayne called alſo bootes arctos fygure ſterres called charles wayne alſo vrſa maior arctous arcticus um northe arctus um ſtreyght arcturus ſterre whiche tayle called arctos urſa maior arcuatim bent lyke bowe arcuatus faſcioned lyke bowe arcubaliſta croſſebowe arcula lyttell coffer caſket arculus roll woman weare heades beare water mylke eaſelye arcuor ari made bente lyke bowe vaulted arcus bowe vault roufe ardea byrde called heron alſo name citie latio beinge rome xxii mile wherein palayce turnus aeneas vaynquiſhed people called rutuli ardeates people citie ardea ardelio buſy man medlyng many thinges ſkyll nothynge ardens ti haſtye doynge quycke wytted burnynge ardent ardenter feruently ardeo arſi dêre burne loue ardentely excedyngely make haſt conſumed deſyre alſo ſhine tyrio que ardebat murice laena mantell dyd ſhyne fine purple tyre ardêre cupiditate couet ardently ardêre iracūdia inflamed anger ardêre maxime flagitio plautus haue done infamed myſcheuous deede ardeola hernſewe alſo byrd wherof iii kyndes one called pella whiche ingendreth moche dyffycultie lyke wyſe ſytteth tyme treadynge bloud yſſueth eye called alba greke name leuce whiche amounteth moche iii called stellaris piger ardeſco haſty arduenna great wod gallia belgica whiche taketh ſpace 500 myles comming frō ryuer rhene throughe lande luke vnto citie tournay ardum olde wryters vſed arduum arduus hygh difficult harde come area large place citie kept euer cleane marchauntes aſſemble haue ſene diuerſe city almayne alſo euery place marked buylde ſet houſe alſo floore corne thraſſhed ouer quarter garden wherin herbes ſowen ſet areator threſhar arefacio make drye arelate citie fraunce citie araby called alſo aloab areopolitae inhabitantes areopôlis areſco ſcere waxe dry made drye aretalogus bragger vaūter vertues somtyme forger lye make men mery arête latine uirtus englyſhe vertue alſo name wyfe alcinous kyng phaeacis homer wryteth odyſſea arethuſa companion diana alſo name fountayne sicile metia arethyſſa arethuſa ryuer greate armeny aretium citie tuſcana fyfty myles frō peruſe aretinus um citie arferis wyne water offered infernall goddes rather dyuelles arganthonius hyll nyghe bithinia citie pruſias nygh thervnto wel hilas companiō hercules taken ſodeynly away nymphes whan well fetche water argatilis kynde foule whiche bredeth water bankes makynge neſte lynnen threde fourme ball ſoo cloſe entrynge maye founde argemata galen iſagog ſore eye whiche blacke eye prouiſion money argentarius banker men doo make theyr exchaunge money argenteus um ſyluer argentina fayre citie germany weſt ſide riuer reine called strauſburgh alſo called argentoracum argentum ſyluer ſomtyme ſignifieth plate argentum uiuum quicke ſyluer argeſtes wynde whiche bloweth oute ſouthe weſte argeus um citie argo argia countrey peloponeſo morea argiae plurali citie laconia argiletum thynge gathered whiche confirmeth whiche doubtefull ſometyme ſignifieth mater ſomtyme coniecture ſometyme ſhorte expoſition whiche foloweth othewhyle ſentence alſo ſygne token sine argumento without moneyplautus argus ſon ariſtor v kynge argiues oſiris wente egypte whiche made ſhyp wherin iaſon ſayled colchos poetes fayned hundrede eye ſignyfyenge thereby wyſedome circumſpection moreouer iuno appointed kepe io ſhe tranſformed cowe mercurius ſent iupiter ſwete armony broughte argus ſlepe ſlewe hym toke io broughte egypt iuno toke eye argus ſet fethers pecockes tayle wherfore pecocke called auis iunonia iunos byrde argutatio reaſonynge debatynge argute aduerb ſignifieng wittyle ſubtyly argutiae ſharpe wordes ſhreude argutioſa prety taunte quippy argutor aris ari ſpeke ſharpelye ſhrewdly pertly argutulus ſomewhat perte quicke aunſwerynge argutum ſelender ſmall argutum caput ſharp piked head lyke ſugar lofe argutus um reproued ſometyme ſignifieth ſhrewde ſpeakynge ſharply inſerche mannes wytte alſo ſhyrle voyce ſomtyme leane arguta diuiſio ſubtyl diuiſion arguti homines ſpeake moche fewe wordes arguti oculus rollyng eies alway moving argyranche ſyluer ſyckeneſſe argyraſpidae men bearynge ſhyldes ſyluer theſe ſouldiours great kinge alexander whiche deathe retayned ſundrye prynces launce knyghtes v argyrini certayne people epiro argyritis ſpume ſome ſyluer ariadne lady wyfe theſeus forſoke notwithſtandynge ſhe ſaued lyfe aricia citie italy aricinum noemus wood ſayde citie numa kynge romayns fayned ſpeake aegeria fayry aricinus lacus plautus brooke aricia ariditas dryneſſe aridus drye arida uita ſtraight lyfe aridus uictus plinius harde fare aridus homo drye felowe whome nothynge maye gotten ſome call hym pelt pynchebeke aries etis ram alſo piece ordyuaunce ingine made lyke rammes heed beat downe wall alſo oone xii ſignes ſum paſſeth alſo fiſhe hauynge horne lyke ramme whiche ſometyme holdeth heade water eſpy man ſwymmynge goeth vnto hym pulleth hym vnder water deuoureth hym arietinus ramme arieto aui hit throwe downe arimaſpi people sithia whiche haue one eye theyr foreheade whiche fyghte continuallye griphons gripe herodotus ſayth haue ii eye vſe wynk one may haue ſtedfaſt whan ſhote ariminum olde citie flaminea countrey italy ryuer rubicon arimpaei people vnder domynyon prynce moſcouites whiche lyue alwaye woodes gentyl maners iuſt whiche eate nothinge bearies maſteherodo arinca gellius called rye arion plinius famous harper mariner wold haue throwen ſea haue moneye deſyryng let playe ſonge harpe dyed afterwarde lepte water dolphin receyuynge hym backe brought hym lande lyue ariſta berde corne sometyme put wheate ariſtathea malowe great leafe ariſtarchus grāmarien alexandria whiche taught ſon kynge ptolomeus called philometor ſuch iudgement thoughte verſe homere whiche dyd approue dyed abſtinence bycauſe wold ſuſtein peyne dropſy whan age 72 yeres incarnation chriſte 127 yeres ariſtheus ſonne apollo cere called h • ſiodus apollo paſtoralis whiche ſlayne dogges gentile painted hym yong lad berdleſſe ſtandyng betwene ii top mountayn parnaſus whiche ranne fountain caſtalius hauynge far hym ſerpent pithon ſtrake arrowe alſo dedicate vnto grype rauen ariſtides noble manne athene wyſedome iuſtice temperaunce excellēt gouernaunce commō weale athene ioyned themiſtocles man great proweſſe rycheſſe ſayinge counſayle knewe thynge whiche expedyente common weale neceſſary ſhulde openly knowen deſired haue one appoynted vnto ſhuld diſcloſe counſayle aſſigned hym ariſtides ſhewed nauye lacedemonians mought ſhortly ſet fyre ſoo ſhulde theyr puiſſaunce abated whiche ariſtides herynge retourned vnto counſayle ſayde aduyſe themiſtocles profitable honeſt athenienſes herynge honeſt iuged mought profytable wolde let diſcloſed ſuche credence ariſtides alſo withſtandynge atheniences exiled without cauſe onely bycauſe excelled iuſtice yet departynge prayed god ſo euer deſyred moughte come good effect concluſion whan called agayne exyle neuer remembred olde diſpleaſure ſoo moche alway honoured themiſtocles euer contended weale publyke temperaunce greate token withſtanding ben greteſt dignitie office common weale athene yet dyed ſo poore left ſufficiently bury hym worſhypfully doughters maryed charge citie ſon lyſimachus gyuen people one hundred mina whiche amounteth money ccxxxix li xi viii howe maye chriſten men aſhamed whā rede ſtory beholdynge temperaunce iuſtice charitie reſemblance chriſtis doctrine whiche wyl nothynge vnhyred meaſure iuſtice theyr affection name iiii whiche deſerued ſo good remembrance afore incarnation 474 yeres ariſtides chriſtian philoſopher athene yere lorde 132 made eloquente defence chriſtes religion delyuered hadriane emperoure wherwith ſo perſwaded gaue commandement proconſull aſia ſhulde put chriſten man death except conuicte ſome crime notable ariſtippus diſciple socrates notwithſtandynge dyd put chyefe goodnes volupte pleaſure wherfore diogenes called hym royall dogge bycauſe alwaye folowed ryche taughte money tyme beinge ſea whan ſtorme came ſhyppe peryll ſore aferde peryll paſte men aſked hym feared ſo moche ſens philoſopher peryl ſaid loſſe ignorant knaue noble philoſopher lyke eſtimation folowers hym called cirenaici saynct auguſtine ſaythe hym requiſite aunſwere ariſtippum euery part lyued ſo betwene hym beaſte diuerſitie ſecte diſciples socrates noble phyloſophers vtterly exterminate doughter called arête excellentely lerned afore chryſte 366 yeres ariſtobolus ſon hircanus captayne chiefe buſhop iewes 92 yeres afore commynge chryſte man attempted tranſlate dignitie byſhop vnto dignitie kynge fyrſte whiche returnynge captiuitie babylon toke hym weare crowne ſubdued people called iturei siria compelled circumcided afterwarde yll counſayl brother antigonus put mother yonger brethern pryſon ſlewe ſayd brother antygonus famyſhynge hym whiche crueltie god ſoo ſtrake vengeance hsi bowelles rente bely vometed vp bloude body ſo dyed ariſtocratia fourme gouernaunce weale publyke rule whiche moſte vertue ariſtolochia herbe wherof thre kyndes one called rounde whiche hath leaues faſcion lyke iuy ſomwhat rounder wher ſharpe delycate odour floure white lyke lyttell bonet vppon red knop rootes rounde manye called longe ariſtolochia hathe lengar leaues ſmall braunches pourple floure whiche ſtynketh whan ſpryngeth facion peare rote therof longe greatneſſe mannes fingar bothe beare bearyes lyke caper within boxe colour ar bitter ſtynkynge thyrde longe hath ſmal braunches ful leaues ſomwhat rounde lyke leſſe ſyngreene hath floures lyke vnto rewe rootes longe ſmal thicke rynde ſote ſauour ariſtomenes man meſſene whiche called iuſtiſsimus moſte iuſte manne whan dead foundē haue harte hearye ariſtophanes poete mooſte eloquent tunge athene althoughe borne rhodes wrate liiii commedyes wherin ſpared whiche lyued diſpleaſure socrates therfore reprehendeth hym commedy called cloudes ariſtopherum dyſhe wherin meate borne dyner ariſtoteles ſonne nicomachus phiſition borne stagera greece conſumed youthe ryottouſely afterwarde ſcholer noble plato xx yeres continually excelled men ſharpnes wytte knowledge dyuerſe ſciences wherfore kynge philipe macedoni ſente ſonne alexander hym taughte ſayinge thanked god ſon borne tyme man began ſecte folowers wherof called peripatetici taught deathe plato xxiii yeres banyſhed athene bycauſe ſuppoſed demid wel goddes written dyed occaſion wente ſea ſyde perceyued fyſher menne ſyttynge doinge ſomwhat whan aſked tolde hym ryddell whiche whan longe ſtydye coulde aſſoyle ſhame ſorowe dyed hym quintilian writeth wyſe ſay ariſtotle wote whether maye iudge excellent knowlege thynges abundaunce wrytynge ſwetenes eloquence ſharpneſſe wyt elles diuerſitie workes withſtandynge lyttell perſonage crooke backed yll ſhapen ſtuttyng 345 yeres chriſtes incarnation arithmetica scyence numbrynge fyrſte founden vncertain albeit abraham fyrſte taught vnto egyptian longe tyme pythagoras declared vnto greekes plato wylleth thynges number taught vnto chyldren whithout whiche nothynge eyther priuate commone well ordered ſcience diuided viii partes ſaye numbryng addition puttynge subtraction takynge away mediation partynge myddes duplication doublynge multiplication augmentynge one number another diuiſion diuidynge one number progreſſion one two thre maketh ſyxe ouer ſcience digitus ſingle number vnto ten 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 articulus hole number 10 20 30 40 ſo forthe number compounde digitus articulus 12 23 34 46 c ſcience ſuch excellency well diuines phyloſophers therby declare moſte diffuſe miſteris theyr ymagination pythagoras ſuppoſed world al thynges fyrſte created number ariſtotle affirmeth beſte profe naturall foole number truelye aritudo drythe dryneſſe arma orum harnayes weapon alſo inſtrumentes al maner craftes alſo ſtandardes baners ſomtyme battaylles ad arma uocare commaunder men harneys redy armamenta tooles inſtrumentes al ſtore warres ſhyppes armour tacklynge armamentarium armory ſtorehouſe ſhyppes ordinaunce armarium bookes layde ſtuffe houſeholde armati armed men armator armorer armatura armure armenia name ii region one called armenia minor armenia maior minor hath northe weſte parte cappadociam eaſte noble ryuer euphrates armeniam maiorem ſouth mountayn taurus armenia maior hath northe colchidem iberiam albaniam weſte parte cappadocia eaſte parte ſea called hircanum ſouthe meſopotamiam mountaygne taurum armeni people armenia whiche chriſtened late yeres nowe ſubiectes vnto turkes ſome thing erred frome churche latines greekes haue one great byſhop call catholicum celebrate moche lyke vnto faſcion doo kepe holy neyther natiuitie chriſte baptiſine ſaying neded purged clenſed ſynne alſo take frome ſacramentes vertue conferre grace alſo efteſones baptiſe come churche latines ſayinge catholike faythe alſo ſaye man may chriſtened excepte receyue ſacramente aultare alſo infantes nede baptiſed affyrmynge oryginall ſynne alſo holy ghoſte procedeth father ſonne alſo ſacrament aultar maye cōſecrate bread cleane without leuen alſo conſecration put water wyne moreouer ſay receyuing ſacrament profyteth onely body ſowle alſo ſay whā chriſte deſcended hell led hym ſoules alſo matrimony ſacrament may diſſolued wyl man womā alſo chriſte dyd ryſe ſaterdaye paraſceue good fryday theſe hereſies whiche paſſe ouer briefneſſe condemned ſondry generall counſailes conſente chriſtendom armeniacum malum fruyte accompted among kynde peach italianes call armelini frenche men ſez abricotes knowe englande armeniaca malus tre beareth fruite armentarius keper armery ſometime eſquiar de eſquiry armentum ſtore horſe nete ſometyme ſignifieth cattell armiger geri properly eſquire body whiche alwaye attendynge aboute knyght beareth head piece ſpere ſhylde armillae rynges gentyll woman vſed weare aboute theyr armes daye ſome men womē vſe called bracelet armille neut gen inſtrumente falſhode craft armillum veſſell wherin vſed theſe ſacrifice put wyne armiluſtrum feſtyuall day whyche romaynes dyd ſacrifyce armed trumpettes dyd blowe bluddy ſoundes alſo place wherin ſuche ſacrifice made armipotens puiſſant armes armo aui arme armocea wylde radyſhe armoraciaio agric ruellius idem armon ryuer cometh hylles arabye diuideth moabitide frome amonitide armorica auncient name brytayne fraunce armus ſhoulder beaſte pynion fowle arnentis oppianꝰ f maſſariꝰ fyſſhe whiche plinye calleth hippuris theodorus callyth hym equiſelis whiche lyke horſes tayle ſpauneth ſprynge tyme verye lyttell fyſhe ſhortly groweth greate vſeth repayre ſhippes wrecked arnion uel arnogloſſo herbe callyd plan tayne whiche colde drye ſecond degree iuyce wherof curyng feuers certiane ſtoppynge bloud ſouerayne vertue lyke ſede water therof againſt ſtone drunke arnobius noble rhetorician affrike maiſter lactantius wrate agaynſte gentile yere lorde 305 whoſe expoſition haue vpon pſalter arnus ſwyft ryuer italy runneth citie florence aro aui eare plowe lande aroma atis pleaſant ſauour alſo ſpice aromaticus um ſwete ſauor odoriferous aromatites precious ſtone hath ſauour myrre aromatorius aromatopola ſellith thinges hauyng ſwete ſauour aros herbe callyd wake robyn callid ſome serpentaria minor bycauſe hath leaues lyke dragon broder hauyng black ſpottes groweth hedge arpinas man woman arpinum arpinum aunciente towne italye famouſe noble byrthe plautus tulli marius arquatus morbus ſyckeneſſe callyd iaundiſe arquites olde wryters vſed archer arquus qui raynbowe arrectarij paries walles made tymber parget diuide chamber arreptitius obſeſſed ylle ſpyrite arrha arrhabo erneſt money arrideo plautus riſi dêre ſmyle thynge ſometyme lyke content aedes mihi arridebant houſe lyked well arrexit animos aduanced theyr courage arrige aures saluſt lay thyne eares gyue eare whiche ſpokenterent arrigo rigi ere water grounde arriminenſis ſynodus generall counſell kepte arriminum italye yere lord 360 xxii yere raigne emperour conſtantius grekes aſſayd ſubtyl wyttes cōdemne noble counſayle nicene wyſedome latines dyſpution defeeryd generall counſayle rome opinion arrians condemned arripio pui ere take arripere conditionem sueto de claris grā take offer arripere maledictum take heede ylle reportecicero quare cum iſta ſis authoritate non debes marce arripere maledictum ex triuio aut ex ſcurrarum aliquo conuitio wherfore moche ye auctoritie eſtymation ye oughte marke take hede ylle worde ſpoken abrode rebuke raylyng knaue arripere ſermonē plautus take hym worde arripere ſe foras gette hym oute doores arrius heeretycke beynge prieſte churche alexandria yere lord ccc twenty conſtantinus magnus beynge emperour arrius fayre perſonage hauynge verye ſharpe wytte hadde moche eſtimation fallynge laſt pryde ambition honour purpoſed helde hereſye ſonne deitie equall vnto father ſame ſubſtaunce meere creature vnto errour inducyd onely great parte worlde chriſtened alſo greate number noble clerkes whyche callid great counſel nicene themperour preſent 318 biſhops ſundry many aſſemblees longe diſputation laſte determined ſon equal one ſubſtance father touching diuinite decree apꝓued thēperor arrius vi byſhops obſtinatly perſeuered hereſy banyſhed afterward arriꝰ foul hereſy corrupted world finyſhed lyfe horrible deathe diſputyng beinge prouoked ſtole mauſolus kynge caria notable chaſtytie loue towarde huſbande ſoo excellyd whan deade ſhe cauſyd harte dryed veſſell golde pouder lyttell lyttell dranke vp ſayinge theyr two harte ſhulde neuer departe aſunder ſhe thoughte mought made worthy ſepulchre owne bodye withſtandynge ſhe made body ſuche ſepulchre excellent workemanſhyp alſo beaultie coſtlynes taken one meruayles worlde notable fame thereof hereſye beynge one condempned eftſoones reuyued paulus samoſatenus arteria ſynew lyke vayn wherin ſpiryte lyfe dothe walke myxte bloude arthetica paſsio callyd alſoo morbus articularis ioynte
