whyche beynge waſhed water drunken wine inhabitauntes doo affyrme onely cureth ſayde ſtroke plinius ſaythe male female gothe alwaye togyther one ſlayne continually foloweth ſleer wyl neuer leue hym vntyll haue ſtryken hym althoughe great aſſembly people except paſſe ouer ryuer withſtandynge name aſpis ſoo generall conteyneth dyuers kyndes whiche ſhal written hereafter aſplenium io agric herbe called alſo scolopendra hath many leaues growyng one rote lyke wourme whiche callyd palmer hath many feete ſomewhat lyke vnto ferne hathe neyther flowres ſede callyd cōmon apothecarie • citrac ſome calle ſtone ferne aſplenos ruell herbe growynge ſtone wallesdioſc amonge flyntes ſhadowe hauynge leaues many dyuiſyons lyke polypodium many growynge oone roote whyche nygh grounde tawny coloured aboue grene hath neyther ſtalke flowre alſoo callyd scolopendra aſporto aui cary away aſſae dry ſtoones aſſaracus ſonne trois kynge troyanes aſſatura roſted meate aſſ • cla page foloweth thyng wyll man aſſectator companyon aſſector aris ari kepe company aſſentatio flattery aſſentatiuncula flatterynge tale aſſentio si tire aſſentior conſent aſſent alſo perceyueplautus sed aſſentio aperiri foras quae abſorbent quicquid uenit infra peſſulos perceyue doores openyd whyche deuouren commethe within boltes aſſentor aris flatter commendyng man actes yll aſſequor eris qui folowe gette optayne ſometyme render moche one hath deſerued nullam partem uidear tuorum meritorum aſſecutus cicero maye founde haue rendred thynge merites haue done ſo moche ye haue deſerued aſſequi nomen gette renoume aſſer eris aſsimulatio plautus dyſſembled countenaunce aſsimulo fayn thing alſo compare counte • fayte aſsipondium pounde weyght aſsis ſawen bourde aſsiſia one n • mi pallas minerua aſsiſto ſtiti ſtere defende leo tyme byſhop rome conſules certayne ſenatours ſubmytted ſelfes vnto hym whan hoſt ſuppoſed wolde haue contempte haue continued iornay diſtroy rome contrary theyr expectation pardoned departed wherat men meruailynge demaundynge hym ſo dyd aunſwered while byſſhop ſenatour ſpake vnto hym beheld ſtandynge euery hand man armes excellent perſonage euery holding naked ſworde ouer hym menacynge pro audire poteris thou mayſt audiens dicto redy commanded commaundement obedient audienciam facere commaunde make ſilence whiche cryers place iuſtice audiri beleued auditio herynge audience aſinar suſpendas potius quam tacita haec auferas thou mayſte rather hange make confeſſe ſecrete auferre inultum goo quyte without punyſhment ergo pretium ob ſtultitiam fero terent • andria ſed inultum depenes baratro vnthriſt lechery gluttony deuoureth ſubſtance barba bearde barba tenus touchinge bearde barba iouis herbe callyd syngrene groweth tyles barba ſaenis herbe whyche groweth amonge ſtones leaues wherof lyke vnto longe heares alſo callyd barba petrae hathe yelowe floure roote therof bytter barbare barbarouſelye rudelye withoute eloquence barbari olde tyme people excepte grekes properly whiche ſpeake groſſely without obſeruynge congruitie pronounce perfectely ſpecially greeke latyne alſo abhorte clegancy moreouer ſygnifieth whiche without letter fiers cruell maners countenaunce barbaria countrey dwelleth people rude beaſtely barbaricarii weauere clothe baudkyn barbaricus barbarous barbary rudenes lacke ciuilitie barbariſmus corrupte fourme ſpeakyng pronouncynge barbatulus hath yonge berde barbatus um bearded barbeſola towne spayne callyd barbeſull barbitium bearde barbitos inſtrument muſyke whiche ſuppoſe men calle doulſymers ſome thynke double harpe callyd roote hym ſeketh hym hoole lyeth breath noſethrylles compelleth come forthe hart hath fought ſerpent caten hym becommeth thyrſty runneth vnto ſome water leapeth doth drynk ſhuld take neuer ſo lytel water ſhulde dye incontinent yſſue eye dropes whiche lyttell lyttell congeale waxe greate cheſten nutte harte comme water men awayt thoſe dropes fall taketh layeth amonge treaſure thynge moſt precious agaynſt maner poyſon moſt certayne remedye haue taken oute boke ioan agricola de recentioribus medicamentis bembina towne forreſte callyd nemaeus bembinatus towne wodde benacus lacus lake italy callyd gardae bene well honeſtly proſperouſely bene accipere aliquem intreate one well intertayne hym bene acceptus well intertayned bene agitur plautus thynge well done bene ambulato god bene audire plinius well ſpoken bene cogitare de aliquo haue good opinion one bene conuenire inter eos agreed well togyther bene curare aetatem lyue pleaſantly bene de te mereo intreate well thou art beholden vnto bene ferre gratiam plaut rud pleaſure one bene habere behaue hym well bene hercle denuncias plaut trinum thou telleſt good tydynges bene hoc habet plaut epid mattier commeth well paſſe bene longus ſermo longe tale bene magnus great bene mane tymely bene mereri pleaſure one bene multi many bene nummatusm marſupium purſe welle ſtoryd money bene nummatus homo well monied man bene ſucceſsit came well paſſe bene uale farewell adewe bene ualere good helth bene uertere turne good precor deum ut haec re bene uertat tibi praye god thynge may tourne good may thy profyte bene uiuere make good chere bene bithynia bitumen kynde naturall lyme whereof olde walles citie babylon made bituminatus um lyme claye called bitumen biturges bourges fraunce biuium awaye hauynge two pathes biuius um done two ſundry wayes bizen citie thracia pliny called bizian b ante l blanda towne spayn called blanes alſo delectable thinges readynge blande aduerbe ſignifienge fayre pleaſaunt wordes graciouſely amorouſely flatteryngely blandimentū thynge pleſantly done ſpoken blanditia flatterye pleaſaunt motion intiſement wordes blandicus flattereth blandidicus plaut trinum fayre ſpeaker flatterer blandi loquentulus pleaſaunt ſpeaker blandior iris iri flatter ſpeke fayre aduauntage blanditiae flatterynge fayre ſpeche blandus um flatterynge fayre ſpoken pleaſaunte blapſigonia loſſe generation properlye bee blaſphemia curſynge reprochynge commonly blaſphemy whiche nowe onely referred deſpite god blaſphemo aui curſe reproche ſpeke derogatiō deſpyte blatero oni bablar talketh purpoſe blatero aui bable vayne purpoſe blatio iui ire ſpeake talke lyke foole without purpoſe reaſon bable blatta properly longe flye fleeth leame candell kynde mothes alſo ſylke worme blattaria herbe callyd moleyn blatteus um purple veſtis blattea purple garment blax ſofte delycate wanton decaerne thynges whyche vaynely boſteth hym ſelfe blemmiae monſtruous people india haue none head theyr eye mouthe breaſtes blepharo oni hath great browes bleptae people aphrike haue vyſages theyr breaſtes blaeſus ſtammereth omyttynge ſome letter ſpeakynge blitteus um vnſauery blittea meretrix vnſauery queane blittus herbe beinge kynde bietes hauynge ſent blitum herbe callyd ſpynache ¶b ante boa ſerpent italy ſo great large tyme whanne one kylde chyld hole founde bealyplinl •• cap •• pliny writeth boa alſo ſyekenes wherin body ful redde blyſters boalia playes made healthe ox kyen boaria herbe callyd clote burre boarium forum market place ox ſolde boca uel bocas fyſhe whiche hath back paynted ſundry colour iouius ſayth affyrmeth taken coſtes great ſculles withſtandyng yet fynde name englyſhe boces callyd theodorus bocae fyſſhe onely hath voyce whiche mought ſeme dogfyſhe whiche ſayde dothe make noyſe lyke barkynge dogge taken bocchyris man name bodellium kynd ſwete ſmellyng gumme boebis lake theſſaly boēmia royalme callyd beame incloſyd boundes germany hauynge eaſte hungary ſouthe bauier weſte countreye callyd noricum northeaſte polonia poole equall length bredthe eche beyng thre dayes iourney enuyroned famous foreſte callyd sylua hercynia myddell therof paſſethe greate ryuer callyd albis nother ryuer namyd multania vppon ryuage whereof ſette pryncipall cytie namyd braga praga language duche ſlauoin tungue withſtandynge church 〈◊〉 people art taughte duche tunge church yardes taughte beame tunge varye catholyke faythe ſundry opinyons ſkorne ceremony ſome place pryuyly obſerue ſecte adamites waldenſes acte lecherye whereof wrytten wordes adamitae vualdenſes boeodurum citie almayne nowe called patauia paſſaw boeotia countrey greece wherin citie thebe nowe called vandalia bogud towne affryke alſo name kynge boiae gyues fetter boij people burbon fraunce bauiar almayne boletus muſhrom bolis idis darte wyld fyre alſo plū met lyne wherwith ſhypmen doo ſounde ſea fynde lande bolus maſſe lumpe mettal like thynge alſo throwe caſte dyſe alſo draughte net water alſo morſell bombax plautus aduerbe ſpoken hym ſetteth naught whiche ſpoken one wolde ſaye whan rebuked faulte tuſhe care bombitatio noyes bee make bombus great ſowne noyſe trumpe gunne bounce bombix icis ſylke worme bombycinus um ſylke bombycina ueſtis garment ſylke bomolochus common ſcoffar ſuſteyneth villany get money alſo taken boye ſtode altar ende ſtele away candels bona dea ſhe ſome called farua fauna varro wryteth lyfe neuer man dyd ſe harde named onely huſbande bona caduca goodes damned goodes eſcheted bona praedia goodes whiche lyable euery action bonaria caulmnes ſea bonaſus beaſte fourme lyke bull broder ſhorter hath mane lyke horſe downe ſhulders heare ſofter commeth downe eye heare body lyke bryght ſorrell mane darker couloured fleſhe pleaſaunte eatinge therfore hunted runneth continually vntill wery runnynge flyngeth ſhoteth forthe ſharde dunge thre furlonge hym plinius writeth bonitas goodnes honeſtie iuſtyce bonum good whiche contrary ylle bonus good man alſo beneuolent peaſyble lyberal playne eaſy ſpeake worſhypful treatable mercyfull bona dicere report well bona fide dicere terent andria ſay truely playnely bona par part bona uenia lycence noo diſpleaſure bona uerba quaeſo ſay well pray bonae aedes ſubſtancyall houſe bonae fidei poſſeſſor feoffee truſt boni conſulas take good parte boni frugi honeſt good condition bona ualetudo good helthe bonae notae uinum wyne good ſorte bonae fidei emptor meaneth good faythe byenge intendynge deceyte bonus horas male collocare looſe tyme whyche mought haue ben better ſpent bonis auibus good lucke bono animo eſſe good chere bono animo dicere aut facere ſpeake thynge good intent bono ingenio eſſe debonayre bono publico facere doo commune weale boo belowe lyke cowe boōtes ſterre folowith charles wain borbetomagus vormatia towne callyd wormes almayne boreae iaſper ſtones boreas northeſterne wynde boreus polus northeſterre callyd lode ſterre borith herbe fuller vſe borſyrites kynde olyue hauynge manye boughes white ſpotted ſanguyne boryſthenes greatte ryuer countreye scithia bos bouis rother beeſt bul oxe cow ❀bos lingua prouerbe touchyng whiche dare ſpeake truthe wyl bicauſe haue receiued money hold theyr peace boſphorus name part ſea whiche lyeth two ſundry coſtes one conſtā tinople northe boſra citie idumea boſtar oxe houſe boſtrychites preciouſe ſtone lyke womennes heare botrys botrus cluſter grape botrytes precious ſtone like black grape botuli whiche haue moche bloud botulus botellus puddynge made inwarde rother beaſte botytillus lyttell cluſter grape bouatim lyke oxe bouicida ſlauter man bouile oxe ſtall bouillae arum towne far rome bouillus um belonginge neate bouinator greatte noyſe cryeth man bouinor aris belowe lyke cowe b ante r brabevta brabeutes ordeyned iudge game wraſtelinge runninge leapynge bracca kynde mantell whiche nowe commeth ireland longe garmēt made roughe friſe braccharij maker ſuche clothe brachiale wreſtbone hande brachialia bracelettes whiche ſome gentyll men gentylwomen doo vſe aboute theyr armes brachiatus whiche lyke arme holdeth thinge vp prop ſhore brachicatalecton one ſyllable lacketh ende verſe brachicatalecticum carmen verſe lacking one bracara auguſta towne called briga spayne bragada ryuer nere vtica affrica branchia gilles fiſhe branchos reume catarre falleth downe chekes brannouites people countrey fraunce called le vafe de moriane braſsica colewurtes brauium brabium rewarde wraſtlinge runninge leaping commonly called chiefe game brauum citie burgus spayne breno capitayne leader frenchman called galli whiche builded verona citie venice brephotrophia hospitall chyldren kepte nouriſhed breue ſhortely breuia place water oone maye wade breuiculus lyttell ſhorte man breuiloquium ſhorte fourme ſpeakynge breuiloquentia ſame breuiloquus ſpeaketh mynde fewe wordes breuiarium bridgment breuitas ſhortneſſe breuis breue ſhorte breui poſtea ſone breuiori ſumma emere bye leſſe pryce breuiſsima terra lyttell grounde breuiter ſhortly breue idem quickely briarêus gyant whiche exceding greatneſſe brigantes auncient people northe parte englande brigantium citie galitia called compoſtella britanica herbe lyke great ſorrell blacker thycker therewith moſy roote blacke lyttell taſtynge ſtrayneth tunge britania moſte noble yle worlde wherin conteyned countreis englād scotlande lyeth frome germania weſt fraunce spayne weſte northeweſtplin li 4 fourme therof lyke triangle ſome haue wrytten lyke blade gleyue lengthe extended northe furthermoſte parte scotlande called calidonia whiche plinius solinus martianus doo agree eight hundred myles alſo breade martianusmart li 6 thre hundred myles accompting italion myles whiche ſo moche englyſſhe myles dyſtaunce betwene yle calays ſandes called plinius geſſoriacum gallia narroweſte paſſage betwene bothe countreys 50 italion myles ſame pliny nowe geſſed lyttell aboue xxx englyſhe myles fyrſte occaſion name yle yet found certayne determination moche remaineth autentique ancient hiſtory makynge therof remembrance olde bookes britonnes ſuche beinge deſtroyed saxon indeuored ſelfe extincte vtterlye honourable renoume name briton lyke gothes delt romaynes alſo parte titus liuius conqueſt britain remembred hiſtories iulius ruſticus dyuerſe noble wrytars wrate ſpecially countray vtterlye peryſſhed whiche remayne commentary iulius caeſar cornelius tacitus diodorus siculus whiche wrate coſmography haue omytted origynall begynninge name hyſtorye gildas briton canne founde withſtanding saxon inuaded realm therfore mought lack ſuche bokes mought beſt inſtructe beda vertuouſe ryght well lerned man ſemeth haue ſeene nothynge wrytten matter ſaythe yle toke name britania inhabytauntes britania fraunce nothynge lyke true countrey verye longe afore tyme beda named armorica armoricus tractus whiche tyme long yle called moſt aunciēt wrytars britania solinus wryteth ſemed worlde moche weſt coſt gallia thoughte vttermoſte boundes worlde alſo iulius ceſar wrytethcaeſ li 5 place yle vnknowen frenche men ſauynge fewe marchauntes yet noo farther knewe ſea cooſte towarde fraunce moreouer ſame briton inhabitantes yle dyd affirme lefte amonge remembraunce innermooſte parte countray inhabited theym whiche theyr fyrſte begynnynge ſame yle well conſydered aucthoritye wrytar bothe excellent prince alſo great lerned man beinge hym ſelfe yle douted moſte diligently ſerched true knowelege auncienty therof mought haue founden inhabitantes come ſtocke aeneas whiche progeny hym ſelfe came wolde haue reioyced lyttell therat proweſſe valyaunte courage whiche hym ſelfe commended moreouer name began brutus whome wrytars haue theyr owne heades ymagined haue diſcended aeneas troyane lykelye yle called albion diocleciās daughter whyte rockes whereof haue writen dyuerſe cauſes firſte olde latine hiſtoriens agree ſon syluius whiche ſeconde ſucceſſion aeneas theym named ſonne aſcanius aeneas called alſo syluius whervnto greekes doo alſo accorde name syluius brother aſcanius borne deathe aeneas therfore called poſtumus neyther romayns grekes writ man called brutus eyther ſonne aſcanius afore iunius brutus whiche expelled kynge tarquinus oute rome whiche name alſo gyuen hym deryſion ſonnes tarquine bycauſe ſeemed theym folyſhe dull wytted moreouer ſo moche diuerſitie betwene britania brutus ſemeth vnlykelye agaynſte reaſon one ſhulde procede brutus ben gyuer fyrſte name yle wold haue called brutia brutica rather britania whiche hath noo maner proportion analogie brutus haue done worde albion ſo wyll declare reaſonable cauſe coniecture yle named britania xxx yeres paſſed hapned wildſhere place called yuy churche diſtant ii myles citie sariſbury men digginge make fundation founde holowe ſtone faſt keuered nother ſtone whiche beinge broken booke hauynge lyttell aboue xx leues ſayd thyck velome wherin ſome thyng wrytten whan ſhewed pryeſtes chanons whiche tyme coulde reade wherfore toſſed one another meane whereof torne dyd neglect dyd caſt ſide long tyme piece therof hapned come handes ſtandinge alſo rent defaced ſhewed delyuered maiſter richarde pace chiefe ſecretary kynges moſte royall maieſtye wherof excedyngly reioyced bycauſe partly rente partely defaced bloryd weate whiche fallen coulde fynde one ſentence perfyte withſtandynge longe beholdynge ſhewed ſeemed ſayde boke cō teyned ſome auncient monumente yle perceiued word prytania put britaniae time ſaid afterwarde gyuynge moche ſtudy diligence reading hyſtories conſyderynge wherof worde britania firſte came fyndinge yles part oceane callid britaniae firſt coniecture albion ſayde olde wrytynge reuiued remembrance chāce fynding suidas vnderſtod prytania greke circūflexid aſpiration dothe ſignifie mettalles fayres martes alſo reuenues belongynge commune treaſour conceyued opinion whan greekes flouriſhed wiſedome proweſſe mooſte experte ſaylynge one entred ocean ſea founden yles great plenty tyme leade yron braſſe dyuerſe place golde ſyluer great quantitie wherof came vnto comune treaſores theyr city yerely great reuenues called thoſe yles generall name prytania 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſignifienge place whiche came one wolde ſaye wente mart whan goeth warp barowe fayre whan goeth sturbrige reuenues whan goeth place oute reuenues come yet bicauſe yle excelled euery condition ſome priuatelye called olbion ſay happy richer haue wrytten myne onely coniecture whiche doth nerer approche true ſimilitude inuentions excepte aunciente hyſtorye mean tyme geffraye monemouthe beda whiche probably confute whiche haue declared ſuche wyll gladdely gyue place fynally haue alwaye thought yet doo honourable vnto countrey haue receyued fyrſt name ſuche occaſion haue reherſed generation inhabitauntes therof eyther equall moſte aunciente myxte moſte wyſe valyaunte people greece vainquiſſhours ſubduars troyanes take name fyrſte generation eyther vayne fable man ſuche whiche ſlayne father wandred worlde vncertayne dwell alſo aduaunte v come troianes cauſours deſtruction theyr owne countreye fauourynge • uoutry paris helene neuer proceded notable monumente alſo breaker theyr oth promyſe yet foly founde allmoſte people euery contende haue theyr progenitours come firſt troy whiche fantaſy among wiſe men maye well laughed fayth chryſte fyrſte receyued yle incarnation chriſt 156 yeres britannus brito man countrey eatethe corne groweth bruma wynter brumalis le belongynge wynter brunci whiche haue tut mouthes brunduſium citie realme naples brupeo ere olde wryters vſed ſtupeo pére abaſhed bruſcum bunche knur tree blower trumpet ſpreader fame buccino aui blowe trumpet ſette forthe mannes prayſe diſpraiſe buccinum ſowne trumpet alſo ſhell ſuche made ſayncte cornelys wherin one maye blowe trumpet buccones whiche beinge xxx yeres olde woundes onely extreme labour ſondry bruiſes laſt died ouer alexander builded citie called bucephala horſes name india alexāder vainquiſhed porum bucephalus ſignifieth alſo oxe throte buphthalmon herbe called alſo cotula fe tida lyke comomyl groweth vpright maywede bupina great thyrſte bupodes great fete bupreſtis fly lyke blacke bytell hath lengar legges whiche beaſte dothe conſtantine emperour chyefe head al empire oriental byzari fantaſticall men ſtraunge inuentions c ante c hym selfe ſignifieth caius proper name manne therfore ioined name c iul caeſar caius iulius caeſar cl ſignifieth claudius cabala tradition ſewes lefte amonge moyſes without wrytyng father ſon ſo continually theyr generation wherin included vnderſtandynge well ſecretes nature miſticall ſence included wordes holy ſcripture cabaeſi cael meaſures fylled caballi people aſia caballinus um perteyninge horſe caballinus fons riuer called alſo helicon whiche ryuer moſte commune haunt ix muſes cachinnor aris ari laughe immoderately loude voyce cachinnus ſcorne loude laughter deriſion cachinnos commouere make menne laughe cachinnum ſuſtollere laughe oute meaſure cachrys rounde thyng growyng meaſure amphora dothe caea yle ſea called aegeum alſo called coa ſilke wurmes fyrſt founde countreye hyppocrates prynce phiſitions caebus ape tayle maye take munkay caecum dy oculata dy day whā money payed daye whanne paydplautus pſeud eme die caecum hercle oleum id uendito oculata die bye day money payde layde promiſing day ſell agayne whan moneye brought forthe eraſ chil alſo ciuile lawiars call thoſe day wytneſſes whiche certified abſent caecas dy caecum teſtimonia caecias eaſte northeſt wynde caecigeni whiche borne blynde caecilia ſlowe worme blynde caecitas lucre 2 blindnes onely bodely bycauſe dyd weare tyme theyr election white apparayl may taken tranſlation tyme vniuerſities callyd inceptours regent maiſters alſo lately chriſtenyd newly entred ſome honorable worſhypfull ſtate vegetius ſaythe candidati men warre whiche priuilege candidati caeſaris ſuch ſued great office recōmended emperor election preſuming alway themperors recōmendation ſhuld take place dyd ſolicite negligētly wherof hapned prouerbe sic petis tan quam caeſaris candidatus ❀ whan man aſked thing ſuch form thinketh māwyl deny hym ſayth ye aſke themperor ſpoken alſo callid candidati principis budeus facion vſed may neuer publik weie perfit candide gentylly eaſyly candido aui make whyte candidus um whyte albus orient white ſometymes taken fortunate gentyll eaſy candidus iudex gentyll eaſy iudge candidus lector gentyl reder doth openly reproue readeth candifacio make white bleache make glowe lyke burnyng cole candifico aui make white candor oris brightnes whitenes canentae old romayns canicae branne wheate caniceps beaſt whiche hath onely face dogge canicula lyttell dogge bytche alſo ſterre wherof canycular dogge dayes named dy caniculares caniculus whelpe caninus doggyſhe dogge canis dogge kynd fyſhe callid dogfiſh play table ſygne heauen whereof two ſterres one called canis maior canis minor ❀canis feſtinans caecos aedit catulos haſty bytche bryngeth forth blynde whelpes prouerbe applied theym whiche beynge haſty ſettyng forth theyr warkes make vnperfecte ❀canis reuerſus ad uomitum salom •• pro •• dogge turneth agayn eate vomited prouerbe referred hympetrus epiſtola whiche beinge reconciled vnto god returneth eftſones olde condition vice ❀canina facundia dogge eloquence prouerbe applyed ſuche doo neuer exerciſe theyr tunge penne reprouing blamynge men ❀caninū cardinalis le chiefe principal cardineus ſame cardinum herbe whiche ſome ſuppoſe creſſis cardo dinis poſte wheron dore hangeth moued alſo mere boundes whiche paſſeth fielde frome ſouthe north alſo coffar wherin breade layde • n northe countreye called arke carduelis byrde called lyuet carduus thyſtell care derely great pryce carex icis ſedge groweth fen groundes watry carectum place ſedge doth grow careo ui ere lacke properlye thoſe good thynges whiche one somtyme ſignifieth without thyng careo culpa without faulte careo febre without feuer care name keruer ſcholer lyſippus caria region aſia hauynge northe ſyd •• great ryuer meander weſt great ſea called icarius eaſt licia dyuerſe countreyes towarde ſouthe mountayne taurus people therof called care whiche good men warre therfore euery reteyned ſoudiours suyzars suychynars nowe carica cae drye fyg ſuch eaten lent carica lyttell houſes ſet hyghe place whiche ſtronge naturall munition place caricus um countray caria caryatid fyſhe called prane lyke ſhrīp caries lyttell worme eateth wood alſo putrifaction fylthe growen age continuaunce cariem trahere waxe rotten putrified vinnewed carina kele bottome ſhyp carina arum ſtrete rome wherin pō pey dwelled carinatus um made fourme kele ſhyp bote carino aui make thynge lyke keele ſhyp carinthia countrey ouſtrike ioynynge ſouthe mountaynes called alpes italy eaſte northe stiria fourme election newe prince gouernour declared pius coſmographye ſtraunge right pleaſaunte knowe town called sancti viti great valey medowe ſet ſtone marble good height whervpō aſcendeth huſband man vnto inheritaunce office belō geth right hande ſtandeth blacke cowe lefte hand yl fauoured mare ſtandeth great multitude carles ſyde medowe cometh duke accompanyed noble men theyr robe aſtate goeth erle goritia gret maiſter hous betwene xii banner bearynge prince ſtandarde noble men doo folowe prynce clad lyke huſbande man ſhepe croke hande lyke ſhepeherd ſone earle whiche ſtandeth marble ſtone doth ſe commynge aſketh loude voyce ſlauon tungue cometh ſo proude gate whiche ſtande anſwere prince countrey anſwereth eftſones earle rightuouſe iudge ſekinge weale countreye free manne borne worthy haue honour trewe chriſten man defendour chriſtis fayth anſwere yea ſhall ſayth earle right maye put place aunſwereth erle goritia thou ſhalt haue thy place lx grotes theſe two beaſtes ar thyne ſhewyng hym cowe mare prynces aparayle whiche dyd late put thou ſhalt alſo haue thy famyly kynne ſhall free maner tribute carle gyuyng prynce lyttel blowe checke byddeth hym good iuge commynge downe frome ſtone gyueth hym place ſoo departeth takynge hym cowe mare prynce goeth vp ſtone holdynge naked ſworde hande brandiſhing tourneth euery parte ſtone promyſyng equall iugement vnto people brought hym cold water huſbande mannes cappe whiche prince drynketh ſignifienge condempneth drynkynge wyne thanne goeth church lady hath harde maſſe putteth ruſticall apparayle putteth apparayle honour dynynge nobilitie ſumptuouſelye commeth eftſones medowe hereth matter mynyſtreth iuſtice hyſtorye haue thought neceſſary knowen amonge v wherfore haue ſpared labour delyte duke countreye chiefe maiſter game vnto imperiall maieſtie cariophillon ſpice called cloues carioſus um erth wel dunged ſtered alſo putrified rotten cariota date cariotis idis idem caritas tati ſcarcitie derth properly whiche ſerueth ſuſtinaunce manne caritas annonae derthe vitayle carius name iupiters ſonne carmania countrey india whiche ptholomeus diuided two partes oone parte fertile barain peple ſtede garmētes weare ſaynnes fyſhes eate fiſhe theyr bodyes roughe keuered heare excepte theyr vyſages haue townes certayne habytationstrabo alwayes wandrynge countrey fynde one thynge worthye remembraunce ſo euer wyll mary muſte brynge fyrſte kinge countrey head ennemy king ſetteth vppe palaice taketh fyrſte tungue cauſeth cutte piece mengled breade giueth parte therof brought head many heades deuideth tunges amonge gentylmen moſte delycate meate carmelus name two ſundrye hylles iudea carmen mini verſe meire alſo hole warke whiche made verſis ſomtyme ſignifieth charme carmentis name lady whiche hadde ſprite propheſy gaue aunſwere verſis alſo called nicoſtratis mother euander carminare carde wull like thing carminarij picke make cleane wull carde carmites people countrey fraunce called chartres carmon place meſſenia temple apollo laconia carna macrob ſuppoſed goddeſſe mā ne lyfe deſyred harte lyuer preſerued carnarium larder wherein hangethe ſalte fleſhe sometyme ſygnifieth bouchers ſhambles carnarius boucher carnarius um perteyneth fleſhe carneus um whiche fleſhe carni people countrey almayn called carinthia belongynge duke auſtrike alſo name people italy countrey called marca taruiſina carnifex ficis executioner hange man cutteth men piece ſometime murderer carnificina place ſuche execution done alſo office acte hange man▪ alſo great murder cruelty carnificium ſame acte carnificinus um perteynynge act murderynge ſleinge carnificor aris ari playe hangemans parte carniuorns um thynge deuoureth fleſhe carnoſitas abundaunce fleſhe carnoſus fleſhye carnoſium folium herbe ſeede called carwayes alſo herbe called caret rote wherof like perſenepe ſome yelowe ſome red eatyng pleſant perſnepes wyl ſoner digeſted carorae cel ant lect uel carotici greatte • ynewes whiche holde vp necke called alſo tenondes cornelius celſus ſome prynte called cerotes wolde amended written carotas caroticae ariſto▪ • al •• great vaynes euery ſyde necke carpâthium mare ſea ioynyng egypt wherin yles called sporades carpathos yle agaynſte egypt myddes betwene rhodes candy carpâtinae ploughman bootes made vntanned lether maye called okers carpentarius cartwright carpenter carpo pſi pere gether plucke alſo theſe reproue taunt vſe fiuor paſſe ouer quickely carpere agmen aſſayle hoſt euery ſyde carpere cibum eate carpere iter take iourney carpere lanam toſe wull carde carpocrates heretike whiche denied chriſte god affyrmynge pure man ſect called carpocratitae carpocratiani alſo affyrmed worlde made aungelles god reiecte olde teſtament deny generall reſurection alſo denyed chriſte born virgin mary ſaying got ten ſede ioſeph alſo body ſuffered onely ſoule receyued heauen carpocrates lyued yere lorde 142 carpophyllon tree whiche hath leues lyke laurell carptim perſia whiche length • plinius ſayth vii myles solinus wryteth viii myles breade ſoo narrow carte may hardly paſſe throw martianus wryteth thoſe gate faſte ſhyt greate yron beames let man ſhulde paſſe man er lerned latine letter ſemeth olde er lerned greeke yet notwithſtandinge gatherynge bridgmentes oute tucidides demoſthenes warkes became greatteſte oratour tyme called romane demoſthenes made alſo blamed people rome moche commytted authority offyces often tymes one perſon ſayinge ſemed eſteme rule auhoritie elles ſuppoſed worthy promotion one ſigne contempt diſcorage good wittes rebuke theyr countrey alſo whanne thre ambaſſadours choſen ſente bithynia one goute peine heade thyrde timerous cato laughinge ſayde ſenate people rome ſendeth ambaſſade whiche hath neither feete heade yet harte lyfe man alſo cato worthy often tymes radde ſpecially coūſaylours men authoritie incarnation chriſte 182 yeres cato vticenſis ſo called bycauſe ſlewe hym ſelfe town called vtica affrike great graundfather cato called cenſorius man childhood ſhewed wonderfull conſtance grauitie ſeldome mery ſene laughe dyd lytel ſmyling wold lyghtly angrye angrye ſhortely appeſed alſo harde lerne whiche lerned perfectly reteyned verye ſtudious morall philoſophye practiſynge actes lyuinge rad vertue honeſty alſo ſtudied eloquence onely entente counſaylynge rayſonynge mought adde vnto philoſophy force ornamente yet wolde ſhewe practiſe openly whan one ſayde hym mē dyſprayſe thyne obſtinate ſilence anſwered force ſo diſprayſe liuing wyll breake ſilence whan ſpeake worthy vnſpoken beinge tribunus militum ſaye capitayne thouſande men budeus reſembleth marſhall army beynge ſente macedonia meruaylouſe grauitie prudence peynefulnes made whiche vnder hym fierce hardy agaynſte theyr ennemies gentyll theyr felowes fearefull iniury prompte get prayſes hym ſelfe labourynge vſynge apparayle feedynge goinge lyke vnto contrary mennes expectation withſtandynge ſeuerytie wan harte goinge foote talkynge euery manne ſuche conſtance ſoo far ambition flattery neyther pompeye caeſar theyr chiefe pryde whan menne eyther dread fauour inclyned theyr deſyres moughte meanes perſwaded agree theyr myndes caſes ſemed agaynſte weale publyke maner menacynge dreadfull token mought conſtaunce remoue hym ſo moch whan harde iulius ceſar hadde vainquiſſhed pompeye frendes wold haue ſent caeſar deſyre fauour cato aunſwered whiche vainquyſhed haue wiſe treſpaced ought make ſuite ſenſe al lyfe neuer vainquiſhed innocency ſurmounted caeſar whiche makynge war agaynſt owne countreye hadde condemned hym ſelfe haue done thynge whiche often denyed fynally malyce caeſar bycauſe wolde beholde weale publyke deſtroied ſlewe hym ſelfe vtica hauynge hym ſouper euenynge greatteſt officer citie many frendes alſo ſentence beinge ſpoken amonge onely good man free man yll men bonde▪ whan one hapned reaſon agaynſte cato beinge therwith chaufed diſputed ſo vehemently longe men ſuſpected wolde longe lyue dyed afore place alſo lyttell court houſe caueo caui cauêre beware eſchewe alſo prouyde diligently take hede ioyned accuſatiue caſe ſygnyfyeth bydde beware caue tibi take hede thy ſelfe caue tibi illum puerum beware chylde caue facia take hede thou doſte caetera cauebuntur reaſte wylle prouyde cauêre alicui gyue counſaylle oone matter lawe concernynge contractes inſtructe one ſhall cauêre capite pli li 54 put ſureties appere matter lyfe deathe cauere ſibi ab aliquo take quytance dyſcharge payment money delyuerance thynge uero inquam tibi ego brute non ſoluam cicer bruto niſi prius à te cauero amplius eo nomine neminem cuius petitio ſit petiturum truely ſayde brutus wyll pay excepte haue fyrſte quyttaunce thou ſhalt efteſones demaunde hym whome thou moughteſt aſke quid iſti caueam b vt reuehat domum plaut bacch ſhall prouyde hym b one brynge hym one cauêre teſtamenta gyue charge teſtament thynge done caueri taken hede caueares hoſtiae cauae partes beaſtes next tayle ſacrifyced byſhoppes cauerna caue holow place ground ſometyme cauernae ſygnifie eares cauernoſus um full caues cauilla uel cauillum mocke ſkoffe cauillatio cauillation ſubtil forged tale cauillator mocker bourder cauillo aui uel cauillor ari ieſte mocke bourde caula ſhepehouſe propely folde cauleſcere growe ſtalke caulias liae iuyce whiche preſſed oute herbe callyd laſerpitium cauliculus tender ſtalke caulis ſtalke ingendred red choler ſharpe vaynes nexte harte vaynes mouthe ſtomake holownes liuer lunge ſignes feuer intollerable heat continual thyrſt horrour ſwyft pulſe kepyng none order ſhorte breathe vrine high coloured thynne cauſſa cauſe matter ſuite cauſſam accipere take mattier hande alſo take excuſe cauſſam capere take occaſion cauſa cadere loſe action cauſſam agere pleade matter cauſſam dicere plaut capt anſwere vnto layde vnto charge cauſſam dicere ſay cōtrary deny hoc ſi ſecus reperies nullam cauſſam dico quin mihi parentum libertatis apud te deliquio fiet thou doſte fynde wyſe wyll ſay contrarye thy pleaſure ſhall loſe bothe parentes libertie cauſam dicere ex uinculis aunſwere warde priſoner cauſſas nectere liuius fayne matter make excuſes delayes cauſſam orare pleade cauſſam quaerere ci attic ſeke occaſion cauſſam ſuſtinere beare blame cauſſam tenîre optayne iudgement cauſſa mea terent heauton ſake syro ignoſcas uolo quae mea cauſa fecit wylle ye forgiue syrus al hath rocke ❀ prouerbe applyed great ſpekers gatheryd continual clackyng ſea maketh whan ſtryketh agaynſt rocke cautio promyſe writing made diligently aſſurance thynge cautio oni prouiſion cautio eſt nede prouyde beware cautum eſt praedibus ac praedijs aſſurance taken bondes ſureties mittere cautionem chirographi delyuer writynge ſigned owne hande aſſurance cauto eſt opus procedere nedeth wyſely handlyd cautor alieni periculi warneth man daunger cautor formularum ſkyl kindes action ſued cautum eſt ordeyned prouyded acte parlyament counſayle cautus man circumſpecte caua uena vayne lyuer cauus um holowe cauus holowe place cauſter floudde lidie cayſtrus foem gen citie cilicie c ante e cecrops opis auncient kynge athene whoſe ymage made hauing two heades ſom men ſuppoſe bicauſe dyd firſt pitis tyrfe▪ ſom call ſoddes graſſe erthe togither ceſſatio ſlackenes ydelneſſe ceſſator ſlowe dutie ceſsio one claymeth thynge whiche man hath denyeth maketh contrary clayme ceſim ferire ſtryke huſbande dyd gird wife ſet full ſtuddes cetariae place nigh ſea ſyde tuny great fiſhes taken ſalted cetarius fyſhmonger taker great fiſhes cetra lyght tergate cetrati milites ſouldiors lyght tergats cete cetus great fyſhe callid whale ceu ci ad euenas ceua lytle cowe giueth moch mylke c ante h chaam callid alſo gog chaam name dignite great emperor tartariās callid alſo gret chan catay cambalu whoſe dominion extendeth furtheſt part caſt vnto coū trey ruſſy northweſt ſo northe vnto ſeptentriall north ſea ſoutheaſt vnto ſouth indiā ſea ſouthweſt vnto perſia ſo chart appereth vnder hym moche mayn land within lyttell reſydue aſia europa affrica chabrias noble capitayn athenienſis whome inuention armes lefte remēbrance whan came ayd theban agaynſt lacedemonians ageſilaus king lacedemoniās vāquyſhing aray ſouldiors retayned putting flyght chabrias reſtrayned reſidue cauſyng ſet tergats againſt knee thraſting forth ſpeare abyde receyue brunt enemy ageſilaus beholdīg durſt go forth latin ſalue god ſpede wel mette ſuche ſalutations chaerephillon herbe callyd cheruyle chalame citie perſy whiche callyd aetiſiphon chalaſis knot wherwith woman garmentes knyt theyr neckes chalaſtra certayne apparayle chalaſtricum nitrum ſalte peter pure lyke ſalte chalaza gatherynge vnder ſkynne lyke diſeaſe callyd bubo chalazia ſtone lyke hayle ſo cold fyre may heate chalazium lytell round werte eye lyddes whiche may moued one fynger hyther thither chalcantum cop • roſe vitriole chalcedonia cite aſi againſt cōſtātinople chalchis fiſh ſec kind turbut chalcis dis name citie grece alſo yle byrde chalcites ſtoone colour braſſe blacke wherof braſſe tried chalcographus prynter chalcos ſeu aereola xxxvi part dram chaldaea countrey whiche strabo wryteth doth ioyne arabia ſea callyd mare perſicū solinus plinius nameth countrey chaldaea great city babylon ſtode new chartes wyſe ſet weſt ioyneth meſapotamia north vpon aſsiria medium eaſt vpon perſia ſouth vpō arabia deſerta ſo far frō iudaea haue proper language ſomwhat lyke hebru letter ar vnlike otherletters strabo nameth countrey people callid chalybes dwell chaldea li 12 chaldei taken great aſtronomers countrey aſſiria chaleſtra citie theſſaly ſea coſt chalybes people laſſe aſia coū trey callyd pontus whiche people dygge great plentie yron beinge naked alſo name fludde spayne chalybs lybis ſteele chalyx flynte ſtone whiche fyre ſtryken cham aeciſſos herbe callyd grounde yuy chamedaphne herbe whyche groweth lengthe wyndyng togither dyuers partes hath leaues lyke laurell bayes hath floure lyke violet callyd ſome men perwyncle chamaedris drios herbe callid germander chamaeleo albus maner thyſtel growyng ground without ſtalke puttynge vp prickes lyke hedgehog hauinge middle knap ful prickes ſhort ſtalke whiche doo appere purple floures whiche growe plume fly away wynd lyke thyſtels hath white roote ſwete groweth olde landes bare hylles chamaeleo niger cōmun thiſtle whiche hath great ſtalke longe ſomwhat ruddy hauyng toppe rounde knap ſharpe floures chaungeable colour chameleon ontis lyttell beaſt hauynge ſkyn ſpotted lyke lybarde chaungeth dyuers colour accordynge thing ſeeth ingendred india quantite figure liſarde legges lengar goth vpryght hath ſnowte lyke ſwyne longe tayle ſmall ende eyen neuer cloſed dothe neuer eate drynke nouryſhed onely ayre chameleuce ce herbe growing ryuers hauing leues like poplar moch greater chamaemelon herbe callyd ca •• omyll chamelopardalis beaſte whiche great camel ſkin color like panther hauyng ſpottes ſundry color hath forelegges necke longe heed lyke camell fecte legges lyke oxe chamelus beaſt callyd camelle commonly knowen chamemirſynne buſhe tree hath ſharpe pryckes leaues redde bearyes cluſtered ſuppoſe kynde holy holme chamaepyris herbe wherof iii kyndes one commonly callyd herbe yuy whiche deſcribed dioſcorides although haue ben proued haue lyke vertue ſeconde ſmall cipres ſet pottes iii ſuppoſed callyd ſaynt iohn̄s worte chamaeterae maydens whyche wonte ſyt theyr mayſtreſſes feete chamezeleon herbe callyd cinquefoyle chamitterae chamitteridae lyttell ymages made folowynge greatter ymage chaniſcus hyndermoſt part whiche delyteth beholder thinke crymſyn charon ti named paynyms boteman caried ſoules ouer thre ryuers hell acheron stix cocytus charopus amyable pleaſaunt hauynge good grace charta paper alſoo leafe wheron ſoo many men workynge ſame kynge ſpente onely perſely oynions garlike thouſande thre ſcore talent whiche great talent amounted money cci thouſande fyue hundred fifty poundes cherinthus heretike affyrmed chryſt ſhulde come raygne worlde ſpace thouſande yeres durynge tyme men ſhoulde lyue carnall delytes afterwarde ſhulde come vp heuē ſhuld euer lyue pleſures gloteny lecherye alſo denyed chriſt god pure man alſo world made god principates alſo receyued onely goſpell ſayncte mathew reiected euangelyſtes actes apoſtels yere lorde 88 cherroneſus parte greece called nowe morea ſomtyme taken northe parte greate aſia alſo called cherſoneſus cherſina kynde londe ſnayles cherſydrus kynde ſerpentes calabria whych liue bothe lande water cherubin one holy order angelles wherin ſcience macedony chimaera gote alſo mountayne licia alſo monſter hauynge thre heades one like lyon lyke gote thyrde lyke dragon chimerinos cercle heauen whiche whan ſon commeth dayes ſhorteſt chymus iuyce meaſure ounce ynche meaſures ſo laſſe quart georgius agricola conteyneth three cotylas meaſure vncertain moche galene ſayeth dyuerſe opinion meaſure cotyla rede cotyla notwithſtanding meaſure ſoo commune amonge auncient grekes therby meaſured moche meate ſhoulde ſuffyſe theyr ſeruauntes one day suidas remembreth expoundynge place homer choenici ne inſideas one coūſels wyſe pythagoras whiche ſaynct hierom doth wyſe expound notmoch careful thou ſhalt liue morow plutarchꝰ wyſe leue ſome morow ſaythe olde tyme leful take vp table without thyng left whiche expoſition contrary ſaynct hieromeschil 1 eraſmus doth declare wyſe men ought ydelneſſe ſlouth eate whiche men paye owne labour ſtudye gette ſome wherby may honeſtly lyue nowe ye haue three expoſitions euery manne take whiche lyketh beſt cholera one foure principall humour called choler alſo ſickenes ſtomake bowel wherin hapneth vomit flyx tourment bowelles ſendinge forth choler vpward downwarde firſt watry afterward lyke fleſhe ben waſhed ſickenes ingēdred inordinate fedynge longe tyme ſpeciallye rawe fruites muſhroms moche vſe cucumber pompones fruytes colde whiche eaten meales meate digeſted corrupted ſtomake ingendreth venomous iuyce whiche nature may ſuſteyne therfore ſhe expelleth violence cholericus cholerica ſhe cholerike cholerica tormina tourmentes frettinges whiche come choler choliambi kynd verſes made fote meter called iambus cholon gut wherin ordure dregges meate fourmed commeth lefte hednay toucheth ſplene ryſeth vp right ſide ſtomak cometh lyuer receyueth little choler gal ſharpnes wherof ordure prouoked diſcende made redy paſſe chomata water bankes kepe ryuers ouerflowe chomer idem quod chodrus chonca ſhell fiſhe chondrilla herbe kynde cichorye deſcription therof herbe growynge corne fieldes hauynge leaues lyke vnto wyld cicory full mylke ſtalke greatter tender holowe oute whiche commeth moche mylke sauynge whiche dioſtorides doth wryte hath maſtyr comminge braunches whiche may happen contray hot althoughe happen yet may herb chondrilla haue vertues chondrus rede alica choragiū ſtuffe properly wherwith place adorned ſhalbe enterludes diſguiſinges alſo apparayle player choragus kepeth ſuche ſtuffe apparayle chorannei certayne men lyue woodes perſia ſo ſwyft take harte runninge choraula craft blowe trumpettes playe ſhaulmes lyke pypes choraules minſtrels play danſing chorda ſtrynge harpe lute inſtrument chordapſon ſikneſſe called illiaca paſsio reade illica paſsio chorea daunce chorebus one athene firſt inuented makynge erthen veſſel choriambus fote meter whiche hath fyrſte ſyllable laſte longe two mydde • l ſhorte chorius fote meter whiche name called trochaeus two ſyllables fyrſte longe ſeconde ſhorte chorobates meaſure meete ground maſons rule chorocithariſta leadeth daunce playeth hym ſelfe inſtrument chors ti place incloſed wherein cattell kepte barton called ſome place chortales aues pultry fedynge abrode barton courte huſbandry chortos haye graſſe mowen chorus company player dauncers alſo quyar chorus ſiue chomer meaſure hebrues whiche conteyneth ten tymes moche batus ephi amounteth vii buſhelles halfe meaſure chreſis vſe catachreſis abuſion chreſton herbe called cykory chreſtus name noble author athene chria notable ſentence ſpoken ſhortly exhorte vertue diſſuade vice chriſis vnction chriſtus annoynted ſurname redemar chromaticus whoſe colour neuer chaungeth alway one chronica orū hyſtory actes done tymes expreſſed chronicle chronicus um temporall perteynynge tyme chryſanthemum herbe called crow fote hath yelowe floures commonly called golde knappes chryſe yle whiche plinius solinus ſet mouthe famous riuer indus martianus writeth ſuche abundaunce fyne golde therof yle toke name chryſos englyſhe golde chryſendeta cup hauyng border golde lyke maſers nuttes wont haue therfore maye ſo called chryſes name prophette amonge gentile alſo mayden gyuen grekes kynge agamemnon battayle troy chryſia citie phrigie ylande indie chryſippus noble philoſopher borne cilicia towne called soloe solinus wryteth laertius writeth borne tarſus ſecte called stoici chriſtis ſkym whiche golde beinge molten chryſoaſpides knyghtes ſhyeldes golde chryſoberillus chriſtal ſtone wherin colour golde ſhyneth chryſocolla ſtone poulder wherof paynters doo make golden colour alſo goldſmythes vſe ſowder golde chryſocoma golden heare chhryſocomus hath golden heare chryſogonum bryngeth forthe gold cryſolachanon ruellius herbe called orage latine atriplex chryſolampis ſtone fyry colour nyght chryſolitus pretious ſtone colour golde chryſomela yelowe quince vergilius named aurea poma ruellius ſuppoſeth chryſopraſſus ſtone grene leke hauing ſpeckes golde chryſoſtomus name buſhop conſtantinople alſo hyſtoryen whiche ſo called theyr eloquence chryſoſtomus englyſhe golden mouthe chryſothemis doughter agamemnon clytemneſtre chus uel choa meaſure greekes whiche three ſortes one called attica medica conteyneth vi ſextarios atticos whiche englyſhe meaſure one pottle halfe pynte called georgica huſbandry englyſhe meaſure vi pyntes halfe quarter poyſe oyle xili iii ounce wyne xiili di hony xviiili ix ounce veterinaria theym whiche cure cattell whiche receyueth meaſure pottell quarte weyghte wyne xili one ounce ii drammes ii ſcriples oyle viii li hony xvilidi one ounce di one dramme chymoſis galen defini moyſture ſkynne whiche incloſeth eye chytra pot fete triuet chytracus triuet cradel whereon pottes ſet boyle meate c ante cibale perteyninge meate cibarium meate cibarius um vyle cibarius homo vyle perſon cibarius panis cice tuſ queſ 1 ranged breade cribble breade cibarium uinum varro ſmall yll wyne cibatus tus vittayles cibele le doughter minois kynge creta nowe candy ſhe beinge caſte deſerte nouriſhed beaſtes founden womanne kepte ſhepe ſhe nouryſhed becam meruaylouſe fayre alſo wyſe founde fyrſte pipe rabour alſo cymbales amonge greekes moreouer education chyldren ſhe tenderly louynge al ſo moche deathe childe called • y ſhe moche loued ſhe became madde afterwarde ſhe honoured gentile goddeſſe alſo called rhea mother goddes veſta ymage beinge ſpecially honoured citie phrigia called peſsinuus counſayle sybilla fetched thenſe scipio naſica brought vnto rome great reuerence cibo aui feede ciborium kynde appuls alexandry cibus meate cibi repoſiti quintili meate ſet vp kepte cibum facere plautus trucul make redy meate mane aliquid fie • cibi ſhall ſome meate made redy betyme cibum ſub ducere take meate away one cicada graſhopper cicatrico ſtryke one ſo marke alwaye remayneth cicatricoſus hath manye token woundes cicatrix icis token ſcar wounde ben cicatrizo idem quod cicatrico alſo heale wounde ſoo onely ſeme ſcar maye appere ciccum tender rynde pomegranade cicer eris grayne lyke peaſon whereof ſome red ſome blacke ſome white cicercula leſſe cicer cicerculum idem cicerbita herbe called ſouthyſtell cicero oni ſurname marcus tullius whoſe diuine eloquence abundant lernynge ſharpneſſe wyt dexteritie actes moſte ardent loue comune weale countray ſufficiently expreſſed noo mortall mannes tunge pen linyally diſcended auncient kynges people called volſci tyme occaſion wearynge dignity bloudde name continued long ſtate worſhyp aunceſtours named cicerone bycauſe tullius appius noble kynge volſcis one noſe mark lyke chiche peaſe called cicer child hood ſo excelled wyt childrene father meued fame went purpoſly ſchole behold hym ſo profited eloquence greeke alſo latyne onely companion meruaylous admiration hym alſo apollonius moſte excellent orator tyme herynge hym beinge ſore abaſhed ſpeakynge great ſpace ſayd laſte truly cicero prayſe meruayle lament fortune greekes whan conſyder lernyng eloquence whiche onely lefte vnto v euen nowe tranſlated vnto romayns whiche ſayenge apollonius founden afterward true ſor loke ſubtiltie logike commoditie morall philoſophye ſecrete knowledge philoſophye naturall knewe tacitus writeth declared latine moſte perfecte eloquence whiche wondred withſtanding beinge verye yonge man came practyſe rome ſtudied abundauntly ciuile lawes meruaylouſly occupied greate weyghtye cauſes ſenatour continually ſemed moſt buſy weale publike yet dothe exactly reade ſtudy warkes ſhall thynke neuer dyd thynge rede great author wryte bokes ſecte philoſophers none oratour poete afore tyme eſkaped hym rad warkes bokes ſufficientely appereth yet howe many bokes mde ſens haue thyrde parte yet ſuche haue man wryte ſo moche ſo well ſhoulde thynke hym haue ſpente parte tyme wrytynge yet noble cicero lorde god howe many thynges dyd exploit wiſdome diligence moſte weighty affayres well warre peace howe dyd dexteritie prudence ſaue citie people rome moſt pernicious confederacy rebellion catiline manye nobility whiche went deſtroye weale publike robbe citie howe preſerued ſame citie people deathe caeſar oppreſſed marcus antonius incō parable actes hole senate people gaue hym firſte name father countray trouble miſery ſuſteyned beinge exyled procuremente clodius onely puttynge ſayd rebelles dethe suche reward people vnſtable like wyſe dryuinge antonius rome ſharpe oration cauſynge hym proclaymed ennemy weale publyke made antony ſo moch enemy treaty peace betwene hym octauius demaunded cicero doo hym pleaſure beinge graunted vnkynd octauius cicero brought vp meanes cauſed hym made chiefe gouernour romaynes finally antony ſent one herennius cicero ſaued deathe eloquence purſued hym fled whiche cicero perceyuynge abode comynge lyinge horſe lytter waikenes conſtant eye prepared throte herennius men therat abhorringe ſtrake head handes brought antony reioycynge therat cauſed heade handes ſette ouer place ciuile iugementes rome whiche beholden ſenat peple daily lamented haue purpoſely written intente moſte noble counſailour ſhulde hyd ſuche yet vnderſtande lyfe wrytten greeke latine men ſhoulde inflamed reade vnderſtande warkes whiche afore gentile wold chiefely red folowed chriſten menne fyndynge incomparable wiſedom eloquence truely wyll affyrme quintilianes ſaiinge may well thynke hath moche profyted cicero ſpecially lyketh flouriſhed xl yeres incarnation chriſte ciceronianus coueyteth folowe cicero eloquence cichorea cichoreum herbe called ſucchory cicina nyght crowe cicindula fly whiche ſhyneth night cicinia lyttell leane ſerpent italy ciclades yles ſee ionium called ciclades bycauſe lye rounde together orels bycauſe ſaylinge menne muſte fetche great compaſſe aboute reaſon promontory whiche number 53 cicones people thrace ciconia • riſot byrde whiche ſome ſuppoſe called ſtorke fygure heron •• nius greater whyte ſauynge toppes wynges blacke byll legges red ſome thynke haue tungues naturally ennemies ſerpentes ſlea wrytten whan olde theyr byrdes fede prouyde meate cauſe ymage token iuſtice auncient kinges top ſeptours lower parte beaſte called hippopotamus contrarye wyſe ſleeth father rydeth mother wherby exorted aduāce iuſtice pitie oppreſſe iniuſtice crueltieeraſ chil byrde came greke worde prouerbe antipelargein ſignifieth mought ſaye lyke ſtorke whiche prouerbe exhort men kind theyr parentes theyr mayſters whiche teacheth bringeth vppe requitynge benefyte whiche receyued ciconius name bylded brixia cicorium herb groweth euery cicum thynne ſkynne whiche within pomegranade cicur euery beaſte byrde whiche one beynge wylde made tame cicuro aui make tame cicuta venemous herbe groweth ii cubites heyght grene ſtalke full knottes buſhy toppe hauynge leaues ſmaller coriander ſeedes greater anyſe ſeede horrible ſauouor ſome nowe vſe name hemlocke cidaris cap whiche kynges perſia dyd vſe alſo buſhops old law cieo feſtus cio ciui meue thynge cal name alſo trouble make one angrye quid negotij eſt plautus piſtoclerum lydus quod herum tam ciet matter lyous thus trubleth angreth maſter bellum ciebant ſet forth bataile ciere aluum prouoke one ſtoole ciere urinam make one pyſſe cileo ui ere meue ſtyrre thynge cilicia countray aſia beyond moūt taurus partly incloſed hygheſt parte ſayd mount hardeſt paſſe strabo deuideth cilicia two partes one called tracher ſay rough rocky campeſtris ſaye playne ioſephus writeth olde tyme called tarſus tarſis oone ſonnes iaphet yōgeſt ſon noe herodotus ſayeth people called cilices cilix ſon agenor kinge phoenitia called hypatus saynct hierom doth interpret cilicia congregation lamentation aſſumtion lamentable callynge vomyte people nature inclyned lien • ſtealynge whereof grew prouerbe ❀cilex non facile uerum dicit cilician lyghtly ſayeth trouth prouerbe applyed couetous man alway lyeth particular aduauntage nowe dayes mooſte parte men doo whiche lyue onely ſellynge cilicinus um made hearen clothe cilicium cloth garment made heare cilium ouer ſkynne wherwith eye cloſed cilix icis inhabitaunt cilicia cillibe cilliba rounde table cilones men hauyng great round foreheades cima tender part ſtalke herbes cimaria thynges foure ſquare cimbalaris herbe whiche groweth ſtone walles whiche hath lyttell leafe ſomwhat faſcion lyke iuy hath lyttell purple floure ſuppoſed herbe whiche called vmbelicus veneris cimbices plutarch whiche make moch little greately eſteme thynge whiche ſmall value cimbri people whiche dyd inhabite denmarke norway hadde meruaylous cuſtome whiche strabo wryteth theyr wyues folowed theym warres alſo woman kunnynge diuination whoſe heare whyte likewyſe theyr gownes vnder whiche hadde launde clothes made faſte pynnes tach beynge gyrte gyrdelles braſſe wente bare foted alwaye priſoners taken naked ſwordes bete grounde drewe vnto braſen cauldron whiche conteyned fyfty amphora meaſure 250 gallon hauynge haulte place made purpoſe went vp quickely liftynge hygh men taken dyd cut theyr throtes ouer cauldron droppynge bloudde declared theyr propheſies openynge men bealyes ſerched theyr bowelles propheſied victory vnto people cimeliarchon budeus iewell houſe cimeliarchus maiſter iewell houſe cimex ſtinkynge worme bredynge wood paper cimmerij people inhabitynge furtheſt parte europa fer great fennes called paludes meotidis ſea called boſphorus cimmerius northeaſte grecia plinius ſome affirme farre diſtaunce ſon countraye alwaye verye darke wherof hapned prouerbe ❀cimmerijs tenebris atrior blacker darke cimmeria applyed moche darkeneſſe dulnes wytte lacke wyſedome cinabulum cradle cinaedus nonius marcelleus expounde exerciſer wonton daūces motion body dyuers fourmes perottus cor •• copie declareth perſon exerciſynge actes lechery deteſtable agaynſte natural fourme order whiche wyll expreſſe omytted alſo nothyng offended thing worthy remembraunce cinamomum kynd ſpyſe odoriferous dilectable called cynamome ſome canell groweth ethiope lyke lowe buſhe dyuerſe ſtemmes whiche excede two cubites heighte hauynge leaues lyke organum ryndes thereof whiche haue vſe hot dry third degree cinara herbe whiche ſome men ſuppoſe artochoke cincinnati men haue curied heares cincinni heares curled cinclidae ca 〈…〉 bayes parcloſis made aboute place iudgement men beinge ſutars maye ſtande beholde done ſpoken amonge iuges pledours suche lyke thing weſtmynſter hall common place called bekens cinclidarius 〈◊〉 ant 3 whiche kepte place monumentes recordes kepte euery manne ſhoulde enter without leaue kepeth recordes towre porter rolles maye ſo called cincticulus ſhorte cote called ierkyn cinctus tus ſhort garment conſull dyd weare whan profered battayle cinediae ſtones founde fyſhes heade cineraceus cinereus um colour aſhes cenericius um baken roſted vnder aſhes cingo xi gere gyrde compaſſe cingria ſhorte pype hauynge ſmal ſounde cingulum gyrth beaſtes cingulus gyrdell men cinifactum broughte aſhes thynges whiche burned ciniflo oni maketh hote inſtrumentes wherwith men woman dyd trym theyr heare cinis neris aſhes cinna citie theſſaly alſo name romayne whiche exceded crueltie cinnabaris ſtone called ſanguinarye alſo called latine sanguis draconis dragon bloud put ſondry medicine ſtaunche bloud cinnamolgus called pliny cinnamomus ariſtotle byrde whiche makethe neſt cynamome cinniligium gyrdell whiche bride new wedded wyfe weareth corſe cinnus heare man woman head medley dyuerſe thynges together ciperum circania byrde flyght fetcheth compaſſe circe • odorus • ul li 5 doughter ceta kynge yle colchos hecate wyche ſuſtar medea woman knew meruaylous operation ſundry herbes howe cure al maner poyſons ſet forth prepareplautus deuiſe talke togither put ne poſterius culpā conferas put lauſ defaut conſilia con ferunt kepe coūſels togither lay toterentius ioyn nouiſsima conferam primis wyll lay ioyne laſt firſt alſo profyte lay togither sit que utri que proxi mum horreum quo conferatur ruſticum inſtrumentum columel next muſte barne wherin may laid vp togither inſtrumentis longyng huſbādry alſo confero gyue multa contuli catonē haue gyuē attribute moch cato haue fauoured moch cato cōtuli domū went home contuli ad catonem wēt vnto cato confero campum uel ad campum go felde conferre amorem loue cōferre animū alio ſet mind el wha conferre caput aſſemble counſaylle lay theyr heades togyther confer gradum plautus come forthe conferre pauca conclude ſhortely conferre manus aſſayle eche conferre pedem come poynt proprely contention party doo ioyne conferre ſe pes plaut bacch runne awey take legges conferre ſtudium employ ſtudy conferre tempus aleam plinius pan ſpende tyme playenge dyce conferre uerba ad rem terent eunucho ſayth confert profitable conferum buſhement confertus um caeſar cōment full alſo flocke multitude abuſſhement vt nun quam conferti ſed rari magniſ que interuallis praeliarentur mought fight multitude togither one great diſtance ſunderti liuius turba confertaiter clauſit people gathered buſhement ſtopped waye qua parte hoſtiū acies cōfertiſsima uiſa eſt caeſar erupit brake ſyde hoſte enemy femed moſt thycke people confertiſsima turba thyckeſt preaſe conferua herbe whiche groweth freſſhe water lyke ſpounge confeſsio confeſſion confeſſor oris confeſſour confeſtim eftſoones confibula clapſe tache conficientiſsimus literarum ci pro l flacco putteth thynge wrytyng conficio lactantiꝰ cic feci ficere performe fynyſhe peryſſhe conſumed diſtroye ſlea explycate declare honeſtaris par confecta eſt quā tibi cupio eſſe notiſsimam part honeſtie declared whyche wolde ſhoulde vnto perfectly knowen alſo bryng paſſe si amas confice thou loueſt bryng paſſe alſo gather money permagnam dice ex illa pecuniam confici poſte thou wylt ſaye greate ſūme money myght made thing conficere breake nucem dentibus conficere plinius breke nut teethe alſo conſume wa • te qui cum hic non uideant terent credant conficere argentum ſuum bicauſe ſe beleue waſt theyr money alſo confici made quomodo poteſt ex multorum deorum aceruo unus deus confici meanes may heape goddis one onely god made conficere penſum plautꝰ mercat ſpyn threde tranſlated ſentence haue done brought ende thynge whiche commanded appoyntedplaut perſa conficere prandium haue dined pallium ad phrigionem fert confecto prandio plaut men dyner done whan dined caryed mantyll brouderer conficere ſolicitudines alicui terent andria brynge one heuynes make hym ſorowfull confidens ti regardeth lawes feareth thynge ſommetyme ſygnifieth conſtant aſſured confidenter conſtantely aſſuredly ſometyme hardily boldly aduenturouſely confidentia truſt hope certayn aſſurance alſo madde hardynes confidentiloquus ſpeakethe boldlye without feare confido plautus di dere truſt ſure dare cōfigo fixi figere ſtyk thruſt thīg confingo finxi fingere ſayne thynge trew confingere dolum fynd mean deceyue one confinis ne next adioynyng confinium border march countrey lande confirmitas aſſurednes confirmo confirme aſſure thinge ſpoken confirmare animum ci tym take courage confirmare ſe make hym ſelf ſtronge ſyckenes confiſcare ſeaſe forfayture confit made togither confiteor eris confeſſe conflages place whereinto many wynde • blowe conflagro fyre inflamyd conflare blowe togyther blowe lyke one bloweth fyre alſo conflare gather cōflauit ex omnibus populum thoſe gatheryd great multitude alſo makevergilius et curuae rigidum falces conflantur enſem crooked ſythe harde ſworde made conflare citie one yere conſularis bene conſule mete conſull conſulatus tus offyce conſull conſulo lui ſulere datiue caſe gyue counſaile accuſatiue caſe aſk coū ſayle alſo datiue caſe ſignifieth prouyde help grauiter de ſe conſulere ſome hurt hym ſelfe conſulto taui tare gyue aſke counſayle often delyberate ſhewe myn aduiſe ofte conſultò delyberately aduiſedly conſultor oris giueth counſayl ſometyme aſketh counſayle conſultus ta tum wyſe well aduyſed conſultus tus conſultum thyng conſulted ſomtyme acte counſayle conſummatus um perfect poyut conſummo aui ſumme vp reckenynge fynyſhe performe make vp make perfecte conſumo terent andria ſumpſi ſumere conſume dyſtroy ſomtime ſignifieth finiſhe make vp bryng poynt alſo ſpende conſumere diem apparando ſpend al day preparynge conſumere fidem saluſt conſyderate conſyderation conſyderatus doth thynge conſyderation conſydero aui conſyder contabeſco plaut mercat ſcere waſt away relent like ſalt put water contabulare bourde lay bourdes roufe floore contabulatio floore bourded contactus ta tum touched contacti relligione dy plautꝰ pſeud dayes reputed paynyms infortunate begyn enterpryſe contagium contagio oni contages infectiue ſyckenes alſo infection contamino aui violate defyle myxtyng thynges togither diſhoneſt contechnor plaut pſeud ari inuent ſom thīg deceiue contego texi terent hecyra tegere hyde faute eſpied contemero aui vyolate contemno tempſi temnere deſpiſe contepmne whiche laſſe deſpyſynge contemplatio oni beholdynge ſpeciallye mynde deuotion god contemplator beholdeth great affectyon contemplo contemplor aris ari beholde intentiuely great affection contemporanei whyche one tyme contemptibilis deſpyſed regarded contemptim dyſdaynfully contemptor aris ſette lyttell contemptus tus deſpite contempt contemptus um contemned eſtemed contendo di dere cōtend teſyſt ſtriue caſt ſhote darte arowe continue make haſt inforce contendere aliquid ab aliquo requyre ſome thyng one contendere ſacramento wage lawe contentio oni reſyſtence ſtryfe debate alſo ſharpe oration apte confirme repreue continuance inforcement ſettynge forth vehemence contentus um whiche contayned alſo content ſatisfied contereo rui rere make aferde contero triui terere weare occupienge alſo make warre conterere aetatem ſpende lyfe conterere diē plaut bacch ſpēd day vnprofitably conterere operam loſe labour peyne conterere queſtū terent hecyra ſpende hath gotten wonne conteris tu tua oratione mulier plaut caſtel thou makeſt wery woman thy talkyng conterraneus countrey man conteſtari aſke togither wytneſſe conteſtari litem perpleade one hath full purpoſed hathe fully anſweryd conteſtatus um proued wytneſſe contexo ere ioyne togither contexere dolos fynde crafty meanes contextus tus ioynyng ſowyng togither contextu pennarum corpori tegmenta faciebat made hym garmentes fethers fowles ſowen glewed togyther contextu longiore loqui ſpeake longe deliberation tracte tyme conticeo ticui cere holde peace conticeſco ſcere kepe ſylence craſſeſco ſeſci ſeſcere make fatte ful fleſhe thycke craſſiore muſa playne intelligible ſenſe craſsities craſsitudo fatneſſe thyckenes groſſenes craſſo make fat craſſus plaut pſeud um fatte fleſhye thycke groſſe poyſy craſſae compedes weyghty gyues craſſus ſurname noble romaine whiche two ſpecially worthy remembred notable quality whiche one named lucius craſſus whiche nexte tully moſte excellent oratour euer amonge romains quintus sceuola tully boke called brutus wryteth wyſe thynke ſaye brutus citie euer two excellente perſons well knowen counſaylours one ſay sceuola moſte eloquent ſay craſſus counſaylinge moſte excellent lyke wiſe thynges vnlyke one ſo ye coulde tell vnto whō ye wolde wyſhe lyke craſſus delycate ioly moſt ſober sceuola al ſober moſt freſhe pleſant craſſus gentilnes ſufficient ſeueritie great ſeueritie sceuola lacked gentylneſſe commendation tully declareth theſe two men worthy counſaylours weale publyke craſſus called marcus beinge none emperour rycheſt man pryuate peron romayns plutarchus wryteth ſente generall capitain agaynſte parthian treaſure ſeuen thouſand hundred talentes whiche amounte money thouſande thouſande hundred thouſande thre hundred fifty poundes ouer beſides gyuen x parte moueables hercules offerynge made feaſte people rome appoyntynge euery man rate three mina euery mina beynge moneye xxxv xi q whiche thre mina v li vii ix ob q euery man portion whiche conſyderyng multitude people whiche tyme rome beinge greateſt citie mooſte populous worlde ſemeth ſumme ineſtimable wolde ſay ought called ryche man excepte could yerely rente maynteine legion whiche conteyned vi thouſande foote men v hundred men armes commonly wordes pliny recited xxxiii boke▪ x chapiter may wel ſuppoſed lyttell ſame plinye eſtemeth ryches craſſus xx thouſande seſtertia rate money ſyxe ſcore xi thouſande thre ſcore fyue poundes ſame ſumme yerely reuenewes marcus craſſus euerye seſtertium beinge vi li xi ix ob whiche reuenewes onely poſſeſſions grayne fruite cattell alſo labour greate multytude bonde men whiche dyd lette hyre vnto nede theyr ſeruyce beinge inſtructed maner ſciences artes v hundred carpentars al moch greater number gayned cam cofers moreouer practiſed vſury lendynge lightly men wolde borowe brake promyſe hym exacting therof extreame rigorous gat infynite ſubſtance poſſeſſions goodes men attaynted tyme sylla fauoured hym therwith excedyng conaytous vnſtable vſynge moche lyberalitie affabilitie towarde people alwaye great eſtimation amonge alſo eloquent wold plead euery commune cauſe fynally beinge ſtered couaytous enuye whiche hadde great honour caeſar pompey obteyned procured warre agaynſte people called parthi bothe ſonne xxx thouſande romaynes wereſlayne many alſo taken whiche plutarch wryteth happened negligence beinge induſtrious gatherynge moneye gouernynge orderynge armye dyed afore incarnation chriſte 51 yeres craſtino aui deferre day day craſtinô idem quod cras craſtinus um perteininge moreowe tyme come crater baſon water cundit whereinto water runneth pipe cockes cratera uel crater teris great cup alſo great hole top meruaylous hyll aetna sicile whiche yſſueth flame fyre alſo veſſell well craterra • would • buckat take vp water crate grate yron wood alſo watling wal houſe klayed thatched alſo name philoſopher whiche entente moughte quyetlye ſtudy philoſophy beinge ryche threwe al goodes ſea ſayinge henſe miſchiefe ye vngratious appetite leauer drowne ye ſhoulde drowne suppoſynge moughte haue vertue ryches gether crathis name two ryuers oone grece calaber frequente accuſtomed alſo ſtandynge beynge thycke gether tree crebreſco brui breſcere wonte commune crebritas crebritudo oftnes thicknes beinge growynge together crebro often credibile whiche maye hange crementum increaſe cremera ryuer cremium fryed meate burned panne cremo bourne cremôna towne italy cremor ôris iuyce barley ſteped water beaten preſſed crenae dentes leafe herbe tre lyke ſawe pare make great noyſe ſounde alſo broken crepuit foris dore craked crepundia pla • tꝰ amph tryfles ſmall gyftes gyuen litell chyldren lyttel belle tymbrelles ſuche lyke toyes alſo fyrſte apparayle chyldren ſwathels waſt cote ſuche lyke traſlation ſay crepundijs erat uirtuti deditus chyldehode euer gyuen vertue crepuſculum breake fyrſte ſprynge daye called twylyghte creſco creui creſcere growe increaſe creuit haereditatem increaſed lyuclode hath inheritaunce fallen vnto hym creta yle lying betwene part grece called peloponeſus nowe morea rhodes hath northe parte ſea called aegeum cretenſe ſouthe ſea aegypte affrica called candy yle iupyter nouryſhed whome paynimes named theyr chiefe principal god alſo minos raigned radamāthus gouerned vnder hym moſte exquiſite iuſtice ye may rede blaſynge ſterre crinitus hath moche longe heare crinon red lyly criſa name towne buylded criſus phocus ſonne criſpina deſcription io agricola ſemeth bryer called reſpis criſpulus hath heare kurled criſpus kurled alſo name saluſtius reade place criſta kreſt thynge growynge heade foule beaſte cockes combe feather head byrde called coppe criticus iudgeth actes warkes men wryte critici dy dayes crocinum idem crocitus noyſe rauen crowe maketh called crokynge crocitatio idem crocodilus yll beaſte whiche bredde aegypte lyueth partely water partely lande facion lyke dragon hath ſmall eye longe tethe lyke ſawe lacketh tunge meueth ouermoſte ſawe nether hath great nayles ſtrong fete hath ben ſene theym xx fecte longe ſkinne backe vnpenetrable deuoureth men alſo beſtes whiche come nighe ryuer nilus aboute yet withſtandinge egyptian dyd honour beaſt ſo moche kylled cauſed hym ſalted buryed bring forthe egges geeſe egges lx tyme male female ſyttyng tourne reade trochilus beaſte crocodili hyena lyo • eſſe neuer cloſeth eye wynketh ſydes mouth hath one tothe breake thynges theyr tethe quyckelye ſwoloweth forthwith dygeſteth nature betwene dog wulfe moche worſe counter fayteth voyce well men beaſtes croeſus conſt •• kynge lydia ſonne halyattes ſubdued many greatte countreys aſia greece gathered innumerable ryches tyme demaunded wyſe man solon happyeſte man euer ſee ſayd tellus man athene whoo honeſte good ſonnes alſo lyke good chyldren al whiche ſawe lyfe whan lyued good tyme honeſtlye laſte fyghtynge agaynſte ennemies coū trey vainquiſhed dyed fayre deathe ſame place honourably buryed athenienſes whā croeſus aſked moſt happy next tellus ſayde cleobis bito whiche argiues competent lyuynge ſuche ſtrength game prouynge ſtrengthe obteyned pryce feſtiuall daye iuno theyr goddeſſe theyr mother old woman wolde caryed vnto temple wayne ox whiche ſhulde drawe come fielde wherfore two ſonnes takynge beame wayne drewe theyr olde mother therein vii myles ſoo broughte temple iuno men meruaylinge cō mendynge yonge men al womenne prayſynge mother bryngynge vp ſuche chyldren mother beynge ſurpryſed ioye wel acte ſonnes alſo fame commendation thereof ſtandynge afore ymage iuno prayed ſonnes mought haue thyng giuen whiche beſte thynge euer mought happen men▪ whan ſacrifiſed eaten drunke moch pleaſure ioye fell ſleape neuer awaked▪ whoſe ymages al people countrey ſet vppe moche honour delphos croeſus beinge abaſhed ſayd vnto solon frend athene ſetteſt thou ſo lyttell felicitie thou preferriſt v theſe priuate perſons solon anſwered truely croeſus proceſſe tyme many thynges ſene men wold ſe many thynges ſuffered men wolde ſuffer moch ſpoken man calamitie laſte thus concluded ſayinge ende euery thynge loked whereto ſhall come god pluckith vp roofes many men vnto gaue fortune pleaſure creſus made hereto coūtenance eſtemyng solon fole conſyderyng paſſynge ſo lyght vppon thinges whiche appered good bad hym take heede ende thynges ſettynge lytell solon let hym depart good ſpace creſus comfort anſweres apollo delphos attemptynge warre agaynſt cyrus kyng perſia laſt taken cauſid great pyle wod made redy creſus beinge gyues ſet toppe therof forthwith croeſus remembryd wordes solon man lyuyng bleſſed al partes happy therwith lamentyng cried solon solon solon whyche cyrus heryng cauſed demanded hym namyd croeſus moche difficultie laſt tolde finally declared reherſyd whiche cyrus herde recogniſyng hym ſelf alſo man ſoore repented went aboute bourne hym whyche equall hym honour rycheſſe cōmaunded hym taken fyre whiche beganne flame ſoo great difficultie delyuered afterwarde cyrus entertayned hym honourably vſyd counſayle whyche many thynges founde verye profytable moche herodotus noble hyſtoryan wryteth hereof clio whyche wold god radde plaut men whoſe cattall cuiuſmodi faſcion maner cuiuſmodi homines erunt cice pro cluen maner men ſhall cuiuſ que modi vereor enim cuiuſ que modi e roſci cice pro roſcio ne ita hunc uidear uoluiſſe ſeruare ut tibi omnino non pepercerim feare ſo euer ſtate thou art roſce leſt ſhalbe thought wolde ſo excuſe defende foraſmoch haue alway ſparyd cuiuſcun que modi genus hominum saluſt catal maner ſortes men culcitra mattreſſe culcitrula lyttell mattreſſe culcitula lyttell ſtaffefeſtus culeus amonge roman greateſt meaſure receyueth twenty meaſures callyd amphora whyche amounteth two thouſand eyght hundred foure pounde meaſure euery pounde beinge xii ounces▪ meaſure v ſcore galons alſoo ſacke lether whereinto whyche ſlayne theyr father mother ſowen alſo put alyue cocke ſerpente ape throwen togyther ryuer tyber punyſhement paricides murderer theyr parentes culex culicis gnatte culicem colant camelum deglutientes ſtrayn gnatte theyr tethe ſwolow downe camell apt prouerbe applyed fauiour chriſt vnto pharyſeys whiche dyd aggrauate ſmalle offence mayntayned great enormity may nowe vſed agaynſte ſuche perſons whyche ſeeke doo punyſhe ſmall offendours let great treſpaſſours againſt law go quyte vnpunyſhed alſo whyche ſcrupulous thynges lyttell importance ambytion auaryce extortion aduoutrye thefte murder treaſon hereſy fynde daunger conſcience culigna bolle dyſhe drynke culina kytchyn whome thing cōmitted ſuruey prouide thinges neceſſary wele publick order ſuch thingis hath charge concernyng wel priuate thingis belōg cōminalte may ꝓperly callyd ſurueyour curatorius um belonging ſayd office curatus good poynt ſtate curatus um done dylygence cure cytie sabine curculio oni lyttell worme grayn callyd myte wyuelle alſo weſyll throte man wherby draweth wynde cur cura ylande ſea adriatike curêtes prieſtes cybele whyche fyrſt inhabyted italye alſo callyd corybantes people ſo callyd whiche next aetolia alſo dalmatialeonicus uaria hiſtor callid slauonia curêtes callyd alſo idaei dactyli v brethern yle callid creta vnto rhea cauſed ſonne iupiter brought fearyng yre saturnus huſband theyr name theſe hercules iolaeus paeonius epimedes iaſius ida curetis olde name yle callyd creta curia romulus fyrſt kynge romaynes diuided people rome xxx partes bycauſe cure charge weale publike depeched conſent ſentence theym callyd theym curia afterwarde added vnto theym fyue euerye manne owne curia ſhoulde obſerue holye dayes doo ſacryfyce curia alſo courte senate ſommetyme vſyd courte ſeſſyon 〈◊〉 • udges whyche haue 〈…〉 whome name iudges 〈…〉 curia dominicales maye taken amonge thoſe courtes whyche call courte baron occaſion begynnynge curia dominicales rede coment zaſius vpon title lawe ciuile de origine iuris curia ueteres prieſtes minyſtryd aboute theyr ceremony curia hoſtilia place buylded tullus hoſtilius kynge romayns senate dyd ſytte aboute affayres citie rome curiata commitia great aſſemblies callyd people euery xxxv diuyſyons callyd curia whiche beinge ſette xxxv ſundrye particions affyrmed denyed ſuche lawes conſtitutions purpoſyd vnto theym lawes ſo made named leges curiatae curiales whiche court curio varro taken place prieſtes conſulted thynges concernynge diuine ceremony alſo curate hath ſpyrytuall charge paryſh alſo ſurname familye rome whereof many excellent oratours curio magnus sipontinus writeth taken plautus oone made maygre leane marcus curius mā meruailous honeſty conſtance grauitie many great victory whiche capitayn ageynſt samnite sabine noble king pirrhus deuided among people rome feldes appointing euery man xl acre retained conſentes moch ſelf whā wold haue giuen refuſed ſaying yl citeſyn thought ynough inough whan ambaſſadors samnite brought hym great ſumme golde ſyttyng fyre boylyng rape ſayd vnto leauer eate erthen dyſſhe haue dominion ouer haue ſoo moche golde whan accuſed holdynge money brought forth tree • barrelle whyche occupied whan dydde ſacrifice toke ſolemne othe pray gotten theym vanquyſſhed kepte barrell owne vſe curmundula peares verye delycate hauynge ſo thynne parynges men dyd eate theym vnpared curo aui care thyng take hede diligent thynge doinge thingeterent 〈◊〉 andria cura ut ualeas loke thy helthe curaſti probe thou haſte done euery thynge well ſomtyme prepare heale one ſycke take refection comfort curabo wyll doo dilygence curabo illi pecuniam wylle prouyde ſhall haue runnynge curſura courſe curſus u idem curtus um ſhorte curta ſupellex lyttell ſmalle ſubſtaunce curuamen mini crokednes curueſco ueſci ueſcere croked curuipes hath crooked foote curulis curulae lytell carres dray hauynge theym chayres yuory wherein ſatte whych hed officer rome ſommetyme vſyd poetes ſame offycers curuatio curuamen curuatura bowynge bendynge curuo aui bowe make croked curuus um ſaythe bodye fourme lyke man hath lyke voyce ſuppoſe thoſe whyche call baboris horus apollo writeth pyſſe xii tymes day often nyght declaryng euery houre day nyght makyng vrine▪ alſo dogge kynde ſoo lamenteth wane moone tyme ſhe dark chaunge loketh neuer vpward eateth thynge hangeth downe head ſheweth countenāce ſorow▪ alſo peple vnder great cane hauing heades lyke dogges ſo callyd cynodontae dogges teethe whyche doo growe latter age cynogloſſa herbe callyd houndes tunge cynomyia fly dothe ſucke bloud beaſtes▪ ſome call hors fly▪ etimologye worde mought better called dogflye cynorrhodos eglantyne cynos latyn canis dogge alſo citie locris cynoſarges place athene chylderne exercyſed whyche baſſtardes cynoſbatos wylde eglantyne doth beare lyttell thynges lyke ſpounges alſo floure lyke corſica corſe cyrnij people yle corſe cyrrhea citie mountayne helycon cyrrus name ii riuers one armenia medium cyrus noble kyng perſia ſonne cambiſes mandanes whyche doughter aſtyages kynge medium bycauſe dreamed ſawe ſpring ſecrete place onely doughter vyne whoſe branche aſia keuered cauſed chylde throwen deſerte deuowred beaſtes goddes prouydence bytche gaue ſucke vntylle founde ſhepeherd brought vp laſte kyng perſia medium ſubdued parte aſia man excelled menne tyme goodly perſonage gentylneſſe proweſſe lyberalitie wyſedome memorie sollinus wryteth excedynge multitude menne whiche hoſte ſoo retayned name commynge daylye amonge theym named euery manne propre name whan ſpake vnto reſydue wounderfull vertues written xenophon moſt eloquentely greke laſte beynge vnſatiable
