fynger foote meter hauynge one longe ſyllable ii ſhort alſo date daedala leonicus uarſa hiſtor feaſtes celebrate yerely honor reconcilynge iuno iupyter rede citheron alſo daedala generall denomynation ymages wroughte whome ſemeth ſome daedalus toke name daedala lucretius vſyd terra diuerſitie thynges fourmes whiche daedalus name excellent carpentar athene whiche fyrſte founde ſawe twybyll augor made place crete callyd laberynthus doemogorgon oni paynyms callyd god erth fyrſt creatour erth daemon monis proclus writeth taken diuers ſignifications one whiche euery hath ſouerayntie prouideth next vnto god ſo iupiter callith saturn daemon alſo euery man particularly prouideth▪ alſo reaſonable ſoule plato boke callyd timaeus callid daemon animalis boke callyd sympoſium loue mynde contemplation diuine pulchritude vnſpeakable beautie callid daemon porphyrius ſuppoſid daemon euery mā nothyng el vnderſtandynge plato alſo affirmeth boke callid phoedo vnto ſoules come lyfe gyuen daemon whiche beholderand ſercher thoughtes deedes whiche ſoule departed body remayneth ſtyll hym forthewith bryngeth hym ſodaynely iudge teſtymony eyther delyuereth condempneth hym theſe wordes plato approcheth nygh aſſertion chryſten doctours whyche affyrme god appoynteth euery reaſonable ſoule good aungell bad sommetyme daemon taken god therfore apuleius intitled boke de deo socratis de daemone socratis although socrates hym ſelf alwaye ſoo named thynge reſtrayned hym admitting thing yll inconuenient porphyrius hath daemon manye opynions whyche paſſe ouer bicauſe may ingender buſy wyttes rather errour wyſdome ouer wold alſo remembred daemon beynge greke worde dyuerſely writen grecke one waye lyttell callyd omicron dothe ſignifie whiche latynes cal genius cicero nameth lar whyche ſygnifieth pryuate goddes ſpyrites appointed euery particular perſone howſe effect good aungell badde sometyme written great callyd grekes omega doth ſignifye god wyſedomedaemoniū fortune lykewiſe doemonium neutre gender ſygnifieth god godheade power god whiche doth order gouerne hole worldedaemoniꝰ daemonius maſculine gēder diuers ſignifications one contrary vnto ſignyfied happy like god diuine meruailous contrarywiſe miſerable vnhappy vnfortunate therfore worde daemoniū written amonge auncient grekes onely ſentence wherein wylle well vnderſtande without conſydering gothe foloweth withſtandyng among chriſten author daemon daemonium indifferently taken diuel damned ſpirite haue remē bred child onely alſo ſuche perchaunce ryght well lerned latyne tunge yet ſuche wordes made greke may happen myſſe proper ſignificatiōs readyng greke author owne tongue daemoniacus daemonioſus poſſeſſyd yll ſpirite daemonicus um dyuellyſſhe dagnades kynde byrdes whyche egyptian vſyd tye theyr garlandespom feſt whanne drynkynge whyche contynuall ſyngyng bytynge pluckyng theym dranke wolde ſuffer ſleape dahae people scithia valyaunt cruell battayle dalida uel dalila harlot dwellyng gaza countrey philliſtians whiche deceyued ſtronge samſon reade samſons deſcription dalmatia part great countrey callyd illiria slauonia hath weſt croatiā eaſt boſsinā north great mount callyd albanus mon coūtry callyd seruia ſouthe ſea callyd adriaticum goulfe venyce dalmata man countrey dalmaticus um countrey dalmaticatus apparailed ike slauonoyſe dama falowe decre damaſcus famous moſte auncient citie siria surry dyuyded frō iudea mountayn callyd antilibanus boundeth vpō arabia petreia citie greateſt reſort marchauntes partes ſouth eaſt world ſpices clothes ſylke golde ſuppoſed fyrſte citie euer inhabited alſo fyeldes damaſcus callyd ager damaſcenus god made adam fyrſt man damaſcena pruna ar damſins grow damaſcus greater lengar damſyns whan dryed call prune damaſcene whiche galene commended kynde louſe bealy reſtrayn diſtyllations damaſonium nowe callyd among grekes moſte excellent precious fruite whiche callyd myrobalanum kynd nowe callyd myrobalanum indum damia one name goddeſſe cybele damatris prieſt temple damnas damnatus ſometyme vſyd amonge olde ciuilionsmarcu • quiſquis mihi haeres erit dare damnas eſto fidei que eius cōmitto uti det quantas ſummas dictauero ſo euer ſhalbe myn heyre ſhalbe bounden pay put truſt pay al ſuche money ſhall appoynt damnatior cice l worthy deathe damnatus piſonem condempned reproued compellyd boūden neceſſitieterent tuus eſt damnatus gnatus non tu thy ſonne bounden doo thou damnifico feci facere harme damno aui condemne diſ • herite compell delyuer blame reproue damnari cauſa indicta condemned abſent ſuffered ſpeake damnari uoti perfourme auowe optayn wherfore auowe made inter ipſam dimicationem ti li ••• 7 aedem iunoni monetae uouit cuius damnatus uoti cum uictor romā reuertiſſet dictatura ſe abdicauit myddle fyght auowed make temple iuno moneta vowe performed hauing deſire retorned rome ſurrēdrid great office dictator damnari uotis takē virgil auowe bynde vowe damnoſus um harmefull hurtefull hauynge moche harme damnum harme hurte damni dati formula action treſpaſſe takynge awaye thynge v damno auctus indamaged damnum contrahere get loſſe harme thynge damnum dare hurte harme quid facia illi terent andria qui damnum dederit aut malum whate wylte thou hym doeth hurte diſpleſure damnum reſarcire recompenſe harmes done make ſatiſfaction amendes damoetas ſhepeherdes name vergil damon philoſophers name pythagoras ſecte dan towne whiche boundes iudea northe parte danaē doughter acriſius kynge argiues vnto beinge cloſed ſtronge toure iupiter came fourme ſhure golden raine top hous lyinge gat perſeum afterwarde valyant knyght whiche gaue name fyrſte vnto countrey people perſia fable ſignified iupiter ſente treaſure priuely vnto danaē alſo whiche kepynge wherwith beinge corrupted dyd ſuffer iupiter enter towre accomplyſhe pleaſure fable declareth force money gyftes aſſaultynge chaſtitie danaides doughters danau danau kynge argyues fyfty doughters whiche al ſauynge one ſlew theyr huſbandes one nyghte daniel elis holye prophete trybe iuda noble man horne kynde honourable perſonages ſerued kynge yonge chyld brought vnto babylon became manne ſuche temperaunce among iewes taken eunuchus man gelded continuallye bewayled hieruſalem faſtynges refrayned concupyſcence fourme bodye drye leane fauour god beautyful prayer reſtored nabuchodonoſor fyrſte fygure trāsformed god monſtrous beaſte ſtandynge lyttell ſame nabuchodonoſor kynge babylon throwen dungeon among hungrye lyon whiche neuer wolde touche hym hurte hym beinge afterward delyuered propheſied bothe comynge chriſte empire babylon medium perſia grekes romayns fynally died babylon buryed lyued incarnation chriſte 619 yeres daniſma vſury daniſta vſurar daniſticus um perteynynge vſury danubius famouſe ryuer called dunow deſcription plinie hath begynnynge germany hyll called arnoba li 4 ca 12 paſſynge countreys innumerable reteyneth name ſone entreth illiria called iſter receyueth hym lx ryuers well nigh one half nauiagable fynally beinge ſyxe wonderfull greate armes falleth ſea called pontus ſame affyrmed tacitus ſauynge nameth hyl dunow ſpringeth arbonā arnobam danunt plautus doth vſe dant giue dapalis coena ſupper wherat many dyuers incares dapatice feaſtfully plentuouſely dapes delycate precious dyſſhes bankettes daphne proper name lyttel mayden alſo wood daphnis nidis latine laurell alſo ſonne mercury alſo dylectable place withoute citie antioche alſo name portion lycia ſea ſyde daphnites one name apollo daphnoides herbe lyke laurel called lorell laury whiche cauſeth vehemēt purgation plurall number beryes laurell daphnon place laurell groweth dapifer beareth dyſhe banket dapino gyue delycate diſhe dapſa ſacrifice whiche made wynter ſprynge tyme dapſile abundantly dapſilis abundant liberall large dapſilis lectus excellent good bed dapſilia dictum plaut trucul wordes frankly ſpoken dardanarij foreſtallers markettes whiche bye hande ſell dere afterwarde dardania countrey troy ſtode dardaniae artes wytchecrafte dardanus name prynce reigninge parte phrigia troye ſtode whiche hym called dardania daricus money perſia darideus name kyng perſia tyme tyberius caius claudius emperours dariorigum vane britayne darius name dyuerſe kinges perſia daſeia thycknes breath datarius um giuen alſo officer rome whiche ſubſcribed date letter datatim one gyuyng toſſynge ball daucus yelowe caret wherof rootes ſodden brothe pleaſaunte holſome conſtantine ſayeth hotte dry ſeconde degree kyndes bē herbe whiche wyll ſpeake bycauſe ſo neceſſary daunia parte italy nowe called apulia ante e de ioined verb nown ſignifieth withdrawynge takynge awaye decortico barke take awaye rynde depilo plucke awaye heare ſomtyme ſignifieth downward deorſum deſcendo go downewarde somtyme contrary dehortor gyue contrarye aduyſe dedoceo teache contraryterentius somtyme ſignifieth quantum amas de fidicina hac howe well doeſt thou loue ſynging wenche de die cicero day ergo ne una orationis par de die dabitur mihi plautus ſhal ſuffered ſpeake one lyttell worde day de die uiuere cicero phil euery daye frome daye day lyue de compacto pla cap terent hecy agrement de filia te adij come ſpeake doughter de illis uerbis caue tibi plaut bacch beware howe thou ſpeakeſt ſuche wordes de imperio decertatur plaut men fyghte empyre chiefe rule de improuiſo plautꝰ trucul aduenture vnſoughte vnloked de induſtria terent heauton purpoſe de integro eftſones begynnynge de manu manum cicero hand hande de iſtac te amo terent eunucho loue ſake de mea ſententia counſayle de meo plaut perſa good de tuo thy good de meo exemplo aedificet plautꝰ moſtel lette hym buylde accordynge plat de hath ben accuſtomed de nihilo nihil eſt iraſci plaut epidic foly angry nothynge de nocte abijt plaut rudente wente awaye nyght de nocte uigilare wake nyght de pace legatos mittebat ſente ambaſſadours treate peace de praefacili exores thou ſhalte lyghtely opteyne de proximo ſenex plautus olde man dwelleth hereby de repente ſodeynly de ſubito idem de ſcripto dicere ſpeake written vnto hym de ſua ſententia owne heade fantaſy without counſayle de ſententia alicuius one counſayle one aduyſed hym de uia languebat ſycke reaſon iourney dealbo aui ti 〈◊〉 make whyte blaunche deambulatio walkynge forthe abrode houſe deambulatorium aley walke may ſometyme vſed galery deambulatorius place wherein men vſe walke deambulo aui walke vp downe deamo aui loue fauour deartuo aui ioynte cut ioyntes diſmember deauro aui gylte laye ouer al golde debacchor aris ari rage drunkennes wood angry debellare courteſie decedet nihil de ſumma cic 1 ſhall nothynge minyſhed decedi cic de ſe ••• tute haue place waye gyuen haec enim ipſa ſunt honorabilia quae uidentur leuia que communia ſalutari appeti decedi aſſurgi deduci reduci thoſe thynges ar honorable whiche ſeme ſmall effect commune awayted ſued vnto haue way gyuen ryſen vnto brought vnto courte brought agayne home decem number ten december name one whiche called decem uiri decemu • ri lawes grekes broughte vnto rome spurius poſthumius publius sulpitius aulus manlius ambaſſadours ſente purpoſe athene ten men choſen appoynted ſame lawes auncient cuſtomes citie ſhuld make lawes wryte publyſhe theyr authorite aboue al mought make lawes nede interprete • table lawes added vnto ii mo ſo al thoſe lawes together called leges duodecim rabularom garmente becommeth well dedecet inconuenient vnſyttyng decido di dere cut alſo decide diſcuſſe matter variaunce decido ere fall awaye decidere ab arch • et • ypo vary copy paterne decidere á ſpe ſomtyme bad whan ſpoken one perſon ſpecially loueth fauoreth may interpreted wyſe meum delicium meae deliciae derlynge ſweete harte ſuche like elegancies venus ſecretaries whan ſpoken thynge wyſe quid agit comum tuae meae que deliciae howe comum moſt pleaſaunt dilectable place reſort deliciarum cauſa paſtime recreation delicias facere wanton ſquaymyſſhe playe cockney delico aui explane delictum people greece delphicus um citie delphicum oraculum anſwere made temple apollo delphos delphinus greatte fyſhe ſea called dolphin whoſe mouth almoſt bealy elles fyſhe mought eſcape hym ſo ſwyfte ſwymminge take fyſhe lyinge vprighte tungue moueable apte voyce contrary fyſhes hath camoyſed noſe compaſed backe delyteth muſyke hath ben knowen loue child receyued ryde theyr backes ſpace xxx myles ſea whiche haue ben beholden moche people readeth plinium appianum uaria hiſtoria ſhall fynde fiſhe thynges wondred delphos citie countrey called phocis mountayne greece called parnaſſus great famous egypt ryuer called nilus maketh place furme letter whiche 〈◊〉 wherfore place called delta delûbrum place wherin dyuers ymages god ſaynctes deludificor cari begyle deludo ſi ere mocke deceyue abuſe delumbis weake ſometyme wanton delumbatae radix rootes nypped broken intente ſhal wax greater delumbo bare debilitate make feble ſtrengthe deluo lui ere waſhe cleane waſhe delutamentum clayenge deluto aui laye claye thynge dêmades great oratour athene ſodayne oration without ſtudy excelled demoſthenes ſo moch plutarch wryteth whan demoſthenes conſtrayned ſpeake vnto people vnprouyded beyng tymorous ſomtyme ſtayed myddell oration demades wolde aryſe place fyniſhe oration demoſthenes begun wherin appered diuerſities wyts adays alſo perceyued demades ſo corrupte maners antipater wont ſaye hym whan olde decrepite lyke beaſtes offred ſacrifyce nothynge remayned theyr tungues bealyes finally ende auaryce prodygalitie flattery falſehoode ſonne callyd demea commyng vnder colour frendſhyp macedonye dede ſecretely conſpired antigonus ennemy antipater kyng countrey ſon takē caſſander chief capytain antipaters army firſt ſonne demea ſlayne armes bloud ſprange father face ſelf many reproches excellente oone kynge macedonye noble oratoure ſurnamed phalarêus kynge demetrius ſonne antigonus kynge macedonye alſoo raygned goddlye ſtature ſoo excellent fauour beaultie paynter karuer mought truely counterfaite hym ſemed vyſage bothe terriblenes mercy grauitie gentylnes wherwith ioyned princely maieſtie tyme recreation kynges moſt pleaſant whan great affayres hande ſurmounted al ſtudy dilygence greatnes wyt father mother wonderfull reuerence excedynge men withſtanding noted moche incontinence full proweſſe valyaunt delyuered grece ptholomees tyrannye vanquiſhed ſea alſo ſubdued athene countreye boeotia citie thebe hadde warre one tyme ptholomeus kyng egypt lyſimachus kyng aſia seleuchus king syria pyrrhus kyng epyrus oftentymes vanquyſhed theyr army concluſyon beynge vanquyſhed seleucus hym commytted honourable pryſon ſay kepte towne syria callyd cheroneſus hadde appoynted vnto hym fayre palayces pleſant orchardes gardeynes company ſuche lyſted ydelneſſe exceſſe voluptuous pleaſures fell ſycke dyed wham age lxiiii yeres demetrius phalareꝰ noble philoſopher orator diſciple theophraſtus tully writeth fyrſt boke office ſayeng ſubtyll diſputer noo vehement oratour yet ſwete dilectable excellent vertues gouernour atheniēſes ten yeres bicauſe greatly enryched citie athene yerely reuenues adorned commodious buylding people honor hym dyd ſet vp ccc lx image made mettal afterward abſent meanes certayne enuious perſons people condemned hym dye alſo pullyd downe image ſomme dyd breake ſome ſolde onely oone kepte hole caſtell wherof herynge demetrius ſayde yet haue plucked vertue ſette vp thoſe image mā cauſyd ptholomeus kynge egypt make great libratye ſende iewes haue theyr lawes propheſyes tranſlated greke ſente vnto hym euery trybe twelue pli epi apply lernyng ſtudy deſesterenti •• deſidis vnoccupied deſiccare plautus drye vp deſideo ſedi deſidere ſytte ſtylle abyde place ydell deſidia ſlouthfulneſſe deſidioſus man full ydelneſſe ſlouthfull deſido ſedi ere ſyt ſtyl contynually ſit thing ſyt chamber ſtole alſo properly whan erthe doth gape thynke terra deſedit groūde openeth gapeth deſignata praedeſtinata deſignatio diu •• e ordināce appointmēt deſignator toris marſhall whiche ſetteth appoynteth euery man place conuenyent degree offyce deſignatus aſſygned ordeyned deſignati conſules praetores tribuni elected apoynted ſuccede thē tyme exerciſed ſayd office deſigno aui aſſigne note ſygnify thyng newly alſo choſe thing appoynt ſome purpoſe deſilio lui ere leape lyght downe deſinas holde thy peace deſino ſii nere leaue ceaſſe deſinere artem leaue crafte deſinit uiolam draweth coloure vyolette illae orationes legi ſunt deſirae thoſe oratiōs radde deſciſtere conatu leaue enterpriſe deſiſtente autumno ende autumne harueſt deſipio pui ere folyſhly wax folyſhe deſiſto deſtiti terent phor deſiſtere leaue deſiſtere litibus leaue ſuite deſita ar ſcience vſe ſpoken primus papiſius eſt uocari deſitus fyrſt deſyre loue ſtudy delyte ſommetyme ſygnifieth abſence multarum rerum deſyderio te angi neceſſe erat nedes muſt ye greued ſorow full remembrance dyuers thynges deſyderati men dead ſlayn batayle eo prelio trecenti capti quin quaginta millia de ſyderata ſunt batayle three hundred taken fifty thouſande ſlayne dead deſyderium idem quod deſyderatio ſommetyme abſence deſydero aui deſire thing alſo require loke lepidꝰ qdego deſyderabā fecit deſired lepidꝰ ne •• nunc uires deſydero adoleſcētis nō plus que adoleſcens tauri uires deſyderabam nowe wyſhe haue yonge mannes ſtrength whan yonge wyſhed ſtrength bulle virtu nullam aliam mercedem ſuorum laborum deſyderat praeter hanc laudis gloriae vertue requireth none rewarde labour onely prayſe renoume quis ab eis ullam rem laude dignam deſyderat loketh thyng worthy cōmendation si erit bellū ut uideo fore partes meae non deſyderabuntur chaunce haue warre perceyue wyll ſhal lacke nothyng dutie ſor parte wyll fayle curia uires meas non deſyderat ſenat hath nede myn ayde deſydero ab te aliquid ſeemeth thou doſte wolde haue deſyderauit nōnun que agrippae patiētiā ſory agrippa pacyent vt ego tuum dolorem amorem que deſydero fynde lacke thou doſt loue arte ſoory deſyderata magno philoſopho grauitas grauitie whiche requyred ſoo great phyloſopher deſyderio urbis flagrari ſorye citie detectus ta tum dyſcouered diſcloſed made apparant manyfeſt detectus caput hathe heed vncoueryd detego tegi tegere dyſcloſe dyſcouer detegere ſtomachum utter ſomake mynde detendeo di dere ſtretche ſtretche forthe detentio withholdyng retaynyng deter lackyng ſomewhat yll deterior warſe deterrimus warſte detergo detergeo ſi gere wype make cleane ſcoure detergere faſtidia put away lothſomnes deterior deterius war war condition diagridion certayne confection made scammony pourge choler dialectia arte whiche teacheth inuent quyckely diſpute aptely fynally trye trewe falſe commonly called logike dialecticus logician dialectus maner ſpeche wold ſaye diuerſities englyſhe northern ſpeche southern kentyſhe deuenyſhe lyke dialexis diſputation dialis iupiter alſo ſignifieth one daye conſul dialis conſull one daye diâlogus diſputation betwene two diâmeter lyne whiche diuideth figure two equal partes diâna doughter iupiter whiche fleinge company men intente ſhe wold meued carnal luſtes ſhe continuallye exerciſed ſelfe huntynge wylde beaſtes chaſt lyfe ſhe honoured paynyms goddeſſe ſhe alſo taken moone diapaſma compoſition dyuerſe ſweete pouldres caſt body thintent ſuperfluous ſweate maye put awaye maye alſo taken ſwete perſume pomeambre diapaſon concorde muſyke fyue tune two halfe tune diapente fyue diaphanum clere throughe chriſtall diaphonia diſcorde diaphora difference diaphoreſis linac • eth gal digeſtion euaporation diaphoreticus ca cum whiche doth diſſolue ſende forthe humour vapour diaphragma • andinꝰ ſkyn loweſt parte breſtalex whiche diuideth place harte lunge ben ſtomacke bowelles ſoo vapour ryſinge vpwarde ſhall come ſpiritual member wherby mynde rayſon mought indamaged diapyganon confection made herb called rue whiche alſo called diaſpoliticon excellent medicine agaynſte lacke good digeſtion agaynſte peyne breſte ſydes lyuer raynes mollifyeth bely comforteth ſtomacke maketh good digeſtion diaria febris feuer whiche dureth oone daye ſicke man kepe good dyet diarium prouiſion one daye alſo booke declarynge done daye day diarrhaea laſke flyxe without inflammation exulceration late phiſitions called fluxus humoralis diaſtole diſtintion poynte whereby oone worde ſentence fyne ſumme money payed hym hath commytted treſpaſſe dicere utran que partem ſuſteyn ſayinge bothe party dicere nummos promyſe money dicere ſacramento take othe properly whiche retayned warres dicere ſalutem ſalute recommende hym vnto one alſo pray god ſend hym good helth well dicere ſententiam gyue ſentence iudgemente dictamen thyng wrytten man inſtruction dictamum herbe whoſe leaues lyke penyroyall greatter ſomewhat hore moſy byteth tunge lyke gynger hath neyther floure ſeede conſtā tinus calleth dictamum ſaythe hote drye thyrd degre herbe wonderfull incomparable vertues well dieſpiter one name iupiter dieteris ſpace two yeres diffamo aui ſprede fame diffarreatio certayne ſacrifice whiche betwene man wyfe differitas olde wryters vſed differentia dyfference differentia great fauour hym ſo moche denyſe commaunded officer ſhuld gyue dion al wold aſke dion ben herar plato folowed doctrine grauitie deniſe fauoured hym semblably ſeconde denyſe withſtandyng dion al reade bacchus alſo name two kynges sicile whiche theyr crueltie auarice called tyrantes fyrſte ſonne hermocrates ryche man sicile valiantneſſe armes sicilian ordeyned theyr capitayne agaynſte carthagynenſes whiche inuaded theym menaced diſtroye theyr countrey take theyr liberte enmies vanquiſhed denyſe preſerued con • ray bondage benefactour became cruell tyrant man deſyrouſe ſe wyſe plato thanne famous importunate requeſtes cauſed come sicile athene hauyng communication whiche plato commended rightwyſe gouernaunce diſpraiſed tyranny denyſe beinge therwith offended wolde haue ſlayne hym beinge let interceſſiō dion ariſtomenes gaue polydes ambaſſadour lacedemonians ſell whan came grece reſidue ye may rede myboke knowlege maketh wiſe man dionyſius denyſe ſon man like condition better lerned alſo made meanes haue plato come vnto hym good ſpace hym moche reuerence herde leſſōs philoſophy fynally ſuſpectinge hym conſpired agaynſte hym dion expelled vnethe deſyres architas prynce tarentum ſuffered retourne vnto athene lyghtly myndes great men towarde lernynge ſatiſfied ſmall occaſions offended excepte ſuche ſet theyr delyte vertue eſteme aboue pleſures tyme man ſhal appere diſcalceatus vnſhodde diſcalceo ceare pull one ſhoes diſcapidino aui vncloſe open diſcedo ſceſsi dere departe ſome tyme ſignifieth exception quum diſceſſerim à fratre nemo eſt mihi te charior excepte brother man dere thou arte alſo ſignifieth diuiſion openynge quum terra diſceſsiſſet magnis quibuſdam imbribus diſcendit illum hiatum whan erthe occaſion moch rayne opened wente downe cleft ſwalowe diſcedere à ſeſe forgete hym ſelfe mynde diſcedere ſuperiorem wente awaye vaynquiſher diſcedere inferiorem wente awaye vanquiſhed diſcedere ab armis put awaye theyr harneyſe diſcedere ab officio duety diſcedere à iure agaynſt lawe diſcedere ſententia change opiniō diſcedere diuerſa ſondry opiniōs diſcedit uſus fructus loſeth poſſeſſion profyte diſceſcit mo maner vſe lefte diſceſsio departynge diſceſſus u idem diſceſsio facta eius ſententiam part went ſyde opinion diſceptatio diſputation contention diſceptatio libera iudgement accordynge conſcience hym iudgeth diſceptatio legittima iudgement accordyng lawe diſceptator iudge arbitrour dayes man diſcepto aui diſpute contende arbiter iudge diſceptare armis trye battayle diſcerniculum pynne lyke inſtrument wherwith woman dyd diuyde ſhed theyr heare diſcerno decreui cernere departe ſunder one thynge alſo ſtryue vary knowe diſtinctely diſcernere armis fyghte battayll diſcerpo pſi ere pluck teare piece diſcinctus dyſſolute negligent vnable warres cowarde diſcindo ſcidi ſcindere cut diſcingo xi gere vngyrde diſciplina lernynge perceyued ſcholer doctrine tought mayſter alſo good fourme lyuynge diſciplinoſus apte lerne diſcipulus ſcholer diſciple diſcludo ſi dere ſhut diſco didici diſcere lerne dediſco ere forget whiche was▪ one lerned diſcobolus throweth diſhe diſcobinatus wounded cut diſconuenio ni nire diſagree dyſcorde diſcolor dyuerſe coloure diſcoquere make boyle diſcorda dyſcorde diſcordo diſcorde agree yll diſcors dis dyſcordant agreynge yl together diſcrepo aui diſagree diſcorde diſcrete diſcretim seuerally diſcrepantia difference diſcretio oni ſeparation ſome tyme election good euyl diſcretion diſcretus ſeuered parted valla ſayth diſcerneth quality men value thynges diſcrimen mini diuerſitie difference alſo ſhedynge partyng heare alſoo ſygnifieth peryll danger ſomtyme battayl diſcriminale inſtrumēt wherwith hear parted ſhadde diſcriminatim diſtinctly ſunder diſcriminatus ta tum diſtincte diuerſitie diſcrimino aui deuyde diſcrucior ari moche vexed troubled mynde diſcûbo bare lye downe ſleape diſcumbo cubui cumbere ſyt meales diſcumeatus openyd wedge lyke thynge diſcupio deſyre moche diſcurro rere runne hyther thyther wander diſcurſus runnynge hyther thyther diſcuſſoria medicamenta plaut 〈◊〉 medycines whyche diſſolue breke thinges congelid tough diſcus dyſhe alſo rounde ſtone hauynge hole myddle whyche olde tyme men vſed throwe vp ayre intent exercyſe ſelfe diſcobolus throweth ſuche ſtone diſcutio ſsi tere caſt ſhake downe remoue examyne dyſcuſſe alſo diſſolue humour gatheryd impoſtume diſertus well ſpoken diſerte loqui ſpeke wel purpoſe diſijcio diſieci diſijcere caſte ſunder disiecta milites hoſte dyſperſed diſiunctio ſeparation diſiunctus ta tum ſeparate diſiungo xi ere vnioyne ſeparate diſpaleſcere publyſhe abrode diſpalo aui wander hither thither diſpalati ſcattered diſpando ſi dere ſtretche diſpar vnlyke vnmete diſparo rare ſeuer diſparatum whyche ſeparate frome thyng layeng contrary diſpartior tiri diuide dyuyded diſpello diſpuli diſpellere expelle putte many place many wayes diſpendioſus ſa ſum harmefull vnprofitable diſpendium loſſe negligence ſuperfluous expenſes alſo ſignifieth harme diſpendo di ere ſpende alſo ſtretch diſpenno ere ſtretche diſpenſator toris ſtewarde offycer ſayinge money houſeholde diſpenſer thynges diſpenſatio layēg mony mā diſpenſo aui lay money diſpendo di ere loſe diſpereo rij rire loſte vtterly diſpeream pray god dy word vſyd ſtede othe affirmance denyenge matter diſperij vndone diſpergo ſperſi gere ſowe abrode ſcatter diſpertio tiui ire gyue parte one parte iniuriam diſpertiuiſti pinguiorem agnum iſti habent thou haſte parted equally haue fatter lambe diſpeſco cui ere dryue beaſtes theyr paſture diſpeſſo ſsi ere ſprede abrode diſpicientia circumſpection aduyſement diligent conſyderation diſpicio xi cere diſcerne eſpy cōſider diſplicio cêre dyſpleaſe diſplina ſhe hath dyſpleaſed diſplodo ſi dere ſpreade diſpolio idem quod deſpolio diſpoliabulum plaut bacch deſpoylle place myſchiefe robbery done diſpondaeus foote meter hath foure ſyllables longe oratores diſpono ſui ere dyſpoſe order diſpoſitè ordynately diſpoſitus uir ſetteth wordes good order diſpudet aſhamed aſhamed whiche done diſpulue • make thynge poulder diſpumo ſkymme diſpunctio examination diſpungo budaeus annota xi gere put thynges writen ſettynge pryckes vnder euery letter diſpungere rationes examyn accompt diſputo taui tare dyſpute make playne vnderſtande rayſon diſquiro ſiui rere inſerche whiche firſte dyd gyue write lawes people athene wherein appoynted death euery ſmall theft wherfore ſayde wrate lawes bloud men draconarius ſtanderde bearer dracones pliny taken old branch vine alſo drama matis comedy interlude dyuers perſonages brought ſome abydyng ſome departynge drangiana prouynce aſia drepanum name citie italy callyd nowe trapani dromedarius dromada certayn kynd camelles whiche haue two bunch backes meruaylous ſwyft may ſuſtayn thre dayes without drynk whan iourneyed dromus place men runne horſes try ſwyftnes dropax noble oyntment made pytche excellentely cōmended galenus famous phiſitions druides ſomtyme france callyd gallia one two eſtates like cōdition ſpiritualtie nowe among v great eſtimation woddes greatte okes vſed theyr ſacrifices ſuperſtious ceremony meruayllous reuerence al thyng grew oke ſpecially myſſelden affyrmynge ſent heuen theyr ſacrifice fourme fyrſte vnder oke wheron grewe myſſelden cauſed meate prepared ſette brought forth two white bulles whoſe horne newe bounden ſaye fyrſt ſet plough wayne prieſt clad whyte clymmed vp tree hauing byll golde hande dyd ſhread cut myſſelden offred ſacrifice prayeng vnto god gyft whiche ſhulde gyuen mought theym receyued proſperous fortunat ſuppoſing beaſte whiche barrayne yf dranke myſſelden ſhoulde fruyteful ſure remedye agaynſte poyſon ſuppoſed theyr ſuperſtition came firſt yle callyd britayne drupae ruellius olyues oyle bearies whiche betwene grene rype doo begynne waxe blacke druſus name romayn ryght noble lygnage eloquence proude ambitious dryas proper name man theſſaly frende neſtor dryad fayries woddes dryinus lytell worme ſomtime founde rootes oke whiche ſo miſcheous poyſon one treade hym barefoted forthwith ſkyn cometh legge ſwellyth meruayled handle hurt loſeth ſkyn place ſayd worme hath bitten rednes ſwellyng riſeth lyttel wheales cometh watry humour alſo hapneth hurt frettynges ſtomake bealygalen pau aeg one remedy therfore akornes beaten morter drunke wyne alſo roote holy bruiſed laid place dothe mitigate peyne drylon ryuer slauony drymodis afterwarde pelaſgus callyd archady dryopteris dioſcori herbe groweth old oken tree amonge moſſe lyke ferne creues bloweth echi columel lyttell narrowe valeyes dale betwene two hylles echidna water ſerpent echinades ben ylandes riuer grece called achelous diuideth aetolia acarnania echinatus ta tum hauynge rough prie kynge ſhale ſhell echinata folium plinius leaues hauynge prickes echimus hermola corell cap 201 kouerynge vttermoſte ſhale cheſten nut whiche roughe prickynge alſo ſea fyſhe whiche hath hym ſhelle pryekes hath pryckes ſtede fete goeth onelye tumbleth whan taken prickes ſeme worne made blunte ſome haue long pryckes lytel ſhels called echinometrae theſe fiſſhes ſundry colour ſome whyte ſome red ſome purple ſome blue ſome grene perottus wryteth cornucopiae ſawe ſayeth whan deade freſhe dilectable colour vaniſheth awaye alſo beaſte called yrchen hedgehog alſo veſſell braſſe amonge greekes whereinto ſayinge witneſſes put ſealed alſo parte hey ſorte pottes alſo certayne fourme bracelettes whiche woman vſed weare echion herbe called alſo alcibiadion growynge wayes roughe groundes edulco aui make ſwete edulis le maye eaten edulium ſo euer ſet table dyner ſupper eaten ſaue bread eduro rare make harde edurum harde e ante e f eeton andromaches father reigned thebe cilicia effari ſpeake properly perteyned byſhoppes augures whan dyd dedicate place conſecrate thynge effartio effarſi ire ſtuffe fyl thynge effaſcino aui bewyche thynge wherby eyther forme chaunged thing dyeth ſome wyſe deſtroyed worde solinus maketh mention affrica certayne kynreds wherof men woman prayſe fayre tree goodly corne pretye chyldren galante horſes fat forthwith dye plinius wryteth ſome whiche beholdynge perſonne ſtedfaſtely angry countenaunce diſtroye lyke experience haue ben ſene realme credyble perſonnes haue reported effata certayn prayer whiche diuynours vſed make ende theyr diuination tellynge ſucceſſe thynges effaxillo aui cut arme pyt effectus effecte effectum dare brynge paſſe effero extuli efferre carye forthe put deuulgat tell abrode aduaunce promote tyme ouercome ſubdue alſo commende ſome tyme holde vp ſet forthe tyme myniſhe orappayre efferre aliquem laudibus extoll one prayſes efferre cadauet cary body buried efferre clamorem crye efferre humeros beare ſhulders efferre manum lyfte vp hande efferre ſeſe aduaunce hym ſelf efferre pedem plaut capt go go forthe seruate iſtum ſultis intus ſerui ne quoquam pedem efferrat kepe hym ſyrs ye woll go forth whether efferre ſe letitia glad without meſure efferri funere caryed buryenge ſolemnely effero aui make ymages wyld beaſtes alſo make wood beaſte efferueo êre boyle moche efferueſco ſcere begyn boyle ſethe efferueſcentia uerba hot angry wordes effexis effeceris efficatia effecte vertue efficax acis effectuall efficientia idem quod effectus efficio feci ficere brynge effecte efficere argentum alicui get money man ſome meane deuyſe efficere morbos iugender diſeaſes efficere nuptias alicui cauſe maryage efficere pollicita kepe promyſe id ſimilitudinem panis efficiebat ſerued ſtede bread efficiam tibi tua ut ſit wyll brynge paſſe ſhe ſhall thyne effigy plautus ſigne made ſimilitude man beaſt effigia ſame effigio counterfayte one ymage payntynge keruynge effilatum whiche ſowed ſtitched garment garde purfle effilo lare ſowe effingo xi gere make lyke effio fieri done efflagito aui deſyre aſke thynge importunately efflictim excedingly effictim amare loue ardently oute meaſure effligo flixi fligere tourment efflo plaut perſa aui blowe away blowe forth efflare animam dye efflauit animam ſpes haue maner hope truſte effloreo effloreſco bloo floure dothe fyrſte comyng effluo uxi ere flow runne water dothe fountayne effluet plaut trucul ſhal tolde abrode wyl kepe counſayle men ſhall knowe effluxerat remembrance forgotten effluxit terent eunucho quite gon effluit aeſtas ſommer paſſed effluunt uoluptates pleaſures paſſe awaye lyghtly effodio ſsi di ere dyg effoeminati men wanton delicate tender endurynge hardnes effoemino aui effeminat make delicat effoeta ſhe hath latelye broughte forthe chylde alſo woman paſte teemynge effoetus ta tum hatched byrde come egge alſo barrayne couſumed feeble terra effacta lande ſpente worne bearynge moche grayne effoetum corpus weake body effreno nare vndeuyded ſnout noſe ſo longe ſuche fourme hym ſteede hande neyther eateth drynketh brynging noſe mouthe therewith helpeth vppe maiſter keper therwith ouerthroweth tree hath iiii tethe euerye ſyde mouthe wherewith eateth gryndeth meate hathe alſoo two greatte tuſkes male greatter female bowyng downward tungue lyttel within mouthe beaſtes ſo vneth maye ſeene beaſtes moſte gentyll tractable many yeres leaſte cxx yeres female almoſte longe floure theyr age ſaye lx yeres ſuffer wynter colde loueth ryuers wyll often go vp noſe wherwith bloweth taketh wynde ſwym weight body wyll let hym plinius solinus wryte vſe none aduoultry happen mete man wyldernes way gentylly wyll go hym bryng playne way battayle ioyned haue lyttell regarde woū ded brynge ſoore hurte wery mydle hoſte defended made tame drynking iuyce barley haue contynuall warre agaynſt dragon whiche deſyre bloud therfore lyinge wayte olyphant paſſeth dragon beinge excedynge lengthe wyndeth tayle aboute hynder legges olyphant letteth hym go thraſteth heade olyphantes noſe exhauſteth breathe elles byteth hym eare wherto maye reche noſe whan olyphant waxeth faynte falleth downe dragon whiche full bloud poyſe body breaketh hym ſo owne bloud bloud olyphant runneth oute hym mengled together whiche called cinnaberis englyſſhe synopre eleuies purgation eleuo aui lyfte vp ſometyme take awaye myniſhe extenuat eleus ryuer wyſedome dyed atte aege lxx yeres enoch man name holy ſcripture enodis enode without knot enodo aui cut away knottes vnknytte enormis great meaſure enos great citie nygh mountayn callyd lybanus no doughters theyr ſyſters men beaſtes myſchiefe whiche dyd • ommyt deſpiſours god relygion enoteſco ſcere come knowledge en entis beinge euery thynge enſis ſworde enterocele dyſeaſe whan bowel fallen man codde enthymema matis imperfecte ſyllogiſme lackyng maior minor enucleatè clerely enucleo aui take oute kernelle nutte alſoo declare make playne ſentence enyalius ſonne bellona ¶e ante eo iui ire goo eo inficias denye eo obuiam go mete one eo uenum ire uenum ſolde eò therfore foraſmoche vnto eo locus ſtate eodem locus ſame place ſtate eo ſecius neuer leſſe eo uſ que ſo moche eon compaſſe eye eous eaſte ¶e ante p epacta thynges added epaminondas theban borne ſon honeſt gentylman callyd polymnus ſundry quality excellent welle bodye mynde kyndes muſycke perfectely inſtructed therwith daunced excedyngely welle wraſtelyd ranne man better armes ſtronge valyant hardy marcyall polyrye equall lyuynge alſo wonderfull well lerned phyloſophy ſpecially whyche taughte pythagoras whyche moſte dyffuſe • pure doctrine contaynynge moſt ſecrete diuyne myſteries whervnto added moſt noble vertues temperate wyſe great grauitie vſyng tyme wyſely perfect chiualry courage inuincible ſoo diligent obſeruyng trouth wolde tyme lye neyther game erneſte alſo continent mercyfull wonderful pacient ſuffring wronges onely people alſo frendes moreouer ſecrete truſtye ſo faythefull louynge frendes taken warres theyr doughters redy maryed able ſet forth accordyng theyr degres wolde aſſemble reſidue frendes exhorte theym gyue hym whyche lacked accordyng theyr power ſelfe wolde lyberallye gyue quantitie ſubſtaunce lyttel although great authoritie refuſed al rewardes ſauynge thankes onely whan hadde made good ſumme whyche granted receyued brought hym ſhoulde haue vnto ſhuld gyue mought receyue knowe howe moche beholden euerye oftentymes refuſed greate ſummes money ryche preſentes ſente hym pryncis thowghe poore ſayinge thynge honeſte whyche requyred doo wolde doo bycauſe good without rewarde yll honeſt goodes worlde ſhulde make hym profytable vnto countrey bounden redye freely otherwyſe ryches worlde moughte counteruayle loue bare cōmune weale eloquence thebane moughte compared vnto hym ſentences graue compendious wherwith counſayles vanquiſhed dyd put rebuke greate famous oratours battayle ouercame athenienſes lacedemones one daye vyctory grece laſt battayle mantinea betwene thebanes lacedemones ſtriken wounded vnto deathe longe ſpeare heade remaynynge ſtylle bodye yet retayned lyfe vntylle tolde hym hoſte hadde vyctory ſayd haue lyued longe ynough dye vnuanquiſhed yron beinge drawen body dyed incarnation chriſt ccclxxii yeares one thynge well conſydered probus fayth citie thebe epaminondas born alſo dead vnder rule ſubiection people tyme gouernor weale publike citie heade pryncipall ouer grece may wel perceiued one ſuch noble mā thā hole city epanalepſis replication repetition eparcus preſident prouynce epatica herbe callyd lyuerwort epauxis increaſe ephabus eruila grayne callyd tare eruilia ſome ſuppoſe frenche beanes erumpo rupi rumpere braſte ſomtyme leape forthe ❀erumpet neruum iſtaec fortitudo prouerbe whyche dyuerſely expound may ſignify courage thyn may bring halter ſytte heeles may ſignifie great ſtrength courage thyne wyll come vnto nothyng prouerbe taken archer oftentymes put forth moſt ſtrength breke ſtrynge theyr bowe arrowe falleth downe theyr fete wherby ſhote loſt cometh nothynge erunco caui care wiede eruo ui ere drawe force eruptio whan hoſte iſſueth haſtily campe fortreſſe fallith enmies eruum kynde pulſe callyd alſo orobos affyrmed whiche kepte faythe taught ſhulde ſaued hadde committed neuer ſo great ſynne continued yere lorde 353 eunucho eunuchiſo gelde men eunuchus man gelded euocati ſouldiours whiche ſomme wronge diſpleaſure hym dothe wronge expreſſe dicere plin ••• 〈◊〉 epiſto▪ ſpeake properly poynte exprimo preſſe wrynge expreſſe declare playnely exprobratio reproche exprobro aui imbrayde twi • e alſo laye reproche expromitto miſi mittere promyſe vndertake expromiſſor promy ••• ſuertye expromo prompſi mere ſhewe forthe open exprompta memoria redy wyt expugno aui wyn aſſaulte force expulſo aui meue thyng moch thruſtynge put awaye expulſor expultrix putter awaye man woman expuncti ſouldiours diſcharged put wage expungo punxi pungere put awaye remoue expungor geris gi cancelled put oute raſed alſo ſpoken iudges whan put oute commiſſion alſo quite munus munere expungitur one good turne quyt expuo pui puere ſpyt expuere miſeriam ex animo tere •• 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 put myſery cleane mynde forget myſery expurgo make cleane expurgare ſe plaut • mili • declare hym ſelfe innocente whiche layde vnto hym expurgationem habere idem exputo aui ſhrede lop tre cutte cleane awaye 〈◊〉 alſo vnderſtande perfectely ſplene extemplo forthwith extemporaneus um ſodayne extēporalis extēporanea oratio oration matter ſpoken writen without ſtudy ex tempore ſodaynely without ſtudye tyme extendo plautꝰ bacch di dere callid feuerfew ſomme thynke one kyndes herbe whyche callyd olde wryters parthenſon febrilis le pertaynyng feuer febrio iui ire haue feuer febris feuer whiche vnnaturall heate kyndled hart brought feuer callid humoralis alſo putrida humor matter wherof eyther bludputrida coler fleume melancoly feuer hapneth either feruētnes ſon aire lack accuſtomid exerciſe baines euacuation dayly ſurfets thyne vngracyouſnes 〈◊〉 throughe thy defaulte nam id bi tam flagitium eſt quàm illa non facere uobis quae modo dixti v great faulte haue done flagitio ardêre conuict gret offence flagito aui aſke fluctio oni • poſe fluctiuagus wandrynge ryuers water fluctuatim troublenſly doubfully fluctuatio animi whan man doubteth beſte fluctuatio ſtomachi whan meate ſwymmeth ſtomacke fluctuo aui waue vp downe water dothe trāſlation ſignifieth thynke nowe one thynge fluctuoſus um troublous vnquiet ſtormy fluctus floudde waue water ſtyred tempeſt fluentia auntient name citie called florence italy fluentum ryuer ſtreame flueſcere reſolued relented fluidus da dum flowyng telente • reſolued fluito aui flowe continually ſomtime flyt ſwymme flumen inis greate ryuer ſome tyme courſe water flumineus um ryuer fluminoſus um full ryuers fluo xi ere runne water dothe procede come thynge growe fluor fluxus fluctio flyx fluſtrum full tyde ſea water whiche ebbeth floweth fluta fyſhe lyke eele called thinges proſperouſe commodiouſe profytable foemina woman alſo beaſtes female foenarius um perteyninge hay falces foenariae hokes ſythes cut hay • foenebris bre pertayninge vſury vnreſonable gayne foeneratitius um ſame foenerator oris vſurer lender vnreaſonable gayne foenero aui foeneror rari cum datiuo lende vſurye foeneror cum ablatiuo borowe make ſhyfte lay mortegage foeniculum fenell foenile hey houſe foeniſecium hey harueſte foeniſex ſecis mower hey foenograecum fenegreke foenum hey foenuſculum bottell hey foenus noris vſury alſo vnreaſonable vnlefull gayne comynge thynge lente ſomtyme fruite erth bryngeth forth without labour foeteo tere ſtynke foetidus um ſtynkynge foetifico aui brynge forth moſte commonly beaſte byrde dothe foetovarro taui tare ſame foetor oris ſtynche yll ſauour foetuoſus um full bredynge foetura tyme conception vnto byrthe alſo increaſe cattell ſometyme ſignifieth increaſe commynge forthe thynges foetus tus thynge broughte forthe generation sometyme fruite tres foetus ta tum full great yonge woman chylde beaſte foliatius um full leaues foliatus ta tum leaued hauynge leaues folium leafe follico caui care ſnuffe fetche backe wynde noſethrylles folliculus huſk wherin eares weate corne incloſed whan greene called hoſe alſo ſacke wherein corne put follis wherwith fyre blowen alſo ball blowen full wynde semblablye bed ſtuffed onelye wynde alſo bag wherin money fomentum nouryſhement naturral heate alſo thynge layde body fourme playſter mittigate peyne griefe diſeaſe callyd fomentation fomes fomitis matter wherewith fyre kendeled kepte burnynge somtyme ſignifyeth whiche feruentely ſtyrreth v thynge fons fontis fountayne well fontanus um fountayne aqua fontana well water fonticulus lyttell well ſprynge forago ſkayn hat alſo pirwike galetia cuntray spain hauing eaſt part ryuer callid seyn latin sequana ſouth royalme portugal weſt north occean ſea galgulus byrd one beholde hath yelowe iaundyſe forthwith man becometh hole byrde hath ſyknes galilea cuntrey marcheth siria arabia egypte galiopſis herbe callyd archangell ſome ſuppoſe galla fruite callyd gaulles gallaria lampurne gallia noble region ſet celtica lugdunenſis contayned betweene ryuers seyne geronde whiche bordered spayne callyd aquitania bounded mountaynes callyd pyrenaei ceſar boundeth parte callyd celtica ryuers callyd rhone gerounde aquitaniam hylles callyd pyrenaei ryuer gerounde agrippa deſcribed galliam betwene ryuer callyd rhenus rhene mountaynes pyrenaei occean ſea moūtayns callid gebenne iura moreouer whiche nowe callid people betwene aſſyria india ganges great ryuer dyuideth inde whyche holye ſcrypture callyd phiſon one foure ryuers whyche come paradyſe ioſephus doth interprete inundation li 1 cap 2 bredth therof solinus wryteth naroweſte place eyghte myles brodeſt twenty myles arrianus lib 8 wryteth hit narroweſte hit breadthe hunderde furlonge whyche eyghte myles manye place ſpreadeth ſoo wyde grounde moſte horne alſo long tethe white aboute ix inch length ſtandyng theyr mouthes lyke bore beeſt naturally hath ſuperfluous bloud congelid bealy growith like impoſtume whan ripe beaſt goeth tree ſtone rubbith theron bealy vntill humor breakith like vnto corrupt matter firſt ſtīketh whan hath ben hanged ayre 〈◊〉 waxeth ripe hath odoriferous ſauour callid muſke gazella cyuet ſom ſuppoſe cyuet lyke great cat boeotia doris phthiótis theſſalia magneſia macedonia thracia whiche late yeres vnder ſweete yoke chryſtes relygyon nowe ala great diſcomforte al perfecte chryſten men vnder mooſte cruell ſubiection ſeruitude greate tyrante turke become barbarous lyuynge beaſtely ſuperſtition falſe prophete mahomete graeciſco folowe grekes graecor aris ari ryot bankettynge rybendry graecoſtaſis place ambaſſadours together ſwarthe graminoſus um growen graſſe herbes gramma idem quod ſcriptulum uel ſcrupulum ſcruple xxiiii parte ounce grammataeus chauncellour grammatica grammer grammaticus teacheth grammer expoundeth aucthors profounde grammarian grammaticus ca cum perteynynge grammer grammatice loqui ſpeake congruely grammatiſta ſmatterer grammer mean grammaria • grammatocyphon wryteth knee grammatophylatium place recordes commune writinges kepte gramme lengthe without bredthe grammia fleume eyen granâtae reyalme citie spayne ioynynge ſea called mare mediterraneum whiche vnder ſubiection moore dccc yeres laſte great wyſedome polycie prowes kynge ferdinando queene elyzabeth famouſe memorye late kynge queene spayne eftſones reſtored vnto chriſtendome more expelled granarium grayenarde graſſor aris ari rob ſlee men paſſynge high wayes alſo go come one violente rage therfore ſodayne violent peſtilence ſayde morbus graſſatus ſickenes kylleth men ſodaynly grate kyndely grate thankes gratia grace ſometyme ſignifieth thanke ſomtyme benefite ſometyme rewarde alſo peace loue ſomtyme cauſe reſpecte alſo prayſe authoritie fauour mala gratia ſignifieth diſpleaſure mea tua uel eius gratia ſake thyr ſake ſake gratiam haber thanke gratiam inire get thanke gratiam referre uel reddere requite one good turne gratificor ari gratifie doo thynge thankefull confer benefyt good turne gratioſus thankfull alſo fauour people well eſtemed gratis aduerbe betokenynge withoute rewarde tyme without deſerte nothynge habitare gratis alieno dwell mannes grounde without paying rente seruire gratis ſerue without wage gratitudo dinis kyndneſſe grator ari gyue thankes god offerynges alſo reioyſe good fortune gratuito aduerbe ſignifyenge good wyll without benefyte gratuitus ta tum without rewarde vnhyred gratulatio ſometyme ſignifieth reioycing ſome good fortune happened hym ſelfe man ſometyme giuinge thankes gratulabundus doth reioyſe ut ſupra gratulor ari datiue caſe ioyous hym ſelfe good thynge hath happened tibi de hac tua felicitate gratulor 〈◊〉 ioyous glad thou art proſperitie thou art sometyme ſignifieth gyue thankes vnto god accuſatiue caſe ſignifieth take thankfully acte gratus remembreth good turne alſo agreable pleaſant dilectable gratus ta tum thankefull pleaſaunte acceptable grauaſtellus 〈◊〉 auntient father grauate grauatim greuouſly dyſpleaſantly peynefully grauatus greued grauedinoſus hath heuy heade grauedinoſus um heuy vnluſty diſpoſed nothynge grauedo dinis heuyneſſe griefe diſeaſe ſometyme mur reume head graueolentia ſtenche ſtynke graueſco ſcere hym wolde cauſe hum ſe naked gyges refuſed doo diſſuadynge moch could candaules foly ryghte wyſe exhortation candaules obſtinately perſiſting folyſhe fantaſy dydde ſet gyges ſecrete place behelde wyfe naked goynge bed gyges departed lady behelde hym fynally matter dyſcloſed huſbande vnto ſhe kepyng ſilence determined harte reuenged candaules huſbande countrey intollerable reproche man woman ſeene naked wherfore ſone callynge vnto ſuche ſeruauntes ſhe ſpecially truſted ſhe ſente gyges beinge come vnto ſhe purpoſed vnto hym election eyther hym ſelfe ſlayne el promyſe ſlee candaules take wyfe sobac dyd ſee vyſion menne beinge apparayled white dyd call chylde threwe hym fyre gaue hym flame fyre eate father ryſynge vp wente hieruſalem ſhewed viſyon vnto priſtes gaue anſweres ſayd vnto hym beware thou diſclo • e habitation chylde ſhall lighte worde demonſtration ſhal iudge iſrael ſworde fyre helias brought fyre thryſe heauen bare rayne tungue taken vp heauen fyry ſtorme written helias byble maye rad ſens bible nowe commonly rad englyſhe helicon mountayne aonia dedicate muſis heliocaminus ſoller ſet ſunnye placeo heate ſun maye receyued whiche vſed olde tyme heliochriſos herbe hauyng yelow floure marygolde heliogabalus ſuppoſed baſtard ſonne antonius caracalla emperour rome lampridius wryteth lyfe semiamitra egnatius writeth scenides couſen made emperour deathe macrinus diadumenus boy xvi yeres olde ſo moche exceded deteſtable lechery promotynge vyle perſons rybauldes fynally hated al mē laſte ſlayne drawen throughe citie rome throwen ryuer tiber albeit warned afore aſtronomers ſhoulde dye vyolente deathe therfore prouyded rope ſylke nede hange hym ſelfe alſo ſwordes golde kyll hym ſelfe alſoo ſtronge poyſon iacinctes emerauldes poyſon hym ſelfe inforſed ouer made hyghe toure hauyng floore bourdes keuered plate golde bordered pretious ſtones frome whiche toure wolde throwe hym ſelfe downe whan purſued nothynge auayled ſlayne knaues throwen tiber wrytten hym maye reede lyfe alexander seuerus whyche dydde tranſlate englyſh callid ymage gouernaunce heliopolis citie grecia callyd alſo corinthus egypte helioſcopium lyttell tree lyke fygge tree hath leaues lyke plane greatter blacker helioſelinum herb lyke ſmallage groweth watry groundes hathe one leafe heliotropium floure whiche ſonne riſynge dothe open ſonne ſet cloſeth thynke cihory ſom ſuppoſeth marygoldes ruddes heliſſaeus prophet abelmuth lande rubim whan borne galgalis cowe golde selom cryed ſoo lowde ſhe herd hieruſalem prieſte ſayde ſignifyed prophete borne day whyche ſhuld diſſolue keruen ymages breake piece ymages whyche caſte mettalle many meruayles almyghty god ſhewed whiche ye may reade byble nowe englyſhe helix icis ſome men taken kynde wyllowe tree ſome men yuy helias obſcur • hard vnderſtande heraclius name emperour alſo touche ſtone herba herbe alſo generally thinge groweth erthe wood ſometyme wede herbam dare aut porrigere manne yeldeth hym confeſſeth hym ſelfe vanquyſhed herba paralyſis ſmall dayſye herbaceus um herbes graſſe herbare brynge forth herbes herbarius herbarium ſhe dothe gather herbes phiſitions alſo knoweth property herbes maketh medicine theym bryde whan ſhe went bedde ſhoulde gyrte woullen gyrdelle knyt hercules knotte whyche houſbande good lucke ſhulde vndoo bedde mought fortunate gettynge chyldren hercules reported haue lxxii ſonnes one daughter ariſtotle writeth de natura animalium li 7 cap 6 herculeana par cuſtome men olde tyme auowe tenth part goodes vnto hercules tenthe parte callyd herculeana par hercules quaeſtus ſygnifieth ſame herculea herbe commonlye called millium ſolis dio corides lithoſpermon herculeius romane whyche fauoured parte marius hercules ſemeth generalle name gyuen men excellyng ſtrenthe men theyr tyme cicero de natura deorum wryteth amonge auncient writer founde vi hercules varro affyrmeth xliiii hercules fynallye noo notable mencyon made two one called hercules aegyp̄tius libicus whyche ſuppoſed oſyris wryten hereafter whiche longe hym ſonne iupyter alemena callyd alcides proper name incomparable ſtrengthe laboures whyche tooke commune profytte mankynde named alſoo hercules yt beroſus caldey affyrmeth hercules ſonne oſyris kynge aegypte callyd hercules libyus bycauſe conqueryd libyam ſayncte hierome tenthe chapyter geneſis wryteth hercules perfourmed twelue notable labour whyche poetes doo wryte alcides ſonne alemena fyrſt twelue labour diodorus siculus writeth ſleing lyon wod callid nemea far exceded al lyon greatnes whyche mought ſlayne neyther mettall ſtone wherfore conſtrayned ſlea hym handes ſeconde labour kyllyng hydra monſter fennes lerna whyche hadde hundeede neckes ſerpentyne heades whan one head ſtryken dyd ryſe eftſoones two heades third labour takynge great wyld bore erimanthus whiche waſted countreye arcadia people drad hym fynally hercules toke hym alyue bearynge hym ſhulders broughte hym kynge euriſtheus fourthe labour battayle whyche hadde alone great number men callyd centauri whyche greatte ſtrengthe ſwyfte horſes theym ſlewe whan aſſaulted hym fyfthe labour takynge great hart runnynge whyche ſwyfteneſſe hadde horne guylte ſyxthe labour deſtruction byrdes callyd stymphalides whyche conſumyd fruytes grayn countrayes adioynynge ſeuenth makynge cleane halle augeus beinge fulle dunge whyche hercules perfourmed wyſedome bryngynge ryuer callyd pignio halle whych ſwift courſe ſtreame one day caryed awaye dunge without reproche vnto hercules eyghte bryngynge bull yle creta greece drawynge hym alonge ſea nynthe takynge diomedes kyng thracia caſtynge hym horſes whome fedde mannes fleſſhe hym ſelfe theym deuoured hercules breakynge thoſe wylde horſes makynge theym gentylle broughte theym euriſtheus tenthe labour voyage spayne ſleynge gerion ſonnes takynge greatte kyne whyche gaue kynge countray contynually afterwarde bulles commynge kynde yerely offered one ſacrifyce honour hercules leuenth goynge helle fetchynge thenſe theſeus perithous bryngynge hym cheyne cerberus dogge helle hauynge thre heades twelfthe laſte laboure takynge golden appuls garden callyd heſperides ſleynge terryble dragon whyche contynually watchynge kepte thoſe appulles whyche callyd goulden beaultie theym somme ſay ſheepe whoſe fleeſes coloure golde dragon ſygnyfyed dylygence ſtrengthe ſhepcherdes whyche kepte theym theſe twelue laboures hercules whereof grewe prouerbe herculei labores labour doo ſeme impoſſible achieued herculis cothurnos vſed prouerbe thyng lyttell importance ſette forthe great cloquence thynge ſolemne apte greatter matter one ſhulde putte hercules hoſen chyldes legges lyke vnto accorded ſayenge wyſe kynge igeſllaus whan one commended hym rhetorician whych craftye eloquence made tryfles ſmalle thynges whyte ſkynne face ryuellyd bourned ſunne wearynge hym lyon ſkynne bearynge ryghte hande great clubbe lefte hande bowe quiuer backe drawynge hym multitude people tyed eares lytell chayne wrought ambre goulde ſo eaſyly tyed laughynge good chere wyllyngely ſolowed ſeemyd wold louſed ende chayn tyed hercules tungue looked towarde theym lawghynge countenaunce ymage ſygnyfyed eloquence whyche puyſſaunce man hilum ſmalle gutte ar • gutte hilarè meryly ioyouſely hilareſco ſcere mery hilaria plurali viii calendes apryll whā day nyght haue equall houres day begynneth increaſe hilaris hilarus mery ioyous hilaritas tati myrthe hilarius proper name man hilaro aui make one mery ioyouſe hilarodus ſynger wanton delycat ſong hillus ſonne hercules deianyra hilum lyttell blacke whiche ende beane ſometyme taken nothing nought hima mule whiche begotten betwene horſe aſſe himulus himula lytel beaſtes ſame kynde himera ryuer sicile deuided two partes one freſhe water ſalt hin meaſure hebrues whiche accompte senalis meaſure one galon pynte receyueth poyſe wine xvili dī two ounce oyle xvli hony xxvli hinc aduerbe ſignifieng thenſe ſome tyme cauſe hinc ille lachrimae cauſe teares matter wherfore wepte hinc locus mei frome countray towne came fro hinc ſcibo iam ubi ſiet wylle wete hym nowe hinc illinc hinc illinc euery ſyde hinc inde idem hinc illinc uenit commeth knowe whenſe hinnio iui ire neye lyke horse hinnulus fawne hynde calfe ❀hinnulus leonem vnderſtād coepit uicit prouocat kydde fawne toke vanquyſhed prouoked lyon batayle prouerbe applied perſon feble ignorant whiche meane hath vanquiſhed hym whiche puiſſant prouoketh batayle contendeth hym whyche wyſer better lerned hym ſelfe hinnus hinna hinnulus hinnula mule ingendred betwene aſſe mare hio aui gape alſo wonder meruail hiant flores floures ſpreade hioſciamus herbe callyd henbane hippacen cheſe made mare mylke hippaco aui fetche breath quyckly hippagium caryage horſbacke hippago ginis ferybote hippagogius inſtrumente wherewith ſtones polyſhed hipparchus capitayn horſemen hippeas kynde crabfyſhe hippei cometes blaſyng ſterres hauing mane lyke horſes hippiades ymages woman horſeback woman amazon alway paynted hippiae ben kynd creuyſes countrey callyd phoenicia ſo ſwyfte impoſſible ouer take hippias rhetorician apuleiꝰ ſaith floridor 2 excelled al men multitude craftes equall man eloquence countrey kynred vncertayn came tyme piſa great tryumphe callyd olympicum thynges dyd weare vpon owne makyng ſhoes patens cote wrought fyneſt threde three threde ſtytches bawdrike baudkyn chaungeable colour ſundrye picture mantelle whyte ouer rynge fynger ſtone wherin ſygnet moſte perfectly wrought dyd worke owne handes alſo caryed hym lyttell oyle bottell narow mouth reſydue rounde flatte lyttell inſtrument ſtryke ſweate frome body hangyng therat played excellentely euery inſtrument ſange owne verſes kyndes whyche man coulde amende partes rhetorike logyk philoſophy vanquyſhed many none vanquyſhed ran wraſtelyd dyd feares actiuitie men beholdyng hym therwith abaſhed finally nothyng ſemyd ignoraunt weake vnable withſtandyng plato two dialogue bringeth socrates diſputīg one inſerching beaultie lye concludeth proueth hippias arrogant ignorant folle foraſmoche prayſynge beaultie wyſt beaultie boſtyng man coulde diſcerne lyar frome true man coulde make tru diffinition appereth howe moche commune iudgement men varieth inferior iugement perfect wyſe man socrates hippiatrus horſe leache hippius tyrius fyrſt made ſhyppes whiche ſerue onely burdeyn callyd latyn naues onerariae hippo maſc gener name two city hippobotos feedor horſes hippocampus hippocampae fyſſhes lyke horſes forepartes hippocentauri people theſſalia mount pelius whiche alſo callid centauri fyrſt ſene grece rydyng horſes wherof came fable centauri halfe menne halfe horſes hippocomus horſecorſer hippocrates name phyſition mooſte excellent hippocrene fountayne boeotia dedicate apollo ix muſes hippodamia doughter oenomaus kyng arcadia vnto tolde ſotheſayer whan doughter dyd marye ſhulde dye therfore whan doughter cam yeres mariage ordeyned price runnynge charyottes cauſyd proclaymed ſo euer dydde vaynquyſhe hym therin ſhulde haue doughter wyfe vaynquyſſhed hym ſhulde dye many wowers ſlayne laſte pelops ſonne ta • talus deſyryng hauē ſaid mayden promyſed pryuylye myrtilus whyche drau • kynges charyotte yf dydde wyn pryce myrtilus ſhulde lye hippodamia fyrſte nyghte vppon whyche couenant myrtilus made extree waxe occaſion wherof chariot fell downe broken pelops price wherfore oenomaus ſlewe hym ſelfe pelops enioyed lady royalme moreouer whan myrtilus aſked promyſed hym pelops threwe hym ſea next adioynyng therof euer callyd mare myrtoum lady callyd alſo hippodamia whyche wyfe perithous whome battayle betwene people callyd centauri whiche namyd lapythae hippodamus breaker horſes hippodromus brode way wherin many horſes many runne togither hippolapathum herbe callyd pacience hippolytus ſonne theſcus complaynte phedra ſtepmother purſewed father charyote fleyng ouerthrowen amonge ſharpe ſtones rente piece afterwarde aeſculapius reuyued hym reſtoryd hym healthe wherfore wolde callyd virbius ſay twyſe man foraſmoche twyſe lyued hippomachia tourneyenge horſebacke iuſtynge hippomanes herbe wherof horſes done eate forthwith run madde alſo venomous humour runnyng ſhap mare whiche man hap receyue inwarde ſhall madde plinius ſayth lyttell fleſſhe forehead colte whan newe fooled blacke moch date whyche mare plucketh awaye teethe ſoone ſhe hath fooled man take awaye ſhe neuer wyll loue foole hippomaratrum wylde fenell hipponax greke poete borne epheſus defourmed vyſage ſtyle ſharpe vehement ſo moch whā kunnynge payntour named bubalus paynted ylle fauoured face make men laughe hipponax made agaynſte hym ſuche vengeable verſes anger ſhame cauſed hym hange hym ſelfe howſe hipponomus hearde keper horſes hippopera male bougette hippophaës herbe callyd taſyll alſo callyd labrum hydram ſecare meddle endles matter one miſchiefe happeneth hydragogus bryngeth water place furrowes trench hydrargyrum certayne thynge wherwith ſyluer gylte ſtede quicke ſyluer hydraulis organ player hydraulos inſtrument puſhe water violence hydria water pot hydrolapathon water dockes hydromantia diuination callynge ſpirites appere water hydromel water hony ſodden gether hydropiper ſeemeth herbe whiche pothecaryes commonly cal eupatory hydropota drynketh alway water hycca great fyſhe whiche hermolaus barbarus taketh ſturgeon hydrops dropis dropeſy ſicknes trallianus wryteth whiche commeth lyuer made ſoo colde maye ſuffitiently boyle meate receyued conuerte ſubſtaunce pure bloud turneth warry ſubſtance wynde elles fleume occaſion wherof galenus paulus doo ſaye lyuer feble colde matter whiche aboundeth ſente member whereof commeth yll habyte fygure body procedeth three cauſes primatiue cauſe moche colde drynke forthwith labour bayninge goinge longe ſun drynkynge moche faſting longe dependynge ſuperfluous ſentence hyperbole exceſſe aduaunſynge depreſſynge hygher heauen whiter ſnowe ſwifter lyghtenyng ſlower ſnayle worſe dyuell hyperbolicus ca cum excedynge credence hyperborei people dwellynge furthermoſte parte northe ſome haue ſuppoſed vnder northe pole called polus arcticus pomponius mela writeth countrey lyttell hauynge ſun ouer beinge fertile ſelfe people verye iuſte lyuynge lenger pleaſantly men alway buſyneſſe labour knowynge neyther warre debate lyke dothe pliny write li 4 cap 12 solinus ſaythe ſome men appoynte rather aſia europa doo ſet meane betwene ſun goynge downe antipode whiche people hauynge theyr feete agaynſte oures ſunne ryſynge v finally ſaythe europa haue vi monthes continually daye vi monethes continually nighte wyndes alwaye holſome knowe neyther ſickeneſſe vnquietnes wherfore strabo wryteth li 15 ſome men affirmed lyue thouſande yeres feſtus pompeius wrate exceded lyfe man lyuynge aboue hundred yeres therfore called hyperborei excedynge commune terme mannes lyfe whan wery tedious lyfe mela solinus doo wryte makynge good chere theyr neyghbours hauynge garlandes theyr heades throw ſelfes certaine rocke depe ſea eſtemyng beſt deth fourme burienge hypercatalecticum metrū aboundeth one ſyllable two hypericon herbe called ſayncte iohn̄s wurte hyperion poetes called ſunne titan terra father ſun mone morrowe ſometyme put ſunne hyperthyron tranſumpte haunce hyperthyrum whiche nexte ouer browe man hyphen dyuers wordes pronounced vnder one accente quandoquidem utcun que c hypnales adder whiche ſtynginge man dyeth ſleapynge hypocauſtum hote houſe ſtewe hypochyma graye humour keuerynge eye called alſo glaucoma hypocondrium inwarde parte body aboue nauel vnder ſtomacke hypocriſis falſe dyſſimulation fayned holyneſſe hypocrita hypocrite hypodidaſcalus vſher ſubſtitute teachynge hypogeum place vnder grounde hypogloſsida lyttell rounde thynges made phiſyke lye vnder one tungue whiche dyſeaſed reumes griefe throte hypomnema matis expoſition comment hypopodion foote ſtoole hypopyus matter runneth eye hypoſarcha one kyndes dropeſy wherby bodye bolneth ſwelleth cometh increaſynge bloude colde thyn watrye infuſed member defaulte thyrde digeſtion cauſed weakenes ſtomake lyuer wayes wherof beinge ſtopped power wherby ſuperfluities ſeparat expulſed made feble wherby body doth gather vitious iuyce wyndes hypoſphagma ſkinne eye ſome ſtroke ſo hurte bloud ſodenly ſpredeth ouer eye hypoſtaſis ſubſtaunce alſo dothe ryſe vrine good dygeſtion reſidence whyte lyght ryſynge faſcion lyke peare ſmal ende vpwarde hypotheca pledge alſo doctrine hypotheſis argumente matter cauſe whervpon one ſhuld argue diſpute ſpeke hypothicos lynnen rochet hypothyra ſeu hypothyrides dore rather place open dore hypothyron groundſyll threſhold hypozigia drawynge cattell hypſicratea wyfe kynge mythridates whiche folowed hym warres beynge armed lyke knyght hypſiphyle doughter thoas kyng lemnos whan woman commune conſent ſlayne men countrey one nyght ſhe ſaued father dyd let hym departe whan iaſon goynge towarde conqueſt goulden flyſe came vnto lemnos ſhe beinge loue hym conceyued hym twoo chyldren twynnes whan borne woman countrey wolde haue put death ſauyng father ſhe fleinge taken pyrates gyuen lycurgus kynge nemea whoſe ſonne ſhe nouriſhed whan argiues wente deſtroye thebe hypſiphyle whyle ſhe went ſhewe argiues fountayne left chylde lyinge graſſe ſlayne ſerpent wherfore whan father chylde wold haue put deth kinges argiues defended ſaued som wryte hypſiphyle whan ſhee perceyued iaſon dyd returne agayne accordynge promyſe ſhe threw ſelfe ſea drowned hyrcania countrey aſia hyſginum coulour lyke ſcarlet hyſopus hyſopum herbe called hiſope hyſteralgia peyne bealy hyſterologia hyſteron proteron maner ſpeakynge laſte ſet fyrſte ſayde carte horſes ¶i ante imperatiue moode eo doth ſignifie go thou alſo forme ſpekynge whan correcte exhorte mocke man nunc rebus nimium confide ſecundis go put thy truſte proſperitie nunc dormientem excita go thy waye awake hym ia yonger ſonne atlas ſouneth moche voyce iacchus one name bacchus called god wynes iacea nigra brunfelſius ſuppoſeth herbe whiche called morſus diaboli iaceo cui cere lye extende length ſometyme medio campus iacet myddle fylde alſo dead ille iacet deade somtyme contemned nought ſet maximas uero uirtutes iacere neceſſe eſt uoluptate dominante carnall dilectation rulynge nedes muſte excellent vertues nothynge ſet iacent without vertue courage eſtimation iacent uirtutes vertue naughte ſet iacent pretia lowe pryce iacet grauiter lyeth ſycke iacet oratio oration without grace ſpirite iacens animus deſperate mynde courage iacente te thou beinge ſicke iacio ieci iacere throwe caſte ſhoote ſomtyme ſet laye iacere fundamentum ſet laye foundation iacob patriarch ſonne iſaac iacobus proper name englyſhe iames iactanter boſtyngely iactantia boſte iactatio idem iacito taui tare boſte often iacto aui throwe reuolue toſſe mynde vexe throwe downe heate auaunt glory ſpeake vaynly ſet forthe toſſe caſte iactuoſe braggingly iaculatio iaculamen iaculamentum ſhot caſte darte iauelyn iaculo aui ſhoore caſt farre iaculor aris idem iaculum thynge maye ſhot caſt far moſte comonly darte lyghte iauelyn iaculus ſerpente lyeth vnder tree ſodaynly meruaylous vyolence perſeth beaſte whiche happeneth paſſe hym iam nowe alſo incontinent forthwith iam ne imu ſhall go nowe iambus fote meter hath fyrſte ſyllable ſhorte longe iam diu longe agone iam dudum nowe late whyle ſenſe iamiam euen nowe iam inde incontinent iam olim nowe late iam pridem lyttell whyle paſte late ſomtyme forthwith iam tum tyme ianiculum parte rome mountayne alſo gate ſame name ianira doughter ocean tethis ianitor toris porter ianthina violet colour tournynge yere retourneth began elles bycauſe knoweth paſſed foreſeeth ſhall happen god rather ydoll temple rome whiche tyme warres alway open tyme peace ſhut therfore whan ſtories mention made temple ianus ſhut vnderſtande romaynes peace vnyuerſally ianum claudere olde tyme ſygnifyed make vnyuerſall peace temple ianus rome two dores opened whan romaynes made war whan warre finiſhed thynges quiete ſhut iapetus father prometheus iapigia countrey realme naples called calabria iapix gi wynde commeth partes apulia weſterne wynde alſo one ſonnes dedalus kynge calabria whiche hym called iapigia iaſminum tree lyttell floure called iaſemin iaſon oni whiche fyrſte conquered fleeſe golde iaſpis pidis ſtone called iaſper iatraleptes phiſition ſurgion whiche cureth oyntmentes iatraleptice curynge moche greatter ſtalke lyttell cubyte heyght ſomer beareth whyte floure hath lyttell ſede groweth ſtalke hermolaus dothe interprete wyld kreſſes manardus writeth ſome menne calleth lepidium aetius calleth cardamine whiche latine naſturtium engliſhe kreſſes iberus ryuer spayne ibi ibidem ſame place ibis foule byrde aegypt high hath ſtiffe legges longe byl profyt moche countrey kyllyng eatynge ſerpentes libya caryed aegypt ſouthern wynd alſo taken enuyous perſon ¶i ante c icaria yle ſea icario whiche alſo called icaros icarus father chaſte penelope icarus ſon dedalus hauing wīges father flew yle crete whan flewe higher father commaunded hym waxe wherwith fethers winges glewed beyng molten heate ſun fethers fallynge icarus conſtrayned fall ſea whiche afterwarde callyd mare icarium alſo icarus mountayne region athene ichneumon beaſte aegypt greatenes cat faſcioned lyke mouſe crepeth bodye cocodryll whan gapeth eatynge bowelles ſleeth hym alſo kynde waſpes ichnographia plat immiſceo ſcui ſcere myngle togyther immiſericorditer without pitie immiſſum layde abyde beame houſe lyke thynge immitis te cruell without pitie immitia poma appuls yet ripe immitto miſi mittere ſend ſomtyme ſignifieth let grow length ne que barbam immiſeris iſ • neither let berde grow length reſpicimus dira illuuies immiſta que barba beheld horrible filthynes beard growen lengthe alſo bryng ſende contrary parte hoc futurum eſſe dixerunt ut poſt breue tempus immitteret deus regem qui expugnaret iudaeos ſhuld come paſſe ſayd god ſhuld ſende contrary parte kyng ſhuld vanquiſhe iewes alij tarquinium cicerone immiſſum • ebant ne craſſus ſuſcepto malorū patrocynio rēpub turbaret ſayde tarquine brought craftily cicero leſt craſſus taking defence miſdoers ſhuld therby bring ſedition ſet peyn iuges neceſsitatem imponere conſtrayne onus imponere gyue charge imponere praeſidium ciuitati ſet garriſon citie imponere praetium ſet pryce silentium imponere commande ſilence imporco aui make balke caryng lande importunitas tati whiche hath commoditie tyme place importunus na nū ſeaſon importunate importuoſus um without porte hauen impos impo • vnable without power impoſtor oris deceyueth promiſes ſelleth falſe ware good impoſturam facere deceyue maner aforeſayde impotens tentis reſyſte appetite affection ſomtyme vſurped puyſſaunt impotentia debilitie ſomtyme immoderate power alſo vnabilitie reſyſt impraeſentia impraeſentiarum time preſent tyme imprecor aris ari deſyre wyſhe impreſsio oni violent aſſaulte imprimo preſsi primere prynt ſeale improbè yll naughtily vnhappyly improbitas tati diſhoneſtye vnthryftyneſſe wantonnes obſtynacye malapertnes rauenye wylyneſſe improbus yl man diſhoneſt obſtinate wanton malapert wyly vnſatiable improbus aliae rei good none thing improba facies yll fauoured face facinus improbum ſhrewde tourne labor improbus great trauayle improba merx vnlefull marchandyſe ſmalle profyte improbum o leud myſcheuous tunge improbi poſtes rotten poſtes beinge wyſe vnſufficient improbum teſtamentum teſtamēt vnſufficient lackynge circumſtance forme improlis uel improlus yet citiſē improperiū imbraiding defaut impropero aui imbrayde man ſome defaute improuidus prouideth time commynge improuidus da dum whyche commeth ſodaynly vnloked improuiſè improuiſo vnthoughte vnlooked improuiſus um idem quod improuidus imprudens dentis vnware alſo circūſpect imprudens harum rerum knowynge thoſe matter imprudenter vnwyſely vnaduyſedly imprudentia lacke foreſyghte thought impubes impuber man chylde age xiiii yeres mayden xii impudens ſhameles impudenter ſhamefully diſhoneſtly vnaduyſedly wantonly impudicitia vncleannes lyuynge impudicus vnchaſt vncleane lyuyng impulſo aui perſwade often impulſus perſwaded prouoked inforced impune without damage without punyſſhement griefe vayne impunitas tati lacke puniſhment libertie without puniſhment pardon puniſhment impurus ra rum diſhoneſt vyle reprochable ſluttyſhe imputatus ta tum vncutte neuer cut imputo aui repute aſcribe lay blame defaut alſo reken one thyng acoōpt one ſum nother imu mum loweſt moſt lowe imu pe ſole foote imu ſonus baſe ſonge imo à pectore bottom hart ¶i ante n ſygnifyeth aduerſum contrary part annum yere bonis amonge good men coenam ſupper conſpectum aſpice loke diem addicere ſell vpon condition thynge done day diem uiuere lyue withoute carynge morowe dy ſingulos day day horam one houre horas houre houre lucem vntyll day magno munere great rewarde manu uel manibus eſt power hande caſy hande manum dari giuen apart ſeuerally meam partem parte medium afferre bryng forth common vſe commoditie mentem uenire come mynd remembrance conſydered nauem ingreditur went ſhyppe noctem vnto nyghte numerato habere redy hande numerum order ordinem ducere uel cogere bring downe authoritie miniſhe eſtimation power ore eſt omni populo people ſpeaketh partem thy part age ſis tu partem nunciā hūc delude atꝓ amplexare hanc go nowe thy part deceyue hym hardyly take vnto partem dimidiam decoquere boyle halfe deale paucos dy lyttell whyle pedem euery foote ſe ternis nummis pedem tecum tranſegiſſe dicebat ſayd bargeyned thre pēce fote euery foote iii penny perendinum morow ii dais hēs portu ſum ſaufe poſterum fynally concluſyon hen forthe hereafter poteſtatem eſſe vnder rule pleſure one praeſentia tyme praeſens idem primis chiefly ſpecially aboue al thinges priuato publico home abrode procliui eſt eaſy bring pa promptu eſt eaſy know aparāt propatulo men iam propinquo certamen erat nowe battayle hande day battayle come proximo hande publicum legiones brought army daunger ſure place uiros diuidere gyne euery man uniuerſum generally utranꝓ partem one ſyde inacceſſa ylande egypt whiche commynge inachus fyrſt kynge argi • e inaneſcere vayn none eſtimation inaniloquus abablar inanimus • mum without ſoule inanio iui ire make empty inanis ne empty vacant ydelle lyght eſtymation inanis accedit cometh without bryngyng thynge hym inanitas inanitio emptynes voydnes inareſco ſcere drye vp inarime yle thuſcane ſea alſoo mountayne inaudio iui dire inauditus ta tum neuer harde ſtraunge heare inauris rynge lyke thynge hangynge eare inauro vncertain incertus ta tum vncertayne doubtfull inceſſo ſsi ſſere make angry diſpleaſure one accuſe inceſſere hoſtes iaculis caſte dartes iauelyns ennemies inceſsit ambo inopia bothe theym vexed pouertie cupido eum ceſsit toke deſire came fantaſy vnto hym inceſsit mo taken ſuch cuſtom inceſto aui ppllute inceſtuoſus doth often pollute inceſtus ta tum polluted inceſtus tus lechery cōmytted one whiche nygh kynne aliaunce hym commytteth alſo ſygnifieth maner pollution inchoo aui begyn alſo performe incîdo cîdi ere cut graue inciſa loſte spe inciſa prius quam praedicta dy adeſſet hope loſt damageous commune equally incompactum vnioyned yll ioyned incomprehenſus comprehended inconcinnus um vnmete yll proportioned inconcuſſus ſtable ſhaken incōditè aduer without faciō without order inconditus ra tum order facion ru • e alſo weryſhe inconditus ta tum vnmade vnbuylded incongelabilis le froſen conſiliari callyd counſell conſilio adeſſe counſayl mattee lawe quo que petilius ut ſibi conſilio ad eſſem rogauit petilius alſo deſyred wold counſayle inconſultè without counſayle vnaduyſedly inconſultus lackynge aduiſe conſyderation wyll aſke counſayle inconſultu meo without counſayle inconſutilis without ſeame inconſutus ta tum vnſowed inconſyderatè vnaduiſedly inconſyderatus nothyng conſidereth incontinens chaſt kepeth one woman incoquo xi quere ſeethe boyle thing incordio aui pardon indulge ualetudini ruae take hede thy helth nimium illi indulges thou careſt moch hym thou foloweſt moche thou makyſt moche hym indumentum garment induo duo ere putte garment lyke thyng induuiae apparayle inebrior aris ari make drunke drunken inedia hungar ineffigiatus ta tum vnfaſcioned without good proportion ineo iui ire begyn go deſerue get wynne optayne treate inîre ſometyme male leapeth female horſe keuereth mare alſo conſider vnderſtande inire curſum begyn courſe falſam gratiam inire get faynt vnſure frendes inire foedus make leage treatye peace inire fugam flee men
