howe thynge maye done inire ſocietatem fall feloweſhyp one inire ſuffragia aſſemble people election conſent matter inita ſubducta que ratione al thynge rekened well accompted ineunte aetate youthe ineunte uere begynning ſpring yere ineptio iui ire trifle thynge vnmete purpoſe ineptus ta tum vnapte ineptus triflar vſynge nothynge order vnapte purpoſe inermis vnarmed man yolden iners inertis without ſcience crafte ydell perſon alſo vnprofitable inertia lacke crafte ydelnes inerticula vine wherof wyne ſo good none yuell procedeth therof ineſco ſci ſcere cram fode alſo deceiue ineuitabilis le eſchewed inexercitus ta tum exerciſed vnoccupied inexhauſtus um neuer reaſynge inexploratò without ſerche inexputabilis le maye numbred inextricabilis le ſhaken diſſolued infabre vncunningely vncraftylye yll fauoured infamia infamy infamis infamed infamis digitus myddle fynger infamo aui infame yll report infandum maye ſpoken infans chylde yet ſpeake alſo euery thynge yonge alſo ſignifieth eloquent ſome tyme ideote ſpeake infantia chyldehod • alſo folyſhenes infantilis le pertayninge chyldhode infarcio cij ciui cire infarſe ſtuffe fyll infatuo aui make folyſhe infector toris dyar colour infectus tus dyenge ſtayni • ge infectus ta tum infected dyed ſtayned poyſoned alſo vndone done made infecta pace without peace made infectum reddere vndo whiche done infenſus diſpleaſed moued anger hate toward alſo bearith malice inferiae ſacrifice done infernall goddes infernalis le infernall infernas atis lowe infernè alowe benethe infernus hell infernus na num lowe infero intuli inferre brynge throwe adde caſte conclude inferre arma make warre inferre crimen alicui lay one charge inferre ſermonem talke stuprum inferre commyt adultery fornication kynſwoman inferus ra rum nothynge lower infeſtiuus ua um vnmete diſporte infeſto aui diſpleaſure ſondry incurſions rodes infeſtus mortall ennemye infeſtus ta tum ſtandeth agaynſt man intent indamage infeſta ſigna ſtanderdes bauers diſplayed battayle bothe partes infeſtum mare ſea occupied pyrates robber infeſtus ager daungerous countreye paſſe throughe infeſtus animus malitious mynde infibulo aui claſpe gether inficias ire doubt deny inficiator oris denyeth infici feci ficere dye clothe ſlayne infecte inficior aris ari deny diſaffyrme infidus da dum vnfaythfull infimâtes baſe people infimo aui brynge lowe infimus um loweſt moſte baſe infirmitas tati vnſtableneſſes weakenes ſickenes infirmo aui make weake infirmus um vnſtable ſycke feble infit ſayde began inflammo aui inflame ſet fyre inflecto ctere bowe plye infligo xi gere poenam aut opprobrium punyſhe rebuke influo xi ere runne thynge water licour dothe informo aui ſhape fourme enfourme teache good maners inforo aui declare barre place iudgemente pleade alſo perf • cate make hole infortunium yll chaunce infra within benethe number ſignifieth laſſe fewer infractio ſlouthfulnes infractus ta tum vnbroken ſure infractus animi ſtyf courage ſometyme ſignifyeth diſcouraged infrendes chyldren lackynge teeth infrendo di dere craſhe teth anger infringo fregi gere breake piece infrunitus foole knoweth howe vſe thynge infuco care colour thynge intendynge deceypte infulae labelles whiche hange euery ſyde mytar old tyme attyre prieſtes dydde weare theyr heades alſo tapets linen wherwith temple hanged infumibulum ſhanke tonnel chymneye infumo aui drye ſmoke infund • bulum tounnell wherinto lic • ure poured whan veſſelles fylled infundo fudi fundere poure infurnibulum piele wherwith breade put ouen infuſcare ui •• merum alay wyne water ingemo gemui ere lamente bewayle moche ingeniculor aris ari bowe knee make courteſy ingeniculus fygure amonge ſterres called nowe hercules ingenioſus wytty ingenium proper name thynge alſoo wytte ingens ti wonderfull great ingens animus great courage ingenuatus come honeſte ſtocke kynrede ingenuè frely frankly ingenuitas tati fredome ingenuus free man borne gentylman ingenuus um naturall ingenua facta noble actes ingero geſsi gerere brynge myxte ingerere cibum gyue one meate ingerere dictum aliquē chyde one ſay yll one ingerere malum diſpleaſure omnia mala ingerebat dydde warſt coulde oſculum ingerere kyſſe one paſſynge ingerere pugno ſtryke fyſte se ingerere aduaunce hym ſelfe company malapert ingitas tati pouertie inglorius um renoume fame ingluuies gluttony alſo craye gorge byrdes ingrandeſco ſci ſcere ware great ingratijs maulgre one ingratis agaynſte wyll wyll ingratus ta tum vnthankefull diſpleaſante conſtrayned agaynſte mannes wyll alſo vnkynde remembrynge frendeſhyp beneuolence ingraueſco ſci ſcere ouercharge ingredior eris gredi enter ingruo ui ere inuade imminent properly ſpoken battayle tempeſt inguina priuie member men womenne inguinaria herbe cureth diſeaſes priuy member inguinium citie liguria aunciente ryche ingurgito aui deuoure gluttonouſely inhabilis le vnapte inhabito tare dwell place inhereo cleaue ſtycke inhereſco ſci ſcere ſticke faſte inhalo aui drawe brethe inhibeo bui bere forbyd inhibere imperium haue charge rule inhibere nauem caſte ancre ſ • aye ſhyppe whiche vnder ſayle ſhe ſayle full courſe inhibere ſupplicia alicui execute tourmentes one put one deathe inhio aui gape alſo couet moche inhoneſtè diſhoneſtly inhoneſtus ta tum diſhoneſt inhonor without honour inhonoratus ta tum lackynge honour inhorreo rui rere inhorreſco ſcere abhorre quake feare inhoſpes wyll lodge man inhoſpitá tecta houſes man maye lodge inhoſpitalis le vnapt lodgynge inhumanus cruell vncourteys inhumo put grounde inibi euen anon amonge inijcio ieci ijcere caſt throwe caſt ſome thynge throwe violence put inijcere manum ſcaſe take poſſeſſion thynge inijcere manus aliquem apprehend attache one inijcere ſcrupulum alicui put one fantaſy inijcere ſtudium alicui cauſe one ſtudy manus iniectio ſeaſer lande inimicitia hoſtilitie contrary amity inimico caui care make ennemies inimicor caris cari practiſe hoſtilitie inimicus ennemy ininde initiatus inſtructed entered rule concernynge religion initio aui inſtructe thynges concernyng religion alſo begyn thynge initior aris ari begyn alſo weaned chyldren initium begynninge ſacrifice cere inito aui walke initor toris ſtalyon inîtus leapynge keuerynge mare horſe iniuges cattell neuer yoked broken whiche ſometyme ſacrifiſed iniungo xi gere inioyne appoynte laye man wyl ad gret burdeyne iniuria wronge iniury reproche damage taken lyke aduerbe ſignifieth without cauſe without deſerte iniuria tua throughe thy default iniurioſus wronge doet iniurius um wrongfull dothe thynge agaynſte lawe iniuſſu imperatoris without emperours commaundement iniuſtus ta tum vniuſte alſo excedynge iuſte meaſure iniuſtè vniuſtely innaſcor ſci ingendred one innatus ta tum ingendered innato aui ſwym place innitor teris inniti aſſaye indeuoure innocens vnharmfull innocent innocentia integritie true intente innocuus um vnharmfull dothe none harme innoteſco ſci ſcere knowen innoxius um wherin damage whiche none harme innumerato redynes innuo nui ere graunt aſſent nod • dynge heade ino daughter cadmus wife athanſas kynge thebe whiche huſbande bèynge mad learchus ſonne ſlayne ſhe threwe ſelfe ſea inocco aui harowe inoculatio graffynge betwen rynde wood inoculo aui graffe betwene rynde wood inodorus without ſauour inoffenſus vnhurte inofficioſum teſtamentum father teſtament gyueth awaye ſon landes goodes without cauſe inoleſco ſci ſcere waxe great inopia pouertie lacke thynges neceſſary inopinatus vnthought vnloked inopioſus um needy inops pi pore lackyng helpe alſo vnburied inops ab amicis diſpuruayed frendes inops amicorum idem inora beaſtes without mouthes poſterum laſte concluſion inprimis ſpecially pryncipally chiefely promptu redy redines promptu eſſe playne without inquilinus dwelleth place neyther auncetours borne inquino aui defyle polute inquio ſaye inquiro ſiui quirere inquire inquiſitius intentifely inwardely inſania madnes peuyſhenes dotage frowardenes inſanio iui ire mad peuyſhe dote vnaduyſedly inſanitas madneſſe inſanus mad peuyſhe dotynge regardyng counſell frowarde vntractable inſatiabilis le vnſatiable inſcendo dere go vp clyme inſciens vnwyttynge alſo thynkynge doth inſciencer ignorantly inſcientia ignoraunce inſcitia idem inſcius um ignoraunt inſcribo ſcripſi ſcribere wryte vpon name intitle inſcriptus um vnwrytten wrytten vpon inſeui inſ • tum ſygnyfieth graffe inſerto aui ſet inſertorium bonde thonge wherwith tergate buckeler hanged mannes arme inſeruio uiui ire ſeru • inſideo e ſedi fidere ſyt ſyt beſiege abyde place inſidiae wyles intray man er ware inſidior aris ari practiſe wile intrap betray man inſidioſe wylily craftely inſidioſus um full wyles inſido ſidi enter intente abyde inſigne notable ſigne token inſignia ſignes token honour wherby euery aſtate great aucthoritie knowen robe mace ſwordes borne vpeyghte cappes mayntenance lyke thinges alſo ſome tyme token doctrine vertue ſtaues typped ſyluer whiche bedells beare doctours hoodes furred crownes laurell may alſo taken armes bages gentylmen inſignio iui ire note ſome ſigne alſo doube knyghtes inſignis ne notable excellente marked ſome ſpeciall token knowen inſignite inſigniter notably inſilio liui ire leape vp inſimul together inſimulatio accuſation appeale inſimulo aui accuſe appeale alſo fayne diſſemble inſinuatio colourable crafty begynning oration diſſemblynge ſomme thynge matter maye fauourablye herde inſinuatus um wounde gether inſinuo aui brynge conioyne put mannes mynde couertelye craftely aliquem alteri inſinuare brynge one fauour cauſam inſinuare ſe conſyder grūde matter inſinuare ſe lyttell lyttell crepe fauour credence inſinuare ſe conſuetudinem enter aquayntaunce become familiar one inſinuare ſe ſermonem aliquorum cterlaſe communication alredy talkynge matter inſipidus um vuſauery inſipiens entis without diſcretion inſiſto inſtiti inſiſtere ſet faſt fyrmely indeuour prouoke ſollicite ſomtime aſſyſte inſiſtebat manu cereris dextera ſimulachrum pulcherrime factum victoriae ryghte hande cere ymage vyctory moſte pleaſauntly wroughte aliquod negotium inſiſtere go aboute ſome affayre buſines haſtae inſiſtere leane ſpeare mente animo inſutere rem aliquam employe al wyt mynde ſome thing omnes itinera inſiſtant ſua let euery man go owne waye quam inſiſtam uiam waye ſhall kepe veſtigijs alienis inſiſtere folowe mennes doinges inſiſtere ueſtigijs laudum ſuarum contynue well vrijs insiſtere aut ingredi cary way go forthe insitio oni graffynge insitium ſtocke insitium graffe alſo iegot lyke meate ſtuffed fleſhe egges chopped mynced insitiuus ua uum infarſed ſtuffed inſolabiliter without comforte deſperatelye inſolatio ſunnynge inſolatus um ſunned inſolens wont accuſtomed haut arrogant preſumptuous inſolenter arrogantly inſolentia ſeld omnes vſe thyng vnhauntynge place alſo preſumption wanton pryde inſolitus wonte inſolo aui drye ſunne bleach inſomnes noctes nyghtes without ſlepe inſomnia ae lacke power ſleape inſomnioſus ſleapy ſleapeth moch inſomnium vayne dreame inſons ſo ntis innocent gylty inſonus um without noyſe inſpectius auyſedly inſpecto taui tare beholde attentiuelye wayte inſpectio beholdynge ouerſyghte controllement inſpector ouerſeer controller inſpicio ſpexi cere beholde ouerſee controll conſyder thyng throughly inſpico aui make thynge ſmalle lyke wheate reede inſpiro aui inſpire blowe inſtans ti inſtant leaſt part tyme inſtanter inſtantly inſtantia thynges preſent inſtantia dilygence inſtar lyke inſtat nigh come hande caeſar ubi ſe diutius duci intellexit diem inſtare qua die frumentum militibus metiri oportebat whan caeſar perceyued delayed daye nyghe come whan muſt nedes delyuer corne men warre inſtatio inſtant tyme inſtauratio reedifieng repairyng renewynge inſtauro aui new make begyn agayn thynge ſometyme renue reforme reedyfye inſtaurare bellum make warre eftſones inſterno ſtraui ſternere couer ſpreade inſtigo aui ſtyrre prycke forwarde inſtigo inxi gere meue inwardly inſtinctus inwardly moued inſtita purfle inſtito aui repugne withſtande inſtitor oris chapman mercer alſo ſelleth apparayle fyne ſtuffe going therwith alſo marchantes factour inſtitorius um pertaynyng chapman actio inſtitoria action agaynſt maiſter acte factour inſtituo tui tuere inſtitute begyn inſtruct teche ordeyn aueo ſcire quarū rerū rationē inſtituat wold fain know gothe intendeth senex inſtitui lyra non erubeſcebat beynge old aſhamed taught play harpe accuſationem inſtituere commence action make complaynt byll aſtutiam inſtituere inuent crafty mean certamen ſibi inſtituere cum aliquo varyance one collegium inſtituere founde college conſuetudinem inſtituere enter famyliaritie delectum militum inſtituere raiſe men warres quaeſtum ſibi inſtituere begyn waye haue gayne profyte vitam ſapienter inſtituere prepare hym ſelfe lyue wyſely inſtituta auncient maners cuſtomes alſo ordynances pro meo inſtituto purpoſe inſtitutiones inſtructions doctrine inſto inſtiti ſtare require inſtantely ſolicite ſtyck reſiſt perſyſt preſe come immediatly folow alſo nygh veſtigijs alicuius inſtare folow one foote foote inſtat periculum inſtat danger hande inſtant à tibi dona poynte doo good inſtratum à counterpoynte alſo ſygnifieth tapiſey ſerueth couer thing alſo trappier apparayle horſe horſeclothe inſtrumentum inſtrument toole alſo ordinance warre veſſell neceſſaries houſeholde huſbandry ſomtyme ſygnifieth deede charter concernyng lande dettes couenauntes inſtructus ta tum inſtruct taught furniſhed garnyſſhed inſtructiores peditum copiae foote men better order better appoynted vir inſtructiſsimus man furniſhed al thynges neceſſary conuenient inſtruo ſtruxi ſtruere ſet order aray inſtruct fourniſhe prepare domum inſtruere garnyſhe houſe thynges neceſſary epulas inſtruere prouyde feaſte banket inſidias inſtruere prepare thingis intrappe deceyue one inſtruendae fraudi aliquanto intentior ſomewhat buſy deuyſyng deceyue inſubres lumbardes properly men duchy melayn inſucco aui ſoke lycour inſueſco ſueui ſcere wont inſuetus ta tum vſed inſula yle inuyronned water alſo houſe towne hauynge none hous ioyned ſtretes euery ſyde inſularis belongyng yle inſularius um moſt vile proprely men bauyſhed yles dygge mettall inſulatus ta tum made yle inſulto taui tare leape vp ſcorne ſpeke reproche man inſultura leapyng vp thynge inſum ineſſe ſome thynge ſumma vniuerſally alway fynally inſummo fynyſhe inſumo pſi ere ſpend lay money inſuper furthermore moreouer inſuſurro aui whiſper one care integer gra grum ſpoken age ſignifieth yong luſty ſpokē man ſignifieth honeſt poyntes quality thing ſignifieth entier hole alſo ſafe integer aeui luſty age integraſco ſci ſcere renewed integritas honeſty without corruption innocency corporis integritas good diſpoſition body integro aui begyn agayn renewe integrè truely diligently integrum eſſe man liberte power non eſt integrum gn pompeio cō ſilio iam uti tuo pompey power counſell ego ſi mihi eſſet integrum ſuſciperem hoc crimen libertie wold take blame vpon conſtituent quid agant quibus integrum eſt whyche yet haue done nothynge let take hede si mihi eſſet integrū power haue done integrum reſtituere bring fyrſt eſtate reſtore point integro eſſe ſpoken matter affaire nothyng done euery man may lyketh hym sed quoniā hec iā neque integro eſſe poſſunt foraſmoche noo remedye theſe thynges may holpen may good poynt intellectualis vnderſtandynge intellectus vnderſtandynge intelligentia perceyuyng mynde intelligibile may vnderſtande intelligo lexi ligere vnderſtande intemerata perfecte ſacrifyces thynges obſeruyd intemeratus ta tum vndefyled vncorrupted intemperans dothe euery thyng without order meaſure intemperiae goddeſſes hauīg power harm intemperies intemperantia vnteperatnes intempeſta nox mydnyghte whan thynge ſylence intempeſtas tati caulme water whan tempeſt intēpeſtiuè vntimely due tyme order intempeſtiuus ū thing tyme ſeaſon intendo di dere bende ſtretche alſo loke diligently thynge knyt tye inforce might intendere animum ſet fyxe mynde intendere formulam bringe action agaynſt one tenebris ſaltare ſignifieth thing vnaduiſedly without iudgement intentatus aſſayed intentio ſignifieth intent pourpoſe forthe act appoynted executed intento aui menace intentus ta tum ſet fyxed inter betwene amonge inter coenam coena inter no amamus loue togyther one inter opus whyles buſy inter paucos dy ſhorte tyme inter poenam beyng tourment inter ſacrum ſaxum poynt periſh vtterly loſte inter uias way rydyng goyng interamna citie italy interana inwardes man beaſt interaneus um whiche within interareſco ſci ſcere dryed vp interbibo bi bere drynke intercalaris intercalarius um put ſette betwene intercalaris dy day leape yere intercalaris menſis moneth certayn dayes ſet lacked make yere complete moneth februarye reade abundantly hereof solino macrobio whiche wold tedious write englyſhe ſpecially dictionary intercalaris uerſus ſyngular verſe often repeted amonge verſes call englyſhe balades ſonges foote refrete ditie intercalo aui ſet put betwene intercapedo dinis ſpace pauſe intercedo ceſsi cedere make interceſſion alſo go betwene betwene quadringētorū remigū obſequio cōtra ſe intercedit letted iiii hūdred waterman rowed dyd obey hym vaeteres mihi neceſſitudines cū omnibus intercedunt ther great amitie longe tyme betwene v tribuni inter ceſſerunt tribune dyd let prohibyte intercedit mihi tecum amicitia amitie betwene pro alio intercedere anſwer man interceſsêre pauci dy day lyttell whyle quae ratio tibi cum illo interceſſerat acquayntāce haddeſt thou haddeſt thou hym interceſsio tribunorum let prohibitiō tribune againſt auctoritie officer interceſſor lettith matter may go forwarde intercîdo cîdi ere cut ſūder middes intêcido cidi ere decay periſhe betwene intercino nere ſyng betwene middell thing comedy enterludes while newe perſonages preparyng intercipio caepi ere preuent apprehende one vnware take myddes meane ſometyme take intercipere iter kepe incloſe way men may paſſe intercipere literas take letter way hym carieth intercipere ſermonem dyſapoynt one purpoſe interciſa porrecta cut made longer interciſi dy day diuided part holyday part warkeday intercludo si ere ſhut ſtop lette intercludere corporibus ſuis aduentum inimicorum ſelues warre let enemyes enter dolorem intercludi enuyronned heuyneſſe fugam intercludere keepe paſſages eſcape libertatem intercludere lette theym theyr lybertie spem cōmeatus intercludere put theym hope haue vitayles intercolumnium ſpace betwene pyllars intercus cutis diſeaſe betwene ſkyn fleſhe whan adiectiue ſygnifieth inwarde intercutibus uitijs madentes ouerwet inwarde vice intercutaneus um within ſkinne interdico xi cere prohibite greuouſely alſo reſyſt let interdico alicui aqua igni condemnation rome whereby one depriued vſage water fyre wherby conſtreyned depart limites empire rome interdicere de ui hominibus armatis ordayne whoſe meanes one ſuppoſeth putte poſſeſſion force ſhall ſet hym eftſones poſſeſſion veſtigijs interdicere forbidde one go certayne way nihil interdico wyll lette care interdictum prohibytion menace ſomtime determination poſſeſſion thynge debate interdiu day tyme interdum ſometyme interea meane while▪ alſo neuertheleſſe interealoci meane ſpace intereo rij ire dye vtterly interequito aui ryde betwene intereſſe preſent publicis conſilijs interfuimus preſent comnune coū ſayl alſo betwene id morari uictoriam rati quod intereſſet amnis ſuppoſynge cauſe • orthewith vyctory foraſmoch riuer betwene magni ſua putabant intereſſe thought made moch purpoſe profite triginta ferme interfuere anni almoſt thyrty yeres betwene intereſt mea tua ſua noſtra ueſtra behouith hym v pertayneth hym c alſo maketh matter diuerſitie si nihil intereſt regis peto ut dum dico uinculis liberer mattier kynge pray whyles ſpeake let without gyues somtyme ſignifieth middes nihil intereſt tui matter nihil intereſt eius maketh matter intereſt eius part profyte quid ergo inter eſt proferantur nec ne maketh matter brought forth nec intereſt diſcentium quibus quidque minibus appelletur maketh matter lerne name thing callyd permagni intereſt maketh moche matter inter hominem beluam hoc maxime intereſt moſt diuerſytie betwene man beaſt interficio feci ſlea interfluo xi ere flowe betwene interfoemineum woman priuy token wherby ſhe knowen man interfundo fudi fundere poure betwene intergerimus wall added olde foundation wall ſuſtayne interhaec meane tyme interi within interiaceo cui cere putte betwene caſte betwene interibi myddle place interiectus ta tum put caſt betwene interiectae collibus ualles valeys lyenge betwene hylles interiecti inter philoſophos eos qui rem pub adminiſtrent whiche neyther philoſophers yet mynyſters cōmon weale participatours one interiectum tempus meane tyme interncio ieci ijcere lay put betwene interim mean ſpace tyme mean ſeaſon alſo ſomtime ſodeinly interimo emi imere kylle interior interius inner interitus deathe interiungo ere tary interius inwarde interlino nere enterlyne interloquor eris qui ſpeake man tale interluceo cere ſhyne betweene myddes interluco care make glade themyddell wood interlunium ſpare tyme whyche neyther olde moone dothe appere newe moone ſene interluo ere flowe betweene waſſhe betweene meales actes intermedius um myddell intermeſtris luna newe moone chaunge intermeſtrum tyme whan moone poynt chaunge intermico ſhyne myddes interminor aris ari thretten ſoore intermitto tere leaue put tyme conſuetudinem intermittere forbeare family ariti • reſorte intermorior dye vtterly intermortuus um dead ſeaſon internecio vnyuerſall ſlaughter internitio idem interneco ſlea one internectiuum bellum warre vtter dyſtruction deathe internicinum bellum warre vttrance internodium ioynt man fynger alſo ioynt ſtrawe reede internoſco ſcere know thyng amonge thynges internuncius meſſanger meane betweene two perſons beynge varyance internus na num whiche within inwarde inter opus euen doinge interordinium ſpace betweene whiche order interordo dinis idem interpellatio let man buſynes interpellator diſtourber letter may theyr buſynes interpello interrupt let one ſpeketh doth thynge alſo require aſke demaunde interpellare debitorem call dettour interpenſiua certayne piece tymber whyche ſet corner wal endes rafter conuey rayne water ſpoutes interpenſiui paries walles whyche ryſe vppon walle haue foundation grounde interpola newe inuentions deuiſes interpolator oris interpolatrix tricis ſhe refreſheth old thynges make ſeme newe interpolis le interpolus la lum renewed refreſſhed interpolio put ſet betwene rem • e refreſhe thynge interpono ſui nere put betwene reſyſte interponere fidem publicam promiſe vppon credence conſent al people interpremo ſtoppe cloſe interpres pretis interpreter trāſlater alſo ſtikler betwene two ar variāce interpretamentum interpretatio interpretation tranſlation interpretor aris ari interprete expoune tranſlate alſo iuge eſteme virtutem ex conſuetudine uitae interpretêmur let v iuge vertue perſon cuſtome lyuynge bonam partem interpretari take good parte peruerſe interpretari meane ſhrewdly interputo cut betwene interrafile whiche playne betwyxt two partes grauen imboſed interrex regis ruleth mean time betwene ceaſſyng auctoritie one principall gouernour death otherwiſe vntyl elected ſame office interregnum ſayde meane tyme gouernaunce rule interrogo demaunde queſtion interrogati legibus tried examination offended againſt lawes interrumpo rupi pere breke middes interſcalmia ſpaces betwene oores boote galey interſcapilium ſpace betwene ſhulders vnder necke interſcindo di dere cut myddes interſepio ſepſi pire diuide myddell ſome incloſure interſeptae griſtell whiche maketh partition betwene noſethrylles interſero ſeui ſerere ſowe ſet betwene myddes interſono make noyſe myddes betwene interſpiro ſpryng vp myddes interſtertio ſtrawe betwene throw thinges betwene interſtitium diſtance ſpare betwene interſum intereſſe preſent alſo differ dyuers stulto intelligens quid intereſt diuerſitie betwene fole wyſe man intertextus um wouen wrought betwene tinſelde cloth tynſell baudkyn intertrigo ginis gallyng whiche happeneth occaſyon ſweat betwene legges toe fyngers intertrimentum waſte loſſe thynge wearyng occupienge interturbo trouble excedyngly interuaco vacant voyde betwene interuallum ſpace betwene interuello ere plucke vp interuenio ire come meane whyle preſent amonge interuenium ſpace betwene veynes interuerto ere take away craftily falſly interuiſo ere viſit among interula ſhyrte ſmocke inteſtabilis lawe make teſtament ſomtyme ſignifieth deteſtable inteſtatus dyeth without makyng teſtamēt inteſtate alſo dyeth making none heire teſtament alſo man credence man wyl take wytnes inteſtina bowel inwarde part man thynge lyuinge inteſtinum bellum people war within theyr owne realme inteſtium odium hate hart mynd mortall hatrede inteſtinum opus inwarde buyldynge tymber parget intimus moſte inwarde mooſt ſecrete alſo man moſt ſpecially fauoureth intingo xi gere depe one doth fyngar licour intorqueo ſi quêre thruſte throwing darte lyke thyng alſo turne wynde intra within intra famā leſſe thā opiniō mē haue intra modū leſſe thā mean ſhort mean intrarius idem quod intimus intrarius amicus ſpeciall frende intrico care wrappe intrinſecus within intritus broyed morter intrò place intro enter 〈◊〉 introcludo ſi dere ſhutte introduco xi cere bryng leade introeo iui ire go introgredior eris gredi come intromitto miſi mittere lette introrſus within introrumpo rupi rumpere breake introſpicio ſpexi ſpicere loke introuoco calle intueor eris eri beholde take hede intus place intuſium ſhyrt ſmocke intutus ta tum vnſure intybum ſemeth general name kyndes endiue cykory yet dioſcorides diuideth ii kyndes one wyld ſowē alſo makith two ſortes one brode leaf take endiue narow leaf take cōmon cykory whiche wylde callyd erraticum inuado ſi inuade enter apprehend inualeſco lui ſcere waxe ſtrong cōfirmed ſtablyſhed inualetudo dinis feblenes inualidus da dum feble weake inuectiuae orationes oration made agaynſte one reprouyng maners lyuyng inueho uexi uehere cary thyng cary thynge place inuehor eris uehi rebuke one vehemently violent foore wordes inuenio ire fynde thynge whyche man ſeketh uerba vnthriftily waxed olde inuetereſco raui ſcere wear age vſe aged old alſo worn almoſte conſumyd inuicem togyther one inuicē diligūt loue one alſo ſignifieth thy yt habes re urbana inuicē ruſticas haue enuye thy lernynge inuidia enuy hatred yll wylle inuidia facti ſui diſpleaſure act attemptate dede whereof enuied hated inuidiam concitare alicui brynge oone hatred yll opinyon facere inuidiam whyche played ſhaulmes iſmenides woman thebe iſmenus ryuer countrey boeotia iſocolon two ſentēces ar lyke length iſocrates name famous orator wonderfull eloquence whoſe ſchoole proceded moſt excellent oratours grece iſodomon fourme buylding euery thynge equally ſtraight iſonomia equalitie lawes indifferent maner perſons iſopleurus thre edged iſpalis citie spayne callyd nowe syuile iſrael slauony iſſus rytie sicile ryuer siria iſter greate ryuer callyd alſo danubius duche donawe commeth hyll germany callyd pliny arnoba ptholome • abnoba tacitus arbôna receyueth thre ſcore ryuers whereof parte nauygable rounneth swaue bauyer owſtryke hungarye valachia ſo europa falleth ſea callid pontus ſeuen ſundry dry place solinus mela doo write plinius tacitus affirme ſyxe herodotus arrianus fiue germany callyd danubius cometh part thracia called iſtria wher brodeſt thā callid iſter iſthmus narrow part countrey ii ſeas ſmal diſtance ſunder incloſyng lande bothe ſydes ſuch place ſet citie corinthus grece dyuers ſuch place grecia certayne playes callyd iſthmia iſtic thou arte iſtria part italy marching illiria callyd nowe slauony ¶i ante ita aduerbe anſweryng affirming ſomtyme ſignifieth yea ſomtyme ſo ita eſt euen ſo ita loquor yea ſo ſay ita aiunt ſo men ſay ita deus amet ſo god loue helpe ita ne ſoo thou ſayeſt alſo ſignifieth note diſdayne ita ne cō temnor ab te setteſt thou ſo lyttell ita ne beatus quidem eſt therfore happye ita negotium eſt ſo caſe requyreth ita opus eſt facto ſo muſt done ita ſane yea truely ita ut erat dede ita ut fit hapeneth dum ru eo coepi egomet mecum inter uias ita ut fit ubi quid animo eſt moleſtiae aliam rem ex alia cogitare whan went downe countrey way riding hapneth oftentymes whan diſpleaſure commeth mynd bethought one thyng ita que wherfore therfore itaque ſo italia noble countrey callyd italy whyche enuyronned weſt mountayns callyd alpes north ſea callid mare adriaticum • aſt ſouth ſea callyd mediterraneum fretū siculum alſo conteyneth theſe regyons liguriam ethruriam vmb ••• flamineā • atium aprutium campaniam apuliam venetiam picênum galliam giſalpinā callyd lumbardy length therof pliny thouſande xx myles breadthe ſom place betwene two ſeas ccccx myles ſome place paſſeth cxxxvi myles ſomtyme named magna graetia bycauſe inhabyted grekes myrſilius dothe write solinus doth reſemble fygure therof • ok •• leafe extendynge lengthe breadthe towarde ende beynge diuided two horne whereof one lyeth towarde ſea callyd ionium loketh narowe ſea sicile callyd fretum siculum naroweſt place paſſeth bredth twenty myles italica citie italia name callyd confinium nother spayne silius italicus borne italicenſis citiſen italica italicus ca cum italy italus italyan item lyke maner ſo alſo euen afterward iter eris itiner neris iourney alſo way iter habeo ad caeſarem take iourneye emperour iter conficere performe iourney go ryde iourney iter facere go iourney itero doo thynge efteſoones goo backe agayne iterum eftſones agayne ithaca yle lyenge athaſis countraye vlyſſes therfore callyd ithacus ithome towne peloponeſo nother theſſaly ithonia countrey grece ithyphallus name priapus moſte diſhoneſt abhomynable ydoll alſo ithyphalli diſhoneſt perſones whiche honourynge theyr ydoll bacchus daunſed hauyng betwene theyr legges coūterfayt member horryble greatnes ithyra towne mountayne taurus itidem ſemblably alſo itinerarium commentary boke remembraunce contaynyng thynges commytted iourneyes alſo kalender myles diſtaunce place tyme abode euery place lyke geſtes princis itineror aris ari go iourney ito taui tare goo moche ituria region arabia siria whyche people callyd ituraei itus itio going quid noſter itus reditus goyng commyng itys ſonne tercus▪ progne poetes doo fayne tourned feſaunte ¶i ante v ivba name beaſte alſo name kynge mauritania iubar ſterre whych alſo callyd heſperꝰ lucyfer ſomtyme takē brightnes iubeo iuſsi iubêre cōmād deſyre wiſh exhort decree iubeo te ſaluêre god ſaue corinthus ſhe dwellyd men noble ryche great number company tyme came demoſthenes greatteſt oratour greece deſyred lye whome ſhe aſked one nyght thouſande dragmas whiche amounted rate money preſent tyme xxiii li xix x demoſthenes heryng departed ſayinge wyſe wyl repent price write ſhe demaunded x thouſand dragmas whiche talent laius king thebe father oedipus whome oedipus vnwares ſlewe battayle wedded wyfe whiche alſo oedipus mother callyd iocaſta reade oedipus laletania countray spayne laliſiones • oltes wylde aſſes lallare ſpeake lyke babye whiche worde greke dothe approche nerer englyſhe latin babazin made latyn worde babare maye tranſferred noryce babeleth chylde whan ſhe gyueth dugge lamae raggydnes rockes▪ lambo bere lycke tungue alſo touche flowe runne ſoftely lambrus riuer italy meteth ryuer po callyd padus lambrani people dwellinge ſayd riuer lambrus lamentabilis le lamentable lamentarius um cauſeth lamentation lamentatio oni lamentyng waylyng lamentor aris ari lament bewayle lamia beaſt whiche hath woman face feete horſe alſo ſurname noble romayne alſo famous harlot alſo blynd nettle lamia woman beholdyng child gyuyng gyftes alter • ourm whiche child afterward callid elfes taken fayry ſome ſuch woman wyll ſucke bloud chyldren alſo thoſe whiche callid lady fayry whiche allure yong men company carnally conſumyd acte lecherye coueyt deuoure lamina plate mettall lamirus one ſonnes hercules lampas leame fyre bryghtenes ſonne moſte vſed lampe lamperia doughter ſonne neaera whiche ſyſter phaetuſa kept ſhepe sycile lampetra fyſhe callyd lamprey lampſacus towne ſea ſyde callid helleſpontus ſide aſia priapus honoured lampſacenus um lampſacus lampyris gloo worme wourme callyd gloo berde lana woulle lanaria herbe whiche fuller vſe whan ſcoure clothes ſaye whiche apothecary call condiſi lanaris beareth hath wolle lanare paecus beaſtes hauyng woulle lanarius woulle man occupieth ſelleth woulle lanatus um clad wrapped wolle lanatus lupus fyſhe ſo callyd whytenes ſoftenes lancearius beareth iauelyn lanceatus armyd iauelyn alſo woundyd iauelyn lancia ſpanyſhe iauelyn brode heade lancino ſtrike rent tethe lanerum garment made vndyed woull laneus um woullen laneus fyſhe langa beaſt whiche founde ryuer po langia fountayne nemea countreye arcadia hoſt argiues refreſhed whan went agaynſt thebe langueo langueſco ere languyſhe ſycke faynt aferde ydell languidus da dum faynt ſycke aferde ydle languor oris languour faylyng ſtrengthe naturall moyſture langurium languettes aumber like long beadſtones laruena fleſh ſhambles ſhop fleſh ſolde ſomtyme hath leaues lyke pyneappull wodde longe apte buyldyng inwarde warkes hath thyn roſen colour hony athene peryſheth neyther rottyng eatyng wormes wylle bourne flame brought vnto cole lōg ſpace tyme came prouerbe ❀larus parturit larus dothe lay applyed theym whiche promyſe moche great thynges fynally gyue brynge forthe nothynge regarde vnto whiche promyſed laſanum chaumber potte vrinall laſciuia excellent grauer leodamas proper name philoſopher leon phyloſopher leonides king lacedemoniās whiche feates warre againſt xerxes kyng perſia incredible finally ſlayne defendyng grece foure thouſande eyght hundred grekes onely agaynſte xvii hundred thouſande hooſte xerxes alſo nother leonides whiche tutour kyng alexander whan chylde leonina herbe whiche groweth hylles whoſe floures ar like lyon mouth whan gapeth leontopetalon herbe hauyng leaues lyke colewortes ſtalke halfe fote high ſeede huſkes great ſmalle peaſon roote like rape roote great black whiche helpeth agaynſt ſtyngyng bitynge maner ſerpentes leontophon lytell worme lyon byte lyon dieth incontinent leontophona lytel beaſt whoſe head turned aſhes wherwith men myxt fleſh caſt wayes wherby lyon paſſe wherof eate dye incontinent leontopodion herbe callyd pee de lyon whiche hath floures lyke roſes vnſprad leontopodium herbe ſome ſay lyke whiche callyd marygouldes ſome ſuppoſe herbe whyche callyd dent de lyon leopardus lybarde lepaduſa yle sicile lepidè pleaſantly pratily lepidium herbe whiche vergilius marcellus ſuppoſeth apothecary cal setrac ruellius deſcribeth haue leaues whan yonge lyke laurelle lepor ôris lepos •• purenes netenes ſpeche alſo good grace dilectablenes ſpeche geſture leporarium incloſure place incloſed wherin kepte beaſtes pleaſure huntynge leporinus na num hare leporis wherein citie callad mytilene leſbius um yle leſbos leſbia regula ſpoken rayſon applyed acte act reaſon lawe accommodate maners maners lawe hereof ſpeaketh ariſtotle moralium li 5 whiche infynite rule infynite lyke leaden rule leſbos whiche ſerueth buyldyng chaunged faſcyon ſtone leſſus u lamentable voyce vſed buryeng men ſay ala leſtorum region indie leſtrygones people extreme part italy whiche dyd eate companyons vlyſſes roſtyng broches letalis le mortall letania uel litania ſupplication common prayer letatus ſlayne lethargus letargia whiche ſom callyd veternus paulus egineta writeth diſeaſe part head whiche power reaſon contayned poſſedyng ſame place phreneſy dothe ſaye brayne cauſe matter contrary continual neceſſitie ſlepe harde awaked matter beynge moyſt colde humour waſhyng brayne compellyng one ſlepe alexander trallianus addeth therto therin ſuche forgetfulneſſe whiche ſyrk remember wold ſpeake cō ſtantinus ſaythe ſometyme gape forgette cloſe theyr mouthes ſometyme callyd vera pure cold matter ſomtyme callyd non uera cold matter myxt lytell bloud choler ſeldom happeth melancholy sometyme foloweth ſycknes fleumaticke feuer ſycknes lungues callyd peripneumoniîa theſe dyſeaſes heate fleume made ſubtyll plucked vp brayne cotidiane feuer togyther ſometyme feuer departeth ſpace vii dayes leaueth behynde ſyckenes lethargicus hath ſlepyng forgetfull ſyckenes lethe ryuer hel water wherof ſone drunk cauſeth mā forget al thing paſſed alſo ryuer affrica letifer ra rum deadly bryngyng cauſynge deathe letificus ca cum cauſyng deathe leto ſlea letum lethum deathe leua manus lefte hande leuca promontory elbowe lande nyghe corinthus leucacantha ioannes agricola affyrmeth thorny buſhe commyng vp hedge diches hauyng white floures whiche ar ſoote orels ſayth kynde thyſtelles whyche ſquare full pryckes albeit manardus ſuppoſed arabian calle bedeguar ruellius affyrmeth whiche dioſcorides dothe cal rhamnus romaynes albam ſpinā white thorne growynge hedge hauynge ſtraight vp braunches full pryckes lyttell leaues ſomwhat longe fatty ſoft som whiter darker coloured hath broder leaues ſomewhat ruddy twigges length almoſt fiue cubites fruit therof whyte brode macrobii people affrike pomponius alſo callyd meroeni whoſe countrey inuyronned ryuer nilus lyke yle lyue halfe moche lenga • men fayre goodly perſonages reuerend louers vertue golde perſia therfore whiche leſſe precious eſteme decking ſelfes ornamentes copper braſſe makyng gyues golde lyue commonly cxx yeres waſhe theym ſelues fountayne whyche cauſeth theyr bodyes ſmelle lyke vnto violettes amonge olde roman power authoritie people rome vnto appellation callyd prouocatio dignity dignitie senate callyd authoritie senate tantus autem conſenſus municipiorum coloniarum que prouinciae galliae ut omnes ad authoritatem huius ordinis maieſtatem que pop ro defendendā conſpiraſſe uideantur nowe ſuch agrement wylles townes confederat ſubiect vnto v partes fraunce gouerned v menne ſeme conſpyre howe may defend authoritie senate alſo maieſtie people rome maieſtas imminuta man goth derogate thing kinges authoritie royal alſo empire high power people rome may taken treaſon si maieſtas eſt amplitudo ac dignitas ciuitatis eam minuit qui exercitum hoſtibus pop ro tradidit maieſty honour authoritie citie goeth appayre whiche hath deliuered hoſte ennemies people rome alſo de partitione oratoria maieſtas eſt imperij que pop ro dignitate quam minuit qui per uim multitudinē ad ſeditionem uocauit maieſtye authoritie empyre people rome agaynſt plainly committeth treaſon ſo euer violentely prouoketh people ſedition worde minuere maieſtatem later writer vſyd laedere maieſtatem maieſtatis crimen treaſon againſt king amonge romaynes conſpiracy agaynſt ſenate people whiche alſo callyd perduellio hyſtorians named coniuratio maieſtas imminuta therin onely derogate take away ſome part royal authoritie honour due perſone citie endeuour theym diſtroye vtterly brynge ſubiection quod imminuere maior oris greatter maiorana herbe callyd maioram maiores auncetours progenitours maiorina kynd olyues whiche ripe ſyxt idus february maius moneth may mala aurea orenges malaca citie ſoft rype malaſſo make ſofte rype alſoo exercyſe male yll vnhappyly vncommodiouſely miſcheuouſely male acceptus ylle intreated yll handeled ſhrewdely welcome male accipere intreate one yll male accipere uerbis gyue ylle language one male audire yll reported haue yll name male cadere chaunce yll male cogitare de aliquo haue yll opinyon one male conciliatus whome man hathe loſte hath beſtowed fugitiue pro di male conciliate come forthe ther haue loſte thou coſteſt male formido yll ſore aferde male maceror yl vexid yl eſe male habeo ſycke male haber haec re ſory ylle apayde matter matter greueth ſoore male mereri dodiſpleaſure one deſerue diſpleaſure male meritus eſt de hath yll intreated hath done diſpleaſure male metuo yll aferde male moratus yll manerde male morigerus diſobedient frowarde male odi hate deadly male optare curſe male precare aſke vengeance male • uada ſhe gyueth ſhrewd counſell male uertar illi god ſende hym yuell lucke therof yll may broke malea promontorye hylle lyenge ſea laconia whyche daungerouſe ſhyppes paſſe maledicentia detraction yll reporte maledico xi cere curſe maledicus yll tunged ſpeaketh ylle euery man malefica wytche whiche ſorcery dothe hurte men beaſtes maleficus harme doer malefice myſcheuouſly harmefully maleficium maleficentia damage wrong diſpleaſure hurt myſcheuous dede maleloqui maledicere curſe maleuolentia walyce yll wylle maleuolus malycious maliacum mare ſea theſſalia malicorium rynde pomegranade malignè enuiouſly diſdaynfully maliciouſely malignitas tati wyckednes malignitie enuy malyce vnprofitablenes vice contrary liberalitie malignor maligno beare malyce hatefull malignus um wycked cruell enuyous couetouſe maligna uia yll way maligna lux dymme lyght malignus ager grounde ylle brought tylthe malitia contrary vertue goodnes ſome tyme ſignifyeth ſubtiltie deceyte malitioſè malitiouſely malitio • u malitiouſe malleatus um hammered malleo warke hammer malleolus lyttell hammer alſo ſmalle bough twygge vyne alſo malleoli ſomtyme takē generally ſmal ſtyckes ſomtime taken bone ancle malleus hammer malluuium malluuiae arū baſyn wherin men waſhe theyr handes malo leauer rather maui mauult malobathron whiche latyn callyd foliū ſwete herbe growing india vpon water without roote malobathrum ſwete oyntment wherewith men wonte waſhe theyr heare malta clay whiche touching matter ſubſtance ſetteth fyre reade aſphaltum bitumen malna herbe callyd malowes maluauiſcus reade althea malum aduerb ſignifieth miſchiefe lyke thynge quid uos malum ergo ſic ludificamini wherfore miſchief thus mock quid tua malum id refert miſchief reckeſt thou therfore haſt thou therwith malus um yll contrary good ſomtyme labour vexation ſycknes griefe malyce malae fidei poſſeſſor wetīgly poſſedeth man landes goodes mamilla lyttell dugge 〈◊〉 mamma dugge pappe mammare gyue dug breſt chylde māmeata womā gret duggis breſtis mammillare kerchiefe wherwith woman couer theyr pappes mammona language syria worldly ſubſtance rycheſſe mammoſus ſa mammeatus ta tū hauyng great dugges mammothreptus chyld ſouketh long ſo interpreted ſaynt auguſtine expoſition pſalmes withſtandyng eraſmus ratione concionādi almayn yere lorde god thouſande fyue hundred thirty nyne mediolanum chief citie lumbardy callyd myllane alſo town lankaſhyre callyd mancheſter mediouratrices maſtright brabant medioximus um meane meditatorius um whyche belongeth medytation mediterraneus myddle lande furtheſt ſea meditor aris ari thynke depely thinkynge fynde purpoſe lay ſnares ſynge play ſwetely meditari ſe exercyſe hym ſelfe meditrina goddeſſe phyſike meditrinalia ceremony vſed dranke muſte newe wyne meditullium myddell medius um middes equally diſtant extremity ſometyme meane medium commune amonge medio uel de medio tollere kyll medius meane mediatour betwene ii mē mediusfidius othe whyche although ſome tyme ſignifycation yet maye nowe commune fourme ſpeakynge vſed wyſe faythe bodye sen dius iupiter fidius filius nowe vſe meduacus ryuer venyce callyd nowe brente medulla marrowe whiche bone medullitus innerly marrowe medullo take marrowe ſometyme expreſſe vtterly narra iam rem nobis omnem que emedulla telle expreſſe vtterly v hole matter meduſa lady whome fable reporte heares minerua tournyd adder whyche behelde tourned ſtoones whome perſeus afterwarde ſlewe ſomtyme taken one fury helle mefanſilium certayne weapon throwe megabizi prieſtes diana whiche alwaye gelded megaera fury turmentour hell whyche paynyms ſuppoſed dydde prouoke ſtyre men woodneſſe megalenſes megaleſia playes honor cybele men miſcellanea mixture dyuerſe thynges miſceo cui ſcere myxe meddle together confounde together trouble doo thynge order reaſon ſometyme ſignifieth ſerue one drynke miſcere tumultum ſet men rore make commotion miſellus lyttell wretche miſer eri wretche ſometyme innocent miſerabilis le miſerable wretched lamentable miſerabiliter miſerably lamentably miſerandus pitied miſerator dothe acte charitie hym pitieth miſericors dis mercifull miſerè miſerably miſere amat loueth excedyngly miſereſco ſcere moued pitie miſeret haue pitie miſeretur moued pitie miſertum eſt men haue compaſſion pitie miſeria miſſenus hyll campania miſſiculo ſende often miſsile thynges throwen miſsilia thynges whiche aunciente empetours wonte caſte among people bread cake ſwete oyntmente ſuche lyke thynges whiche done theatre feaſtes called saturnalia miſsio meſſage alſo leaue departe miſsito tare ſende often miſsus um ſent miſsus u courſe whan oone thynge cummeth diſtaunce turne miſſum facere omit paſſe ouer thing ❀muli mariani prouerbe referred vnto whyche obedient euery commandement neuer ſo greuouſe may alſo applyed vnto theym whyche inuolued perpetuall intollerable laboures buſyneſſe ❀muli mutuum ſcabunt municipalis le priuately particularly belongynge one citie municipale ius priuate law euery particular citie municipalia magiſteria ciuile offyces euery citie towne municipatim towne towne municipium nire fortyfye prepare repayre munire à frigore arme hym make defence agaynſt colde munire uiam make way ſuch ſorte man may paſſe ſometyme make way one may paſſe eaſyly munis beareth charge whiche murani kynges alba muratus ta tum walled murcia goddeſſe ſlouthe murcidus man without aduyſement murciolum ſeede whyche called lenticula murcus ſlouthfull luſkyſhe perſon murex icis ſhelle fyſhe whome nais ryuer eaſte whiche runneth oute mountayne taurus ſea called pontus nam coniunction cauſall ſet moſt commonly fyrſte parte ſentence nam que ſeconde place ſignifieth therefore ſometyme put autem amonge perſyans ſuche eſtymation yonge men whan wente huntynge dydde eate none meate ſuppoſyng therby theyr ſpyrites made quycke lyuely naſus noſe ſometyme put ſharpneſſe quyckneſſe ſpeche wherefore vſe ſay hym whiche pratily taunt mocke one ſo vneth may perceyued hic naſum habet naſo ſuſpendere mocke couertly naſutus taunte mocke wyttylye ſomtyme ſygnifieth hym hath great inſtrument naſute wyttyly mockyngly naſutila ſhrewde wenche natalis le natalitius um pertaynyng byrthe natalis dy day byrth natiuitie natales ſtocke family wherof one commeth natalibus clarus noble bloode obſcuri natales baſe bloudde natalibus reſtitui make gentylman gyue hym armes natalitia dare make feaſt day one byrthe natatilis le whiche ſwymme natatitius um whiche doth ſwymme natator toris ſwymmeth natinatores trauaylers aboute many thinges natio people countray feſtus writeth theyr begynnyng ſame place dwell came countrayes ſometyme ſignifyeth felowſhyp company beynge order natio candidatorum ordynarye felowſhyp whyche ſue great office natiuitas tati byrth natiuus color naturall colour natiuus ſal ſalt growen place founden natiuum malum naturall myſchiefe natiua uerba wordes deryued nato tare ſwymme often ſometyme ſygnifieth go ſayl rowed barge galey natrix tricis water ſnake alſo herbe roote wherof ſmelleth lyke goote natura nature ſome gentyles taken god creatour thynges seneca lib 4 de beneficijs thinge natura god reaſon dyuine ſowen worlde partes therof ariſtoteles phiſic 1 nature begynnynge cauſe mouyng reſt thynge ſelfe thynge hapnynge ſometyme ſygnifieth maner facion ſometyme priuy member mankynde beaſte naturae ſatisfacere dye naturae cedere idem naturae ſuae rationem habere haue regarde vnto condition naturalis le naturall naturalia priuy member natus ta tum borne growen brought forth natus animo leni ſofte gentyll nature natus annos ſedecim ſyxtene yeres olde natus nata ſubſtantyues ſonne doughter natu maior elder natu maiores moſte auncient natu grandis olde ancient naualis le pertaynyng ſhyppes nauale docke ſhyppes layde vp made venyce arceuale nauarchus patron maiſter ſhyppes nauarchis nauarchidis patron ſhyppe nauci ſhale nutte thyng naught nauci eſſe worth nothynge nauci facere ſet nought naucleriacus nauclerius um pertaynyng mayſter ſhyppe nauclerus nauiclarius maſter ſhyppis naucrates citie egypte naufragium wrecke ſee ſomtyme ſygnifieth loſſe detryment naufragium facere loſe ſhyp tempeſt naufragus ga gum pertaynyng ſhyp wrek naufragus eſcapeth lyue ſhyppe loſte ſometyme taken one fallen pouertie nauia holowe tree lyke ſhyppe occupyed whan grape gathered nauicularius letteth ſhyppes hyre ſometyme pylote nauiculator toris idem nauiculor lari gouerne ſhyp ſometyme go water ſhyppe bote nauicularia arte gouernynge ſhyp rowynge nauiculariam facere frayte ſhyp ſet ſhyppes hyre carieng marchandyſe nauigabilis le ſhyp maye paſſe nauigatio exerciſe going water nauiger gera gerū wyl beare veſſel mare nauigerum ſea wyll beare veſſell nauigium al ſortes veſſel ſayle row nauigia ſpeculatoria brigantine ſhyppes eſpiall nauigo gare go caryed water veſſell nauigare portu ſuertie nauigiolum lyttell barke nauis ſhyppe nauem deprimere droune ſhyppe nauis pompatica ſhippe made chamber bankettynge parlour onely ſolace alſo called nauithalmus nauiter gnauiter diligently dexteritie valyantly naulium towne lumbardy naulum frayte fare payed paſſage ouer water naumachia battayle water place battayle naumachiarij whiche battayle water naumachiarius um perteynynge fourme battayle nauo employ power nauare operam endeuour nauare beneuolentiam declare vſe beneuolence man maye naupegus ſhyp wryght carpenter nauplium fyſhe lyke cuttell plin li 9 naupontus ryuer slauony nauſea diſpoſicion wyll vomyte ſometyme abhorynge thynges nauſeam diſcutere put awaye diſpoſition vomitynge nauſeam facere vomyte nauſeoſus um whiche prouoketh one vomyte nauſeo haue appetite vomyte ſometyme reiecte abhorre thynge nauſeabundus diſpoſed vomyte nauſicaa doughter alcinous kynge pheaces fyndynge vlyſſes eſcaped drownynge broughte hym father palayce nauſio ire open beane doth whan ſpryngeth nauſithous ſunne neptunus father alcinous nauſtibulum hyue lyke ſhyp nauta nauita ſhyp man nautea ordure whiche iſſueth pumpe ſhyp alſo curriours bleche nauticus ſhyppe mayſter nautilus certayne ſhell fyſhe fourme bote doth ſwym bealy vpward nautilia crafte ſhypmen nauus quicke actiue valiant doth thynge ſodenly without moche ſtudy naxos yle ſea called aegeum nazareus man dedicate onely ſeruice god hadde ſpeciall vowe tyme nazareth lyttle towne galilea nazara citie cappadocia called alſo caeſaria ¶n ante e ne aduerbe ſignifienge forbedynge dyſſuadynge tu ne cede mali giue thou place aduerſitie ſometyme coniunction copulatiue ſygnifyeth neyther ſomtyme cauſall vide ne pereas take hede thou loſe thy ſelfe ne multa make ſhorte without many wordes fewe wordes ne plura ſuffiſeth inoughe ne longum faciam make ſhorte ne ſim ſaluus ſi aliter ſcribo ac ſentio pray god dead wryte otherwiſe thā thynke ne uiuam idem eſt ne hic crito ſobrinus chriſidis crito couſen germayne chriſis honeſtum ne factu ſit turpe dubitant doubte whether honeſtie diſhoneſtie ne ue hoc ne ue illud neyther ne dicam wyll ſay dare ſay clauſe ne dicam folowe ſubſtantyue adiectiue put accuſatyue caſe putte betwene ſubſtantyue adiectiue one ſhall nominatiue caſe homo imprudens ne dicam ſtultum ſtultus bycauſe ſubſtantyue homo goeth crudelis ne dicam impius ſceleratus caſtor ſceleratum caſtorē moch ſubſtantiue caſtor foloweth caſes none ambiguitas alway adiectiue ſubſtantiue muſt accorde non faceres haec magiſtro conſcio ne dicam praeſente praeſentem ne aduerbe rational ergo verg ne incepto deſiſtere uictam bycauſe vaynquiſhed ſhall therfore ceaſe myne enterpryſe ne amicis nihil tribuamus epulamur thyntente frendes ſhall thynke wyll nothynge theyr ſake eate banket ne ſometyme ſignyfyeth demaundynge datur ne illa hodie pamphilo nuptum ſhall ſhe maryed day vnto panphilus ego ne nea yle betwene lemnos helleſpontus neapolis noble citie campania ſette border ſea called mare mediterraneum fyrſte called parthenope citie countreys bondage necubi place necunde place nedum onely thynge leaſte eſtimation put laſte funderem pro te ſanguinem ne dum pecuniam wolde ſpende onely moneye alſo bloude thynge moſte eſtimation put laſte ſignyfieth yet ne crederem tibi obolum ne dum uitam meam wyll commytte lyfe vnto thy credence yet lende one halfepeny nefandus da dum horrible named nefarius um curſed vnworthy lyue nefas thynge deteſtable nefaſci dy dayes whiche lefull ſpeake thre wordes nefrendes pygges weyned called ſhootes negabundus denieth negatio denyenge naye negatiuus denyar negito tare deny negligo glexi gligere neglecte haue lyttell regarde thynge neglectus tus ſmall regarde neglectus ta tum regarded negligentia negligence negligens ti negligent negligenter negligently nego gare deny refuſe ſay nay negato eſſe ituram ſay ſhe wyll go negaris ſaepe eſſe domi ſaye oftentymes thou arte home negotialis le perteynynge marchaundyſe occupation negotiator marchaunt man negotior ari exerciſe marchaundyſe ſtraunge countreys alſo buſyneſſe negotioſus hauynge moche buſyneſſe body mynde negotium buſines affayre charge care dare negotium gyue charge sui negotij bene gerens dothe well buſynes exployteth well affayres plurimum eo negotij habui trauayled moche moche negotium magnū eſt nauigare que id mē ſe quintili moche doo ſayle ſpecially moneth iuly negotium faceſſere trouble vexe one eſt mihi negotium haue ſomewhat ita negotium eſt matter ſo requireth nullo negotio without peyne eaſyly nil eſt negotij lyghtly done sed quid negotij quamobrem ſuccenſes mihi matter whye thou arte angry actes forgotten 〈◊〉 riſu teſtem make wytneſſe ſo laughed darſte ſpeake obruitur uulgi ſermo hominum interitus ſpeeche 〈◊〉 people loſte whan menne deade obrutus ta tum ouerthrowen couered periſhed obrutum ſitu uaetuſtatis loſt periſhed age ſo longe agoone remembraunce obrutus niuibus keuered ſnowe obruta itinera ſtrage wayes ful menſlayne kylled obrutania fulmina lyghtnynges ſodaynly happen throwy ••• downe burnynge thynges procured loked obſaeuio ire wode angry agaynſt one obſaturo rare fylled moche thynge obſaluto offre ſelfe ſalute one obſatum olde writer vſed halowed obſcoene lyke rybaulde without ſhame obſcoenitas villany actes rybauldrye obſcoeno brynge cauſe yll lucke obſcoenus na num abhomynable thynge eſchewed diſhoneſt vncleane pernicious alſo bryngyng yll lucke obſcuritas darkeneſſe difficultie vngentylnes bloudde obſcurè darkely non obſcure playnly obſcuro make darke ſhadowe hyde kepe ſilence knowlege make reputation obſcurus um darke hydde dyffuſe vnknowen gentyll bloudde obſecratio ſpeciall deſyre obſecro beſeche hartily pray obſecrare ab aliquo deſyre one obſecr • ſometyme aduerbe hem obſecro eſt howe pray obſecundo make proſperouſe alſoo obey thing man wylle make thynge better ſemeth obſecundanter obediently obſepio iui ire incloſe hedge obſequela dylygence indeuour obſequia thynges done pleaſure appetite hym done obſequens obedyent obſequenter obedyently obſequentiſsime great obedience obſequere animo take thy pleaſure make good chere obſequibilis dylygent redye whyche commaunded obſequioſus idem obſequium redynes al commanded ſometyme ſygnifyeth flattery obſequor eris qui folowe man pleaſure obſequi animo make good chere obſero ſeri ſerere ſowe ſette aboute plante obſero locke ſhutte doore obſeruabilis le mete obſerued worthye reuerence obſeruantia reuerence obſeruaunce obſeruatio idem wayte eſpyall obſeruo awayte dilygentely eye alſo mynde honoure take good hede haue reuerence obſeruare ianuam kepe doore obſes idis hoſtage pledge warres obſeſsi whyche beſyeged may iſſue place ar obſeſſor oris layeth ſiege obſidiae arum lyenge awayte take away thynge craftily obſidianum nitrum glaſſe whyche pure blacke obſidionalis corona garlande gyuen theym whyche delyuered towne fortreſſe beſyeged ennemyes whyche graſſe obſidior aris ari lye awayt take one obſidium obſidio obſeſsio ſyege aboute towne fortreſſe obſidio oni idem obſido obſideo ſeſsi dere lay ſiege obſidere ſtuprum eſpy tyme defloure woman obſigno cloſe letter ſeale theym alſo ſygne theym obſignator toris putteth ſeale ſygne dede inſtrument obſipo throwe caſte whan men countrey ſay obſipa pullis eſcam caſte meate chyckens obſiſto ſtiti ſiſtere reſyſte obſiſtere obuiam mete one obſitus ta tum wrapped ſette aboute herbes tree obſitus annis pannis olde whan bare obſolote porely apparayled obſonium meates except bread potage obſonus na nū hath yll ſowne obſono obſonor ari feaſt banket obſonito tare idem obſonatio feaſtynge bankettyng obſonator obſonatrix ſhe maketh feaſtes bankettes obſono ſowne yll obſorbeo bui bere obſorbo pſi bere ſuppe vp obſorbo idem obſordeo duo ſordére fylthy vnclene ſluttiſhe nonius declareth wax olde obſtaculum obſtacle impedyment obſtetrico care office mydwife obſtetrix tricis mydwyfe obſtinat • obſtinately fyrmely obſtinatus ta tum obſtinate fyrme ſtable obſtinatio obſtinacy ſtyffenes opynion obſtino obſtinate perſyſte fyrme one ſentence purpoſe obſtipo pare ſtoppe obſtipus crouped ſhouldred obſtitum croked ſometyme vyolated obſtro ſtiti ſtare withſtande lette obſtragulum keuerynge bedde obſtrepo confeſſe offēce obſtrudo ſi dere hyde ſtop mannes throte eate meate obſtrudulentum ſtoppynge obſtruo xi ſtruere ſhut ſtop obſtruere luminibus lette man loke wyndowes ſtoppe lyghtes obſtructio ſtoppynge obſtructus ſtopped ſhutte obſtupidus da dum aſtonyed obſtupefacio facere abaſſhe make abaſhed obſtupeſco ſcere abaſhed obſtupeo idem obſum obfui obeſſe hurte hynder indamage obſurdeſco obſurdeſcere wax deffe obtego idem quod tego obtempero perare obeye commaundement obtendo laye excuſe keuer ouer obtendiculum coulourable aunſwere obtentus tus pretence obtero triui obterere treade thruſte downe ſuffocate bruyſe obteſtatio humble deſyre properly thynge alſo take god ſome thynge wytneſſe obteſtor aris ari humbly beſeche deſire goddes ſake remembraunce ſome thynge whiche hym deſyred thankfully herde obtexo ere wayue obticeo cui cere kepe ſylence ſpeake obtritus ta tum worne obtritus tus wearynge foulynge obturamentum heade ponde obturo ſhutte obturatio ſhuttynge obtineo ſtop let one paſſage obuenio nire come agaynſte mete alſo happen obuenſio oni reuenues obuerſor aris ari preſente eye come remembrance obuerto obuerſo tere tourne agayne backe sed mihi ante oculos oculatus full eyen alſo quicke ſighted circumſpecte eſpyenge thynge ſhortely oculatus teſtis wytneſſe whiche ſawe thynge oculeus full eyen wyly oculus eye alſo yonge budde tree oculis captus blynde oculis geſtare oculis eſſe ferre loue one ſo moche ſatiſfyed beholdynge hym oculis habere attend vppon one beholde intentifely ſtedfaſtly vin hodie facere quo tuo uiro oculus doleant▪ wylt thou nowe whiche ſhall make thy huſbande lothe ſee oculus eruditi whan one knoweth whether oculitus eam amat loueth well owne eyen oculum exculpere crache one eye oculos tollere begynne mery thynge well done intendere oculos ſet eye beholde ſtedfaſtly oculos tenere make mē wonder excellent warkemanſhyp thynge oculus blewe ſpottes fethers pecockes tayle oculiſsimus ſeethe moſte clerely oculatio takynge awaye ſuperfluouſe buddes tree vyne oculus chriſti 〈◊〉 herbe whiche alſo called filius ante patrem oculum adijcere loue thyng whiche ſeene ocymum herbe called baſyle ocyor ſwyfter ocyus idem ocyſsimus um moſte ſwyfte ocyus ſooner quicklyer ¶o ante odaea place wherin ſyngynge exercyſed ode ſonge odfacio olfacio cere ſmelle odi hate haue hated odiſſe hate haue hated odinoliontes fyſhe whiche cleueth ſhyp maketh abyde ſhe laye anker uide remora odioſus hated diſpleſant troublous tediouſe odioſe hate diſpleaſantly odit eum cane peius angue hateth war thanne dogge ſerpente ſaythe mortally without hope reconcylynge odites one ſons ixion centaure odium hate diſpleaſure tediouſenes rācour odio eſſe hated odium capere alicuius rei offended diſcontent thynge odium concitare procure hate dyſpleaſure odoeporicon itenerary wherin wrytten diſtaunce one place lyke thynge ieſtes prynces aſſignynge theyr iourneys odoramen ſeu odoramentum perfume odores plur taken columella ſwete gummes ſpyces odor oris odo ſauour ſente odoramentum euery thynge ſauoureth well alſo ſauour odorarius maker ſeller thynges ſmell ſwete odora canum uis qualite power whiche dogges haue take ſente odoratus tus ſmellynge ſente odoratus ta tum perfourmed ſometyme whiche doth ſauour odoryferous ſmellynge ſwete odorator hounde made ſuite odoriferus um idem odorifer ra rum odoryferouſe ſweete ſauour odoriſecus hounde ſpanell whiche hunteth ſente odorariueſtigijs drawe hounde dothe odoro odoror ari ſmell perceyue odorus um whiche ſendeth forthe ſauour hath good ſauour ¶o ante e oeagrvs ryuer countrey thracia oeanthe citie alſo floure vyne oebades kynge darius horſekepar whoſe polycy atteyned kyngdome perſya oebalia countrey greece called alſo laconia oebalus mannes name oechalia citie laconia oeconomia orderynge prouydyng thynges concernynge houſhold alſo order wrytynge wherby euery thynge ſette proper place oeconomica perteynynge houſehold oeconomicus order gouerne houſe oeconomus ſtewarde houſholde oeci place woman ſyt worke woull ſylke oecumenicus vniuerſall perteynynge al worlde oecumenicum conſilium generall counſayle wherin thinges vniuerſally treated concernynge countreys oedema impoſtume botche commen fleumatike matter grief oedipus ſonne laius kyng thebe father delyuered ſhepherde kyll pityenge chyld made hole feete dyd hange hym boughe beynge ſo founde ſhepeherde phorbas kynge corinthe broughte queene lackyng chyldren brought hym vp ſonne afterwarde ſkyrmyſhe vnwetynge ſlewe owne father aſſoylynge ſubtylle ryddle queſtions sphinx monſter opteyned kyngedome thebe queene called iocaſta whiche mother whome two ſonnes polynices etheocles whan knewe ſlayne father wedded owne mother ſorowe cratched owne eye odipodioniua nia um belongynge oedipus oenanthe flour wylde vyne growing hedge called labruſca dioſcorides li 3 ſayth herbe whiche hathe leafe lyke perſenepes whyte floure big ſtalke hand breade highe ſede lyke orage great rote many rounde heades li 5 ſayeth floure wyld vine ſone ſayth grape wylde vyne theodorus gaza dothe tranſlate hym vitiflora oenanthinum oyntmente made ſayde beary oeneus father deianira laſte wife hercules oenōne concubine paris rauiſhed helene oeneus kynge archadia father meleager wherof called oenides oenomaus ſonne mar father hippodamia oeniſteria certayne ſacrifice athene made yonge men newely berded whiche done dyd cut theyr heare longe whiche ſacrifyce wyſe certayn meaſure wyne brought temple hercules wherof yonge men dranke lyttell gaue reſydue preſent oenophorus ſeruaunte whiche bryngeth wyne table oenophorum pot wherin wyne caryed oenopola vyntenar tauernar oenopolium wyne tauerne oenotria italy oenotrides two yles nyghe calabria oeſipum fylthy oyle whiche wulle flankes ſhepe necke whiche wyfe iaſon ¶o ante f offa puddynge alſo dyſhe made fatte brothe harde cheeſe pepper cynamom lyke iunkat ſomtyme taken morſel offa penita piece fleſhe cut tayle offarius offaria maker ſuche iunkettes offatim morſelles offector toris dyer offella lyttell morſell fleſhe mynced al ſo pottage made piece fleſſhe ſtued brothe forced gruell offendo dere meete fall fynde chaunce ſtryke hyt thyng vnware offende offendere apud aliquē thynge whiche lyketh ſee done alſo diſpleaſe offendiculum impedimente let obſtacle offendimentum offendix knotte rybon laſe wherwith bonet hatte knyt faſte heade offenſa offence diſpleaſure offenſam ſubire diſpleaſure one offenſatio metynge offenſaculum whiche layd man way wherat ſtumbleth offenſator ſatoris ſtackereth readynge perfect readynge readeth otherwyſe wrytten offenſans ti whiche hurteth letteth offenſio oni hurte harme ſomtyme dyſpleaſure hatred offenſiones belli faultes battayle offenſiones incumbraunces offenſioni eſſe diſpleaſure harme betwene offenſio offenſa ſemeth diuerſitie offenſa hym offendeth greueth offenſio hym greued offended nam quod negas te dubitare quin magna offenſa ſim apud pompeium hoc tempore non uideo cauſam cur ita ſit hoc quidem tempore ye doubt nowe tyme pompey great diſpleaſure ſe cauſe ſhuld ſo preſente tyme nec tantum intelligebam ei eſſe offenſionis quā tum literae tuae declarant vnderſtand ſo moche diſpleaſed letter make mention offenſionem ſubleuare cice de amicitia vna illa ſubleuandum offenſio eſt one offence griefe eaſed holpen offenſionem obliterare pardon forget offence diſpleaſure offenſiones lenire cice multas graues offenſiones quas quidem tu da operā ut lenias howe manye greuouſe diſpleaſures done whiche ye go mittigate excuſe offenſionem deponere cice fam epiſt li 13 cum tantum literae meae potuerunt ut lectis omnem offenſionem ſuſpitionis quam habueras de liſone deponeres sen letter mought ſo moche whan ye rad ye dyd laye aparte al diſpleſures whiche ye agaynſte liſo ingendred ſuſpition offenſum idem quod offenſio cic ad att 2 scito nihil unquam fuiſſe tam infame tam turpe tam deni que omnibus generibus ordinibus aetatibus offenſum quam hunc ſtatum qui nunc eſt knowe ſuertye neuer thynge ſo reprochefull ſo diſhoneſt fynally ſo diſpleaſaunt ſortes degree men euerye age preſent ſtate nowe offenſo hyt ofte let thraſte agaynſte thynge offenſiuncula ſmall offence diſpleſure offercio cire ſtuffe fyll offero obtuli obferre offer preſente gyue wyllyngly promyſe offerre auxilium promyſe ayde offerre crimen put complaynt againſt one offerre incendium cice ad pont domus ardebat palatio non fortuito ſed oblato incēdio houſe palaice burne chaunce fyre thraſte ſome man offerre mendicitatem brynge one vnto pouertie offerre relligionem make ſcrupule doubt conſcience si ſe uia obtulerit occiſum iri iam ab ipſo milone uideo cice mete milo waye perceyue wyll ſle hym si nihil offeret ſe quod ſit probabilitati illi contrarium fynde thynge contrary whiche maye appere trewe offerre ſe alicui preſent hym ſelfe one one offerre ſpem put one hope offerre ſtuprum aſſaye meanes defyle woman maryed vnmaryed offerre moram let offerre ſe obuiam mete one offerre ſtuprum commyt aduoutry offerre uitium uirgini defloure virgin offerumentae ſtrypes ne offerumentas habebis plureis tergo tuo quam vlla nauis longa clauos tum ego ero mendaciſsimus thou haue mo ſtrypes ſkyn thy backe galy hath nayles ſhall falſyſt lyar euer offerumēta offrynges thynges offred god officina werkehouſe ſhop ex eadem officina uenit one mannes doinge officialis ale perteynyng office duty officialis offycer officio ficere hurte ſometyme alſo dye clothe officere luminibus ſtop lyghtes officioſus frendly ſeruiſable manne glad pleaſe dothe wel duty officioſus dolor griefe whiche procedeth good cauſe reaſon officioſe diligently ſeruiſably officium offyce duetie thynge whiche ought done ſomtyme taken fo honour done one may vſed whiche call homage doone ſuche fourme lawe doth appoynt alſo taken benefyte properly ought done mete conuenyent officium uſurpare duetie officio eſſe duetie indeuour officia intercedere cic fam epiſt 13 multa que magna inter no officia paria mutua intercedunt betwene v hath ben ſundry great pleaſures lyke importance done one officium promereri pleaſure cic oratione ante exiluim non conuenit enim cum ego ad promerendum officium tam fuerim expedius uos ad referendam gratiam eſſe tardiores reaſon ſens ſo ready pleaſure ye ſhulde ſo ſlacke lyke wyſe officio fungi indeuour duetie officium praeſtare officium conferre idem officio continere kepe hym frend officij cauſa proſequi aliquem kepe company one hym honour worſhip officia mutua pleaſures doone one offirmo abyde one purpoſe opynion obſtinate offlecto xi tere tourne thynge contrary offoca powre water mouthe man beaſte offritiae crafty deceytfull tach offringo ere breake ploughe lande cared offuciae cawtelles crafty wayes deceyue offula lyttell morſell offundo fuſi dere powre make darke blynde ſtayne caſte brynge offundere errorem alicui abuſe deceyue one offuſus terror oculis auribus que feare bothe eye care offuſa animis caligo theyr myndes made blynde offuco care put water lycour mannes mouth ſowke done vſe ſycke men febleneſſe canne ſelfes take ſuſtenaunce offuſco care make blacke darke ¶o ante g ogd ov kynge egypt fyrſte buylded citie memphis ogdo adis numbre eyght ogdolapis ryuer whiche commeth oute hyls called alpes runneth rome oggannio ire prate braule ſpeake chydynge oggero • si gerere caſte ſet oculos oggerere caſte ſette eye one oggraſſari go ogyges whiche fyrſte buylded citie thebe ogygeus um made founde ogyges ogygea yle betwene phenicea syria calypſo dwelled deteined vlyſſes ogigidae bane ogyris yle siria ¶o ante h ohe exclamation ſygnyfyeng whiche ſpeaketh worde ſaciate wery whiche ſeeth hereth oh interiection ſignifienge crye whanne one meteth frende long tyme hath ſeene ſomtyme vſed meruaylynge contempte ſometyme affyrmynge ſometyme ſorowynge ſometyme reioyeynge ¶o ante ¶oinomeli wyne hony ſodden together ¶o ante l olea moſt properly fruite olyue yet ſometyme vſed olyue tree oleaceus um oyly oleacum colour whiche myxt grene blacke yelowe whyte oleaginus um olyue tree oleagineus idem olearis olearius um perteynynge oyle olearia cella cellour oyle olearius maker oyle olearus one yles called ciclades oleaſter wylde olyue oleaſtellus uel oleago whiche serapio calleth mezereon oleaſtrinum oyle wylde olyues oleatus um oyle oleitas tyme gatherynge olyues olenus citie archadia goote whoſe mylke iupiter nouryſhed brought vppe therfore ſigne ſterres whiche ſuppoſed ſame gote named olenia oletare corrupt make ſtynkynge leg xii tabu ne quis aquam oletato dolo malo ubi publice ſalit si quis oletarit ſeſtertiorum de cem millium mulcta 〈◊〉 man crafte corrupte water pryngeth commune vſe doth corrupt ſhal forfait ten thouſande ſeſtertius whiche amount money xxv li xiii iiii olentica thynges whiche haue yll ſauour oleo eui olui olere ſauour haue ſauour olent illa ſuper cilium maliciam ſturdye lookes ſygnifye thou art maliciouſe aurum huic olet felowe ſmelleth haue money iucunde olére haue ſwete ſauour bene olére haue good ſauour male olere ſtynke roſa recens longinquo olet roſe newely gathered ſmelled ferre oleoſus um full oyle oleſco leſcere growe oletum place olyues doo growe alſo dunge ordure man properlye draught iakes oleum operam perdere loſe laboure coſte oleum oyle olfacio feci facere ſmell olfacto ſmell moche often olfactus tus ſence ſmellynge olibantum meaſure wyne olidus da dum whiche hath greatte ſauour eyther good badde moſte communly ſtynkynge oligarchia ſtate common weale wher fewe perſons aucthoritie olim ſometyme wel tyme paſſed tyme come nowe late longe tyme paſſed one olitor gardynar ſeller herbes rootes olitorius um perteyninge pot garden oliua olyue tree oliueta tyme gatheryng olyue beries oliuetum place growe oliue tree oliuina plenty olyues alſo reuenues whiche come olyues oliuitas oleitas qualitie olyues gatherynge tyme olyues oliuo gather olyues oliuum oyle olyue olla pot ollares grape conſerued pottes olli illi ollula lyttell potte olophernes chiefe conſtable great nabugodonozer kynge aſſyrians valyaunt capitayne withſtandynge beynge ouercharged wyne moche truſtynge beaulty pleſaunt ſpeche hebrewe ladye iudith ſlayne bedde • • ad headde ſtryken brought ennemies incarnation chryſte yeres ololygones crokynge frogges olor oris wylde ſwanne olôrinus na um ſwanne cantus olorinus ſyngynge ſwanne olus leris herbes whiche ſerue pottage pot herbes oluſcula ſmall herbes olus atrum herbe called alyſander olympia citie betwene hylles oſſa olympus olympiacus ca cum perteynynge playes hyll olympia piadis ſpace fyne yeres whereby olde greekes dyd accompte nowe yeres lorde fyrſte olympia ſeconde thyrd ſo forthe olympicus ca cum olympus olympicum certamen game pryce kepte hyll olympus prince city greece euerye fyfth yere honour hercules fyrſte began whiche theſe mayſtries proued runnynge foote goll alſo runnynge furthe backe agayne two furlong alſo wraſtlynge fyghtynge fyſtes runnynge horſes wraſtlynge handes legges runnynge wraſtlynge child fyghtynge harneyſe runnynge ii horſes leapynge one courſynge charyottes runnynge mare ſo myddell courſe dyd ryde ſhulde leape downe holdynge faſte brydell ſhoulde make end courſe alſo contention vyctory poetes rhetoritiās muſicians ſubtyle diſputars place growe wylde olyue tree wherof garlandes made gyuen victours hereto aſſembled city countreys greece whiche tyme eyther warre appoynted leages concluded theſe gret game alſo called olympia olympionices hath victory game olympus olympius um heuenly olympus mountayne hyll grece betwene theſſalia macedonia aboue whiche appereth clowde therfore amonge poetes vſurped heauen plutarchus uita aemilij ſayth ten furfonge heyght olynthus citie thracia olyras ryuer greece place called thermopylas olyſippum citie portugall nowe called vlyſbona englyſhe luſſeborn ¶o ante omasvm fat gut chitterlynge omen mini lucke alſo worde ſentence ſodaynelye ſpoken whiche ſome thynge hapneth folowe accordynge thervnto aboue expectation thē whiche herde omentum calle ſewet wherein bowelles lapped alſo thynne ſkynne head wherin brayne conteyned ſome called ryme brayne ſurgeons pia mater omentatus ta tum myxte ſewet ominor aris ari omino aui geſſe ſhall happen folowe ominator òris telleth mannes lucke fortune ominoſus um lucky omiſſus um lefte medled omîſſo animo vbi te uidi animo eſſe omiſſo whan ſawe thou caryddeſt nothynge omitto omiſi omittere forbeare leaue neglecte omitte hunc let hym alone pardon hym omitte let let alone omitte iracundiam angry omitte ſolicitudinem care omitte timorem aferde omitte de ea dicere ſpeake matter id omitto wyll ſpeake therof vt omittam de eo plus loqui wyll paſſe ouer ſpeake hym omiſsis iocis credo erneſt doo beleue ❀omne tulit punctum touched euerye pointe prouerbe applyed hym whiche omytteth nothyng expedient neceſary therfore men commended omnibus numeris al poyntes re eſt ō nibus numeris abſoluta thynge perfyte poyntes omnifariam maner wayes euerye kynde omnifarius um ſundry opera rae warke labour operae plurali tantum warkemen labourer factours opera warkes buyldynges pryuate commune operae eſt nedeth opera mea meanes operam perdere labour vayne operam iudere idem operam ponere take labour peyne thynge opera reddere alicui paye oone hyre oreſtes lycurgus una opera mihi ſunt ſodales qua iſte oreſtes lycurgus well companyons haud cenſebam iſtarum eſſe operarum patrem dyd thynke father medled theſe matter spero alicunde hodie bona opera aut mala tibi inuenturum eſſe auxilium argentarium truſte one daye ſhall good meanes bad fynde ſome moneye helpe operam operam optimatus tus ſtate condition heade men towne countray optime well optimo iure good ayd good reaſon optimus beſte good optio choyce requeſt deſyre alſo capytayne warres mynyſter doo commaundemente opus ſit nede opus inteſtinum moſt commonly callyd implementes houſeholde properly tymber fourmes ſtooles cupbourdes lyke thynges opus eſt conuento ita re ſubita eſt celeriter mihi hoc homine opus eſt chaunce ſoo ſodayne matter requyreth ſuche haſte muſt nedes ſpeke man ſhortly quyckely opus eſt facto muſte nedes done executed opus eſt remiſſam voſmet uidete iam laches tu pamphile remiſſam opus ſit nobis reductam domum nowe laches pamphile aduyſe ſelues well whither neceſſary ſhe ſente home fetched home opus ſunt tibi thou haſte nede theym vt cum deſponderim de qui aurum ac ueſtem que alia quae opus ſunt whan haue affyaunced thou delyuer money apparayl al thinges nedefull opere maxumo meanes poſſyble moſt harty wyſe rex seleucus opere orauit maxumo ut ſibi latrones cogerem kynge seleucus deſyred moche poſſyblye moughte wolde geate hym ſouldyours aboute perſone thai maximo te orabat opere ut cras redires thai deſyred hartyly ſhe canne thou woldeſte comme agayne morowe opuſculum lyttell warke ¶o ante r os extreme parte euery thyng edge brym ſkyrtes hemme border cabull tyeth ſhyppe alſo clyme particion fyrmament os uulneris ouer partes wound os marittima ſea ſyde oraculum aunſweres gyuen ydolles ſomtyme aunſwere ſometyme ſayenge ſome wyſe man oraculum edidit deus god ſayde orarium veſtement wherein prieſte dothe ſaye maſſe orata fyſhe callyd gylte head oratio oration prayer orator toris oratour oratoria rhetorike oratoriae lyke oratour fourme rhetorike oratorius um pertaynynge oratour oratus tus prayer orbelon place thracia orpheus dyd dwelle orbes dyſhes hole eyen ſommetyme eyen orbem facere people gather rounde togyther battayle orbi whyche haue loſte theyr chylderne alſo orphanes orbiculatus ta tum made rounde orbiculus lyttell cerkle alſo pully orbicus ca cum rounde orbile li circuite roufe orbis cerkle alſo worlde orbita wheele ſommetyme tracke wheles make grounde orbitas lacke chylderne ſometyme lacke father alſo lacke orbitus ta tum rounde cerkle orbo depryue orbus proprely blynde ſometyme lackynge thynge orca great monſter ſea alſo greatte veſſelle butte vate wherein r • nnyſhe wyne putte alſoo boxe wherein dyce ſhaken throwen table ſometyme coffer wherein womennes payntynge kepte orca promontorium northe ende scotlande orchades thyrtye iles ſea scotlande orcheſtra place wherein senatours honourable perſons ſat beholde playes orchis herbe callyd alſo satyrion alſo certayne kynde fyſhe orchomenus mountayne theſſaly alſoo citie euboea orcomana beere whereon deade corſes doo lye orcula rundelet orcus ryuer helle alſoo nother theſſaly ſometyme taken helle ordeaceus um barly ordinarius um wherein order obſerued ordinary ſometyme ſkoffer geſter ordinare order diſpoſe ordior iris orſus iri begynne ſpeake ordo dinis order dewe place aſtate menne ordinem redigere kepe one within boundes excede degree ordines battayle whyche callyd raye ordines ſeruare kepe raye ordine ponere ſette raye ordo longus great multitude ordines ducere capitayne ordinem cogere brynge vnder obeyſaunce correcte theym whyche oute order ordines conturbare breake ſkatter raye ordinatim order ordinatio ordynaunce ordoluci hylles whiche diuyde scotlande englande callyd nowe cheuiet orea bytte horſe oreus name bacchus oreſtes ſonne agamemnon ore tenus mouthe oreto oria towne spayne callyd calatraua orexis mooſte taken vomyte ſygnifieth appetite eate organon inſtrumentes muſyke organum inſtrument pertaynyng buyldynge alſo ordynaunce warres organarij maker inſtrumentes orgia ceremonyes ſonges pertaynynge infernall goddis bacchus orgyia meaſure
