lyttell care oricos citie epire oriens orientis eaſte orificium mouthe thynge origanum herbe callyd organny origines callyd alſo adamantius borne alexandria egypte ſonne one leonides martyr man mooſte excellente kounnynge vertue frome chyldhode wherein ſoo wonderfully proſperyd beynge infaunt lyenge ſleape father camme chaumber takynge awaye ſoftely clothes kyſſed chyldes breaſte temple hauynge within holye gooſte gyuynge thankes god hadde ſente hym ſuche ſonne tyme father martred origene beynge alſoo deſyrouſe martyrdome yet yonge chylde ranne amonge whyche led ſlayne meanes proffered hym ſelfe dye theym whiche mother perceyuyng moſte entierly loued ſhe fyrſt lamentably intreted hym withdrawe hym therwith inflamed towarde martyrdome withdrawen wherefore mother vſed crafte nyghte whan bedde ſhe ſtale awaye clothes ſo mornyng whā wold haue gone forth mought come theym wherfore conſtrayned tary home deceipt mother complayned father pryſon deſyrnge hym perſyſt conſtantely good purpoſe martyrdome father contynually gaue ſelfe ſtudye holy scripture whyche hadde taſted readynge gentyles warkes father inſtruction phyloſophye ſcyences dydde excelle menne tyme twentye yeres olde eyghtene yeres olde expoundynge openly gentile authours ſoo interlaced holye doctrine conuerted faythe chriſte many great lernyd menne whiche hearer lyuynge alſoo ſo ſtrayght vertuouſe drewe many vntylle hym amonge menne hadde wonderfull reuerence yet neuer ceaſſed perſecutions comforte confyrme men imbracynge martyrdome dydde contynually reade openly alſoo wryte innumerable bokes expoundynge holy ſcrypture withſtandynge alſoo lernyd hebrue toungue perfytely went dyuerſe countrayes preachynge greatte fame hym mammea mother emperoure alexander seuerus ſent hym rome herd ſomme ſuppoſe hym conuerted whereof ye may reade boke whiche tranſlated eucolpius called image gouernance moſt ſtraightly obſerued preceptes goſpell contynuall faſtynges watchynges hauyng oone garment goynge alwaye bare foted counſayllynge hearer renounce hadde gyue almeſſe alſo gelded hym ſelfe onely chaſte alſoo bycauſe tyme perſecution taught worde god well pryuilye openly menne womenne mought lette paynyms ſhoulde ſpeake dyſſhoneſtye hym thoſe whyche repayred sermones leſſons whyche although dydde ſecretelye yet god wolde haue hydde ſo camme eare demetrius byſſhoppe alexandria fyrſte wonderynge • te ſtomacke vertue manne prayſyng feruentnes faythe ſayde vnto hym nowe ſtycke thy doctryne preachynge ſens thou haſte left vnto thyne aduerſaries occaſyon ſuſpycion afterwarde ſame demetrius ſtyred enuy agaynſte origene layde reproche agaynſte hym openly fyndynge nothynge el wherwith dyſprayſe hym wylle knowe origene let hym rede vi boke euſebius hiſtoria eccleſiaſtica ſaynct hierome de ſcriptoribus eccleſiaſtic incarnation chriſte 204 yeres originalis le whyche one hath byrthe origo ginis begynnynge kynde orion ſonne neptunus ſomme fayned came vryne iupyter mercury neptune wyſe one enopius whan lodged thoſe goddis killed oxe deſired graunt hym ſonne thoſe thre pyſſed hyde oxe layde ground therof came orion vrion ouros greke vryne orîon beinge hunter whan wold haue defloured diana ſlayne ſcorpyon tranſlated amonge ſterres ſygne callyd latyne iugula orior eris oriris riri borne ryſe appere oriundus commen auncetours ſome countrey citie ſometyme borne nati carthagine ſed oriundi à syracuſis borne carthage ancetours deſcended syracuſe sicile oriza grayne callyd ryce whyche moſte commonly eaten lent almond mylke orizon furthermoſt parte fyrmament man eye determyne orminium herbe lyke horehounde ornamenta ſommetyme dothe ſygnifye thoſe whiche worthy prayſe ornamentum apparayle alſo honour prayſe commendation ornithoboſcion howſe poultrye fedde cowpe ornithon thonis place wherein byrdes kepte orno nare garnyſſhe decke trymme make fayre prepare make meete honour ſome auctoritie dygnitie alſo prayſe ornare ſuffragio help one voyce good report ornare fugam runne away ornate trymly gorgeouſely ornatus greate dygnytie authorytie ornatiſsimam de ſententiam dixit gaue honorable reporte ornatus ta tum apparayled trymmed garniſhed inſtructed fournyſhed ornatus tus apparayle trymmyng deckyng ornus wylde aſhe great leaues oro orare praye demaunde ſpeake openly eloquentely oratours doo pleade orobanche herbe growynge amonge beanes peaſyn deſtroyeth orobia kynde frankyncenſe lyttelle graynes orobitis greene colour lyke blaades corne orobum kynde poulſe corne ſuppoſe tare looke eruum orontes ryuer citie antioche orphanus whyche lacketh father fatherly ſuccour orpheus borne thracia ſonne oeagrius ſome doo write apollo calliope aunciente poete moſte excellente harper poetes ſurmyſed dyd delyte beaſtes infernalle ſpyrytes • yd ſtones ſweteneſſe armonye whereby recouered wyfe eury dice helle laſt ſlayn lyghtnynge ſome wryte torne piece woman orrea towne englande callyd newe caſtell oroſius wourſhypful prieſt borne spayn ryght eloquente experte hyſtoryes wrate ſeuen bokes agaynſte theym whyche ſayde decaye commune weale rome hapned doctrine chriſte ſent ſaynte auguſtyue vnto ſayte hierome iudea lerne hym raiſon ſtate ſoule orſus beganne orſus begynneth thynge orſus um begunne orthodoxia ryght opynion faythe orthodoxus man ryghte oppynyon faythe orthogonus ryght corner orthographia ryght forme writynge alſo platte buyldynge wherein paynted ſette oute fygure holle warke reaſons ſame orthopnoea dyſeaſe whanne man ran fetche breathe holdynge neck • vpryght orthopnoeci whyche haue ſyckeneſſe orthoſtadios garment whyche alway worne vngyrte orto luce ſoone day ortus ti uide hortus orti penſiles gardeynes made howſes pyllours ortus ta tum borne ſprunge begunne ortus tus byrthe natiuitie alſo ryſynge ſonne ortygia name yle ortyx tygis byrde callyd quayle oryx gi beaſte kynde gotes ¶o ante o oris mouth alſo viſage ſome tyme proporcion bodye ſometyme countenance alſo preſence language ore eſt omni populo people ſpeaketh hym omnes uno ore authores fuêre one accorde o ad male audiendum prebêre ſuffre hym rebuke hym face per os hominum ferri publyſſhed ſpoken abrode o diſtorquêre ſette mouthe wrye mocke mouthe o ducere idem o durum ſhameleſſe perſone o impudens idem o alicui laedere ſaye ylle oone face o hominis inſignem que impudentiam cognoſcite conſyder boldnes preſumption felowe duarum uiginti gentium ore loquebatur ſpake xxii language o portus entrye hauen o ſublinire mock deceyue craftyly fayre promyſes oſsiculum diminutiue o o oſsis bone oſſum idem oſae lawes concernynge deuotion oſanna pray ſaue v oſaſum odi hate oſcedo dinis yanynge gapynge ſommetyme ſtenche oſci people italy oſcillo bowe downe oſcilla lyttell ymages waxe offred oſcillum lyttell mouthe ſometyme lyttell ymage poppette oſcines byrdes whyche theyr voyces doo ſygnyfie ſomewhat come happen oſcinum general name byrdes whiche ſynge ſyngynge byrde oſcis abhomynable vſe carnall ſynne oſcito tare gape menne doo lacke ſleape oſcitor tari idem oſcitatio gapynge alſoo quyeteneſſe frome laboure oſcitans gapeth lacke ſlepe alſo careth nothyng ſure fearynge nothynge neglygent oſcitanter ſoftely withoute courage yf one almooſte ſleape alſoo neglygentely oſcitabunde idem oſculana pugna battayle wherin whyche vaynquyſſhed haue vyctorye oſculatio kyſſynge oſculum lyttell mouthe alſo kyſſe oſiris ſonne iupyter niobe fyrſte kynge argyues leauyng royalme brother went egypte raygned maryed iſis fynally ſlayne typho brother longe ſoughte iſis wyfe laſte fyndyng body ſhe buryed yle called abatos egyptian afterwarde fyndyng oxe ſuppoſed oſiris become god takynge oxe theym cytie memphis honoured god callyng hym apis ordeyned hym certayne ceremonyes lyttell whyle drownynge hym ryuer ſought nother lyke oxe waylynge weepynge whyche beynge founden cryed moch gladneſſe brought citie incarnatiō chriſt 2012 yeres oſyris alſo herbe whiche ſome doo ſuppoſe wylde lynne wylde flaxe oſſa hygh mountayne theſſaly oſſeus um bony bone harde bone oſsiculatim oone boone frome nother piece oſsifragus ga gum whyche breakethe boone oſsilegium gatherynge boone oſsiculum lyttell bone oſſuaria ſhryne lyke thynge bone dead men put oftendo di dere ſhewe oſtendere ſe ſiue animum ſuum declare courage intendeth oſtendere ſe uirum proue ſelf man valiantly oſtentatio booſtynge oſtentare periculum capitis menace one kyll hym cauſe hym dye tranſgreſſour oſtentare iugulum pro capite alterius offer dye ſaue lyfe man oſtentata occaſio occaſyon preſent oſtentare ſpem put hope oſtento oſtentare ſhewe often alſo boſt aduaunt oſtentui eſſe poynted oſtentum thynge whyche hapneth ſeldome betokeneth ſome ſtraunge thynge ſhall happen blaſyng ſterre thunder fayre day sometyme ſygnifieth thing monſtruouſe oſten tus tus ſkorne oſtia oſtiorum entree greate ryuers ſometyme hauens oſtia towne nyght rome oſtiarius porter oſtiatim doore doore oſtienſis lyttell hauen rome oſtigo ſkabbe whiche hapneth ſhepe oſtium doore gate oſtraciſmus maner exylynge menne athene whyche excellyd power authorytie whyche exyle doone delyuerynge oyſter ſhelles wherein name hym whyche ſhulde exyled wrytten oſtracum ſhelle oſtrea oyſter oſtreum idem oſtrearius panis browne breade whyche men wont eate oyſters oſtreatus ta tum harde oyſter oſtrifer place ſea whyche apte ingender oyſters oſtrinae ueſtes garmentes purple colour oſtrum purple lyke colour oſus oſurus participle odi oſus ſum oſus e oſus eſt hate thou hateſt hateth ¶o ante othris mountayne theſſalye dwellyd peple callyd lapithae otior ſwyfter otior ari ydell reſte otioſè ydelly leyſure ſurely without care otioſus um ydell ſure without care otioſus dy holy day playenge day otioſus animus terent animo iam nunc otioſo eſſe impero nowe charge care nothynge otioſa re thynge requyreth noo care ſtudye otioſae ſententiae ſentences whyche haue vertue power moue audience otioſus ſtudiorum ſtudyeth nothing otioſe dormire ſlepe without care ſlepe ſoundly otioſe negotium gerere go neglygently byrdes lyke partryches otus ſhryche oule ¶o ante v ovalis corona garlande myrtelles gyuen vnto hym whiche victorye without effuſion bloudde ouatio ſmall triumph prynce capytayne whyche vyctorye enemy whyle moche profited noumbre beſte oratours tyme aduanced ſundry authority made ſenator withſtāding chiefely dyd dedicate hym ſelfe vnto poetry wherein nature made excellent facylitie abundaunce ſawce oxyporopola ſelleth meate ſharpe ſawce ſowce oxyrinchus cytie aegypte ſo named fyſhe callyd oxyrinchus moch egyptian worſhypped two fyſſhes goddis ſay lepidorū oxyrinchū alſo two byrdes hawke paederotes preciouſe ſtone called alſo opalion appereth fyry bryghtnes carbuncle ſhynynge pourple coulour amatiſt grene ſea emeraulde ſhynynge gether incredible mixture pli li 37 ca 6 alſo bremble herbe whereof plinius maketh mention li 19 ca 8 dioſcorides li 3 et 4 called paedaeros ſome ſuppoſe kynde berefore paedia erudition inſtitution good artes gellius teacheth paedico paedicaui paedicare alſo brodeſt part rynge palae wedge piece gaddes mettalle whan fyned palaca piece fyne golde palaemon oni callyd god ſea palaeſtina countreye syrie ioynynge araby callyd holy ſcripture philiſtum palaeſtra wraſtlynge place alſo exercyſe wraſtlyng alſo comelynes mouynge geſture accordynge ſtate degree perſon whyche ſheweth palaeſtricum idem palaeſtricus wraſtler palaeſtricus ca cum pertaynynge wraſtlyng palaeſtrita vſeth wraſtlynge palam openly men al mē mayſe palam facere reuele brynge open knowledge re palam eſt matter openly knowen thynge manifeſt palamêdes ſonne nauplus kyng yle callyd euboia valyant capytayn grekes ſiege troye falſe ſurmyſe vlyſſes ſlayne people wryten hym found certayne letter greke order flyght crane palangae leauers porter wherewith lyft beare tymber ſuch lyke thynges great weyght palango beare leauers porter palangari men whyche beare leyuers porter thynges great poyſe weyght palatiar palatual ſacrifyce done rome hyll callyd palatinum palatio oni foundation made maryſe grounde pyle tymber palantes wander aboute wote whyther go palanteum citie buylded hylle callyd palatinus palantia doughter euander palantia citie arragonia palatha tarte fygges palea chaffe corne alſo gryſtell whyche falleth downe frome necke cocke capon palearium dewelappe rudder beaſte alſo place wherin chaffe kepte paleatus made myxte chaffe pale called goddeſſe ſhepeherdes paſture palene cytie ſo called pallena daughter sython wyfe cletus palepaphos citie cypre paleſcamander ryuer troye palicenus fountayne sicilia palilia ſhepeherdes holydayes kepte honour pale palimpſeſtus parchemente raſed palingeneſia regeneration ſeconde natiuytie palinodia contrarye ſonge retractynge whiche one hath ſpoken wrytten nowe ſome men called recantynge palinodiam canere retracte whiche one hath ſpoken wrytten palinurus mayſter ſhyppe wherein aeneas camme italye alſo elbowe lande sycile ſea paliurus bryer whiche beareth cod wherin thre foure blacke ſeedes ſuppoſe deſcription bothe theophraſtus dioſcorides fyrſe gorſſ althoughe ſome place may greater place palla womannes gowne pallace concubine palladium ymage pallas palladius mannes name whiche wrote houſbandry pallancana ſharpe oynion whiche cauſeth eyen water palladius um longeth pallas pallas anti ſonne euander ſometyme kynge latynes alſo gyant pallas adis called goddeſſe battayle alſo wyſedome pallax acis concubine ſuche one kepeth ſtede wyfe palleo lui lere pale palleſcere idem palliaſtrium courſe mantell palliate fabulae comedy enterludes made grecia perſonages therein grekes togatae fabulae enterludes rome perſonages romaynes ſo called bycauſe ouermoſte habyte grekes called pallium romaynes toga palliatus cladde mantell pallio concele hyde palliolatim amictus cladde palle palliolatus idem palliolum ſhorte mantelle pallium mantell ſuche knyghtes garter pallor oris paleneſſe colour paluſter ſtris tre tra trum fenne palma palme hande alſo meaſure called handebrede ſometyme ore row alſo palme tree date tree ſomtyme ſygnifyeth vyctorye palma chriſti called alſo buchaides herbe kynde satyrion hauyng rote lyke palme one hande palmam praeripere take prayſe honour palmare facinus acte worthy palma ſygne vyctorie palmarium worthy ſygne token vyctorye palmaria ſpacia handbrede ſpace palmata palmaris ueſtis garmente bawdekyn whiche conſule dydde weare tyme peace vyctour tyme warre palmes itis ſmalle tender braunches moſte properly vyne palmetum place wherin date tree doo growe palmeus um palme tree palmifer palmiger beareth palme date tree palmipedalis meaſure foote handebrede palmipedes aues byrdes haue hole fete commonly al water foules haue palmipes ſplay footed palmyra great caſtell fortreſſe myddell syria palmyrena countrey syrie palmo bynde pampinus vyne leafe grene braunche panagron great ſwepe nette taketh maner fyſhe pan panis called god ſhepeherds panagyris commune aſſembly people fayre marte markette hyghe feaſte ceaſſions alſo lyke leaues fygge tree alſo long ſtalk moſye top knappe wherin ſwete ſedes ſharpe ſente hath yelowe floure growith diuers party grecia panarium pantry breade kepte panathenea among athenienſes certayne ſolemne ceremony wherof ſome great kepte euery fyfth yere ſome leſſe yerely celebrate ſometyme called athenaea panchaia region arabie called alſo sabaea pancarpia garland made dyuerſe floures omnibus al men may perceyue acutis morbis adoleſcentia magi patet youthe ſubiecte ſharpe daungerouſe ſyckeneſſes patens open patens uulneri daunger hurt pater tris father patera brode pece bolle gold ſyluer paterfamilias good man houſe paterpatratus whome pertaynyd whan true ſhuld taken receiue othes appoyntment partes therin chiefe principalle ambaſſadour pater patrimus father hathe father lyuyng paternus um pertaynyng father pateſco ſcere open pathe trouble vexation mynd paſſiōs pathetica oratio oration mouynge heater indignation pitie pathmos yle theſe callyd aegeum patibulum woden locke doore barre wherwith doore made faſt alſo place tourment gybbet galowes croſſe patillum payre tongue lyke inſtrument wherwith cole taken vp patina dyſhe wherin meate caryed patinarium meate whiche ſtewed vppon chaffynge dyſhe patior pateris pati ſuffer endure pati uita ſuſtayne hunger pati aegre yll content pati aequo animo well content pati fortiter ſuffer pacyently pati iniquo animo angry thynge indigne pati diſcontent pati facile diſcontent patior non moleſte dyſcontent nullum patior eſſe diem quin foro dicam lette noo daye paſſe pleade ſome matter pati aeuum haue duryd well grauius accuſas • patiturtua conſuetudo y accuſe greuouſely ye wont nec ulla ſegetū minus dilationem patitur corne typeth haſtyly wolde ſooner reaped pati febrem haue feuer pati iactiuras haue loſſes pati impedimentum lette pati imperium vnder ſubiection pati ſupplicium put deathe pati ſolicitudinē pro aliquo take thought one pati poterunt oculus cum gabino ſententiam dicere may indure ſyt gabinius iudgement patiens ti participle ſygnifyeth pacient indurynge patiens nowne ioyned genitine caſe patiens nauium tyberis tyber may beare ſhyppe patiens operum indure labor patiens uaetuſtatis whiche dureth long patienter paciently meaſurably patientia pacyence patienter praeſtare ſuffer let paſſe patibilis le ſufferable patitor ſuffer thou patrae trarum citie achaia patrator oris dothe thynge patriarche patricida kylleth father patricidium murder man father patricè nobly lyke noble man patricius ſenatours ſonne commen ſenatours patrimonium goodes commen inheritance patrymonye patrinus patrimis whiche hath father lyuynge patrinus um father pertaynynge father patritus ta tum whiche happeneth one father patrius um countrey alſo pertaynyng father patrizo patriſſo lyke father patro perſourme patrare facinus commytte myſcheuouſe dede patrocynor aris ari defende whiche poore falſely accuſed patroclus noble greke companiō achilles patrocinium defence menne beinge trouble ſuyte patronymicū nomen name taken ancetor priamides childrē priamus patronus aduocate defendantes parte patrueles couſyn germayns ryght couſyns father ſyde patruus father brother patruus magnus father vncle patruus maximus grandfather vncle pattagia ryuer sicile patulico care open parulus um wyde open patulus bos oxe cowe whoſe horne ſtande wyde open paucis fewe wordes paucus ca cum fewe paucitas tati fewneſſe pauculus um fewe paucies ſeldome pauciens idem paucitas fewe numbre pauens ti feareth tyme paueo ere feare pauera wheate whiche ſpryngeth well hoſe whan groweth ineare paueſco ſcere aferde pauicula pauynge bytell wherwith ſtoones dryuen grounde makyng pauement pauidus alway feareth pauide fearefully pauimento make pauement pauimentū pauement place paued flore pauio ire ſtryke pauito ſoore aferde paulatim lyttell lyttell pauliſper lyttell whyle paulum paulo lyttell paulo lyttell paulominus lyttell laſſe paulo mox paulo prius lyttell erſt paululum lyttell paululum modo neuer ſo lyttell paululo tum erat contenta ſhe content lyttell paulum lyttell paulus name mooſte commonly romaynes whiche one moſte excellente named paulus aemilius ſonne lucius paulus man aſcendyng dignity vnto conſul capitayne warres spayn faught two battayles wherein ſlayne xxx thouſande spanyardes wan ccl wallyd townes withſtandyng returned rome one grote rycher lyberall ſumptuouſe ryche afterwarde made warre againſt ligurians ieane hauyng hym onely viii thouſand put flyght xxx thouſande brought theym ſubiection finally faught agaynſt perſeus kynge macedonia vanquiſhed brought hym chyldren pryſoners rome triumph forme▪ ſenatours apparailed white ſylke ſat ſtages made market place beholde triumph temple ſette open fylled floures ſoote perfume triumph diuided thre dais firſt day vneth ſuffyſed beholdynge image wel paynted wrought ſtone mettall moſte excellent warkemen whyche caried ccl chariotes ſecond day brought forth harneyſe artyllery macedones apparayle horſes whyche ſuche ſorte maner terryble vanquyſhers beholde folowed three thouſande menne whyche dydde beare ſyluer coyne cccl veſſelles ſyluer euery veſſelle weighte three talentes whyche ccxl li ixxx li euery talente euery veſſelle borne foure men dyd beare greatte cuppes pottes ſyluer thyrde daye trompettes came blowynge blouddy ſoundes theym came hundred twenty ox horne gylt thervpon ſet fyllettes garlandes led yong men gyrt prepared ſacryfyce theym chylderne bare cuppes goulde ſyluer ſerue ſacryfyce theym folowed whyche bare money gould golden veſſels euery waying thre talentes alſo number veſſelles ccxl folowed whyche caryed potte whyche aemilius hadde lette make precyouſe ſtoones wayenge tenne talentes whyche dccc pounde▪ alſoo bare plate kynges antigonus seleucus thericius perſeus whych innumerable came charyotte wherein perſeus harneyſe dyademe ſet thervppon soone two ſonnes oone doughter ledde theym greatte numbre theyr nourices mayſters gouernours wepynge holdynge vp theyr handes vnto people wherof many meuyd teares ſoo tryumphe ſemed myngled gladneſſe vyctorye heuyneſſe compaſſyon chylderne ſeruauntes folowed forthwith perſeus blacke garment tremblynge troubled ſpyryte whome enſewed greatte companye counſayllours offycers beholdynge hym ſorowfullye teares whyche moore conſtrayned dyuerſe romaynes wepe pytie hadde theyr myſerye hym borne foure hundred crownes goulde whyche gyuen aemillus cyties greece vertue proweſſe thanne folowed aemilius hym ſelfe ſyttynge charyotte verye rychely apparayled hauynge robe pourple tynſette bearynge hande braunche lawrelle manne beſyde honour worthye looked came men warre whyche hadde bene hym order ſuche bendes companyes belonge vnto batayle euery theym bearynge hande braunche lawrell ſyngynge verſis myxt mery tauntes ſome ſyngynge prayſes aemilius whome behelde wondered excellente qualyties nowe beholde aemilius beinge ſtate condytion nothynge lacked hym man coulde wyſſhe yet lyfe vnmixt aduerſyties hauynge foure ſonnes whyche two hadde gyuen adoption scipio aphricanus fabius maximus two kept home oone theym dyed fyue dayes tryumphe beynge ſyxtene yeres olde beynge twelue yeres olde dyed thyrde daye tryumphe whyche crueltie fortune men lamented broughte ſoo greatte heuyneſſe howſe repleate gladneſſe reioycynge noble renoume hadde meddlyd teares ſorowes lamentation vyctorye ioye tryumphe therfore aemilius neuer abated courage callynge people togyther made theym noble oration declarynge theym nothyng deceyued fortune moche whan ſhe ſeemyd hym moſte fauourable thanne fearyd anye thynge elles althoughe ſhe hadde taken frome hym good ſonnes whome appoynted ſuccede hym yet ſens ſhe hadde ſhewed extreme malyce hym bloudde hadde good truſte nowe people rome ſhoulde remayne proſperouſe withoute perylle noble harte valyaunt courage wourthy lefte remembraunce broughte ſoo moche goulde ſyluer treaſourye romaynes neded noo taſke ſette people vntylle fyrſte battayle betwene octauyane antonye whyche foure ſcore yeres aboue yet lefte patrymony vneth fyue hundred foure ſcore twelue pounde treaſour lyttell nothynge hyſtory haue bene meued wryte dyuerſe pleaſaunt notable thynges whyche therin conteyned vnſuretie proſperytie wherein men blynded whiche doo deſyre haue one thynge wolde remembred althoughe aemilius fauourer nobilitie yet people better beloued scipio onely ſtudied ſerue theyr pourpoſes humanytie equally myxte grauitie ſeueritie brought erth ſumptuouſe preparation loue fauour onely countreye menne alſoo ennemyes many liguria spayne macedonia rome yonge ſtronge dydde beare corp olde menne folowed callynge hym benefactour conſeruatoure theyr cyties countrayes plutarchus vitis paulus apoſtelle chriſte borne iudea towne callyd giſcalis trybe beniamyn towne beyng taken romayns went parentes tharſum cytie cilicia dwellyd afterwarde ſent theym hieruſalem lerne lawes taught one gamaliel great lerned man beinge martyrdome ſaynt steuyn receyued letter byſhoppe wyllynge hym go damaſcum perſecute theym beleued chriſte waye reuelation chaunged frome perſecutour veſſelle election afterward whanne hadde conuerted sergius paulus beynge proconſule cypre faythe chryſte hym callyd paulus named saulus fynally ſufferyd martyrdome beheadyng paſſyon chriſte xxxvii yeres fourtenth yere raigne nero haec hieronymus sophoronius reſydue lyfe appereth actes apoſtles lernynge myſtycall wyſedome well ſhewed epiſtles whyche ſaynt peter ſaythe ſomme thynges harde vnderſtande men vnlerned inconſtant depraue like partes ſcripture owne pardicion theſe wordes wold god men wold conſider theſe dayes reade ſayd epiſtles reuerend feare deuotion preſumyng theyr ſpirite onely conferryng eyther coū ſell men well ſtudyed catholyke el approuyd expoſitions moſt holy doctours yf may come one uel peplum kerchiefe lyke couerynge heade peperci haue ſpared forborne pardoned pepigi pupugi pretertence pungo alſo pepigi pretertence pango pepigit foedus made league alyance pepo oni kynde melones callyd pompones peptica medycynes whyche doo make good concoction manne meate eaten maye dygeſte welle alſoo ſaluts oyntementes whyche doo make impoſtumes rype per ſygnyfyeth ioyned nother worde ſygnyfyethe perfection perpulchrum verye fayre pergraue veray greuouſe per aetatem reſon age per fidem per fortuna per dexteram te oro praye loue god caeſar mihi ignoſcit per literas ceſar writeth hath pardoned per maturitatem dehiſcens clouen moche rypeneſſe reaſon rype per licet content per multas aetates longe tyme per metum feare per nebulam ſcire knowe one halfe certaynly per noctem nyght per omneis dy euery daye day day per otium leyſure per poteſtatem vnder colour authoritie obſecro ut per pacem licet te alloqui praye lette talke without dyſpleaſure praye heare pacientely per ſe ſibi quiſque charus eſt euery man nature loueth beſt hym ſelfe per ſilentium adeſſe aeque animo heare without ſpeakynge one worde per ſilentium without noyſe per ſtadia duo ſpace two furlonge per ſpeciem uenādi urbē egreſsi wēt towne makynge ſemblance go huntynge per ſummum dedecus great ſhame per te ſtetit lay per tempus tyme tyme pera ſcryppe bagge peractio accomplyſhement performance perago egi agere perform make perfit cōſider draw cauſe drawen force peragere reum accuſe one ſue condemnation peragere oīa ſecū animo conſyder euery thyng dygeſt euery thyng mynd peragere cibum dygeſte meate peragere mortem dye peragere re geſtas wryte al done vbi ſententiam meam uobis peregero haue ſhewed myne opinyon peragro walke go place peragrare per animos hominum paſſe men harte people fauour peragrare latebras ſuſpitionum ſeeke coniectures wherof ſuſpition may happen peragratus ta tum gone peragratio goynge perambulo go throughe ſometyme ryde countrey fielde peramo loue well peranno annare continue lyue ouer yere perardeo dere bourne perareo ere drye vp dry perareſco idem peraro tylle perbacchor ari oftentymes drunke perbellè well ryght well perbibo bibere quafte drynke perbitere praeire go per cauſam cauſe perca fyſhe callyd perche percalleo lêe waxen harde percallere uſum alicuius rei knowe perfytely vſe thynge percautus ta tum ſubtyll wytty percelebro publyſhe place perculit eum illud abateth courage ſtrake hym harte percellere pectus pauore troubled ſpirite feare perculſus animus et abiectus ſpirite troubled courage abated percenſeo ſére recounte reken percingo gere gyrde percedere departe percello li lere ſtryke ouerthrowe percino nere ſynge ſtyll continewe ſyngynge percipio caepi cipere perceyue take receyue comprehende lerne neque agri neque urbis odiū unquam percipit neuer wery eyther countrey citie percipere uſum alicuius rei vſe thinge percipere opinione doubt thynge perclam priuilie perduaxo perdo peredia meale men eate hungerly perceptio uerbale perceptio fructuum takynge profyte reuenues perceptio animi vnderſtandynge percitus ſtyrred percitus inſania madde percoarcto brynge lyttell roume percolo ui ere worſhyp moche percrebreſco bui beſcere publyſhed ſowen abrode place percrebuit bruyte voyce people percolo ui ere worſhyp moche percontor aris ari ſerche enquire buſily percoquere boyle throughly percoctus well boyled percudo di dere breake perculſus percuſſus ſtryken percunctor aris ari enquire demande percuro heale perfytely percurſum animo playnly knowen percurro rere runne apace runne tell reade thynge quickely percurſo ouerrunne percutio cuſsi tere ſtryke ſmyte percutere fore knocke doore percutit animum brake hart ſtrake hym harte percuti ſydere taken haue vſe member taken hym percuſſae de coelo turres towres beaten downe thunder percutere foedus make league alyaunce one prynce one coū trey citie nother percutere foſſam dyg dyche trenche percuſſor murderar perditè extremely perditus ta tum loſte peryſhed without recouery hope perdius abydynge day watchyng al daye whyche dothe thynge day tyme perditium herbe callyd pelytory wal reade helxine parietaria perdix dicis partryche perdo didi dere loſe ſlea perduco duxi ducere brynge ende brynge leade force meanes perduellio oni treaſon agaynſt kynge countrey alſo traytour perduellis ennemy peredo edi edere eate peregre man proper countrey peregre uado go countrey pylgremage peregre uenio come oute ſtraunge countreys pylgremage peregrinor aris ari go ſtraunge countreyes pylgremage peregrinus ſtraunger alyen peremptalia amonge augures thoſe lightnynges whiche dyd vtterly dyſtroy put awaye ſignifications lyghtnynges token precedynge perendie day next morowe perendinus dy idem perennis fluuius courſe water commeth rayne brooke onely made rayne perenniter continually perennis ne perpetuall euer durynge perennitas tati continuance long abydynge perenno dure contynue per exiguum tempus ſhort pereo iui uel ij ire loſte conſumed alſo dye perire ab aliquo ſlayne one perierunt aedes howſes downe ruyne perijt illi pudor aſhamed nullus otio perit dy day loſte ydelneſſe tua arte uiginti mina pro pſaltria periêre thy craft haue caſte awaye twenty noble ſyngynge wenche ne pueri pereant fame chylderne dye nat hunger quod ſi fit pereo funditus yf ſo vtterly vndone perire morbo dye ſyckenes peream wolde ſhulde dye perit ab animo courage fayleth hym perire mulierem dye loue woman pererro go ryde perfacul auncient writer vſed facile lyghtly per fa nefas ryght wronge oone way perfectè perfytely perfectus um perfytte accomplyſſhed opteyned perfector oris bryngeth thynge paſſe poynt perfero ruli ferre brynge concluſyon alſo brynge telle tydynges ſommetyme ſuffer indure perficio cere accomplyſſhe brynge poynt opteyne perfidioſus um full dyſloyaltie perfidioſé diſloyally trayterouſly perfido dere truſte moche perfidus falſe promyſe dothe thynge agaynſte truſte put dyſloyall perfidia falſehode againſte promyſe truſte diſloyaltie perfidus truſty perfines perſtringas ſtrayne thou harde perflatus great blaſte wynde perflo blowe vehemently ſtrongly perfluo xi fluere runne water doth broken veſſell perfodio dere bore perce throughe ſtryke throughe dygge bottome depeſt thynge perfore come wel paſſe perforare perce make hoole throughe perfortiter myghtily perfoſſus um perced throughe ſtryken dygged throughe perfracté obſtinately perfrigefacio perfrigefacere make verye colde perfrico care rubbe moche perfricuit faciem aut frontem aut o prouerbe moche ſaye hathe layd apart ſhame ſhameleſſe without abaſhement perfrictae frontis without ſhame honeſty perfringere breake piece perfructus eſt hath taken fruite pleſure thynge hath vſed exercyſed thynge hath left vſe exerciſe therof perfruor perfructus perfretus aut perfruitus perfrui take profyte commoditie take pleaſure recreation thynge perfuga fleeth contrary part battayle forſaketh capitayne perfugio gere run vnto one ſuccour perfugium place wherevnto man runneth haue ſuccour kept daunger alſo taken thyng wherby mā maye ſuccoured perfunctoriè paſſynge ouer lyghtly perfunctorius um whiche paſſeth lyghtly away taryeth longe perfunctus hath done diligentlye duetie offyce perfundo perfudi fundere poure droppe ſtyll perfundit que genas lachrimis teares dropped downe cheekes perfundere animum relligione ſcrupulouſe perga towne pamphilia wherof diana called pergaea pergama orum towres troye pergamena charta parchement pergama ſiue pergamus citie aſia whiche silenus ryuer paſſeth ſame citie called troy perge go paſſe forthe perge uirum playe man go lyke man go hardely pergin wylt thou leaue wylt thou gone pergrandis de great pergo perrexi pergere go procede endeuour thyng continue make haſt aſſaye ire perrexi endeuoured go suſpenſo gradu placide ire perrexi aſſayed lyght pace go ſoftly pergunt domos eorum went theyr howſes c pergo praeterita wyll ſpeake whiche paſſed domum ire pergam wyll make haſte go home pergraecor aris ari ryotouſe eating drynkynge hauntynge harlottes pergrauè greuouſly pergula galery properly open bothe ſydes alſo place ſhyppe wherin men walke alſo vyne rayſed fourme herber ſometyme company warkemen obeyinge chiefe warkeman pergulana uitis vyne runnyng frame perhibeo êre ſay gyue affyrme praetium perhibere ſette pryce perhibere teſtimonium beare wytneſſe perhibere uerba ſaye perhorreo rere ſore aferde perhorreſco idem perhumane perhumaniter ryght gentilly perhyemo indure wynter periander one ſeuen wiſe men greece periclimenon herbe called wodbynde whiche beareth honyſucle pericles noble valyaunte capytayne athenienſis excellent wytte naturall eloquence inſtructed philoſophy anaxagoras ſo therby atteyned meruaylouſe great knowledge noble courage pacience ſo moch whā lewde perſon folowed hym houſe reuylynge hym waye whan come dore beinge nyghte perycles commaunded one ſeruauntes take torche bryng hym rebuked hym home houſe alſo great eſtimation auctoritie amonge people athene wolde neuer feaſtes bankettynges receyue man anypreſentes gyftes dyd go euerye aſſembly counſayle beinge dydde ſpeke reaſon euery matter reſerued ſelf thynges gret importance yet ſemed tymerouſe yet eloquence ſo excellent voyce pronunciation ſoo pleaſante ſentences ſo ponderouſe vehement neuer ſpake therto men conſented therefore wrytten fulminate wordes ſaye proceded thūder lightnynge ſuche temperance althoughe ſemed haue al athenyenſis commaundement yet neuer increaſed owne reuenewes worthe oone ferthynge augmented commune treſure excedyngelye ſuche ſpoyle came parte warres dydde imploye vpon grayne vittayle diuiding among people tyme neceſſitie onely infortunate owne child eldeſt ſone xantippus perſecutinge hym ſondry diſpleſures openly mockyng withſtandynge reaſon dyed miſerably father▪ fynally pericles beinge ſycke vnto death noble men commen vnto comforte hym ſpeking ſoftly communed proweſſe victorie nyne greate battayles herynge ſpake ſayde vnto theym moche maruayled extolled ſo moche thynge wherof parte perteyned fortune hapned dyuerſe capitaines well whiche mooſte prayſed ſpake nothynge neuer man ſaid mine occaſion cauſe put murnynge garmentes vpon hym plutarchus uitis afore incarnation chriſt 441 yeres periclitor aris ari peryll alſo experience proue thinge periclitatio experience aſſaye periculoſe daungerouſly periculoſus um daungerouſe pericuium peryll daunger ſometyme experience profe periculum facere proue perhiodus clauſe circuite wordes continuaunce ſpeakynge perhiodice febris feuers whiche come courſe fyttes perillus artifycer whiche made bul braſſe wherinto beinge glowynge hotte men ſhulde put tourmentynge theyr ceienge noyſe ſhoulde iſſue lyke mowynge belowynge bulle whiche engyne whanne perillus giuen phalaris cruell tyraunt cauſed craftes man firſt put proue owne experience perimo emi imere kyll perimere reditum alicui lette ſtoppe one waye perimere conſilium alicuius breake diſappoynt one enterpriſe peremptus ta tum kylled peridoneus um mete periegeſis compaſſe cyrcuite perij loſte diſtroyed perij animo harte courage gone perire mulierem loue womā feruently periclymenum herbe called wodbynde honyſuckle perinde ſo inlyke wyſe euen lyke moch uen faſcion perinde que capta urbe like citie ben wonne nulla perinde motus quam reſponſo ſo moche moued thinge aunſwere sed perinde erit ut accoeperis ſhallbe euen thou wylte take aduentus non perinde gratus fuit commynge verye pleaſaunte acceptable perinêphra grekes called thoſe beſtes whiche fat kydneys perinthus citie thrace whiche nowe called heraclia periodicus ca cum goeth commeth courſes periodica febris feuer whiche cometh courſes tertians quartanes perioeci companion dweller gether one houſe peripataſma hangynge houſe tapeſrye lyke thynge peripateticus philoſopher ariſtotles ſeete opinion peripheria circumference periphraſis circumlocution one worde expreſſed many periplorema fygure whanne parte ſentence nothynge neceſſary added vnto verſe peripneumonia apoſtome lunge procedynge thycke humour commonly foloweth pleureſy peripneumonicus whiche hath diſeſe perîpſema matis powder duſt cō meth fylynge ſhauynge mettall wodde periſcelis idis ſloppes whiche woman wonte weare periſſologia ſuperfluous ſpeakynge periſterae houſe culuers doues periſtereon culuer houſe periſterotrophium idem periſtrôma tapeſ • couerlyddes ara verdure periſtylium place ſet pyllers perite aduer wyſely kunnyngly perito rare peryſhe loſte perithous companyon theſeus peritia cunnynge ſcience peritus cunninge perfite ſcience periuro rare ſweare vntrewelye periured periurioſus man whiche often forſworne periurus forſworne periured periurior forſworne periurium periurie perizoma matis breche perizonium corſe brode gyrthe wherwith maydens wonte gyrte vnder theyr pappes perlego legere rede ouer perlecebra thynge whiche pleaſantly draweth man fauour perlepidus perlepida perlepidum veraye fayre perlibenter good perliberalis lyberall perlibro way diligently perligo gare bynde harde faſte perlitus ta tum anoynted harde perloquor qui ſpeake ende ſpeake perfitely perlucidum pellucidum cleere man may ſe throughe water glaſſe horne perluo luere waſhe ouer perluſtro ſt • beholde permadeſco moche wette made moyſte permadefacio cere make verye moyſte wete moche permadeo idem permagnus um greate permano permaneſco neſcere diſcloſed knowen diuulgate permaneo manſi nere abyde permano runne ouer fall declared openly per manus traditum whiche lefte frome one taught one father telleth leaueth ſonne ſonne ſo contynually lyne permatureſco ſcere throughe rype permerdo defyle ouer per aut te aut illum aut aliquid aliud ſtare whanne thynge cauſe thynge done omnia iam parata erant niſi per eum ſtetiſſet nowe al thynges redy occaſion lette permeſſus aut permeſsis ſsidos ryuer greece dedicate muſes permiſceo permiſcui miſcere myxte together permiſsio ſufferaunce permitto miſi mittere ſuffer yelde delyuer thraſte throwe downe commytte ſende forthe lette downe lette downe one rope lyke thynge permittere equum gyue horſe brydell let go pleaſure permittere ſeſe yelde hym ſelfe permittere gyue leaue aethiopia peroſus ſa ſum extremely hated perpaco care ſet thynge peace perparum lyttell perparce ſcarſely nyghely nygardely perpaſco perpaui perpaſcere fede vttermoſte perparuus um littell one parpaucus ca cum fewe perpauxillus um idem perpauefacio pauefeci facere make ſoore afrayde perpello perpuli perpellere conſtrayne moue induce one thynge perpendicularis dyrectely downe ryghte perpendiculum plumlyne ſuche maſons carpenter haue leadde ende whereby proue euenneſſe theyr ſquares perpendo dere examine alſo conſyder perpenſé aduiſedly conſideration perperam amiſſe ouerthwartely vnhappyly wrongfully perperi fooles ideotes ſhrewes lycrs perperitudo ſhrewdenes foolyſhenes perpero marre thynge perpes perpetis perpetual noctem perpetem dormire ſleape nyght longe perpeſſus ſuffereth moche peyne perpetim perpetually without ceaſynge perpetro trare properly commytte acte good yll perpetuo continue without ceaſſynge perpetuus petua petuum perpetual euerlaſtynge continuall holl portion diuyded perpetior perpeti ſuffer pacientelye endure perpeſsio endurynge perpeto perpetere aſke importunatelye without ceſſynge perfourme perpetratio acte good bad pepetuitas eternitie euerlaſtynge contynuaunce perpetuum perpetuô aduerbes ſignifieng continually alway euer perplaceo perplacui perplacere contente moche perplector perplecteris plecti bynde twyſte harde faſte meddle ſo gether man knowe thynge meaneth perplexe loqui ſpeake nowe one thyng nowe man wotteth meaneth perplexim idem perplexor aris ari ſpeake doubtfullye wordes wherin two intendementes ſcio quo uos pacto ſoleatis perplexarier pactum non pactum eſt non pactum pactum est quod uobis lubet well knowe well inoughe faſcion wonte ſpeake manne tell howe take promyſed promyſed promyſed promyſed euen liſteth perplexabile worde ſpoken whiche hathe two dyuerſe vnderſtandynges one thynge herynge vnderſtandynge perplexabiliter doubtfully perplexus plexa plexum perplexed twyſted gether harde louſed intrycate amatores god thou fyndeſte verye fewe trewe louers happen commune womenne per belongethe quam paucos pol perpoto perpotare drynke daye drynke ſtyll continually vntyll one drunke perpotatio contynuaunce drynkynge drunkerye perpulcher perpulchra perpulchrum verye fayre perpulchre well done perpruriſco perpruriſcere haue greatte ytche deſyre clawe ſcratche perpurgo gare make thynge cleane neatte perputo perputare declare nunc operam date ut ego argumentum hoc uobis plane perputem nowe take ye hede maye playnely declare matter vnto perquam added nowne adiectiue augmenteth power perquàm doctus verye well lerned perquàm ſtolidus verye folyſhe perquiro quiſiui quirere make dyligente ſerche examyne perraro ſelde perrepto tare go ſoftelye moche peyne perrideo perriſi perridere laugh hartily perriſio ſere ſcorne laughe one make laughe perrogo gare deſyre hartely perrumpo rupi rumpere breake ſunder myddes perſa man womanne countreye perſia perſaepe often perſanctè deuoutly ſolempnely perſcribo perſcribere wryte thynge throughe ende regyſter inroll thynge perſcriptio deede mannes owne wrytynge perſcrutor ſcrutari ſerche inquire dyligentlye perſefacul olde auncient wryters vſed perfacile lightly caſily perſenex perſenis olde perſentiſco ſcere perceyue well perſephone ſurname proſerpina ſignifieth vertue ſedes ſpringinge perſepolis citie countrey perſia perſequor eris qui purſue contynue whiche begonne perſecute auenged perſequi aliquem bello warre agaynſte one perſequi aliquem ueſtigijs folowe one ſteppes perſequi numeris curſus ſyderum calculate courſe ſterres perſequi iniurias aduenge perſequi factis quod dicimus ſpeake perſequi imperium patris father commaundement perſequi ius ſuum defende right perſequi poenas alicuius reuenge one deathe perſequi promiſſa alicuius ſolicite one kepe prommyſe perſequi uita diſciplinam recte uiuendi lyue accordynge doctryne lyuynge honeſtely perſequi uoluptates addicte giue hym ſelfe lyue pleaſauntly perſea tree whiche groweth highe wood blacke leaf floure lyke peare leafe neuer falleth beareth alway fruite whiche quantitie peare fourme long incloſed huſke like almonde grene coloure hath hym nut like damſyn leſſe ſofter fruite ſwete dilectable lyghte digeſtion althoughe excedyngely eaten hurteth rote great perſero perſeui perſerere ſowe aboute abrode perſeuerantia ſtable abydynge thinge reaſonable perſeueranter conſtantly perſeuêro rare continue ſtedfaſte mynde perſeus noble knyghte whiche delyuered fayre lady called andromeda whale alſo ſlewe meduſa tourned men ſtones alſo ſygne amonge ſterres perſia countrey eaſte part world hath north mediā weſt suſianam eſte carmaniam ſouthe perſian ſea called sinus perſicus nowe sophy reigneth perſica poma fruite called peach perſicus ca cum perſia perſideo dère ſytte perſiſto ſtere abyde alſo tary perſido perſe vnto botome perſolata herbe called clote leaues beareth great burtes perſoluo uere paye truely paye accomplyſhe perſoluere grate gyue thankes perſolus alone without company perſona viſour lyke mannnes face alſo perſon perſonage amonge diuynes late philoſophers ſometyme qualitie man perſonatus maſker wearethe vyſour perſonata felicitas counterfayte felicitie perſonata uulnera hydden woundes perſonata herbe whiche growethe water ſyde hauynge great brode leaues like gourde greatter harder ſuppoſe herbe whiche ſome countrey called donye perſonatus tus maſke perſono perſonare ſowne ſowne perfectly perſpecto tare loke well perſpectus ta tum playnely perceyued knowen perſpicacitas tati quickeneſſe ſyghte conſyderation perſpicacè aduiſedly good conſideratiō perſpicaciter idem perſpicientia perfecte knowledge perſpicuè clerely openly euidently perſpicax acis ſeeth quickely dothe thynges conſideration perſpiceo ſpexi ſpicere ſee vnderſtand playnely perſpicuitas ratis clereneſſe properly wordes ſentences caſynes perſpicuus um clere playne eaſye perſpiſſò aduerbe late perſtino ſet pryce thynge perſto ſtiti ſtare abide firmely perſtrepo pui ere make great noyſe perſtrictores iuglers perſtringo perſtringere wringe harde towche thynge ſhortely ſpeakynge writynge dull darke moche lighte perſtringere aures fyll eares noyſe perſtringre nomen aut famā giue man yll name perſuadeo perſuaſi perſuadere induce one beleue truſte aduyſe ſtyrre vehementely perſuaſibile perſuaſibiliter ſuch wyſe maye perſwade perſuaſor oris perſwader inducer • thynge perſuaſtrix woman whiche induceth moueth one acte perſuo ere ſowe vp pertaedeo dère pertaedeſcere verye werye pertego tegere couer per tempus tyme conuenient ſeaſon pertendo dere extende pertento tare tempte aſſaye proue moche pertero triui terere rub frot thynge perterreo rui perterrere make aferde perterrefacio cere idem perteſus diſpleaſed annoyed sermonis perteſus wery communcation perteſus ignauiam ſuam diſpleaſed ſlouthfulnes pertexo texi texere make ende conclude properly wayue weaue perfectly pertica ſtaffe rogel perche poll wherwith grounde met pertimeo pertimeſco pertimeſcere feare moche pertinatia obſtinacle perſeuerance conſtance pertinaciter obſtinately pertinatius obſtynately pertinas acis obſtinate holdeth faſt pertinatior pertinaciſsimus mooſte obſtinate ſometyme conſtant pertineo pertinêre extende thynge touche thynge tuas pertinet aedes ti commeth home thy houſe toucheth thy houſe gratius mihi futurum quam ſi ea tua liberalitas pertinuiſſet ad rem familiarem meam ſhall pleaſure ye hadde extended liberalitie towarde mine owne proper commoditie pertinet verbe imperſonall pertinet ad te belongeth concerneth pertinet ad rē apperteyneth belongeth matter pertinet ſomnium ad hoc euen dreamed eadem bonitas etiam ad multitudinem per tinet beſemeth well people haue goodneſſe men pertineo pertinêre perteyne belonge ioyned pertinax certamen ſoore batttayle neyther parte wyll giue ouer pertinax fama fame bruite whiche dureth euer pertingo tingere touche moche ioyne harde vnto thynge pertiſum olde wryters vſed perteſum pertolero indure ende ſuſteyne valiauntly pertondeo dere clyppe ſhere pertractare touche handell pertraho xi drawe force pertranſeo ſiui ſii ire paſſe per tranſennam inſpicere loke thynge fer parte pertranſlucidus ſo clere one maye loke throughe pertundo tudi tundere ſtryke harde breake thynge ſtrykynge pertundo tuſi tūdere beate hammer perturbo trouble moche vexe perturbatio trouble minde pertubaté trouble mynde vnquietly pertuſa uaſa veſſelles cracked broken ſome parte peruadè peruado peruaſi uadere go ouer peruagor ari wander publyſhed peruello elli eliere plucke ſometyme prycke peruellere aliquem plucke pul one peruellere ius diſpraiſe lawe peruelim ſcire wolde fayne knowe peruenor ari hunt ouer peruenio nire come place ende peruenire ad nummos come money owed si ad herū haecres peruenit periſti pulchre thyng come thy maſters eare thou haſt ſpun fayre threde sine peruenire quo uolo let ſpeake whiche intende ſpeake peruenire ad manus come handſtrokes peruenire ad primo ſet amonge beſte peruenire poteſtatem ſubiection peruenire tu • elam warde peruerſus um frowarde peruerſé malyciouſely myſcheuouſely ouerthwattly peruerſe uides thou ſeeſt naughtily peruerto make yll peruerte depraue peruertere officium contrary duetie peruertere aliquem deſtroye one perueſtigo gare fynde ſekynge perueſtigator oris ſeketh loketh thynge peruicax acis harde ouerthwarte yll intreate ſtubburne obſtinate ſomtime cōſtant peruicatia obſtinacy ſumetyme vſed good part taken perſeuerance conſtancie good acte pertinacia waye yll parte peruicatior oris obſtinate ſtubbourne ſometyme conſtaunt peruicaciter obſtynatly ſtubburnly conſtantly peruico peruicaci peruigil li watcheth alſo diligent induſtriouſe peruigilium moche watche alſo watchinges vigiles ſolemne dayes peruigilo watche nyght peruinco uici uincere ſurmounte peruitere olde wrytars vſed perire loſte peryſhe peruiuo uixi uiuere lyue longe vntylle vttermoſte et ſi peruiuo vſ que ad ſummā aetatem tamen breue ſpacium eſt perferundi quae minitas mihi althoughe lyue yet vttermoſte age yet tyme lyttelle ſuffer wherwith thou thretneſt pêruius uia uium maye gone penetrable aedes fient peruiae ye may come houſe whan ye lyſte peruia uentis domus open wyndes wyndy houſe peruolo flee ende peruoco care call peruro uſsi urere bourne euerye peruolo peruelle deſyre perula lyttell bagge ſcrippe peruſia citie italy peruulgatus ta tum comonly vſed knowen pe pedis foote whiche nowe conteynethe xii ynches olde foote conteyned xvi finger bredthe pes aduerbium foote pedibus idem pedibus ſtipendia facere foteman warre pedem nu quam remoued one fote pedem efferre go forthe per pedibus iſta trahantur wyll care pedem referre retrayte pedibus ire ſententiam opinion faſcion among romaynes ſenate whan diuers ſhewed theyr opinion reſidue looke whiche parte leaned vnto wente theyr place thoſe whiche rayſoned accordyng theyr myndes opyniōs theſe called pedanij senatores pede preſſo fayre ſoft ſoft pace pe corninus reade batrachion ranunculus pe gallinaceus oone kyndes fumitorie growynge walles hedge hathe leaues vnlyke faſcion grener hath purple floure peſtanae certayne vallayes campania floures ſprynge twyſe yere wherof moſte perfyte roſes called peſtanae roſae peſsinus nuntis towne phrigia pes pedibus put aduerbe ſignyfieth foote pes agmen circuibat hoſte wente foote agmine non nunquam equo ſaepius pedibus anteibat hooſte wente alwaye afore ſometyme horſebacke often foote pe louſe alſo corde wherewith ſayle ſhyp ••• ente peſnas olde wrytars vſed pennas peſeſtas olde tyme vſed peſtis peſtiēce peſsimus ſuperlatiue degree malus peſsime yll peſtifer peſtiferus um whiche bryngeth peſtilence peſtilens ti peſtilent vnholſome peſſulus barre bolt wherwith doores gate made faſte peſſum aduerbe whiche ſignifieth backewarde downewarde vnder fote peſſum ire come naught peſſum premere treade downe vnderfoote peſſundo didi dare caſte vnder foote put warſe peſſundare aliquē ſet nought bring naught peſtis peſtilentia peſtilitas peſtilence mortalitie men petaliſmus puniſhment citieof syra cuſis sicile whiche name rulars beinge written leaues olyues diuidinge ſelfe citizen whiche offended exiled fyue yeres petalitis herbe called harte tungue petalum leafe petaſatus weareth hatte petaſati ſurnames caſtor pollux petaſo oni flyche bacon petaſus hatte rounde couerynge houſe petauriſta iuglar tumbler petaurum corde ſtaffe bourde lyke thynge wheron lyght perſonages daunce proue mayſtries alſo rouſte pultry doth ſyt nyghte peteſſo ſere aſke require petigo tiginis tettar runneth ouer mannes face petilanſura houfe whyte horſe petilara thynges dry petilus la lum ſmall petilius floure groweth among brem billes later ende ſomer lyke wylde roſe colour hath fyue ſmalle leaues budde diuerſe colour hauyng within yelowe ſedes petilia citie lucania petimen ſore ſhulders beaſtes whiche ſuppoſe faſſion petitia certayne kynde appulles petiſſo ſere old wrytars vſed peto aſke demaunde peritor toris aſketh demaundethe amonge lawyer called demaundaunt alſo beggar whiche aſketh almes doore doore petoritum chariot wagon petiolus lyttell foote alſo perche wheron fruites oynious hanged petitio oni petition peto petij perere aſke gette atteyne deſyre laye awayte abyde ſtrike goo place ſeke ſworde petere gladio ſtryke aſworde petere ueneno poyſon petere blandicijs flatter petere tactu feele petere mutuum borowe alſo remember petere iugulum kyll folowe petere auribus petere naribus ſmell petere oculis beholde petere oſculis kyſſe petere ui inforce petere alſo aſſayle make aſſault one petra great rocke growynge lande petrones carles countreye alſo wether ſhepe petroſelinum herbe called perſely petulans ti wanton diſhoneſt reprochefull proude viciouſe redy wronge petulantia wantonneſſe viciouſneſſe pryde petreus um ſtone petreleon oyle whiche naturally runneth ſtone petroſus um ſtony full ſtones petulenter wantonly proudely diſhoneſtly petus hath one eye leſſe petulcus wanton peuxedarum herbe whiche hath lyttelle ſtalke lyke fenell buſſhye grounde hath yelowe flowre black roote full iuyce hath greate ſauour dothe gather feleth peyne whyrlynge heade excepte head noſethrylles annoynted oyle roſes dioſcorid ioan agricola ſuppoſeth whych callyd foeniculum porcinū whyche ſuppoſe calle dogge fenelle pexo kembe pexae ueſtes ſome menne expoundynge plinye doo ſuppoſe pexas ueſtes ſuche thynge ſhorne fyne woullen clothe veluette pexati whiche doo weare ſuche maner clothe ſylke pezitae mouſſherons growynge rootes tree ¶p ante h phaeaces people ile corcira phaecaſius ſhowe phaedra wyfe theſeus ſtepmother hyppolytus doughter minois kynge creta phaēton phaētontis worde three ſyllables ſonne phoebus clymenes longe deſyre optayned atte laſte father moughte oone daye gouerne leade charyotte ſonne vnable offyce horſes ouerthrewe charyotte burned worlde whereof iupyter beynge aferde leſte alſo ſhoulde bourned therefore ſtrykynge phaëton lyghtenynge threwe hym ryuer callyd padus erydanus phaētontides ſyſters phaēton looke heliades phaētuſa doughter ſonne reade heliades phagedaena runnyng canker pocke whyche ſhortly eateth fleſhe vnto bone phagones great eater phalacron bolde phalacrocorax acis water crowe may ſygnyfye coote phalango gare moue dryue thyng vppon roller phalaris cruell tyraunt whiche raygned citie agrigentum phagus beche tree phagineus um beeche phalangae ſtaues whereon men carye packes playne ſtaues alſo leauers lyft thynges heuy phalangarij porter whiche cary packes phalangium ſpyder whych ſtyngyng one dyeth ſoone phalanx angis hooſ • e footemenne ſette ſuche order maye incountre theyr ennemyes foote foote man man ſhylde ſhylde alſo beame balance phalanx ioyntes ſpaces fyngars alſoo roller whereon ſhyps great piece tymber remoued phalarica inſtrumente warre wherein wylde fyre incloſed whanne ſhotte faſtened tymber bournethe ſhortely phalerae trapper bardes horſe phaleratus trapped bardyd phalerata dictum gay wordes pleſant ſpeche phalerij cytie tuſcane phalernus rede falernus phaliſci certain people italy higher part tuſcana phanaticus frenetycke hathe vayne vyſyons phaneta one name bacchus phanni fantaſyes whyche happen men dreames phanias taken hyperides lyſias vſurer phanio ſaynct auguſtine epyſtles ſayth taken oone whiche broughte good lucke commynge phantaſia dyuerſely taken phyloſophers phyſitions galenus interiorum 3 affection callyd phantaſia none thīg corruption vnderſtandynge ariſtoteles de animal 2 phantaſia operation power phantaſtical ſay meuynge actuall ſence alſo phantaſia treaſoure power anymall keper fourmes fygures fyrſte conceyued commune ſenſe perceyuyng phantaſma matis vyſyon phanum temple pharāo name kynges egypte vntylle tyme salomon egyptiane toungue pharao ſygnyfyethe kynge ioſephus pharetra quyuer arrowes pharetratus beareth quyuer pharias phariae ſerpente whyche maketh furrowe grounde tayle crepeth ſo lyfteth hym ſelfe vp phariſaei amonge iewes certayne menne whyche profeſſed fourme lyuynge ſtrayghte deuoute thanne people therfore callyd name moche phares hebrewe tungue ſygnyfyeth dyuyded profeſſed contynence vyrgynytie faſte abſtynence meate twyſe sabbate dayes ſlepte vppon bourdes ſomme vppon ſtoones elles thornes kepe theym frome ſtyrrynge fleſſhely appetyte ware theyr forehead ſcrowes parchemynte wherein wrytten tenne commaundementes gyuen god vnto moyſes whyche callyd philaterias hadde great reuerence theyr elder ſoo moche wold worde dyſpleaſe withſtandynge beleuyd thyng happened conſtellation yet toke away free wyll man affyrmed ſoules immortall god ſhuld come iugement hereby came wonderfull credence people wherby drewe great multitude dyuerſe good men amonge ſaynt paule hym ſelfe confeſſeth nicodemus afterward chriſtis dyſciples althoughe multitude takyng profeſſion vaynglory peruerted honeſt forme lyuynge hypocryſie deceyuyng people chriſt ſharpely rebuked declared theyr folye yet ſome theym whiche lykelyhode good men dyned wyſe vſed theym familyarlye euangeliſtae paulus ioſephus hieronymus chryſoſtomus c phariſeus phariſey whych ſecte iewes lyued ſtrayter forme commune people dyd pharius um put aegyptius pharmacentice parte phiſyke whyche healeth medycines pharmacopola potycary pharmacum medycine ſometyme ſygnyfieth poyſon pharos lyttelle yle egypte agaynſte mouthe ryuer nilus citie alexandria yle ſette verye hyghe towre wherein greatte lyghtes nyghte longe comforte ſuretie theym whyche vyage eyther ſea lande whereof towres made pourpoſe callyd phari pharuſij people lybia whyche nowe excedynge poore pharſalia countrey theſſalia battaylle betweene iulius caeſar pompey pharſâlos cytie theſſalia nyghe whiche great ſharp battayle betwene iulius ceſar pompeius pompeius vanquyſhed fledde alſo callyd lucanus pharſalia phaſae worde hebrewe whyche ſygnyfieth departynge commonlye callyd paſcha phaſellus lyttell ſhyp called galyon phaſeoli ſorte poulſe corne whereof dyuerſe kyndes one named dolichus whiche groweth gardeynes longe ſtemme ſuccouryd ſtyckes ſette ſhortly corruptid wete aetius ſaythe onely amonge poulſe eaten theyr huſkes ruellius affyrmeth commune dolichi whyche dyuerſe colour facyoned lyke lyttell kydneys looke theym smilax nother kynde callyd alſo phaſillus whyche ſmalle ſome beinge whyte ſomme redde lyttell ſtalkes rounnynge grounde lyenge holow hauynge leaues lyke faſcyon yuy ſofter full veynes coddes lyke fengreke brothe theym nouryſſheth maketh indyfferent iuyce nother whyche alſo callyd smilax whome reade place nother callyd iſopyron whoſe leafe lyke anyſe hath toppe lyttelle heddes full ſedes lyke nigella haue certayne englyſſhe poulſe dare coniecte feare dyſdayne theſe deſcriptions menne meane wyttes maye fynde beholdynge theyr eye dyuers ſortes poulſe phaſianus feſaunt phaſis great ryuer countreye colchos alſo citie phaſma phaſmatis horryble vyſyon ſight phauorinus famouſe eloquente phyloſopher borne orlyaunce fraunce hym three thynges principallye meruayled fyrſte beyng frenche manne withſtandynge ſo excellente greeke tungue beſydes greatte lernynge lefte behynde hym noble remembraunce greke eloquence ſeconde beynge eunuchus imperfecte manne accuſed adulterye laſte hauynge emperour adriane excedyngly dyſpleaſed hym withſtandynge ouerlyued hym neuer hauynge dammage hym whyche mooſte hyghe commendation noble emperour hauynge ſentence oftentymes mouth greke kynge thanne eſtemed mooſte excellente whanne beinge diſpleaſed inferioure refraynethe anger tyme whanne emperoure dyſputed hym ende ſemed ſuffer emperour haue vyctory afterwarde frendes aſked hym howe happened whyche onely applyed ſtudye letter reputed greatteſt philoſopher athene mought vanquyſhed ſo great prynce occupyed great affayres empire anſwered ſhame vanquyſhed hym hadde xxx legyons men commaundement pherecydes famouſe phyloſopher writer tragoedies whyche dyed louſy ſyckneſſe pheretra thynges borne great feaſtes triumphes pageauntes iewels golde ſyluer ymages ſuch lyke thynges pheretrius iupyter pheretrum thynge whereon pageantes borne alſo dead corpſis phiala generall name plate whych ſerueth wyne phiala potte cuppe golde ſyluer whiche ſerueth wyne phidias excellent warkeman makynge great ymages golde yuory phidiacus ca cum phidias phiditia ſoupers whyche lacedemonyans vſyd whyche openly kepte meruaylous temperance euery man bryngynge meaſurable porcyon meate wyne philadelphia cytie myſia ioynynge lydia philadelphus callyd ptolomeus kynge egypte made lybrarye whyche fyfty thouſande bookes alſo cauſed v bookes moyſes tranſlated greke lxxii interpretours doctor iewes philagathus loueth goodnes philanthropos louer mankynde alſo gentyll kynde philargyria couetouſnes auaryce philargyrus couetouſe philema kyſſe phlieni two bretherne carthaginenſes whome wrytten carthage cyrene dydde ſtryue theyr boundes agreed ech cytie two men ſhoulde iſſue mette ſhulde boundes ſayde bretherne ſent went great waye boundes er mought retourne whan cyrene dyd ſe preuented toke diſpleaſantly menacyd two brethern yf wolde go backe ſhoulde put quyck erth ſtandyng wolde departe wherfore buryed lyue theyr cuntrey mē made ouer two aulters whiche daye callyd arae philenorum whiche nowe within royalme tunyſe philenus loueth wyne philetes kyſſer phileteria herbe callyd wylde ſauge alſo ſcrowe whiche phariſeys dyd theyr forheades wherein wryten tenne commaundementes hieron io chriſoſt decree gregory taken charmes inchantmentes writen alſo conſilio laodicenſi rede phileteria facere philippus kyng macedonia ſon amyntas father greatte alexander prynce chyldhode excellent wytte prowes theſe notable thynges remembred vanquyſhed athenienſes cheroneam began reioyce felicitie intente therfore ſhuld prone iniuries towarde ſubiectes haue indignation vanquyſhed euer cauſyd chylde come chamber doore mornyng ſaye alowde phylip thou art man mortall whiche obſerued ſo conſtantly neuer went chamber receyued counſaylours ſuiters vntyll chyld thryſe ſpoken thoſe wordes notwithſtādynge paynyme tyme athenienfes ſente ambaſſade vnto hym whyche paciently herde ſayde ambaſſadours whan ſhulde depart know ſayd thyng whiche may pleaſure vnto citie amonge democrates yll tungue callyd therſites forthwith anſwered kyng thou ſayde wylte hange vp thy ſelfe anſwere troubled reſydue ambaſſadours dyd ſet hearer indignation great charme philyp moſte gentylly coldely aunſwered say atheniēſes whyche anger abſteyne frome ſuche wordes moche prowder courage doo ſuffer ſpoken withoute punyſſhement eaſyly dygeſte ſoo prowde iniurye alſoo one namyd machetas hadde matter varyaunce hym phylyppe takynge lyttelle heed • ſpoken ſometyme ſleapynge laſte gaue iudgement agaynſt machetas cryenge lowde voyce appealed wherewith phylyppe beynge fore moued grieuouſe looke whome praye ſayde doſte thou appeale appeale ſayde machaetas vnto ſelfe beynge better awaked takyng hede ſpoken philyp waked herynge eftſones matter whan perceyued machaetas wronge wold reuerſe iugement ſūme money wherin machaetas condemned hym ſelfe payde owne treaſure pacyence ſubtiltie wytte valyant courage many haue written aboundauntly whiche readynge bothe pleaſaunte profytable afore incarnatiō chriſte 358 yeres philippeus pei certayne coyne golde ſomtyme vſyd grecia philippi citie thracia philippenſes men citie phillyra nymph saturnus begat chiron therfore ſommetyme callyd phillyrides phillitis herbe callyd hartis tungue philocalus good man kleanely manne elegant philocares herbe callyd horehounde philoctêtes ſonne paean hercules companyon buryed hym hadde arrowes philodolus loueth ſeruantes philoginos doteth woman philologus louer letter alſo greatte ſpeaker philomela nyghtyngale alſo fayre mayden whiche defloured thereus huſbande ſyſter whome poetes doo fayne tranſfourmed nyghtyngale philomuſus amorous muſis philonicus brawler ſommetyme louer vyctorye philopaes loueth chyldren philoponus laboriouſe peynefull philoſophaſter wolde lyke phyloſopher philoſophia phyloſophye loue fauourynge wyſedome philoſophice lyke philoſopher philoſophicus ca cum philoſophicall philoſophor aris ari ſtudy wyſedome philoſophus philoſopher philotheſia ſolemne feaſt among grekes philoxenia hoſpytalitie philoxenus kepeth good hoſpitalitie philtrum drynke charmed whyche cauſeth man madde loue philura ſeu philyra ſmalle thynges hangynge downe tree herbes lyke vnto heares phyma matis ſore fynger whych may callyd whytblowe phineus king arcadia inticemēt ſecōd wyfe dyd put eye ſonnes fyrſt wyfe iuſt vengeaunce god alſo made blynde foule rauenouſe byrdes callid harpyiae defyled deuoured meate preparid thoſe byrdes laſt dryuen away zetus calois courtayſly intertayned phlebes veynes phlebotomia bloudlettynge phlebotomum inſtrumente wherewith bloude letten fleume phlegethon ontis ryuer helle whiche alway bourneth phlegias ſonne mar kyng theſſaly father ixion phlegrei campi thracia iupyter battayle gyantes phlius place grecia phlox yelowe flowre lyke vyolet phlegma matis fleume phlegmon oni phlegmone ne inflamation bloud groweth impoſtume ſome part body member phoca ſea calfe maye ſuppoſed ſeale fyſhe bredeth land phocis cidis lytel cuntrey grecia betwene atticam boeotiā phocide towne delphos phocenſes people phocis phoceus phocaicus pertayning phocis phoebus ſonne aboue ſyx hundred yeres fynally caryeng ſwete ſpyces vp hygh mountayne heate ſunne labour wynges kend leth fyre wherby ſhe beynge bourned axen ryſeth lyke byrde alſo date tree paulme alſo lyttell ryuer grecia alſo brother cadmus whyche raigned phenicia alſo one tutour achilles pholoe mountayne archadia ful wod phonaſcus teacheth one pronounce moderate voyce phorbas ſheparde founde oedippum hanged vp feete phorcus one ſonnes neptunus whiche taken god ſea phoroneus moſt ancient kyng grecia phoſphorus day ſterre photion noble athenienſe ben diſciple plato xenocrates afterward one chief gouernors citie athene man ſuche wonderfulle grauitie conſtāce lyghtly ſene change countenaunce eyther laugh morne haue handes oute habyte excepte warre whan countrey went alway bare footed except colde wynter wherof noo better token ſee phocion go ſhodde ſpeche ſhort graue vehement full quycke ſentences therefore moſte eloquente oratour demoſthenes callyd hym hatchette dyd cut wordes ſuche conſtaunce apollo delphos made aunſwere one man athene contrary opinyon citie whan reported phocion roſe vp ſayde leaue ſayde countrey men ſearche whome poure god meaneth oone manne whome nothynge lyketh whyche nowe doone commune weale citie whan hadde made oration vnto people prayſynge hym conſented vnto hym tourned hym nexte hym ſayde ala haue doone feare leaſte ſomme foolyſhe worde hath eſcaped vnwetynge ſygnyfyeng people ſeldomme allowed thynge good foolyſhe tyme whan rayſoned contrarye mynde people wherfore murmured wolde haue let hym youre pleaſure countrey menne ſayde compelle wold ſpeake otherwyſe thynke man lyuyng cauſe ſo reuerende perſonage great kynge alexander begynnynge letter hadde vanquiſſhed darius ſaluted man hym antipater refuſed infinite treaſour ſent vnto alexander although hadde bene generall capytayne athenienſes ſundrye warres honourably achieuyd enterpryſes yet beſt content lyue poorely fynally vnkynde countreye menne condempned deathe whereto wente ſame countenaunce hadde authorytie whan oone whyche condempned hym lamented fearyd dye phocion tournyng vnto hym ſayde arte thou gladde thou ſhalte dye phocyon whan one frendes aſked hym yf pityuſa yle grecia callyd alſo myletus alſo herbe kynde ſpourge whiche apothecary calle eſula actuarius wryteth barbarouſe people call roote pityuſa turbit turbit whiche white thycke cometh hyl plante tree newely ſette ſometyme herbe growweth lowe plantago ginis herbe callyd plantayne plantaria ſettes plantes place plantes ſette plantaris pertaynynge foote plantarius um mete redy ſette deceyuour mocker alſo iuglar whiche maketh thinges ſeme apparance dede noo ſuche thynge water comme howſe tree growe money leaues ſtones plani piſces fiſhes flat roūd plaſma plaſmatis warke potter hym whyche worketh erthe alſo plaiſter plaſmo make pottes thynge erthe plaſtes warker ymages like thing erthe plaſtice crafte warkynge erthe platanus plane tree platanetum place plane tree doo growe platanodes promontory hyll italy platanonis ne plane tree platêa hyghe waye ſtrete alſo courte great place ouer ſee gull platalea byrde whiche foloweth water foules take fyſhes pecke ſo heade let go theyr proy whiche platalea taketh lyueth therwith plateae citie boeotia far frō thebe plateenſes people citie platee greece plato prynce philoſophers wiſedome knowlege vertue eloqence fer excedynge gentyles borne athene whoſe father named ariſton auncient honourable houſe mother called perictiona deſcended frome solon maker lawes athenyenfis one ſeuen wyſe men greece lyenge cradelle bee founden brynge hony mouth without hurting chylde whiche diuinours dyd interprete ſignification frome hym ſhoulde flowe eloquence moſte ſweete dylectable nyghte brought vnto socrates inſtructed socrates dremed helde betwene knee white ſignet hauynge fethers quickelye growen flewe vp toward heuen fylled ayre moſte ſwete tune daye plato beinge broughte father socrates beholdyng chylde ſaid byrde whoſe ymage behelde laſte nyghte name fyrſte ariſtocles called plato ſome ſuppoſe bycauſe brode ſhulders write moch brode viſage youth exercyſed body wraſtlynge feates actyuitie vntyll xx yeres olde gaue ſelfe make amerouſe verſes whiche came socrates threwe fyre bourned moſte ardently attentifely herde socrates doctrine durynge tyme lyued dyd moſte famouſe philoſophers geometrytians grecia alſo wente italy affrica egypt miſticall ſciences thought herd ſome prophetes whiche tyme liued ſenſe founden warkes ſentences aborrynge catholike faythe ignoraunte marciall affayres fought three great batayles chaſe place athene called academia wherin taught therfore diſciples called academici hym meruaylouſe ſharpeneſſe wytte comparable dexteritie diſputinge makynge aunſweres conſtaunce temperaunce grauitie diuinus plato excellent doctrine whiche conteyneth manye thynges ſayncte auguſtine ſayth whiche dothe accorde holy ſcripture ſo moche therein perceyued fyrſt parte geneſis vnto spiritus domini ferebatur ſuper aqua miſtery thre perſonnes diuinitie therin expreſſed dyed wrytynge beinge age foure ſcore one yeres afore incarnation chryſte ccc xlii yeres reade hym dioniſius plaudi haue great hangyng eares plaudo plauſi plaudere reioyce coū tenaunce clap handes gether plauſibilis plauſibile whiche people doth receiue ioye clapping handes acceptable plauſus uel applauſus conſente people voyce noyſe plautus poete comedy borne vmbria whā ſpent ſubſtance plaiers garmentes therby brought vnto extreme pouertie fayne lyuynge ſerue baker tourninge querne handemyll whan vacant ſeō labour dum aſſhamed lyttell eſtemed poenitentia repentance penaunce poeniteor peyne greurd penitudo repentaunce poenitet têbat têre repente haud poenitet care ſory therfore poenitet ambarum ornatae ut ſumus aſhamed v bothe apparayled eum poenitet deformem eſſe natū aſhamed ſo deformed noſmet noſtri poenitet contente ſelfes aſhamed ſelfes senectutis eum ſuae poenitet taketh age vnpaciently tam diu autē uelle debebis quo ad te quantum proficias non poenitebit thou ſhuldeſt haue wyll tary ſo longe vntyll thou ſhalte well content pleaſed profite ſtudy malo fortunae poeniteat quam uictoriae leuer ſory fortune aſhamed victory poenitet uerbi tui thy ſpeakynge dothe content poenitet hominis aſhamed man quantum hic operis fiat poenitet well content done poenitens ti repenteth hym poenitendus da dum whereof manne ought aſhamed miſlyketh poenitendum gerundife non eſt eius praeceptoris poenitendum nedeth aſhamed maiſter maye content ſuche maſter poeniturus ſhall repente poenitentia repentaunce alſo nowe called penaunce poenula cloke poeon man homer calleth excellently lerned phiſike poeonia herbe called pyonie alſo region countrey macedonia poenicus ca cum affrike reade punica poeninſula place polycnemon herbe called wylde organum polycrates tyraunt ſo fortunate neuer ſuffered aduerſite grief wherfore laſte dredyng chaunge fauour fortune hauynge rynge ſtone excellent valewe dyd caſte ſame wherat well aboute hym meruayled sone ſame kynge oppreſſed people hanged polydamas troyane one theym whiche betrayed citie eneas anthenor polydôrus ſonne kynge priamus hecuba father tyme warres troy herbe whiche alſo called sanguinaria hath leaues lyke rewe runneth grounde graſſe iuyce therof put noſe ſtoppeth bledynge ſuppoſed ſwynes graſſe knote graſſe polygonaton herbe ruellius ſaith whiche ſaluted hym name great capitayne called tyme latine imperator triumphed victory affrik beinge almoſte chyld yet admitted ſenate contrary auncient order rome vaynquiſhed valiaunt capytayne sertorius man time mooſte famous proweſſe exile spain inuincible alſo vainquyſhed mithridates greate kynge pontus great number concubine mithridates woman excellente beaultie taken brought vnto hym wolde company ſente theym vnto theyr frendes ſubdued theſe realmes armeniam cappadociam paphlagoniam mediam cholcidem iberiam albaniam syriam ciliciam meſopotamiam iudeam arabiam triumphed twiſe triumphed winning spain affrike triumphe brought commune treaſure golde ſyluer moneye plate xx thouſande talentes whiche commune talentes amounted xx hundred thouſande poundes great talentes xxvii hundred xxvi thouſande dclixlixiiisiiiid money beſides whiche gyuen men warre whiche ſerued hym euerye one thouſande fyue hundred braſon penny money vilivs whiche ſo great hoſte perteyned conqueſt ſo many countrayes extended wonderfull ſum money wherby may appere ryches romayns afterward mediation frendes bothe partes pompeye toke wife iulia doughter iulius caeſar whiche liued longe amitie betwene pompey caeſar decreſed laſt inſaciable ambition bothe braſt one ſuſteynynge others honour wherof came warre ciuile betwene theym wherin caeſar fewer number vainquiſhed pompey priuily fled ſea egypt vnder ſaulfe conducte kynge ptholomeus ſlayne bote heade ſtriken bodye caſte ſtronde poorely buried whan liued lx yeres aboue frome youth moſte highe honour welthe proſperitie ſemed fortune hadde moſte prodigally powred treaſure pomponius atticus honourable romayn gentill auncient houſe child hode amiable viſage ſwete voice pronunciation therwith hauynge ſharpe witte apte vnto lernynge diuyſion partes taken rome went dwelled athene peple moſt tenderlye beloued well honourable vertues benefites toward beinge lefte riche father ſubſtance great reuenues often tymes reliued neceſſitie comune people wherfore ſynguler reuerence abode athene excellencie theyr eloquence called atticus dyd treaſure kepe people vſery alſo time ſcarſitie gaue euerye citezen ſeuen meaſures wheate called medimui whiche meaſure v buſhelles dī one pecke one galon one quarte euery one loued euerye man charitable men whan cicero went exile gaue vnto hym ccl thouſande seſtertios whiche amounteth oure moneye mxlilixiiisiiiid sylla withſtandynge great pryde hym reuerence mooſte loued hortenſium ciceronem prynces eloquence although hym ſelf wel latine tunge greke perfecte man yet wolde neuer practiſe excellent warkes greke latine whiche periſhed ineſtimable detriment ſtudiouſe pompholix herbe whiche manardus writeth apothecary call nill pompeiopolis citie nauer called pampilona pompeianus pompeius parte fauourer pompeius pomum generall name fruites moſte vſed appull ponderitas hefte poyſe pondero raui rare way ponder conſyder eſteme pondo indeclinabile ſometyme ſignifiethe pounde weyghte olei pondo octaginta foure ſcore pounde weyght oyle ſometyme weyghte onely corona aurea libra pondo crowne golde pounde weight somtime ſignifieth value moneye whiche like mina amonge greekes conteined hundred dragmas ſo pondo amonge romaine conteined hundred denarios ſiluer pondus deris poiſe weight magna auri pondus great waighte ſumme golde dothe alſo ſignifie charge bourden habere pōdus apud aliquem haue auctoritie aboute ſome man great eſtimation one eius filius eodem eſt apud pondere quo fuit ille ſonne ſame moche eſtimation euer ponduſculum littell ſmall waight ponderoſus um waighty ponè behinde pone eum eſſe uictum put caſe vainquiſhed pono poſui ponere put ſet ceſſe buylde laye aparte ponere ſpem hope accuſatorem ponere ſuborne hier one accuſe man ponere ante oculos rem aliquam ſet eies cauſe hym remember make thynge appere clere de rebus ante oculos poſitis diſputare diſpute thynges clere queſtion quod erat ante oculos poſitū man doubt bene ponere beneficium apud aliquem pleaſure one require caſtra ponere pitche ſette campe warres poſituū conſilium fortuna fortune hath therof diſpoſition wyl pleaſure fortune ponere curam ſet ſyde care ponere curam aliqua take care thinge cuſtos frumento publico eſt poſitus charge gyuen hym common graynardes ponere dy multos rem aliquam employe ſpende moche tyme thynge eſt n poſitum te totum wheit ſhall done ponere exemplum allege exaumple ponere ſe extra culpam diſcharge hym ſelfe whiche layde vnto hym ponere fundamenta laye fundation po • ere admirādis tel meruaile ponere aliquid admiratione meruayle thynge ponere aliquem aequo duobus ſummis eſteme one equallye moche two greatteſt ponere aequalitate eſteme oone moche neque ego hoc tua laude pono alia ſunt tua facta que conſilia ſumma laude digna accoumpte amonge thy prayſes thyn actes procedynges doo deſerue moche prayſe maye gyuyn ponere promptu dyſcloſe men ponere ſolem ſette agaynſt ſunne optimum ſpe ſibi ponere aliquid haue good hope thynge ponere uitio take ylle parte interprete warſte ponere mala initia begynne yll ponere loco contumeliae reproche one thynge ponere beneficij loco take frēdly tourne pleaſure tantum ea arte ponitis ye ſet ſo moche arte munus bene poſitum gyft well beſtowed ponere nomina rebus gyue name thynges ponere omnia uoluptate eſteme noothynge ſoo moche voluptye carnall apperyte ponere operam beſtowe labour bene opera poſita peynes well beſtowed ponere operam alicui attend one buſyneſſe ponere oua lay henne dothe ponere pro certo ſum ueritus dare affyrme trouthe dare aſſure ſo bene ponere officiū apud aliquem haue loſte labour doynge hym pleaſure sumptus nuſquam melius poteſt poni man coulde neuer haue better beſtowed money ponere multum temporis aliquo loco tary great whyle place vbi cun que poſuit ueſtigia way paſſyd ſo euer went ponere iubebam de quo quis audire uellet bad hym purpoſe ſoo euer lyſted heare tum uenti poſuere wynde ceaſſed ponere conſilium leaue enterpryſe ponere de manibus laye oute handes ponere dolorem ceaſſe ſorowfull ponere feroces animos leaue fierſeneſſe crueltie ponere arma lay aſyde theyr weapon harneyſe ponere metum take good harte ponere pudorem ſhameleſſe ponis mihi porcum thou ſerueſt table porke ponere pallium laye garmente pledge pone eum eſſe uictum put caſe vaynquyſhed ponunt philoſophi phyloſophers doo wryte c ponere gratia uel gratiam brynge fauour cic ad pons pontis brydge pontia yle ſea callyd liguſticum ſouthe parte italy wherein pylatus borne thereof callyd pontius pylatus pontica nux kynde fylberdes whych camme frome countreye callyd pontus aſia ponticum taſte whyche hath noo ſente dyſcerned ponticulus lyttell brydge pontifex ficis archebyſſhoppe pontificatus tus dygnitie byſhop pontificius um byſſhoppe pontones whyry bootes pontus ſea whyche betwene fenne callyd maeotis yle callyd tenedos alſo great cuntray ioyning ſea whyche conteyneth royalmes colchū cappadociam armeniam dyuerſe countrays ſometyme put generally ſea popa fatte greace popana fatte oyntementes popanum cake breadde popellus lyttell poore people popina tauerne vyttaylynge houſe meate eaten dewe tyme cooke ſhoppe popinatio ryotte popinalis le hande rydynge wanton dalyaunce populabundus waſtynge countreye gothe fourragynge robbynge countrayes popularis pertaynynge people accepted fauoured people alſoo ſygnyfyeth famylyar frende vſe call countrey man nihil tam populare quam bonitas nothing pleaſeth people goodneſſe vertue praeſtat diuitem eſſe ac popularem quàm nobilem ac mendicum better commynaltie ryche nobylitie beggar popularia loca place comminaltie dothe aſſemble populari nomine nobis appellantur commune fourme ſpeakynge callyd c populare ingenium holdynge lyberty people popularitas frendeſhyp occaſyon countreymen alſo fauour one beareth commune people populariter populare homely lyke people accordynge maners people populatus ta tum waſted diſtroyed populatia boyes playes populatim people alſo euerychone populatio
