poplar whoſe ſtemme long playne leaues alway ſhakynge grene within whyte backe callyd blacke poplar whyche hathe barke rough fewer leaues whyte porca ſowe rydge lande balke porcarius um ſwyne porcarius ſwyneherde porceo cere prohybyte porcetra yonge ſowe yelte porcinus na num hogge porcellus pygge porculus idem porculatio bryngynge vp ſwyne porculator fatter ſwyne porculetum idem quod porca porculus ſhoote porcatte porcus hogge porcus troianus hogge roſted manye beaſtes fowles within bealye porgam vſed auncient wryters porrigam wyll delyuer take one pori poores body whyche iſſueth ſweate porphyretes redde marble porphyreticus ca cum redde marble porphyriacus ca cum purple colour porphyrio byrde whyche drynketh yf dydde byte water hathe longe redde legges bylle porraceus cea ceum coloure leeke blade porrectè ſtreyght porrectus ta tū extended length bredthe ſtretched porriginoſus um lyke leekes porrigo porrexi rigere ſpreade offer ouerthrowe herbam porrigere confeſſe vaynquyſhed porrigere manum gyue aide ſuccours porraceus um leke porrò ſurely alſo longe farre tyme commynge beyonde forſothe porrò si ire porro pergas yf ye go vt quieſcant porro moneo fynally aduyſe leaue ſytte ſtylle quid reſtat niſi ut fiam miſer remayneth ende vndoone etiam ne eſt quid porro thynge elles quid deinde porro folowed porro ſommetyme coniunction moche sed ſometyme coniunction expletyue fylle vp onely number ſentence porro autem ne que porro ne que etiam se porro pueros à ſenibus audiſſe dicebant beynge verye yonge herde olde men ſay c porrus porrum leekes porſena name kynge beſyeged rome haue brought tarquinus porta yate portendo dere ſygnyfye thynge happeneth portentiferus tifera tiferum whyche ſygnyfyeth ſtraunge monſtruouſe thynges commynge portentificus ca cum idem portentoſus um monſtruouſe ſygnyfyenge yll lucke aduenture portentum thynge monſtruouſe ſeldome ſene whyche maye ſygnifye ſomewhat come porticus cu porche portio portion portiuncula lyttell portion portiuſculus pylate ſhyppe whyche ruleth maryners portitor oris cuſtomer hauen▪ alſoo porter dothe beare thynges bought whyther byer wyll haue hym alſo beareth men fro hauen ſhyppe porto tare beare brynge portorium frayte payde paſſage caryage marchaundyſe alſo cuſtome tallage portulaca herbe callyd purſelan portuoſus full hauens portus tus hauen re eſt portu matter thyng ſafe portu nauigare daunger poſca ſawce made vyneger water poſcinumius mia um whych requyreth money poſco popoſci poſcere aſke requyre prouoke aſſayle poſcunt pugnam offer fyght doo battayle poſcere maioribus poculis quaft drink depe one poſcere aliquem clamore crye one vbi re poſcit requiſite cum uſus poſcit whan nede po brydge poſitio ſettynge thynge poſitura idem poſitus ta tum put ſette poſitura poſitus tus ſettyng puttynge poſſeſsio oni poſſeſſion poſſeſsio fidutiaria poſſeſſion whyche oone gyueth vppon condytion ſhall redelyuer poſſeſſion vpon certayn thinges perfourmed whan therto requyred hym whyche gaue poſſeſſyon mought haue bene callyd poſſeſſyon vſe whanne feoffementes truſte vſyd englande poſſeſſor oris hath poſſeſſion owner poſsideo ſedi ſidêre poſſede bona ex edicto poſsidêre whan one hathe goodes gyuen hym iudgement decree bona publice poſsidêre haue goodes forfayted confyſcate poſsidêre palmam get price breui tempore totum hominem totam que eius praeturam poſſederat lyttel gotten handes man offyce holly poſſum potui poſſe maye non potuit quin ſuo ſemone aliquem familiarium participauerit could forbeare talkynge made ſome companyons priuy counſayle huc fac ad ut uenias ſi quid poteris ye canne come hyther yf poſſyble poteſt plurimum ad caeſarem maye doo moche good credence ceſar potin e ut deſinas canſte thou lette aloone incende hominem amabo te quoad poteſt good felowſhyp prycke forward man moche poſſyble poſt afterwarde behynde poſtea afterwarde poſtergo leaue behynde caſte backe poſteri whyche ſuccede v bloode ſonnes theyr child ſucceſſion poſterior commeth non poſteriores feram ſubauditur partes wyll laſte paulo aetate poſterior lyttell yonger omnia libertate poſteriora ducere regarde nothynge paſſe vppon nothynge lybertie poſteritas taris worlde come poſterius later ſlower vyler poſterus ra rum whyche commeth poſtera dy daye poſteri pes hynder fete poſtfero ſette behynde ſette leſſe poſthabeo bêre put backe ſet leſſe poſthac hensforthe poſtliminium redire whan manne happeth go v ennemyes retourneth home poſtmitto poſtmittere leaue behynde forgette poſtmodum afterwarde poſtquam poſtremo fynally poſtridie day morowe day folowynge day expreſſed poſtomis brake wherwith horſes mouthe broken made beare heade eaſyly poſtremus um laſte poſtremi homines vngraciouſe men poſtremum uides laſt tyme thou ſhalt ſee poſtulo require demaunde thynge whyche dewe aſker alſo accuſe ſewe one lawe complayne one ſometyme deſyre poſtulare quaeſtionem deſyre party mought ſtraytely examyned properly torture tourmentes poſtulare ius make reaſonable requeſt budaeusin annot poſtulatio ſupplyeation made prynce poſtulationibus uacare dyſpache ſuyters complayntes poſtulationes ſupplycations bylles complaynte potens ti myghty puiſſaunt hable potentia power puiſſance habilite great rule alſo place italy callyd sanctum maria de loretto potenter myghtyly puiſſantly potentatus tus power pote potis poteſtas tati power auctoritie counſaylle reaſon poteſtatem ſui facere ſuffremen come hym ſpeake hym poteſtatem gerere exerciſe authoritie offyce erit haec optio poteſtas tua shall thy choyſe c praeſertim cum tota poteſtas huius rei tua ſit specyally ſens matter reſteth thy power brynge paſſe quae tum erat poteſtas accordynge lefull tyme vix adipiſcendi poteſtas modo fuit vneth great peyne mought come poteſtas mittendi non fuit citius coulde ſooner ſende quoties mihi certorum hominum poteſtas erit quibus recte dem non praetermittā c whan often may haue ſure men whome may delyuer letter wyll forgette wryte vnto cum poteſtate proficiſci prouinciam go countray appoynted hym hauing authoritie rule poteſtatem dare lette ſuffre gyue leaue poteſtatem facere idem poteſtatem ſui facere lette ſuffer men ſpeake hym poteſtate alicuius eſſe vnder nother man rule obedyence commaundement peruenire poteſtatē alicuiꝰ brought ſubiection ponere poteſtate alicuius put hym vnto mercy poteſtur poteſt may potio oni drynke potiono gyue medycine potior potitus ſum potiri haue poſſeſſion optayne take pleaſure potiri urbis wynne cytie potiri uoluptatum lyue pleaſure potiri rerum kynge maiſter worlde potiri regni wynne countrey potiri laborem endure peyne qui bello potiti ſunt whyche haue wonne ſwordes poyne potior fruor potior potius potiſsimus melior optimus potior ſit qui prior ad dandum eſt let hym better condytion haue aduauntage fyrſte gyueth iudicabit nulla ad legendum eſſe potiora ſhal iudge none worthy rad nihil mihi potius fuit quàm ut maſiniſſam conuenirem noo thynge longed mete maſiniſſa fyrſte thynge dydde ferre ſhewe ſemblaunt countenaunce sanus ſi ſim prae te medicum mihi experam wel aduiſed wyl loke haue better phiſition thou art nihil hercle hoc quidem prae ut alia dicam nothynge regarde wyll telle prae formidine great feare prae gaudio ioye prae manu prae manibus hande praeacutus ſharpe praealtus depe praebitere paſſe paſſe forthe iourney ſomtyme perire toleſe caſte away praebeo bui bere gyue ſhewe praebêre aurem harken praebêre aures conuitijs ſuffre paciently rebuke ceruices praebere offer head ſtriken praebet errorem gyueth occaſion error praebêre indignationem cauſe indygnation iuſta praebere kepe tacke hath taken vpon hym non poſſum ſatis narrare quos iudos praebueris intus well telle howe many mockes thou haſte gotten amonge theym howe laugh within houſe o praebêre take blowes ſuffre bobbyd o praebêre ad male audiendum ſuffre one ſpeake yll face strenuum hominem praebuit played man ſhewed hym ſelfe valyaunt dydde valyantely se aequum praebere indifferent iuſtyce without rygour se aequabilē praebere alway one ſort se attentum auditorem praebere dilygent hearer quo quomodo ſe ea quaeſtione praebebat c howe ſoo euer behauyd hym ſelfe matter se credulum praebere giue haſty credence se docilem praebere eaſyly taught se alicui facilem praebere graunt gentylly one deſyre se facilem praebere hominibus audiendis admittendis que wyllyng gentyll men ſpoken gladij ſpeciem praebet lyke faſcyon ſworde erroris ſpeciem praebêre gyue occaſyon errour speciem triumpho praebêre ſet forth tryumph beſt ſhewe tyrannum praebêre behaue hym lyke tyraunt vim glutini praebet good glewe ſame force glewe baculorum uſum ſenectuti praebet ſerueth olde men ſtede ſtaffe praebia orum thynges gyuen ſy • ke men praecaluus balde praecarus ra rum dere praecaueo uêre prouyde thynge happen praecedo ceſsi dere go praecello lui lere excelle praecentio whiche ſongen playde begynnyng ſonge balade praecentor toris fyrſt ſyngeth may taken chaunter quyre praeceps cipitis hygh place ſtepe downe praeceps headlynge ſodaynly haſtily praeceps homo haſty buſyneſſe dothe thynges vnaduyſedly praeceps ingenio iram hotte haſtye wrathe praeceps auaritiam crudelitatem animus mynde inclyned couetouſneſſe crueltie quo iure qua que iniuria praecipitem piſtrinam dabit ryght wronge wyll thruſte myll houſe praecipitem abire come myſery praecipitem dare thruſt one hedlynge agunt eum praecipitem poenae ciuium romanorum quos ſecuri percuſsit cruelle punyſhement romayns byheaded cauſed hym falle ſoo haſtily praecipitem ferri rounne downe falla downe hygh place praeceps occaſum ſol ſun downe praecipite eſſe great daunger praecipitem trahere pull hym downe hygh place aſtat • praeceps ſodaynly haſtily bi patet praeceps tantum twyſe two tymes ſoo depe praeceps animi ſtourdye haſtye actes praeceps ſenectus pyts brynk age praeceptum precepte rule gyuen commaundement praecingo ere gyrde praecidanea porca ſwyne whiche paynyms dyd ſacryfice dyd cut theyr corne praecidaneus um fyrſt kylled praecido dere ſpeake tell preciſely certaynly ſtryke cutte beate denye ſtyffely plane ſine uila exceptione praecidit trewely ſtyffely denyed withoute exception praecidere ſpem put hope praecino nui nere ſynge fyrſt alſo tell thynge hapneth praecipio coepi cipere preuent take firſt forſee alſo commaunde praecipitium downe ryghte place ſteppe daungerous gone paercipito tare throwe downe headlynge praecipitanter headlynge vnaduyſedly praecipuus um chiefe ſpecyall pryncipall ſoueraygne praecipuè chiefly ſpecially principally praeciſè preciſely determynately praeciſum harde intractable cutted verye ſhorte qui praeciſis concluſionibus obſcuri saluſtium que thucydidem ſuperant whiche harde vnderſtand cutted ſentences excede bothe saluſte thucydides praeclamo crye praeclarè excellently nobly wel praeclarus noble ſometyme ſygnifieth good praecognitus ta tum knowen praeco conis crier publiſher thynges praeco feralis belle man whiche ſome town goth declaring late dead praeconium praecox cocis praecoquus um ſone rype tymely rype praeda proy thing goten takē warres praedabundus goynge forragynge tyme warre praedaceus um proy praedatiuus idem praedator ſeker proye praedator ex robber countreys praedor aris ari robbe countrey take prayes praedotiunt chiefly deſyre praeduro harder wonte praeeo iui ire go praefacio feci facere ſet praefanda honeſt ſpoken reherſed praefari ſpeake ſay praefari honorem one ſayth better sauyng reuerence honour praefari diuos praye god one enterpryſeth thynge praefatio oni preface praefecturae may called sheryffewykes amonge romayns ſygnified prouynces ſayd offycers iurisdictiō praefectus praetorij emperours principall officer court nowe fraunce great mayſter praefectus urbis great offycer rome whome belonged ſee hyghe wayes citie welle maynteyned water kepte cleane chanell ryuer tyberis ſkoured kept ſhelues▪ alſo deliuer grayn commune garner dyuyde amonge people alſo callyd praefectus latinarum gellius wryteth praefecti prouinciarum may taken amōg v ſheriffes properly ſuche haue lyke iurisdiction chaumberlayne northwales hygh ſtuarde ſouthewales wonte haue ſay peculiar authorite determe matter within compaſſe theyr offyce praefecti aerarij whyche hadde charge kepynge commune treaſure praefectus fiſci whyche kept themperours treaſour praefectus ſcriniorum lyke officer maſter rolles alſo callyd praefectus libellorum whyche offyce papinianus greatte lawyer tyme seuerus emperour praefero tuli ferre preferre praefericulum great baſon whiche caryed hym dyd ſacrifyce praefeſtino make moche haſt praefica woman whiche deſyred lament buryeng men woman praeficio faeci ficere put auctorytie gyue rule praefectura auctoritie rule praefectus rular praefigo xi gere ſhutte afore praefinio mui ire determyne aſſygne appoynt praefinitus ta tum prefyxed praefluere runne place praefoco care ſtrangle choke praeformido aferd er ſtroke come praefractus cta ctum harde vnflexible whiche wyll rather breake bowe alſo whiche broken praefractè obſtinately praefrigidus da dum colde praefulcio cire fortifye praefulgeo fulſi gere ſhyne moche praefurnium mouth ouen furneys praegelidus da dum excedynge colde praegeſtire leape ioye praegigno nere begynne bryng fyrſt nolebam ex morem praegigni malum wolde yll cuſtome ſhoulde brought vp praegeſtio ire reioyce moche praegnans anti woman chylde ſame beaſt praegnans ſus ſowe farrowe praegrandis de great praegrauatio great grefe praegredio gredi go praegrauo greue moche praeguſtare take aſſay praehendo di dere take manum praehendere take hande praehenſatio ſollycityng labouryng attaynynge ſome great offyce praehenſo imbrace ſette hande one ſolycite praeiacio ieci iacere caſte thynge praeiacio cui cere lye praeire iuramentū miniſter gyue othe praeiuditium thynge whiche beinge one decyded determyned maketh rule example men folowe dyſcuſſe ſemblably lyke mattier thoſe whiche call ruled caſes matter law whiche example iuges praeiudico iuge ſommetyme iudge example nother lyke mattier iudged diſcided praeiuro ſweare praeiuratio othe taken hym fyrſte ſweareth praeiurator toris fyrſt taketh othe fore man iurye fyrſt wytneſſe men ſwere accordyng othe gyuen vnto praelabor beris bi falle fyrſt ſlyde praeliaris pertaynynge battayle praeliator toris warryour praelicenter wantonly praelior aris ari fyght battayle praeliganeum uinum à praeligando whyche ſuppoſe ſoo callyd eyther bycauſe fyrſte tounned putte veſſelles elles bycauſe put ſacke whyche faſte knytte afore praeligo gare bynde afore praelium battayle alſo fyght battaylle ſometyme acte generation praelongus um longe praeloquium begynnyng communication thynge ſpoken whych toryke namyd exordium praeloquor queris qui ſpeake tell praeluceo cere beare lyght one torche candel alſo gyue lyght nother praelucere alijs uirtute ſhyne vertues praeludium proheme whyche muſytians mynſtrelles playe begynnynge er come ſonge whiche purpoſe playe praeludo ſi dere play praelum preſſe praelumbo breake one loynes praeluo luere purge waſhe cleane afore praemando daui ſende praemanibus redy hande praemature ſoone iuſte tyme praemature uita careo dye afore tyme praemeditor taris tari aduyſe man thynge prae fero prae tuli prae ferre declare dede worde geſture prae te fers iracundiam thou ſheweſte thy ſelfe angry alſo confeſſe alſo haue hym thynge remembraunce praemercor caris cari bye afore hande praemeſſum ſacrifyce offerynge cere eares corne fyrſt reapyd praemetium fyrſte croppe praemiatores theues ſteale nyght mought ſay whyche commytte burglary praemiator rewarder praemineo nui ere better another excell aboue aſtate vertue praemior aris ari gyue rewardes praemioſus ryche money praemiſsio ſendynge afore praemitto miſi tere ſende afore praemium rewarde gyuen hym whyche hath done notable laudable thyng premoderor aris ari playe inſtrument praemodum aboue meaſure praemoleſtia feare thynge come praemollis le tender delycate praemoneo nui nere forewarne praemonſtrator toris tellethe ſheweth thynge hapneth praemonſtro ſtrare ſhewe praemordeo dere byte rebuke praemorior riris riri dye er tyme come praemunio iui ire prepare fortify place ennemyes come praenarro rare telle praenato tare ſwymme afore praeneſtè citie italy praeneſtini people cytie preneſte italy praeneſtinus um preneſte praenomen fyrſt name marcus quintus lucius nowe haue name baptyſme praenimis farre moche praenoſco noui noſcere knowe afore praenoto tare make annotation inſcryptions praenuncio ſhewe afore praenuncius fyrſt meſſanger fyrſte bryngeth tydynges praeoccupatio fygure rhetoricke whan wyll ſay wylle telle thynge yet therby couertely wyll declare matter make ſuſpected praeoccupo pare take poſſeede thynge preuencyon praeopto tare rather deſyre praeordinatio fyrſte ordynaunce praeordinator made fyrſt ordināce praeordino ordeyne afore praeparcus ca cum ſcarce nygarde praeparo prepare make redy praepedimentum let praepedio diui lette moche praependo dere hange afore praepes praepetis ſwyft lyght flyght praepetes aues byrdes whyche ſhewed ſelues fyrſt dyuinours called augures whereby ſuppoſed knowe ſhulde enſue praepeto tere begynne fyrſte praepilatus ta tum headded yron iauelyn darte alſo ſharpe afore lyke head dart though hath none yron horne lopſter wherwith ſwymmeth praepinguis fatte praepondero rare waye worthe praepolleo lere excede praepono ſui ponere put ſet praepoſitus ta tum ſet aduaunced aboue ſet auctoritie praepoſitus ti auctoritie chiefe offyce praepotens puiſſaunt mighty praepoto tare drynke afore drynge good lucke drynkynge praepoſterus ra rum ouerthwart order praepoſteri homines thing laſt whyche ſhulde haue done fyrſt praepoſteré fieri done agaynſte good order whan ſeruaunt commaundeth mayſter people ruler fole wyſe man praeproperus ra rum quycke haſty praeputium ſkynne whyche couereth head man priuy member praerancidus um vnſauery praeripio pui pere preuent catche praerideo dere laughe praeriſor oris laugheth afore one praerodo ſi dere gnawe eate moch praerogo gare employ gyue afore praerogata beneficia benefyttes afore employed praerogatiua praerogatiuum prerogatiue one preferred afore praerumpo pere breake ſunder praeruptus ta tum broken ſometyme taken hyll broken ſides harde go praerupta loca place broken man maye paſſe praes praedis vndertaketh whiche hath bounden hym ſelfe thynge touchynge comminaltie praeſagium praeſagatio amonge auncient writer perceyuinge thynge hapneth ſomtyme coniecture praeſagio ire diuine tell ſhall happen praeſagibat animus fruſtra ire cum exiré domo whan went houſe harte gaue ſhulde go vayne neſcio quid profecto mihi animus praeſagit mali good faythe harte giueth ſome yll ſhall happen wote praeſagus pronoſticatour perceyuer thynges er happe praeſcientia vnderſtandynge perfytte knowlege ſhall happen praeſcius knoweth perfectly thynges er happen praeſcio ſcire knowe afore praeſcribo pſi bere aſſigne note intitle put laye tell appoynte determyne praeſcriptio praeſcriptum rule lawe order fourme praeſcriptum precepte fourme rule praeſeco care cutte ſometyme cut ſonder praeſegmina paringes man nayles praeſens ti preſent praeſentia praeſentiarum preſent tyme praeſens animus ſtronge good courage alſo fauourable deum praeſentem habet hath god fauourable vnto hym mihi tua domus te praeſente abſente pateat let thy dores open whether thou home lette welcome thye houſe whether thou abrode praeſens deus god gyueth v incontinēt demaunde praeſens medicina medicine cureth forthewith praeſentius better praeſentiſsimus um beſt ſureſt praeſentiſsimum uenenum greateſt mooſte feruent poyſon alſo ſtronge praeſentiſsimum remedium moſte ſpedy ſure remedy praſentaneum argentum money payed hande praeſentaneum remedium ſhorte ſodeyn remedye praeſentia preſence praeſentio praeſentiſco cere fele perceyue doubte thynge praeſento tare haue redy praeſepe praeſepium preſepes ſtable ſtall ſhepehouſe praeſepio pire hedge afore thynge praeſertim ſpecially praeſeruatio preſeruation praeſeruare preſerue praeſes ſidis hath auctoritie prouince nexte vnder prynce lieuetenaunt viceroy ſomtyme ſignifieth defendour alſo ſure locum praeſidem ſure place praeſideo dere auctoritie dignitie alſo haue auctoritie rule praeſideratio tempeſt whiche commeth begynnynge wynter ſoner loked accuſtomed happen praeſidero tempeſte commeth ſone tyme accuſtomed praeſicco care drye afore praeſidiarius um whiche ordeyned ayde thynge praeſidium garriſon men capitayne ſet chiefe capitayne defende fortreſſe ſome tyme taken generally maner ayde defence alſo fortification thynge praeſilio ſilire lepe ſterte praeſiſto tere ſtande ſet afore praeſpeculor ari loke afore praeſpicio ſpexi ſpicere ſee afore praeſtabilis le excellent praeſtabilius better praeſtantia excellency praeſtat better praeſtans ti excellent praeſtanter excellently praeſtega place open afore couered behynde lyke porche men ſytte recreation theyr buſyneſſe praeſter venymous ſerpente whome ſtryken dyeth thyrſte praeſtes ſtitis auncient wryters callyd prelate praeſtigiator toris iugglar praeſtigiae thynges whyche ſeme praeſtigium iugglynge caſte inchauntement deluſyon praeſtino prepare byenge thyng praeſtituo ere determyn preſcribe appoynt ſhalbe done iſtam enim culpam quam uereris ego praeſtabo blame whyche thou feareſt wyll take vppon praeſto ſtiti ſtare better nother thynge wherwith comparyd excelle alſo vndertake warrante ſommetyme graunt alſo benifyciall beware eſchewe feare perform gyue exhybyte repreſent ſhewe lende aſſigne appoynt thynge non modo facta ſed etiam dictum omnia praeſtanda nobis ſunt oughte make aunſwere onely dedes alſo ſpeke emptori damnum praeſtare recompence byar loſſes damage praeſtare culpam take charge damage vpon hym nihil eſt ſapientis praeſtare niſi culpam wyſe man ſhoulde take nothynge vppon hym whiche ſhall happen throughe defaulte praeſtare fidem faythfull praeſtare fidem publicam whan conſul great officer perfourmeth whiche promyſed praeſtare nihil debeo man ought laye vnto muſſâlam caeſari praeſtabo wyll vndertake meſſala ſhall ceſars frende praeſtat officium deuoyre praeſtare iuſiurandum take othe praeſtat better preſtat furi hic ſuſpendi que apud inferos ardere better thefe hanged thanne lye fyre hell praeſto aduerbe redy hand praeſto ſis helpe praeſto eſſe appiere men place iudgementes alſo redy helpe praeſtolor aris ari tary hande redy ſeruice praeſtringo xi gere bynde faſte ſhutte daſell eien touche quickely ſhortly ſhaue greue ſomewhat praeſtruo ſtruxi ſtruere ordeyne fyrſte buylde praeſul li prelate praeſulatus tus dignitie prelate praeſulto leape daunce afore praeſultor praeſultoris leadethe daunce praeſum fui praeeſſe afore aboue dignitie auctorytie praeeſſe negotio chiefe buſines praeſumo ſumpſi ſumere take fyrſte preuente praeſumere animo coniecte praeſumptio takynge receyuynge alſo whiche called preoccupation whan declare firſte aduerſarye wyll ſaye iudges opynion agaynſte argue dyſſolue reaſon praeſuo ere ſowe afore praeſurgo gere ryſe afore fyrſte praetego gere hyde couer chiefly praetendo ere laye thynge er come alſo carye beare afore alſo ſhewe pretende allege ſet thynge incloſure praetendere auribus ſtop eares praetendere rete lay nettes praetendere ſepem make hedge praetento tare tempte aſſaye afore praetenuis e ſmall praetenué ſklenderly praeterduco cere leade afore leade forth praetergredior di paſſe go beyonde praeteritus ta tum paſſed praeteriti deade departed deceſſed alſo whiche ſuynge offyce dyd ſuffer repulſe put backe praeter propter cauſe whiche reherſed praeter excepte alſo beſyde ouer aboue praeter oculos eyen againſt contrary praeter morem agaynſte cuſtome faſcion praeter ſpem vnloked praeter opinionem wiſe thā thought praeter caetera praeter aequum againſte reaſon praeterbito tare go praeterea moreouer beſyde none el mihi credis praeterea nemini thou beleueſt none el alſo ſignifieth afterwarde praetereo iui ire go ouer paſſe leue thynge whiche ſhoulde ſpoken paſſe ouer praeterire non potui quin ſcriberem ad te coulde forbeare muſt nedes write vnto praeterijt haec re forgotten matter et hoc te praeterit non id ſolum ſpectare ſo lere doeſt thou knowe thynge conſidered non praeterit knowe well inoughe no nobilitate mago praeterijt mago beſte borne greatter bloud praeterfluere water rūne place praetermitto miſi mittere leaue vntouched forget leaue paſſe ouer thyng leauynge thynge vndone vnſpoken praetermiſsio forgettynge leauynge oute thynge praeter quam onely otherwyſe ouer beſyde praeter quam quod praeterueho cary throughe praeteruehere aliquid ſilentio leaue thing vnſpoken praeteruerto tere put one thynge cice si habes aliquid quod huic ſermoni praeteruertendum putes ye haue thynge whiche ye thynke oughte ſpokē ye ſpeke matter praeteruolo paſſe throughe quickely praetexo ui ere make ordeyne firſte couer hyde ſpeake colourably • raetexta longe garment mixte purple ſilke whiche veſture noble men ſonnes vntyll came vnto xvii yeres age therfore ſuche chyldren called praetextati hadde alſo aboute theyr neckes lyttell rounde iewell golde facioned lyke harte wherin incloſed ſome thynge great vertue praetexta alſo robe aſtate whiche kynge romayns chiefe officer weare whan ſate theyr maieſtie praetexta comoedia enterlude wherin perſonages highe dignitie praetextatus ta tum dyſhoneſte vncleane ſpeche actes feſtus taketh contrary ſence praetextati anni youthe praetextata aetas idem praetextati more honeſt condition praetextatus ſermo communication without ribauldry praetextatus dyd weare praetextam praetextum pretence colour praetiamitatores officer whiche wente prelate called flamen proclayminge openlye men ſhoulde ceaſſe theyr warke bycauſe leful thoſe prelate beholde man warkynge praetimeo ere ſore aferde praetingo gere touche afore praetondeo ſheere klyp rounde praetoritius um praetorius praetorium ius lawe made pretor praetor tôris olde tyme euery officer whiche rule army aſconius afterwarde iuridicall auctoritie beinge chiefe iudge iudges ſittinge vnder hym wherof full number citie rome lxxv cic piſonem aſconius vpon oration pro milone ſayth iudges appoynted lxxi well plaintife defendaunte eche drawen v remayned li praetorianus attendant pretor praetorium houſe pauilion hym praetor alſo prince palaice manour ſometyme place iudgementes gyuen ſometyme counſayle whervnto pretores aſſembled praetorius hath ben praetor praetorius um belongynge office praetor praetura dignitie miniſtration praetor praeualeo lere preuayle better value praeualidus da dum ſtronge mighty ſometime great praeuaricatio colluſion alſo one toucheth thynge lyghtely whiche ought inculked playne declaration elles repeted makynge moche purpoſe praeuaricor aris ari ſwarue frome truthe go right waye leaue vnſaide whiche ſhulde ſpoken touche thynge ſhortely ſpeakyng warke colluſion ſuffringe aduerſary opteyne hurte perſon praeuaricator toris leaueth righte waye ſpeake whiche ought ſpoken alſo ſpeakyng ſelf aydeth cauſe aduerſary doth thynge colluſion praeueho brynge fyrſte praeuelo couer hyde afore praeuello lere pull plucke afore praeuenio nire come preuente praeuentio preuention praeuideo dere foreſee beware praeuerſus um whiche done ſped firſt praeuerto uertere ſette care nec uxorē praeuortiſſe dicant prae repub let ſay ſet wyfe weale publike alſo tourne ſette aſyde ne que praeripio pulbamentum ne que praeuorto poculum take away thy meate ſet turne aſyde thy drynke praeuertor deponens idem quod praeuerto alſo goo afore inde illico praeuertor domum then wente home afore alſo tourned forthe foreis enim clauſit ne praeuorteretur foras hath ſhytte faſte doore leſte ſhulde tourned forthe alſo doo thynge fyrſte thynge praeuorti hoc certum eſt rebus alijs omnibus surely ſhal done thynge praeuertere ſerio tourne erneſt si quid dictum eſt per iocum non aequum eſt id te ſerio praeuortier thynge ſpoken iape reaſon tourne erneſte praeuerti pigritiae takē ſlouth caue pigritiae praeuortier beware thou taken ſlouthe praeuertere aliquem prae republica ſette one weale publyke praeuerti rebus omnibus ſette thynge fyrſte done mandatis rebus praeuerti uolo wyll fyrſt whiche commaunded nec aliam rem praeuerti cenſebat wolde thynge ſhulde done praeuertere animum alicuius opteyn one fauour man praeuertere ſerio quod dictum eſt ioco take thing erneſtly ſpoken iape illud praeuertamur let v fyrſte ſpeake therof come matter iuſiurandi relligionem amori praeuertere eſteme othe loue praeuerſum fulgur lyghtnyng whiche knowen whether daye nyghte praeuius goeth leadeth waye praeuſtus ta tum burned ſore ende praeuolo flee pragmaticus practiſer lawe pragma greke latine negociatio acte buſyneſſe alſo exerciſe marchaundiſe pragmatica ſanctio determination practiſians lawe prandeo prandi pranſus ſum prandere dine prandiculum brekefaſte prandiolum lyttell dyner prandium dinar pranſito tare dine eate often pranſor oris diner boden dyner praſinus na num greene like leekes praſius grene ſtone praſoides ſtone coloure leekes praſſium herbe called horehounde rede marrubium pratenſis ſe medowes pratenſe foenum medowe haye pratulum lyttell medowe pratum medowe praué ſhrewedly naughtly vnhappely ouerthwartly prauitas ſhrewdeneſſe vnhappyneſſe ouerthwartneſſe prauus um croked ſhrewde praxiteles excellent caruar ſtone precarius um whiche borowed wyll lender whiche occupied mannes pleaſure precario deſyre another wan wyll preces prayer precium pryce value precioſus um deere preciouſe precor aris ari praye prehendo prehendi dere take et manum prehendi oſculum detuli tibi toke hande alſo gaue kyſſe praehenſo uel prenſo ſolicite labour men giue theyr voyces ſome man prelum preſſe ſuche printours haue premo preſsi premere preſſe ſometyme vexe dygge preſe thruſte deſtroye thruſte downe conſtrayne reſtrayne premere dolorem hyde heuyneſſe ſorowe premit alto corde dolorem hidde ſorowe ſecrete parte harte premere driue put premere ſhyt cloſe preſi que oculos ac vulnera laui cloſed eye waſſhed woundes premere cut awaye et ruris opaci falſe premes umbram ſyth thou ſhalt cut away ſhadowe darke fieldes premere treade downe veluti qui ſentibus anguem preſsit humi nitens lyke whiche thraſting fote grund treadeth ſnake lieth brembles premere teſtimonio connicte manne witneſſe prendo loke praehendo preſa porca ſwyne whiche offered ſacrifice cere ſatisfaction hoole houſeholde moche parte ſacrifice made preſēce corp whiche buried preſſatus ta tum oppreſſed charged troden downe presbiter biteri auncient father yeres dignitie vſed prieſte preſso preſſe thruſte together preſſus ſſa ſſum ſubtylle compacte heuye preſſed preſſura oppreſſion preſſus ſſus preſſura preſſynge alſo oppreſſion preſſe fewe appetite lechery priapus ydole vnto painimes committed theyr gardeynes kepe pridem late ſometime longe agone pridianus um whiche done daye pridiani cibi meates dreſſed daye pridie daye primaeuus um elder primarius um chiefe prima atis chiefe auctoritie amonge people primanus tribunus aſſigned trybute fyrſte legion prima lux ſprynge daye prima ueſpera euenynge primae 〈◊〉 chiefe prayſes cui primae ſine cō trouerſia deferebantur whome chiefe prayſes giuen without controu • rſy prima tenere haue preeminence chiefe holde better parte prima dare eſteme aboue primâtus chiefe auctoritie primitus fyrſte primetium ſacrifice eares corne whiche firſt gathered reped primores toppes thynge digitulis primoribus fyngar toppes labris primoribus fore parte lyppes primoribus labris guſtare touche thing ſcantely ſmatter thynge knowe ſubſtanciallye perfitely primicerius chiefe ruler primigenus gena genum fyrſte borne growen primigenius um commeth naturallye ſelfe vnmyxte primigenia title eldeſt chylde inheritaunce primipara ſhe hath fyrſte chylde primipes battayle fyghteth fyrſte ſworde chaungynge fourme fyghtyng vſeth iauelin dart primipilaris fighteth next ſtā darde moſte properly capitayne company fowewarde primitium principall chiefe primipilus capitayne companye forewarde vauntgarde whiche vnder hym foure hundred ſouldiours primiter primitus fyrſte primitiae firſte fruites primitius um fyrſte ſoremoſte primitiuus um whiche hath none begynnynge primeſius ſtake wherto cabell rope ſhyppe tyed primò aduerbe ſygnifieth fyrſte primodum primo primogenia uerba wordes whiche diriued primogentius ta tum fyrſte begotten primordium fyrſte begynnynge primores fyrſte chiefe primores uiri aut foeminae noble men woman gentil men gentyll woman primulus diminutiue primus primulum forthwith primum aduerbe whiche ſignifyeth fyrſte er euer begynninge primus um fyrſte beſte chiefe primo quoque tempore fyrſte tyme prima qua que occaſione fyrſte occaſyon ſhall happen primula uaeris ſome ſuppoſe dayſyes ruellius ſuppoſeth kynde verbaſcum princeps cipis prynce fyrſte chyefe principalis le principall alſo perteyninge prince principaliter principally principatus ſoueraignetie principiò aduerbe fyrſte beginninge principia place campe pighte pauilions head capitaynes proper ſignifycation therof ſecond ward battayle olde tyme prynces noble men alſo taken order raye noble men principior piari begynne principor pari rule principium begynnynge prior firſte prius priora tempora olde tyme priſcus um aunciente olde time priſtinus na num whiche many yeres paſſed sometyme ſignifieth firſt aunciente priſtis fyſhe wonderfull length ſclender whiche cutteth wawes ſwymmeth priuatus none auctorite dignite priuatus ta tum properlye mannes owne whiche perteyneth one man fewe alſo particular sometyme ſignifyeth depriued priuatim priuatè priuyly aparte priuernum towne campania priuignus na chylde huſband wyfe whiche dead ſon doughter lawe huſbande wife priuilegium lawe concernynge priuate perſonnes alſo priuate ſpeciall lawe priuo take awaye depriue prius aduerbe ſignifieth priuſquam priuus ua uum priuate ſingular euery man owne proper pro pro roſtris bar place pleadynge pro tribunali place iudgement alſo accordynge pro pla • oni ſententia accordynge ſentence plato pro opere warke pro merito accordynge deſeruynge pro curia courte pro uirili power pro comperto ſuertie pro explorato idem pro indiuiſo without diuiſion pro nihilo ducere ſet naught pro ridiculo putare aliquem laugh one make hym foole nemo ſatis pro merito gratiam regi refert man dothe thanke kynge accordyng merites pro opibus noſtris according power pro mea conſuetudine accordynge cuſtome pro ſpe nihil contigit thynge hapned accordynge men hoped pro uirili parte power power pro rata parte accordinge rate portion conſilium pro tempore et pro capere take counſayle accordyng tyme matter required pro horum temporum perturbatione conſiderynge troublouſe tyme pro mea authoritate uideor poſſe men think maye hauynge regarde myne auctoritie pro nata accordynge affayres happen pro meo iure dico tell franckely pro meo iure myne auctoritie pro ſuo iure agere omnia thynges pleaſure owne auctorite pro caetera diligentia accordynge diligence wherto hath ben accuſtomed excubare pro templis watche temple churche laudati pro contione prayſed people great aſſembly pro ſuggeſtu pulpyt pro aede iouis temple iupiter pro ſe quiſ que euery man pòwer pro teſtimonio dicere beare witneſſe maior quam pro numero hominum editur pugna battayle greater one wold haue thought ſhuld haue ben number perſonnes pro eo ac debui grauiter moleſte que tuli toke greuouſely euen cauſe prô ſancte iupiter bleſſed iupiter prô deum que hominum fidē faithe god man proauus great graundfather proauia great grandame probabile whiche maye proued probatica piſcina ponde ſheepe waſhed probatio proufe probatus ta tum proued probé honeſtly well wyſely ioyned nowne adiectine ſinifieth valde probiter idem probus vertuouſe man good man probitas goodnes problema ti ſentence purpoſed hauyng demaunde therto annexed probo proue prayſe approue aſſaye ſhewe reaſon example thynge good probare ſe declare hym ſelfe honeſt mā tuo ex ingenio alienos more probas thou eſtemeſte men like accordynge thy condicions probabiliter illa cur e ueniant quis probabiliter dixerit howe mought tell reaſon probalitas proporcyon propoſitio matter pourpoſed dyſputed reaſoned alſo wherby ſhew generally whereof wyll ſpeake propoſitum purpoſe propraetor toris ſteede praetor mayre popriè proprely partycularly propritim idem proprietarius um whervnto propertye thynge belongeth proprietas propertie proprius propria prium propre particuler culpa mea propria myne owne defaut ſometyme ſygnifyeth perpetuall voluptates deorum propriae ſunt pleſures goddes perpetuall propter sometyme nygh alſo propterea therfore proptoſis dyſeſe eyen meued inflamation fall theyr place propudium ſhame diſhoneſtie alſo moſte away propulſo put dryue away propylaeum porche proquaeſtor toris exercyſeth office quaeſtor abſence prora forepart ſhyppe prorepo prorepſi prorepere crepe prorêta hath rule forſhyppe decke prorideo ridere laughe afarre proripio pui pere withdrawe departe ioyned ſe domum ſe ex curia proripuit departed withdrewe hym homewarde court prorito tare prouoke prorogatio prolongynge delayenge prorogo gare hym haue rewarde labour proſcriptus ſo proclaymed proſcriptio maner condemnation alſo attaynder proſcripturio ire ymagyne proſcription proſeco cut ſunder proſecta bowel cut ſacrifice proſeda ſtrumpet ſhoulde conſumed fyre wherof came prouerbe next folowynge ❀proteruiam fecit hath conſumed al lefte proteruio ire play wanton proteruè proudely immoderately ſhamefully quis eſt qui tam proteruè foribus facit iniuriam ſo proudely rappeth doore ecce autem tu quo que proterue iracundus e lo thou alſo art ſhamefully angry proteruiter idem proteruitas tati pryde foly proteruus ſo proude fierſe nowe publius name roman marcus pucinum uinum wyne growynge nyghe gulfe venyce pudefio fis fieri aſhamed pudendum pryuy membres pudendus um thynge aſhamed pudens ti ſhamefaſte pudenter ſhamefaſtnes baſhefully pudeo duo dere aſhamed pudet pudebat puduit puditum eſt aſſhamed pudibundè ſhamefaſtly pudibundus da dum ſhamefaſt pudicè chaſtely honeſtly pudicitia chaſtitie cleanneſſe lyuynge pudicitiam habere vyolated acte lechery puditum aſhamed nonne eſſet puditū ſi hanc cauſam agerent ſeuere hadde bene ſhame yf purſewed matter rigorouſely pudicus ca cum chaſte pudor doris moderatiō lettith mind puritas tati pureneſſe cleanneſſe puro rare make pure purpura purple whiche ſhel fiſhe wherof purple colour commeth ſomtyme ſignyfyeth garment purple purpurarius um perteyuynge purple coloure harlottes paynte theyr viſages purpuriſſo paynte viſage ruddy purulentus ta tū full matter corruption purus ra rum cleane pure fyne pu puris matter whiche commeth ſoore puſillanimis faynt harted um pyt well puteana aqua well water putearius diggeth pytte well puteo tui têre ſtynke puteoli citie capania puteus well puticuli place commune people buryed putidus da dum ſtynkynge vnſauerye quid huus ſit rei ſciam wyll goo maye knowe matter quid rei eſt tibi cum illa haſt thou quid ſententiae thyne opynion quid iſtuc uerbi eſt meaneſte thou therby alſo quid taken aliquid ſomewhat alſo ob quid wherfore quid ſenem quoad expectas ueſtrum nowe howe longe wyll ye tary maſter note dayly forme ſpeaking quid reherſed whan paſſe one matter quid mecum eſt tibi haue quid faceret aliud ſhulde elles quid eo propere curre ad pamphilum p quid eo dic orare ut ueniat runne quickely pamphi • u p say prayd hym com quid uerbis opus eſt nede many wordes quid multa uerba idem quid multis moror ſhall longe tary quid mea refert care alſo quid ſignifieth wherin quid enim indigen affricanus mei wherin scipio nede quid iſtic si certum eſt facere facia uerum ne poſt conferas culpam woldeſt thou ſhuld thou determined go goddes name afterward put faulte quidnam wherfore quidnam ille commotus uenit commeth ſo chaufed alſo ſignifyeth reuiſo quidnam chaerea hic rerum gerat come ſe cherea dothe quid ni quo ore appellabo patrem tenes quid dicam quidni countenaunce ſhall ſpeake father woteſt thou wyll ſay wherfore ſhuldeſt thou ſo alſo ſignifyeth ye archimedem noſti p quidni knoweſte thou archimedes p ye mary quidam one man plurell number ſignifyeth ſame quid agimus ſhall quidem aduerbe affyrmynge ſpoken sometyme ſignifieth verylye ſometyme hath ſygnification diſtinction thynges ego quidem ſcribo tu uero legis ille autem dormit write thou redeſt alſo ſlepeth quid ita cur wherfore quidpiam thynge wyſe quid quaeris wylte thou nedeth wordes quid tum deni que quid ergo quid tū poſtea quid ita que quid interea quid demum theſe ſignifie wherto ſpeakeſt thou meaneſt thou hereby quieſcas uel quieſce holde thy peace leaue quieſcas caetera care reſte quies quietudo reſte eaſe ſlepe quieſco eui eſcere take reſte ceaſſe quietalis name pluto callyd god helle quietus ta tum quyete peaſyble reſte quietus eſto care quilibet cuius libet cuilibet thou wylt alſo ſometyme ſygnifyeth vyle baſe eſtimation quidliber thou wyll quin quin uenis comeſt thou quin pergis goeſt thou quin dic quid eſt go telle quin etiam allſoo pudet credo neque id iniuria quin mihi moleſtum aſſhamed beleue without cauſe alſo ſoory therefore quin taces wylt thou holde thy peace alſo ſygnyfieth yet c perij quin tu animo bono e c vndoone thou good chere alſoo therfore quin ru uno uerbo dic quid eſt quod uelis therfore telle oone worde thou woldeſt haue alſo ouer quin ipſi pridem tonſor ungues dempſerat collegit omnia abſtulit praeſegmina day barbour paryd nayles gathered parynges togyther caryed theym al order ſettynge tree gardeyne orchyarde verye exactely whyche waye ſoo euer man dyd looke tree ſtode dyrectely one agaynſte nother fourme folowynge quincuntialis le fyue ynches quincuplex plicis fyue ſommetyme vſyd femynyne gender woman quiſquam gentium idem quiſque euery manne doctiſsimus quiſ que euerye well • lernyd man decimus quiſ que euery tenthe suo quiſque tempore euery man tyme tertio braunche kynde holy whiche beareth grayne wherwith ſcarlet krymſyn colour made quiuis genitiue caſe cuius cuius ſo euer quiuis genitiue caſe cuiuſuis man one quis quae quod uel quid quis ſometyme taken ſome man quiſpiam ſome man quiſquis ſo euer quo whyther quo abis whither goſte thou quo non perreptaui uſque omne oppidum ad portam ad locum quo non wente towne aboute gate laake noo place alſoo ſygnifyeth frome whenſe illuc quaeſo redi quo coepiſti beſeeche tourne backe agayne thou beganneſt alſo bycauſe non pol quo quenquàm plus amem aut plus diligam eo feci good faythe dyd bycauſe loued fauoured man alſo wherefore forma bona memini uidere quo aequior ſum pamphilo remembre ſhe wel fauored wherfore leſſe dyſpleaſed pamphilus quo gentium whyther alſo quo ſygnifieth neque enim id feci quo tibi moleſtus eſſem dyd wolde dyſpleaſe alſo purpoſe vſe quo mihi fortunam ſi non conceditur uti pourpoſe ſhall fortune ſerue yf maye haue commoditie quoaxo cry lyke frogge quoad vntyll longe quoad eius moche may quoad quenque peruenit aut peruenerit ex praeda ex manubijs ex auro coronario howe moch pray ſpoyle garlandes crownis victours comen ſhal come handes quoad eius facere poſſum moche may quoaduſque vntyll quocirca wherfore quod wherin sed ſi quid ſit quod mea opera opus ſit aut tu plus uides quàm ego manebo yf thyng wherein ye ſhall haue nede ſeruyce ye perceyue doo wylle tarye alſoo putte quem alienum hominem intromittat neminem quod illa aut amicum aut patronum nominet maye let man whome ſhe wyll calle derlynge mayſter nube grauida candicante quod uocant tempeſtatem albam grando imminebit whan dothe appiere greatte clowde waxeth whyte whyche calle whyte tempeſte ye ſhall haue hayle ſhortly alſo ſygnifieth moche bycauſe senatuſconſulta duo facta ſunt odioſa quod inconſulem facta putantur catone domitio poſtulante two actes counſayle made diſpleaſant moche ſuppoſed made deſyre domitius cato alſo ſignifieth quod ſi quieſcem nihil eueniſſet mali let alone none yll happened hadde bene welle ynough alſo moche tu uelim quod cum commodo ualetudinis tuae fiat quam longiſsime poteris obuiam nobis properes wolde ye moche may health perſone make ſpede meete v farre home ye alſo ſygnyfieth si ad uitulam ſpectes nihil eſt quod pocula laudes thou conſydereſt caulf wel cauſe thou ſhuldeſt prayſe ſo thy pottes uiam quod • edes hoc tempore nihil eſt noo cauſe thou ſhuldeſt take thy iourney tyme alſo ſignifieth wherfore quod te per genium dextram que deos que penates oſecro obteſtor uitae redde priori wherfore beſeche praye thy good aungelles ſake loue betwene ſayntes whyche thyne auouryes reſtoore eftſoones fyrſte lyfe ſtate erſte alſoo ſygnyfieth sane quod tibi uir uideatur eſſe hic nebulo magnus eſt thou thynkeſt man ſurely ſtourdy vacabounde quod abſ que moleſtia fiat ſo dyſpleaſure vnto quare pergratum mihi feceris ſi eum amicitiam receperis atque eum quod abſque moleſtia fiat ſi qua opus ei fuerit wherfore ye ſhall ſyngular pleaſure yf ye take hym fauour ſo dyſpleaſure vnto whan nede requyreth good lorde mayſter vnto hym quod quidem non nouiſti p quod quidem ueniat mentem doſt thou knowe p remembre quodammodo ſomewhat quamobrem ut hi qui ſuperiores ſunt ſummittere ſe debent amicitia ſic quodammodo inferiores extollere wherfore lykewyſe whiche ſuperior ſtate degree ſhulde humble ſelues frendſhyp ſo whyche inferyour ſhoulde aduaunce ſette theym ſelues forewarde quodcun que ſo euer quodcun que militum quotcun que milites vos hortor ut quodcun que militum contrahere poteritis contrahatis aduyſe many ſouldyours ye gette ye gather vnto quominus vt non si poterit fieri ut ne pater per ſtetiſſe credat quo minus haefierent nuptiae uolo may brought paſſe father maye beleue fault maryage concluded content quomodo howe reaſone maner meane quomodo tibi re ſe habet howe matter sed quomodo diſsimulabat maner dyd dyſſemble primulo diluculo abijſti ad legiones tyme mornynge thou wenteſt armye amph quomodo maner faſhyon alſoo pauperculi eſt domi quod edimus yet ſoo euer though poore folkes haue home ſomewhat eate quomodolibet idem quondam ſommetyme one ſygnifyeng tyme paſte tyme come quondam tua dicere facta tempus erit tyme ſhalbe one whan thyne actes ſhall declared alſoo putte tyme preſent quondam etiam uictis redit praecordia uirtus ye theym vanquyſſhed ſommetyme good courage efteſoones imbraceth theyr ſtomackes sometyme ſignyfyeth alwaye vt quondam ſtipulis magnus ſine uiribus ignis lyke ſtubbyll holme fyre alway great without puyſſaunce quonam whyther eamus intrò ſequere quo tute agis c quonam niſi domum let v go folowe whyther wylt • thou go c whyther ſhulde go home howſe quoniam moche quo officio e thyne offyce quopiam whyther ituràne thai quopiam e thai wylte thou goo whyther quoquam whyther quoque alſo quoquo ſo euer quoquopacto maner wyſe tum ſi maxime fateatur cum amet aliam non eſt utile hanc illi dari qua propter quoquo pacto caelato eſt opus vtterly confeſſe moche loueth nother conuenyent maried woman therfore maner wiſe thynge muſt kept ſecrete quoquomodo idem quo quouerſum ſeu quoquouerſum euerye waye euery parte eius imperio claſſem quo quouerſum dimittunt commandement dyſpatched confyrmation ratio reaſon counſayle pourpoſe care reſpecte cauſe maner waye forme proportion habenda eſt ratio rei familiaris affayres concernyng houſeholde muſte conſydered rationem habere cum aliquo haue one neque illud rationis habuiſti thou haddeſt therof conſyderation sine ratione officij withoute hauynge regarde duetie quo mea longiſsime ratio uoluntas que abhorrebat whyche contrarye fantaſy mynde veſtram nequeo mirari ſatis rationē meruayle ynough doynges mea eſt ſic ratio ſo fantaſy cum ratione aliquid inire go abou • e thynge aduyſedly foreſeynge may folowe nun quam ita quiſquā bene ſubducta ratione ad uitam fuit quin c neuer man ſo welle aduyſed lyfe c vt ego oculis rationem capio farre decerne ſee pro ratione fructuum according fruit profyte therof rationibus inferre put reckning rationes galliae procurare minyſter affayres pertaynyng galliam multis rationibus prouiſum many maner way prouyded rationem inire fynde meanes vt rationem te dictare intelligo thyne accompte ratio alſo accompt ratio conſtat mattier apperethe ſhewed rationes referre yelde accompt rationem dare idem rationem dictare accompte ratio de integro ineunda eſt mihi muſte fynde meane rationes putare ſumme ouer booke accompte rationes conferre trye accompt ratiocinatio reaſonynge ratiocinator oris caſter accompt ratiocinor aris reaſone gather argument accompt rationabilis le reaſonable rationale whiche hath vſe reaſon allſoo whyche prieſte weareth maſſe heade putteth backe lyke ahoode rationarius boke accompt alſo booke belongynge counſaile princis wherin actes done done wrytten alſo auditour ratiuncula lyttell accompt reckenynge ratiſpona cite almain callid rentzpurgh ratus ta tum ſtablyſhed confirmed ſuppoſed pro rata accordyng porcion ratus participle ſygnifieng ſuppoſynge ratus ſum ſuppoſed raua uox voyce may wel harde raucae wourmes beinge rootes tree eateth raucè hoorſely rauceo raucio cere hoorſe rauceſco ſcere idem raucus ca cum hoorſe niſi ipſe iam rumor raucus erit factus except tumour ceaſſe raucedo raucitas hoorſeneſſe raudus thynge vnwrought vnpoliſhed alſo taken aes braſſe rauenna cytie italy rauilia purblynde dull ſyghted rauio hoorſe rauis hoorſeneſſe rauiſcellus um lyttell browne colour rauus um hoorſe alſo rauus color dulle ſadde colour dunne ¶r ante e realis actio action concernynge goodes reapſe ſelfe thyng reate cytie italy reatus faute offence rebellare rebelle rebellio rebellyon rebellis rebelle rebito tare returne unum hoc te quaeſo ſi huc rebitet è philocrate ut eius mihi facis conueniendi copiam oone thynge pray retourne philocrates fynd menes may ſpeke reboo ſowne agayn recalcitro ſtryke hele kyck recaleſco ſcere waxe warme recaluaſter tri balde recaluus idem recalueo ere balde agayne recanto tare charme away charme thynge whiche brought inchantment wytches called wyſe woman wont recapitulatio reher • ynge thynges chapyters recedo ceſsi dere depart go away recedere à conditione à perſona à ſtatu chaunge alter condytion perſon ſtate quanquam id nomen durius efficit iāuetuſtas à peregrino enim iam receſsit thowghe auncyentye maketh name dyffuſe yet nowe altered beynge ſtraunge worde recello lere plucke backe withdrawe recens ti newe late ſoone recens aduerbium newely recentior newer recentiſsimus neweſt lateſt recenti pede recurrere runne eftſoones hath reſted make freſh courſe poſtquam thermopotaſti gutturem recipe te recurre pede recenti thou haſt warmid thy throte good drink take thy hart make freſhe courſe recenter newely freſhely recentius newely recento tare renewe recentor taris tari renewed recenſeo ere number tell recken recenſus u recenſio tale recknyng recenſitus ta tum tolde reckned receptaculum place whyche receyuethe thynges alſo place ſuretie comfort recepti ciuitatem whyche ſtraungers made citiſens recepto tare receyue often receptitius um reſeruid receptus ta tum receyued receptio retourne backe drawyng bryngynge agayne quid tibi huc receptio ad te eſt meum uirum draweſt thou houſbande eftſones backe vnto thy howſe receptum taken cuſtome receptus tus place ſuccour retreate battayle receptui canere blowe retrayte alſo prouerbe whiche ſignifieth fynyſhe ende contention receſsim aduerbe whiche ſygnyfieth goynge backe receſſus u goyng away backe recido dere fal eftſones fal bakward recident te hae contumeliae thoſe rebuke ſhall lyght recidit ad paucos com ꝑſons recidit caſſum come nothynge recidipna garment ſuppe recidiuus um efteſones reſtored ſometyme eftſones decayde fallen recîdo di dere cut agayne cut behynd recinium ſquare garment whiche dyd weare dyd caſt one part therof ouer theyr ſhulders back lyke frenche clokes reciniati dyd weare ſuche clokes recino ere ſynge agayne ſowne recipie cato vſeth recipiam recipio coepi cipere receyue take admytte call agayne brynge ſaulfgard delyuer vndertake promyſe alſo recipere reſerue hym ſelfe except thyng gyuyng bargaynyng recipere ſe retourne come agayne percunctatum igbo ad portum quoad ſe recipiat frater wyl go ſeke hauen vntyll brother come agayne recipere ſe ad coenam come ſuppar hic homo ad coenam recipit ſe ad man wyll come ſuppar recipe te ad come hyther recipere ſe ex opere retourne buſyneſſe recipere ſe domum go home recipere aures non aedepol iſtaec tua dictum nūc aures recipio good ſothe thou ſayeſt recipere ſe portū arriue hauen recipere ſe principem take prynce recipere anhelitum fetch breth wynd priuſquam recipias anhelitū uno uerbo eloquere ubi ego ſum euer thou fetcheſte breth tel word caſe ſtād recipe animum take breathe recipere recouer cum quidem audiēte salinatori qui amiſſo oppido fugerat arcem glorianti que dicenti mea opera quin fab tarētum recepiſti certe inquit ridens nam niſi tu amiſiſſes nunquam recepiſſem hearynge salinator whiche towne tarentum beyng loſt fled caſtell ſayeng vnto hym thou haſt recouered tarentū q fab meanes true ſayd laughynge yf thou haddeſt loſt recouered alſo reſerue man owne vſe reciprocatio goinge backe retournynge place came fro reciproco care tourne backe repete goo backe reciprocus ca cum whiche repeted eftſones reherſed reciſamentum lyttell piece gobet raciſus um newe cutte recito tare reade may heare vnderſtande recite tell eftſones reclamo mare denye lowde voyce crye recliuia recliuium whan ſkynne fynger looſe nayle recludo ſi dere open infernas reſerat ſedes regna recludat pallida vndoo locke place infernall lette hym ſette wyde open pale region deathe iuſtinus putteth recluſus clauſus ſhutte recluſus um opened recocta ſeconde courſe cheſe recogito tare remembre recognitio knowlege recognoſco noui noſcere recognyſe knowe perfectly ouerloke remember recolligo legi ligere aſſemble gather togyther alſo reconcyle quod ſcribis etiā ſi cuius animus eſſet te offenſior recolligi oportere quid dicas thou wryteſte ouer yf man dyſpleaſed ſhulde reconciled meanes ſayſte thou recolo lere repute repete calle remembraunce recomminiſcor ſceris recomminiſci recordatio remembraunce recreatio recreation reſtorynge recreo aui recreate refreſhe reſtore recreſco ſcere growe agayne recrudeſco ſcere renewe fault made prince theyr familiar rectum ſupper ſat al rewe rectangulus lynes ſoo ioyned part longer ſhorter thā rectum aduerbe ſignifienge ſtrayghte cur non rectum introibas wenteſte thou ſtrayghte ſtrayghte waye recté wel ynough quid tu igitur lachrymas aut quid e tam triſtis pamp recté mater quid fuit tumulti wherfore doeſte thou mourne arte thou ſo heuy p well ynoughe mother al noyſe recté parere brynge forthe chylde right ſhape recté good right good reaſon recté dicis thou ſayeſt truely recté eſt inoughe haue inoughe tum quod idem ei recté eſt haue alſo ynoughe gyue hym recté facere alicui good man stultus ſine gratia e tibi recté facere quando quod facia perit thou arte ſole without thanke doo good whan loſte thou doeſt recté ferre take paciently si ſapis ne que praeterquam quas ipſe amor moleſtias habet addas illas quas habet rectè fearas thou wyſe adde griefe thanne loue bringeth hym theym bringeth ſuffer paciently recte ſignifyeth ſometyme nothynge donate ſaythe rogo num quid uelit recte inquit abeo aſked wolde thynge nothynge ſayde went waye alſo ye ſtrayght waye tu ru hinc abis rectè goeſt thou nowe cuntrey ye ſtrayght waye rectè ualet ſhe good helthe rectius better rectitas rectitudo iuſtice rightwiſenes rector toris ruler rectus nominatiue caſe rectum inteſtinum gutte whenſe ordure paſſeth rectus ta tum ſtrayght whiche croked vpright iuſte recubitus p • lyinge reſte recubo lye reſte recudo cudi dere newe hamer newe worke anduelde alſo taken make newe newe prynte recuperatores iudges aſſigned commiſſioners priuate matter recumbo ſyt table meales ſome tyme leane one recumbebat mecumuir egregius fidius rufinus ſuper eum municeps ipſius ſatte worſhypfull manne fidius rufinus aboue hym neyghbour recuperatio reciperatio reciperantia olde wryters ſayde lawe made betwene people rome nation city wherin accorded priuate thynges taken ſhulde redelyuered whiche vſed leages entercourſe ſtraunge countres prynces recupero rare recouer recupio cupiui cupere deſyre moche quin ira faciam ut recupias facere ſumptū ſi ego uetem yet wyll ſo handle thou ſhalte moche deſyre ſpende although wolde forbyd recurro rere runne agayne go come agayne quickely recurſus u runninge backe recourſe recurſo runne often backe agayne recurué aduerbe ſignifienge downward bowed backwarde crokedly recuruitas taris bowynge backe recuruo bowe backe recuruor ari bowed backe recuruus um bowed backe croked recuſabile worthy refuſed recuſatio refuſall recuſator refuſer recuſo refuſe alſo defende recutitus circumciſed ſometyme exulcerate redabſoluo uere dyſcharge dyſpeche sequere hac te redabſoluam qua adueniſti gratia folowe thyther wyl diſpatche thy matter whiche thou camſt hither redactus ta tum brought id redactus ſum locus caſe redambulo returne cura quam optime potes er bene ambula redambula beſte thou canſte er well gette henſe come agayne quickely redandruo idem redamo aui loue mutually redarguo guere reproue reddo di dere render yelde delyuer reſtore gyue make reddere certiorem aſſertayne reddere▪ rationem make accompte reckenynge reddere put tempeſtas uenit confringit regulas imbrices que ibi dominus indiligens reddere alias ne uult tempeſte came brake tyles eueſes neglygent owner wold put theyr place reddere commorum cauſe one make haſte haſte hym forwarde reddere dictum ac factum videre egiſſe iā neſcio quid cū ſene de illo quod dudū dictum ac factum reddidi ſemeth thou haſte done late wote old man meaneſt thou daye thou haddeſt ſoo ſoone ſpoken done reddidi impetratum brought paſſe reddere operam requyte good tourne ylle reddere aliquē reſemble like one redemptio redemption redemptito demptitare redeeme bye agayne often redempto tare redeme redemptor toris redemer warkmā whiche taketh warke greate ſometyme ſygnifieth hym taketh rente ferme▪ redeo diui dij redire retourne redhibeo hibui bere cauſe ſellar haue agayne whiche ſolde redhibitio reſtitution redigo degi digere bryng force cunnynge ſometyme reſtore redigere ordinem compell men liue accordyng eſtate profeſſion redis ad ingenium thou doſte thyne olde facyon thou art wont redire ad ſe sed paululum ſine ad ut redeam let take breathe lytell tandem reprime iracundiam atque ad te redi nowe leaue thy fume remember thy ſelfe redeam ad pauca vt ad pauca redeam ac mittam illius ineptias intent wyll ſhorte paſſe ouer foly redi ad rem goo pourpoſe matter redijt ad reſtim re opera tua ad reſtim mihi quidem re redijt thy meanes brought poynt hange ſelfe rediit ad raſtros nam ſi illi pergam ſuppe ditare ſumptibus menedeme mihi illae cuere ad raſtros re rediit surely ſhoulde maynteyn expenſes menedemus wold brynge rake corne graſſe lyuynge redit re eum locum thynge come ſo paſſe cum iam re rediit locum ut ſit neceſſe matter come ſoo paſſe remedy redit mihi animus courage come vnto redit animo commeth mynde redire concordiam agreed redire gratiam idem alſo eftſoones fauour redimicula ornamentes apparaylle womannes heade veluette bonette frenche hoode redimio iui ire adourne apparayle trymme reditur retourned redhibitum reſtored redico cere tell ſay agayne rediculi temple rome withoute gate callyd capena hannyball beynge aferde retyred backe redimîtus ta apparayled head redimere take charge redinunt redeunt retourne come agayne redintegro begynne eftſoones renewe refreſhe redintegratio renewyng redipiſcor ſceris ſci recouer get agayne redimo dêmi dimere redeme bye recouer recompence take bargayne redemptores hyre lande taketh thynge great taſke redintegrare begynne freſhe redintegrato animo courage reuyued freſhe courage redito tare retourne reditus tus retourne reduuia whan ſkynne commeth nayles fyngers alſo adder ſkyn rediuiuum whiche retourneth efteſones lyfe alſo whyche olde thyng made newe yonge rediuius wourme called tyke whyche ſucketh bloude man beaſt redoleo ere ſmelle ſauour redonatio gyuynge agayne thynge taken redono gyue agayne redorior redordior iri begyn ageyne redormio awake redormitio awakynge ſlepe redoſtio tire olde wryters taken gyue thanke reducem reduces call ſuche brought exyle captiuitie reducere brynge ſaufe méque oppido arcem reduco conueyd ſelf quickly caſtell alſo pacifye appeaſe numen que reducant let theym appeaſe wrathe diſpleaſure god reduco duxi ducere bryng back pluck • backe delyuer ſet peryll reconcyle reducere ad planum cicatrix make woundes maye perceyued make withoute ſeame reductus um broughte backe ſafe redundo ouerflowe reflowe retourne backe redounde reduro ſtop cloſe reduplico care double eftſones redulcero rare impoſtume make impoſtume ſome parte body refello proue fals repreue falſehode deny whiche obiected referio rire ſtryke agayne refercio cire fyl refero tuli ferre brynge agayne reſemble reporte referre reuoke tell referebam retourned adde aſcribe turne renewe brynge declare expreſſe refero impenſum make accompt whiche beſtowed referre rationem yeld make accompt referre ad aliquem aſke one counſayle matter referre de aliqua ad senatum whā comſuls purpoſed matter ſenate deſyringe senatours reaſon conſulte therof referre pedem ſet forthe fote goo eutyche hanc uolo rem prius agi quā meum intro refero pedē wyl thing eutyche done go one fote retulit ad pedem came towarde referunt haec ad rem theſe thynges pertein matter refero acceptum omnia quae uidimus ſi recte rationabimus uni accepta referemus antonio ſee recken well maye impute onely antonie quod uiuit mihi acceptum refert confeſſeth longe lyueth verum omnem tranquillitatem quietem ſenectutis refert acceptam clementiae tuae tranquillite quietneſſe age confeſſeth procede haue receiued mercy goodneſſe referre gratiam gyue thanke nunquā ego illi poſſum gratiam referre ut meritus eſt de neuer gyue hym thanke ſufficient hath done spero • e go mihi quoque tempus tale euenturum ut tibi gratiam referam parē truſte time ſhall come ſhall moche pleſure non enim ſperaſti mutuam tibi gratiam relaturum ut uiciſsim tuos compellarē thou dyddeſte thynke wolde wyſe haue requited remembring thine auncetours thou haſte done myne referri acceptum brought reck • nynge poſteaquam reus factus eſt primo negabat opus acceptum referri poſſe accuſed fyrſt denyed warke moughte broughte vnto reckenynge referre melius turne better vſe referre more expreſſe condition maners referre oculos caſte loke vpon one referre par requyte ille quem beneficio adiungas ex animo facit ſtudet par referre thou getteſt benefyt doth thynges good harte ſtudiethe requite referre pedem uel gradum ſtep backe retreate illa retulit quaeſiuit que quidnam mihi uideretur ſhe tolde aſked thought therin refert cuius conſilij magni referebat • e • ereſſe whiche counſayle ben neceſſary▪ ye ſhulde haue ben parui retulit non ſuſcepiſſe made lyttell matter tooke mea quid refert care mea nihil refert haue naught tua refert thy profytte quid refert feciſſe regibus ut mihi obedirent ſi hodie hic umbraticus deriſerit auaylethe haue made kynges obeye nowe lewd knaue ſhall laughe ſcorne refert expediente neceſſary neque enim numero comprehendere refert neceſſary reherſe number refectus ta tum reſtored renewed amended made eftſones reficio ficere recreate reſtore amend make agayne reficior ceris ci reſtored recouered ſickenes alſo renewed newe made refigo xi gere make faſt ſure thruſt harde sometyme ſignifieth contrary drawe whiche faſtened refigere tabulas leges vndo deſtroy lawes acta antonij reſcidiſtis leges refix iſtis ye haue cancelled actis antony vndone diſſolued lawes fixit leges pretioque refixit ſtablyſhed lawes money efteſones diſſolued refirmo faſten ſtablyſhe agayne reflatio contrary wynde reflatus tus idem reflecto xi tere bowe backe tourne backe agayne quem neque fides ne que iuſiurandum ne que illum miſericordia repreſsit ne que reflexit neyther promyſe othe yet pite withdrewe pulled backe reflo blowe agayne contrarye refluo xi fluere flowe refluxus u tyde whan water floweth refocillatio comfortynge refreſhynge recreation refocillo recomforte refreſhe recreate fortifie reformo mare refourme reformator refourmatour refoueo foui fotum fouere nouriſſhe comforte efteſones reſtore ſet fyrſte ſtate refractarius obſtinate wilfull oppinion refragor aris ari reſiſte wordes clamour refrango fregi refrangere aut refringere braſte open refreno nare pull backe one purpoſe refrico care renewe ſore griefe whiche remembraunce animum memoria refricare touche one hart remembrance thing refrigeratorius um whiche coleth maketh colde refrigeratio coolynge refrigeratus ta tum kooled alſo refreſſhed comforted refrigerium recreation aduauncynge mynde refrigeſco ſcere make colde coole refrixit ceſed cooled refrigero coole make colde refreſhe recomforte refrina beane whiche olde romaynes wonte brynge home fielde doo ſacryfyce good lucke theyr corne refuga vnrulie perſonne whiche wyll ordered refugio gere flee runne away backe alſo refuſe refugiunt memoria noſtra iſta theſe thynges ben remembraunce refugere ab admonendo leaue counſaylynge one refugere dicendo forbeare ſpeake diſpleaſure conſuetudine refugere leaue one company become ſtraunge one hath ben familiar refugium refuge ſuccour place one maye ſuccoured refugus um whiche gothe awaye layde aparte refulgeo gêre ſhyne refundo fudi fundere reſtore lacketh quicquid de erit ex meo refundam ſo euer doth lacke wyll make vp myne owne alſo paye home agayne yelde id erat non tam accipere beneficium quàm refundere ſo moche receyue good turne good tourne alſo caſte vppe vomyte quod heſterna crapula ingurgitauerat palam refudit whiche yeſterdayes ryotte ingourged deuoured openlye dyd parbrake vomyte vp refutatio
