regenero rare regenerate efteſones ingender regero geſsi gerere put wrytynge brynge backe vomite vp regeſtum erthe caſte vp regia kynges houſe regi • ſco ſcere olde wryters vſed creſcere 〈◊〉 growe regificus ca cum whereby kynge made regilla kynges robe regillus lyttell kynge alſo name riuer italy regimen mini rule gouernaunce regina queene regionatim place place euery region coſte regio region countrey alſo coſte eaſte weſte northe ſouthe rectum regione deflectere go ſtrayte right waye regium cytie beyonde mountaynes towarde italy called rezo regius um kynge regius morbus iaundyſe regno reigne regnum realme gouernaunce rego xi regere rule gouerne regor geris ruled gouerned regrador deri di go backe regredior regredi idem regredo dere reuoke call agayne regreſsio regreſſus u returne backe reſorte backe regula rule regularis regulare whiche vnder rule regulo rule directe regulus prynce lord lyttell countrey properly regulus chylderne kynges alſo regulus lyttel byrd called wren ſerpente called cockatryce whiche ſleeth man ſyght alſo name conſule whiche kepyng promyſe put cruell death carthaginenſis alſo great rhetorician tyme plynie reieculae uel reijculae oues ſheepe drawen folde age ſickeneſſe kebbers crone cullyars reiectanea philoſophers taken thinges abhorred ſyckenes pouertie ſorowe reiectio parbrakynge reiectio ſanguinis iſſuing bloud mouthe noſe vaynes reiectus ta tum caſte caſte awaye put forthe reijcio ieci ijcere caſte awaye dryue backe tityre paſcentes flumine reijce capella tityre dryue thy gootes fede awaye riuer alſo refuſe put awaye uero tanquam inutilem reiecerunt refuſed perſon vnprofitable si altera illa magi inſtabit forſitan no reiiciat wyl importunate perchance wyll put awaye reiicere iudices aut teſtes refuſe iudges witneſſes reiicere parbrake vomyte senos ſextantes non exceſsit aut ſi exceſsiſſet reiiciebantur exceded twelue ounce paſſed caſte vp agayne relatio reporte reſpecte amonge logician effecte relatiue father ſonne maiſter ſeruaunt huſbande wyfe without oone reteyne name ſon maye withoute father wyfe without huſebande ſeruant without mayſter relati aerarios ſome defaute mayſters maners called cenſores put number citeſens dyd onely paye tribute heedſyluer ſtraungers relatiue hauynge relation thynge relatiuum relatife whiche hath relation ſome thynge relaxo lowſe relegatus banyſhed relegatio banyſhement countrey relego relegare banyſhe remoue ſeuer one ſende awaye religatus ta tum faſte bounde relego legi legere rede agayne relicinus hath good buſhe heare well trymmed behynde relicina frons fayre large hyghe forhede without heare relictus ta tum forſaken lefte relictus ſum mihi lefte alone lybertie religio oni religion reuerend drede doubt leſt ſhall offende alſo conſcience man mought ſaye ſcruple conſcience religionem uertere feare leaſte god diſpleaſed make conſcience thynge religionem inducere brynge feare goddes diſpleaſe religio eſt leful huc introiere niſi neceſſario caſte religio eſt enter neceſſitie chaſtlie lefull religiōe obſtrīgere uel obligare charge one conſcience matter exoluere relligione▪ diſcharge one conſcience remoue one ſcrupuloſitie relligio eſt mihi haue conſcience therof relligio mihi non eſt quo minus hoc faciā haue conſcience therof maye doo religionem alicui afferre cauſe one ſcrupulouſe eximere religionem put hym oute doubte conſcience exemplarantique religionis exaumple good ſtrayte conſcience teſtimoniorum religionem fidem nunquam iſta natio coluit people neuer regarde theyr othe religioſe fearefully doubtfully daungerouſly ſcrupulouſly aduyſedly curiouſely religioſus deuout towarde god fearing offende hym religioſus um timerouſe dy relligioſi dayes heuyneſſe ſome miſaduenture whiche hath happened thoſe dayes delubrum religioſum deuoute place churche chapell whervnto men haue great deuotion come religioſum eſt id facere conſciēce doinge therof teſtimonio religioſi ſcrupulouſe bearynge wytneſſe religo bynde faſte religare relligionibus bona alicuiꝰ giue goodes honour ſeruice god relino releui relin • open whiche ſtopped releui omnia dolia haue broched veſſelles nolo ego no pro ſummo bibere nulli relerimus poſtea wolde dranke wyl man ſet broche afterwarde relimino gyue lyghte relinquo liqui relinquere leaue relinquere animam dye relinquit eum animus harte fayleth hym relinquere aes alienum dye det arrabôni relinquere leaue thynge vppon pledge medio relinquere leaue doubte locum admonitionibus relinquere receyue monition whiche giuen v locum ſubtilitati nullum relinquere thyng ſo ſubtilly amended locum uituperādi alicui relinquere giue occaſion one ſaye yll memoriam alicuius rei relinquere thynge wherof ſhall lefte perpetuall remembraunce pecuniam queſtu relinquere delyuer money haue gayne therby scriptum relinquere leaue writyng spein relinquere hope truſte noo thynge studium alicuius rei relinquere care noo thynge suſpitionem relinquere cauſe ſuſpition relinquitur foloweth reliqua whiche remayneth vpon reckenynge reliqua contrahere arrerage terme reliquatores whiche ben arrerage theyr accompte alſo whiche haue theyr handes ſome parte whiche ought haue payde spes nulla reliqua te eſt haue hope reliquiae whiche lefte reliquium facere leaue omytte reliquos facere leaue reliquias perſequi purſue whiche begun reliquor ari behynde paymente certayne ſumme reliquus um remenaunte remaynethe reliquum eſt reſte reluceo luxi cere ſhyne bryght reluctor tari contende ſtryue agayne reluo luere paye agayn whiche borowed fetche home gage pledge alſo waſhe efteſones remancipo ſell agayne thynge whiche firſte ſolde remandere chewe cudde remaneo ſi nêre abyde ſtylle remano tourne backe place remanſio abydynge remeculi lyttell ſhyppes whiche men lemnos vſed remedium remedy remeligo fyſhe whiche cleauynge keale ſhyppe cauſeth hym tary remendo amende correcte faute remeo returne go backe agayne remigatio rowynge ſaylynge remex remigis whiche rowe galeye bote remigium rowynge ſhyp bote remigo rowe remigro go backe returne remillum thynge croked brode reminiſcor ſceris ſci call agayne remembraunce reminiſcentia remembraunce whiche one mynde remiſſe fayntly without courage humblye sometyme merily remiſsio remiſſion forgyueneſſe recreating mynd ſtudy labour lacke faintneſſe courage remitto miſi mittere ſend ſende agayn ſende backe releaſe forgiue grant lette downe commytte remytte relinquiſhe leaue ceaſſe remittere animum put away care vnbende louſe annum remittere pardone hym one yere ardorem remittere fierſe remittere aliquid adoleſcentiae pardone hym ſomewhat youth remittere nuntium gratiam habeo tibi quum copiam iſtam mihi poteſtatem facis ut ego ad parentes remittam nuntium thanke thou gyueſt leaue alſo authoritie maye ſende thy frendes prouyde el contentionem remittere leaue contētiō de ſupplicio remittere pardon part execution de cuſtodia remittere ſo carefull frenos dolori remittere abandone hym ſorow let hym ſelfe poſſeded heuyneſſe ius alicui remittere releaſe title righte vnto one librum remittere whan barke louſe fallen tree memoriam remittere let paſſe remembraunce numeros cantu remittere reſte ſyngynge vſe prickeſonge nuntium uxori remittere deuorced repudium remittere idem officium remittere renounce duetie remiſſus um dull remitted ſente agayne ceaſed deferred remiſſus animus whiche hath courage remiſſum corpus vnluſty body remiſsius frigus colde remiſsio releaſe loſynge withdraweynge oculorum remiſsio withdrawyng loke remiſsio morbi whan ſickenes abated goynge away remollio ire make ſofte eaſy remolleſcere pacifie mittigate rêmora lyttell fyſhe whiche reteyneth great ſhip vnder ſayle alſo tarienge remorbeſco fall efteſones ſickenes remordeo dêre tourment mynde make one heuy remores byrdes whiche theyr flyghte voyce ſignified thynge purpoſed folowed remoria place toppe hyll called auentinus remus ſtode flyghte byrdes aduyſed buyldyng rome remona dwellynge houſe remus remoror aris ari tary make abyde remorari gradum reſt hym ſelf place remotus ta tum fer remeued remôtus homo à dialecicis paſſeth nothynge logike remota re à memoria thing thought vpon remotus à culpa faute remoto ioco erneſte remoto delectu without hauynge regarde one remotus ab inani laude loueth vaine glory remoueo ere remoue take awaye remouete moram make ye haſt ſpede remouêre ſe à negotijs publicis meddel commune affayres remouere aliquem à republica put one offyce whiche hath weale publyke remouere ab oculis hyde remouere ſe arte ſua leaue forſake crafte remouere de medio put thynge cleane awaye remouere metum put awaye feare remouere moram make haſte remouere operam ſuā à populari coetu take peyn mēs buſynes repandiroſtrum pecus beaſte hauyng noſe tourned vpwarde worde vſed pacuuius lucilius auncient poetes reciprocicornes taken laberius rammes tournynge backeward eftſones forwarde theyre horne remugio giui gire belowe lowe render great ſowne remulco care remulculo properlye drawe gret ſhyppe barge laſſe veſſell tranſlation ſignifyeth drawe thynge caſely remulcus lyttell bote barke remulinus ager remus fielde remuncopae inſtrumentes wherwith ſhyppes dryuen lande remunero remuneror ari reward recompence good tourne remuneratio recompenſe remus brother romulus whiche builded rome renanciſcor ſceris ſci get agayne ren renis kydney renaſcor ſci denuo naſci renaſcens annus ſprynge tyme renarro tell repete renato tare ſwym backe ſwym agayn renes kydneys reynes back renideo dere ſhyne ſauour ſmell renitor ti reſiſte renixus u reſiſtence renodo dare vnknytte vndo knotte renoues garmentes made ſkynnes wulfes beaſtes wherin auncient almaynes wonte lye warres renouo renewe make efteſones renouello lare make newe agayne rentifolia kynd wyld roſes whiche haue neyther good ſauour faſcion renumero rare paye agayne moneye whiche receyued renuntiata ile ethyope ſo riche inhabitauntes giue horſe exchaunge talent golde renuntio reporte ſignify ſhewe openly renounce refuſe reſigne ſomtyme reſtore renuntiare uitae refuſe lyue renuntiatur conſul declared conſule renuntiatio report alſo reſignation office alſo ſummons officer renuntij whiche cary tydynges one renno nuere refuſe deſpyſe renutus nutus refuſal denyar countenaunce reor reris ratus ſum ſuppoſe repagulum dore wyndowe thing ſhutteth cloſeth repages idem repandus um bente bowed brode backewarde ore olde time repando dere bende backe reparo rare repayre reſtore firſt aſtate renewe reparamen reparatio repayrynge reparation reparco parſi ſere ſpare repaſtinatio newe dyggynge vynes alſo bryngynge grounde temper moche labour dyggynge repaſtinatus ta tum newe digged brought temper repaſtino dygge agayne vine alter lande grounde ofte dygging labourynge repaſtinor nari eftſones dygged brought temper repauſo take reſte rèpedo go awaye go backe repello pul pellere put backe repel repellere ſanguinem let one bloude repellere uim ui reſyſte force force rependo di dere recompence rependebatur duplo argento one paied double wayte ſyluer repens ti ſodayne vnloked repenſo ponder ouerſee iudge repentè ſodaynely repentim idem repentinus um ſodayne reperibitur ſhall founde repertor fyndeth repercutio cuſsi cutere ſtryke agayn reuerberate repercutere dictum take aduauntage one wordes repercuſſus ſus reuerberation ſtrykyng often reperio peri rire fynde auenture ſomtyme otherwiſe perceyue reperire cauſam fynde excuſe reperire negotium hac haue moch matter reperire gloriam gette honourable renoume reperit ſuos parentes hath ſhe founde father mother reperies hoc non ſecus ſhal fynde none wiſe reperitur non ullo ueſtigio mention made hym repertitius founden repertorium inuentory repeto tij tere aſke agayne aſke often efteſones reherſe agayne repete reuolue begynne agayne reſorte eftſones thynge call agayne hem repudiatus repetor howe nowe beinge one refuſed called agayne alta repetita reherſed begynnyng farre ſought farre fette repetere poenas ab aliquo auenged one repeto remember quidem adoleſcen tulo repeto quendam principem nomine alternis diebus declamare alternis diſputare remember whan boy one whiche prynce name dyd one daye declame daye diſpute repetere reum accuſe efteſones repetenti memoria call remembrance repetundarum accuſari properly man ſometime beinge greatte auctoritie hauynge rule countrey accuſed called reckenynge hath receyued office aboue whiche ordynary allowaunce alſo thynge toke wrongefully perſon towne whiche moſt neceſſary action publik wele mought deuyſed repignerator redemeth quiteth gage pledge repignero quite redeme pledge gage maye taken ſomtyme v whiche lawe called repleuy repignoratio repleuy repignoratitia actio replegiare replaudo dere make noyſe handes beaten gether repleo plêre fyll replicatio replycation vnfoldynge thynge replico care vnfolde alſo replye diſplaye replumbo vnſoulder repo repſi pere crepe runne rote grounde repleo liui lira polyſhe agayne repolleo lere moche able power repolleſco ſcere efteſones ſtronge force repono ſui nere put ſet agayne place laye vp recite agayne hyde redelyuer reſtore reuoke repreſſe laye exaggerate heape one make grow agayn bring agayne alſo put wrytynge et quantum longis carpent armenta diebus exigua tantum gelidus ro nocte reponet loke howe moche ſheepe longe dayes ſhall byte colde dewe one nyghte growinge ſhall requite reponere ceruicem wry one necke one ſide nowe reponere aliquem deos honour one vnto god reponere numero eloquentium eſteme eloquente reponere optimum ſpe haue good hope thynge reponere ſuis take hym frende reponere fidem truſte scriptor honoratum ſi forte reponis chillem thou writeſt peraduēture thou putteſt athilles reponere nummos paye agayne money whiche lent v reponere aliquid uaetuſtatem laye vp thynge tyme come reponere remum rowe peto à ne id à quaeras ne tibi idem reponā cum ueneris praye aſke leſte aſke lykewiſe whanne thou commeſt semper ego auditor tantum nun quam ne reponam ſhall alway hearer neuer wryter reporto brynge backe agayne reportare laudem ex hoſtibus prayſed victory reportare victoriam haue victory repoſco ſci ſcere aſke agayne myne owne due repoſcere uicem aſke one good tourne repoſitorium ſtore houſe repoſitus repoſtus ta tum layde vp hyde manet alta mente repoſtum iudicium paridis depe mynde remayned iudgemente paris gaue betwene goddeſſes whiche ſprange occaſyon deſtruction troye repotium whan daye maryage frendes come drynke bryde reprehendo dere plucke back reproue reprehenſio caughte reprehenſio rebuke pullinge backe reprehenſo rebuke ſharpely repehendere manu take hande repraeſento tare repreſente render brynge preſence preſente thynge laye one ſhewe declare repraeſentare ſe preſente si repraeſentari morte ea libertas ciuitatis poteſt citie deathe moughte reſtored lybertie repraeſentare ſupplicia punyſhe ſodaynely haſtely repraeſentare iuditia preuent iudgement repraeſentare praetium paye moneye hande repraeſentare diém promiſſorum perfourme promyſed reprimo mere refrayne let appeſe reprimere ſermones ſeu famam cauſe great fame reporte ceaſe impetum populi reprimere appeaſe fury people ceaſe reprimere itinera abbreuiate make waye ſhorter reprobo reproue reprobus man reproued reproces ſharpe reptile thynge crepeth repto tare crepe moche alſo go ſoftely lyke ſnayle repubeſcere waxe yonge agayne repudio forſake man forſaketh wyfe alſo refuſe abandone leaue repudio conſilium quod primum intenderam wyll leaue counſayle fyrſte intended folowe repudium deuorce repudium remittere deuorced repudium renuntiare declare deuorce nunc repudium renuntiare iuſsit tibi wylled declare hath forſaken repudioſae nuptiae mariage foloweth ſoone deuorce neceſsitate mala ut fiam facis uerum uideto ubi uoles nuptum dare ne hac fama faciat repudoſas nuptias thou compelleſt naught take hede thou wilt mary reporte ſhall make ſuche weddynge ſhall ſone diſſolued broken repueraſco ſcere eftſones chylde waxe chylde agayne repugno repugne ſaye contrarye reſiſte repugnare inter ſe contrary one repugnanter aduerbe whiche ſignyfiethe contrariouſly diſpleaſauntly vt igitur monere moneri proprium eſt uerae amicitiae alterum libere facere non aſperé alterū pacienter accipere non repugnanter ſic habendum eſt nullam amicitijs peſtem eſſe maiorem quam adulationem blanditias aſſentationem lyke therfore gyue coū ſayle counſayled properlye belongeth frendeſhyp alſo tone doo euery thynge frankely tother take thynge patiently diſpleaſauntly soo conſydered frendeſhyp peſtilence thanne flatterye fayre wordes conſentynge al thynges repugnantia repugnancy one thynge agreeth repugnax nacis euerye thynge contrariouſe repungo gere prycke agayne mutually diſpleaſe offende repulſa puttyng back hym eyther demandeth loketh authorite offyce repullulo repullulaſco ſcere bourgen eftſones ſprynge repulſor oris putteth man backe repulſus put backe repumicare rayſe pomayſe reputo tare thynke often conſyder moche reuolue mynde compte alſo cut eftſones requies reſte requieſco ſcere reſte take reſte requieſcere ſpe alicuius adoleſcentis content hope whiche one hath yonge man requieſcere ſermone alicuius content one communication requieſcere lectione poetarum take pleaſure readynge poetes non requieſcere conſilio cuiuſ quam ceſſe man counſayle et mutata ſuos requierunt flumina curſus verg riuers altered ceſſed rūne requiro ſiui rere ſeke efteſones often requyre inquyre demaunde quo maiorum noſtrorum ſaepe requiro prudentiam fynde auncetours elder haue therein lacked oftentymes diſcretion vereor ne literarum officiū à requiras feare ye wyl blame writing oftener vnto requiſitum eſt one demaunded requiſita naturae nature neceſſitie re thynge thynge matter ſommetyme aſtate condicion buſyneſſe contention cauſe rycheſſe ſubſtaunce profytte weale experyence occaſyon re eſt matter dede re ad manticam redijt come bagge ſtaffe ſtaffe walette re comperendinata mattier adiourned deferred vntyll thyrde day re iudicata matter cauſe fynally determined adiudged re controuerſa matter ſuite re familiaris man propre goodes re forenſis matter lawe respublica publyke weale ere nata melius fieri haud potuit quàm factum eſt occaſyon begunne coulde better haue ben doone alſoo ſygnifieth meane repperi rem quo pacto nec fur nec ſocius ſies haue founde meane howe thou ſhalte neyther thefe companyon hym rem facere gayne wynne nunquàm rem facies abi neſcis ineſcare homines thou ſhalt neuer gayne peny get hen thou canſt ſkylle angle men rem habere cum aliquo haue one meddell one re gerere haue make warres scipione aemiliano re affrica gerente polybius annaliū conditor ab eo accepta claſſe ſcrutādi orbis illius gratia circumuectus eſt scipio aemilianus makynge warres affryke polybius wryter hiſtories certayne numbre ſhyppes conueyed coſte inſerche parte worlde re ſemper aliquid apportat noui experyence bryngeth alway ſome newes ad rem redi matter purpoſe salua re eſt matter gothe well amicos re inuenit rycheſſe fyndeth frēdes nun quam rem facies thou ſhalt neuer wynne neuer thryue iuuare help dedes wordes onely amicus qui dubia iuuat ubi eſt opus frende whiche caſe doutful helpeth dedes dedes requyred quid iſti credam re ipſi indicat ſhal truſte hym dede ſelfe declareth verba ad rem conferre doo ſaythe vſ que adeo ego illius ferre poſſum ineptias magnifica uerba uerba dum ſint uerum enim ſi ad rē conferentur uapulabit hither ſuffre lewdeneſſe bragges longe wordes ſayth ſhall ſmart therfore rem augere waxe thryfty uera deede trouthe matter dede ipſa idem ere nata non melius fieri potuit quam factum eſt conſyderynge chaunce occaſion coulde better done pro nata matter cōſydered purpoſe happened re tua agitur thy matter hande matter toucheth si rem utri que eſt yf bothe profyttes verba ad rem conferre ſayth re ipſa indicat dede ſhoweth reſalutatio courtayſe ſpeakyng ſpeaketh reſalutynge reſaluto reſalutare ſalute hym ſaluteth reſarcio ſi cire amende refourme reſarcire damna recompence damage reſarrio iui ire wede eftſones corne reſcindo ſcidi ſcindere cutte breake ſunder take awaye deſtroye make voyde repell acte lawe breake vp coelum reſcindere fratres ter ſunt conati thryſe bretherne aſſayed breake vp heuen enter reſcio ſciui ſcire knowe thynge whyche hydde kepte ſecrete alſoo knowe thynge done whiche knowen reſciſco ſcere idem quod reſcio reſcribo pſi bere wryte agayne redelyuer repay money reſcriptum letter prynce makynge aunſwere letter reſeco cut away ſuꝑfluoꝰ reſecare ad uinum pare quycke touche quycke matter reſecro crare pray deſyre eftſones alſo aſſoyle one auowe reſedo dare appeaſe reſegmen parynge man nayles reſero open thynge cloſed reſero rere ſowe ſet agayne reſeruatio reſeruatō keping ſom thing reſeruo uare kepe part thynges reſerue reſes idis ydel accuſtomed labour occupation reſex ſecis whiche cut ſpryngeth agayne beareth fruite dyd reſideo reſedi reſidêre reſte ſytte ſtande faſt reſidet eius rei te culpa faulte therof reſido ſedi ſidere ſytte downe alſo abyde nam viennenſium uitia inter ipſos reſidunt noſtra late uagantur fautes men vienne abyde runne abrode euery knowen reſidet uultu dothe reſte appiere vyſage quorum non ſententia ſolum ſed etiam nutu reſidebat autoritas whoſe ſentence onely alſo countenance auctoritie reſted reſiduus um reſte remnaunt reſigno open whiche ſealed ſomtyme ſeale faſt alſo ſhyt ſomtyme reſtore agayne alſo reſygne ſurrendre reſignatum aes wage ſtopped negligēt ſeruyce warres reſilio lij ire lepe back ſtep away quikly ab hoc crimen reſilit blame layde hym reſimus hath camoyſe noſe ſay tourned vpwarde reſina roſyn lyke gumme whyche runneth tree reſinatius um lyke roſeyn reſinatus ta tum raſed dreſſed roſeyn reſinoſus full roſeyn reſipio pui pere idem quod reſipiſco reſipiſco reſipui reſipiſcere retourne perfecte vnderſtandynge eftſones wiſe erred reſiſto reſiſti reſiſtere reſiſt withſtande reſiſtitur remedy reſoluo uere reſolue deſtroye paye dettes remoue vndo vnlouſe humū reſoluere labour erthe puluerem reſoluere make pouder reſolutio neruorum palſey reſono ſown agayn make eccho reſorbeo bui pſi bere poure dyſgorge lycour receyued reſpecto ſee often loue helpe reſpectus ctus loke ſyght alſo reſpect regard ne que eo reſpectu commotus diſceſſerat hauynge regarde therevnto departed reſpergo ſi gere caſte water lykour ſprynkle reſpergimen ſprynklynge caſtyng lycour reſpicio exi ſpicere loke backe haue regarde prouyde remedy kepe reſrue loue reſpicere helpe ſuccour age intuis ſecundis rebus reſpice let ſe thy proſperitie ſuccour reſpicit no deus god hath pitie v tace modo deus reſpiciet no aliquis peace nowe ſome god wyll haue pytie v reſpicere ſe take hede haue regarde hym ſelfe non ſoles reſpicere te cum dicas iniuſte alteri art thou wont take hede thy ſelfe whan thou ſayſte wrong man non tu te cohibes non te reſpicis non tibi exempli ſatis ſum wylt thou beware wylt thou take hede thy ſelfe good example vnto reſpiratio breathe vapour reſpiro take breathe alſo take comforte retourne fyrſte ſtate si armis aut conditione poſitis aut fatigatione abiectis aut uictoria detractis ciuitas reſpirauerit dignitate tua tibi fortuna uti licebit harneyſe eyther condytions peace beinge layde away wearyneſſe bothe partes throwen away pullyd away vyctorye citie ſhall recouer fyrſte eſtimation thou ſhalte enioye thy poſſeſſyons dygnitie reſplendeo dere ſhyne reſpondeo di dere aunſwere appeere whan one called agree conſente lyke equall agaynſt one thyng ſet lyenge agaynſt reſpondere criminibus purge v layde charge reſpondere ad nomina appere whan callyd non reſpondere make defaute reſpondere ad diem pay day reſpondere ſuperiori accorde whiche afore reſpondere patri folowe father condytions reſpondere ſometyme doth ſignify ſatisfacere hocproprium tuum munus eſt ut ita erudiatur ut patri scipioni noſtro tibi tam propinquo reſpondeat part ſpecially ſo brought vp lernynge maye ſatisfye father frende scipio ſo nygh kynneſman vnto hym reſponſio aunſwere reſponſito tare make gyue aunſwere pertayned proprely lawyer theym interpretation ceremony reſponſo aunſwere reſponſum aunſwere reſponſus ſus ſui one thing doth agree conſent conueniency reſpuo ere refuſe reiecte reſpuit hoc ſapiētiſsimi cuius que fides wyſe man wyll beleue hym reſpuere imperiū wyllyng obey reſpuit hoc ferri ictum one coulde enter yron auribus hominem reſpuere wyllyng hym ſpeake reſtagno nare contayne holde water reſtat reſtare remayne thing left ſtande backe reſyſte hoc reſtat remayneth abydethe reſtauro rare reſtore make agayne reſtibilis whyche renewed ſowen agayne reſtibilis foecunditas whan female beareth euery yere reſtibilis ager fielde ſowen two yeres togyther reſticula ſmalle corde reſtinguo xi guere ſtynt put ceſſe fyre lyght thyrſte reſtio oni roper alſoo hangeth hym ſelfe reſtipulatio puttynge pledge put ingage pledge make anſwer action reſtipulor aris ari make anſwer law reſtire redye ſowen ploughed dygged reſtis halter corde rope bounche garlyke oynyons reſtem ducere whan maydens chyldren daunſe togither hande hand napkyns leadyng one ad reſtim re dijt matter deſpayre deſperate reſtito tare abyde tarye reſtituo ere reſtore yelde agayne repayre make agayn integrum reſtituere reſtore hym vnto fyrſt aſtate pugnā reſtituere begin batayl eftſones reipub reſtitui remitted ſame aſtate banyſhment reſtitutio reſtitution reſto ſtare remayne tary hic nunc credit aliquam ſibi fallaciā portare ea hic reſtitiſſe gratia wenetij worke hym ſome falſhede tary ſtyl therfore nullā quaerentes uoluptatem stoici reſtant stoike philoſophers reſyſte ſticke opinion ſeking pleſure reſtat mihi taryeth ſhal happen vnto reſtrictè reſtrictim ſtraytly ſtrayte reſtrictus nygarde reſtringo xi gere bynd ſtrayn bakward bynde agayne reſtrayne ſomtyme ſignifieth louſe apulei iumentū reſtrinxit abire que ſtabulo liberum ſinit lowſed horſe let hym lybertie reſtringit nauſeam putteth away deſyre vomyte reſulto tare leape agaynſt thynge rebounde rebell leape ſteppe backe reſumo pſi ere take agayn reſume reſuo ere ſow agayn make double ſtyche alſo ryp vndo ſowen vnſtitche sumēti uirilem togā tunica lat claui reſuta ex utra que ꝑte ad pes decidit whan came firſte man aege senatours cote beynge rypte boothe ſydes felle downe fete reſupino tourne vpwarde vpryght reuoke call backe differ peruerte reſupinus um vpryght bely vpwarde reſurgo rexi gere aryſe vp reſurrectio reſurrection retae tree growyng bankes riuers ryuers retardatio taryenge retardo dare make tary rete ti n • tte retego xi gere dyſcouer dyſcloſe retento retayn often empt eftſones retexo ere vntwiſt vntwine vnwind ſomtime twiſt wind eftſones diſſolue penelope telam retexere vndoo non poteſt niſi retexueris illa may except thou chaunge purpoſe therin retiaculum lyttell nette retiarius caſteth nette proprely fyghtynge apprehende aduerſary rete nettes ſometyme ſygnifieth one nette reticeo cui cêre holde one peace ſpeake worde kepe ſecrete ſay nothynge reticentia ſilence whan one holdeth peace reticulum lyttell net wherin man heare woman truſſed reticulatus ta tum made lyke nette reticulum caule coyfe alſo bagge meate caryed retinaculum ſo euer holdeth thynge ſtaye retineo nui nere holde againe retayne kepe remembraunce retinere holde vp man falle ah retine obſecro b obſecro quid tibi eſt diſperij b perij miſera quid ſtupes antiphila holde vp pray b alak ayleth vndone b ala euer borne dothe thy harte fayle antiphila retinere reſtrayne let one doinge wolde pudore liberalitate liberos retinere ſatius eſſe credo quam metu thynke better reſtrayne chylderne wanton wylles ſhame lyberalitie feare si ius ſuum retinet yf maynteyne title officio retinere entertayne men euer redy theyr dueties inuidiam ſuam apud improbos retinere alwayes hated vnthrifty perſons iudicem retinêre aliquem receyue one iudge iuditum ſuum retinêre perſeuer opinyon iuſtitiam retinere maynteyne iuſtyce memoria retinêre remembre modum retinere kepe meaſure morbo retineri ſycke morem retinere kepe alway one cuſtome nummos retinere kepe backe moneye whiche ought payde officium retinere well duety retinens kepeth ſtyll retiolum cawle coyfe retondeo dere klyppe ouer retorqueo torſi quere caſt backeward throwe ſhutte agayne retorreſco retorreſcere bourned ſunne retorridus da dū burned ſered parched retracto ctare call back reuoke thing done drawe backe excuſe lay nother man drawe vp retractare largitiones ceaſſe lyberall gyuynge retractare aliquid repete whiche ſpoken retractare actionem begyn action newe retraho traxi trahere pull drawe backe drawe retribuo buere recompence retrica olde wryters callyd water wherewith gardeynes watered retrimentum dragges thynge ſometyme ordure dunge retro behynde retrocedo ceſsi cedere go backe retrorſum backewarde retrorſus um tourned backewarde retroſpicere loke backe retrudo ſi dere put backe retundo dere make blunt dul whiche ſharpe alſo beate often thyng retuſus um dull blunt contrary ſharpe aliae agrorum partes quae acuta ingenia gignant aliae quae retuſa partes countrays whyche brynge forthe ſharpe wyttes ſome brynge forth dulle reualeſco ſcere recouered ſyknes reueho uexi uehere brynge cary backe agayne reuelatio reuelyng diſcloſing thing reuello reuellere pluck back pull reuelo dyſcouer reuenio nire come agayne reuera matter dede trouthe reuerendus worthy reuerence reuerens rentior rentiſsimus dothe reuerence reuerenter reuerently reuerentia reuerence honour done one reuereor reris reri haue reuerence reuerſio retourne reuertor teris ti retourne reuerto idem reuincio uinxi uincere bynde backe behynde bynd one handes behynd hym reuincere paratus eſt whiche lawyer ſaye paratus eſt uerificare redye auerre reuireſco ſcere become efteſones grene reuiſo ſere retourne ſee reuiuiſco ſcere reuyued reuoco uocare calle backe reuoke brynge agayne drawe backe rayle deathe tourne enterpryſe reuocare pedem tourne back recule ad quae exempla reuocas example putteſt thou thy defence ad manus rem reuocare bryng matter poynte comme ioynynge battayie reuocare reſtore renewe item circa omnium ordinum ſtatum domi foris que aut correxit aut exoleta reuocauit aut etiam ua inſtituit moreouer concernynge ſtate degree well within howſe without eyther dyd amende renewed thoſe thinges vſe el ordayned newe reuocare teſtes reherſe depoſitions wytneſſes reuocare ad curam doo thynge moche dylygence rem ad ſortem reuocare caſte lotte thynge lucem reuocare bryng agayn vſe reuocatio reuocation callyng backe reuolo flee backe reuoluo ui uere tourne vp downe reuolue tourne backe remoue reuolutus ta tum tourned backe remoued reuolutio tourninge backe fyrſt place poynte reuolution tournynge celeſtiall bodyes ſpheres reuorto tere olde wryters vſed reuertor retourne reus ſued accuſed ſometyme gylty reus facti gyltie offence reus agitur ſued accuſed reus peragitur condemned reus ſtipulando bargayneth reus uoti hath auowed reus de ui accuſed breakyng peace reum ſubdere accuſe one great offēce rex regis kynge rex ſacrificulus chiefe minyſter ſacrifices amonge romayns onely ¶r ante h rhabarbarum rubarbe preciouſe rote medicinable purge coler alſo corroborate ſtomake lyuer rhachinon ſpyder hauynge lyttell blacke heade ſomewhat whyte hathe ſhorte fete whoſe bytynge venymouſe ſtyngynge ſcorpyon rhadamanthus kynge lycia whyche ſtraight executour iuſtice therfore ſuppoſed paynyms afterwarde one iudges helle rhaguſium citie dalmatia rhagardes rhagadiae certayne cleftes ſome partes body rhamnus kynde brembles whyche whyte beareth fruite thanne alſo hath floures ſendeth forthe braunches ſtraight prickes croked hath brode leaues rhamnuſia callyd goddeſſe vengeaunce rhamnuſius man towne callyd rhamnus athene rhamponticum herbe roote callid greate centory named plinius ruellius wryteth rhacoma rhampſinithus proper name kynge egypt rhaphanus herbe callyd radyſhe rhebanus ryuer mouthe boſphotus countray thracia rhea callyd mother goddes callyd alſo cybele rhea ſyluia mother romulus remus rheda charyotte rhedarius charyot man rhedones cytie reynes fraunce rhegium cytie bordure italye towarde sycile alſo nother cytie farre parima rheginus man cytie rhegium calaber rhemi people fraunce callyd alſoo rhemenſes rhenones cote made ſkynnes beſtis rhenus noble ryuer germania callyd rheyne rhenenſe uinum rheynyſhe wyne rhenenſes people dwellynge ryuer rheyne rheon reubarbe rheſus kynge thracia whiche camme ayde troianes ſlayne diomedes whome ryuer troye callyd rheſus rheti people italy rhetia countray germanye hauynge weſte hylle called adula north marcheth vppon danubium eaſte vpon ryuer callyd aenus ſouthe lyeth vppon mountaynes called alpes rhetor oris teacheth rhetoryke rhetorica rhetorycke crafte eloquence rhetoricor cari ſpeake rhetorike rhetorice lyke rhetoritian rhetus gyant whome dionyſe tourned lyon ſlewe rhetoricus oratour man cunnynge crafte eloquence rhetoriſſo ſpeake fourme rhetoryke rheuma rewme diſtillation humour rheumatiſmus dyſeaſe rewme rhibis bremble callyd raſpis rhinoceron ontis beaſt hath horne noſe whyche naturally ennemye olyphaunt alſo oyle veſſell oute whyche oyle dropped rhinocerotis naſum habere ſayd wyttye iuuenes que ſenes que et pueri naſum rhinocerotis habent yong men old men chyldern wytty riphaei monte mountaynes north part worlde contynually wynter ſnow huge windes ioyneth vpon scithia aſia rhodanus ryuer france callid rone rhodia kynde vynes rhodites certayne precyouſe ſtoone colour roſe rhodius rhodes rhodope mountayne thracia rhododaphne rhododendros tree hauyng leaues lyke almond tree greatter fatte ſeedes open lyke horne whiche hath theym woulle lyke purple ſylke longe roote ſalte taſte groweth watrye place rhodomêli hony iuyce roſes boiled togyther called cōmunely mel roſatum rhodonia gardeyne roſes rhodophone parte syria gothe ouer mountayne taurus rhodopeius um pertaynyng mountayne rhodope rhodos famouſe yle ſea callyd capatthium lyenge beyonde candy hauyng north countray callyd lycia ſouth egypte yle borne many excellent philoſophers rhetorician ſometyme puyſſant ryche rhodoſtacti idem quod rhodomeli ſome put dyfference betwene ſaying rhodomeli hath thre partes iuyce roſes one parte hony rhodoſtacti hathe two partes iuyce one hony rhombus fygure foure ſquare hauynge ſydes equall corner crooked alſoo fyſhe callyd byrt alſo ſpynnynge whele tourne rhoeas whan corner eien open ſoo doo ſtylle theym continuall droppes rhoeteus rhoeteius troianus rhoetus mountayne troye aiax thelamonius buryed rhoeton wyne danubius donowe rhus whiche apothecary call sumach manardus lib 1 epiſt iiii ſayth alſo callyd ro ſyriacus rhuteni people fraunce callyd rhodes rhymnus ryuer rhyndacus ryuer whyche runneth ſea callyd pontus rhyparographus paynter tryfles ſtayner rhytion veſſelle lyke moone rhythmus numbre armony ſpeakyng alſo callyd ryme ¶r ante rica garment purple hemmed purfled alſo kerchief woman weare ricinus ricinum euery garmente foure ſquare ricinium ricinum cloke whereof parte caſte ouer man ſhoulders ricinus dogge tyke alſoo whyche apothecary calle cherua wherof made oyle ſerueth dyuerſe vſes io agricola ruellius maketh mencion cherua ſayth grekes dydde call cici ſome apothecary name cataputia maior apothecary fraunce call palma chriſti ricula handkerchiefe rictus rictum grynnynge ſkornefulle openynge mouthe alſo fourme vyſage whan man grenneth dogge brawleth rid • riſi ridère lawghe alſoo ſkorne mocke ridibundus da dum laugheth moche ridica proppe wherwith vyne lyke thynge holden vp ridiculare thynge laugh ridiculum idem alſo mocke ridiculus manne whome men doo mocke laugh ridicularius um idem quod ridiculum ridiculè foolyſhely mockage ridiculoſus um idem quod ridiculus ridiculoſè foolyſhely laughed rigatio watrynge rigeo gui gere feruently colde alſoo harde ſtyffe rigentes oculus eye whyche neuer moue rigeſco ſcere idem quod rigeo rigide ſtyffely ſharpely cruelly rigidus da dum colde harde ſtyffe ſharpe cruell rigo make weate water gardeyne fielde rigor rigoris colde hardnes ſtyffenes riguus um maye eaſylye weate watered rima chynke clefte wod ſtone cloſe ioyned rima agere clouyn chynked tymber bourdes lyenge wynde rimam inueuire fynde excuſe meane eſcape rimor aris ari ſerche dylygently alſoo cleaue tymber dothe rimula lyttell chynke clefte rimoſus um full kleftes chynkes ringo xi gere grynne ſhew teth dogge dothe whan wyll barke byte alſo angry braule barke ripa water banke riparia birde bredeth water bākes riparius um abydeth water bankes ripae ſeu ripei mountaynes archadia riphaer mountaynes scithia riſcus cofer couered lether alſo lyttel wyndowe riſibilis le whiche laughe riſum concitare make one laughe riſum captare thynge whiche cauſeth men laughe riſum aedere laughe riſus laughter riſus ſardonius laughter without myrthe madde cruell ſuche iriſhe men vſe whan angry ritè directly truely euen ſhulde rituales bookes wherin fourme ceremony olde maners cuſtomes wrytten ritus tus approued cuſtome riuales whiche equally loue one woman woars together alſo whoſe landes deuided ryuer broke alſo whiche dwell vpon ryuers riualitas tati enuy obſeruaunce betwyxte louers one woman riuinus wower idem quod riualis riuus ryuer borke riuulus littell broke riuo go watrynge beaſtes rixa braulynge contention rixoſè brawlynge rixoſus ſtriuer brawler rixor aris ari rixo contend brawlynge ¶r ante rob robub name barbarouſe ſignifyenge iuyce herbes fruites defecate rede sapa robigalia ceremonyes pertaynynge robigus preſeruatour corne robigmoſus um moche blaſted robigo honored romains goddeſſe ſuppoſed mought preſerue corne blaſting alſo vice corne called blaſtinge robigus olde romaynes named god preſerued corne blaſtyng roboraria place whiche paled aboute roboreus ea eum oken tymber roboro fortifie roboſes olde writer vſed robur ok • robur oris harde oke alſo ſtrength hardeneſſe body ſomtyme ſtrength hardenes thynge generallye alſo ſtockes priſon robus olde writer called red colour alſo maner matter whiche many redde vaynes called robus alſo kynd wheate yeldeth fayre meale whiche nowe call red wheate roburneus um oke robuſteus um idem robuſtus ta tum ſtronge harde rodo ſi dere gnawe mouſe lyke beaſte dothe ſometyme detracte backebite rodus da dum thynge vnperfecte rude vnpolyſhed vnwrought rogamen mini deſyre rogatarij notary requyred party eche ſhulde promyſe rogator rogatoris begger dore doore rogito tare intreate demaunde inquire often aſke thynge rogo require praye inquyre aſke one inacte rogare plebem inquire common contente lawe ſhall paſſe parliament go queſtion rogare aliquem ſententiam demaunde one opinion rogare ſacramento ſweare one gyue hym othe rogatio amonge romaynes whan tribune whiche heade offycers people content act ſhulde paſſe made ſenate ſame tribune deuyſed rogatus tus deſyre rogus great fyre wherin deade bodyes bourned rom citie rome romanenſis commeth countrey dwelleth rome romania countrey called thracia romanus romayne romanus na num rome romandui normandes romula tree vnder whiche romulus remus founde romuleus um romulidus da dum romulus romulus fyrſt kynge romaynes ronchiſſo route ſnorte ronchus routynge ſometyme ſcorne ronchiſonus routeth ſnorteth rorarij milites men whiche beinge lyghte armed made fyrſt ſkyrmyſhe battayle roratio dyſeaſe vynes occaſion wherof chiefe grape falle away roreſco ſcere waſhed dewe rores dewes rorifacio cere ſprynkle roro dewe drop downe lyke dewe rorulentus ta tum full dewe ro roris dewe ro ſyriacus whiche callyd apothecary sunach roſa roſe roſaceus um roſes aqua roſacea roſewater roſalia garlandes roſes roſarium gardeyne bedde roſes roſcius romayn player comedy whome excellencye pronunciation geſture noble cicero callyd iewell ſo moch delited contended hym whither roſcius could ſet forthe one ſentence mo faſcyons geſture countenaunce expreſſe ſame ſentence diuerſite eloquent wordes excellency man arte howe eſtemed fauoured romayns appered well gaue hym contynuall ſtipende one thouſande grotes euery day whyche dydde amount money xvi pound xiii iiii lucius sylla beinge dictatour gaue hym rynge goulde whyche token knyghte tyme colar chayne golde tyme roſetum gardeyne roſes roſeus um roſe coloure roſe roſidus da dum wette dewe roſio gnawynge roſmarinum roſemary lyttell ſnowte roſtellum lyttell beake bylle byrde roſtra ſtrorum roſtris place rome afore court callyd hoſtilia wherein pulpyte whyche oratours rome wont ſtande whan preached people declared matter whiche proceded worde pro roſtris pulpyt barre roſtrati naues ſhyppes hauing pike yron without ſtemme roſtrum beake byrde ſnoute beaſt fyſhe alſo ſtemme ſhyppe bote rota whele alſo kynde fyſhe rothomagus cite roan normandy roto tare tourne thynge lyke whele rotula lyttell whele rotella idem rotundè roundly aptly elegantly handſomly proprely wordes rotunditas roundneſſe rotundo dare make rounde rotundus da dum round ſomtyme well compact facyoned ore rotundo loqui expreſſe moch fewe wordes ¶r ante v rvbea tinctorum mader rubefacio cere make redde rubefio fieri made redde rubellae redde grape rubellio fyſhe callyd rochette rubellum uinum clarette wyne rubeo bere redde ruber bra brum redde rubeta tode rubetum buſſhy cloſe rubeus bea beum redde rubens idem rueba minor goſelynge wede clyuers rubeſco ſcere waxe redde rubi borum towne campania rubicon conis ryuer italy whiche diuideth galliam part italy nowe callyd romandiola olde tyme flaminea rubicundus da dum ruddy rubidus da dum ſwart redde alſo rough courſe bread hauynge moche branne rubigino ruſte rubiginoſus um ruſtye rubigo ginis ruſte rubor oris redneſſe rubrica redde chalke ruddell wherewith ſhepe marked rubriceta roſette colour rubrus um redde rubricatus ta tum coloured redde ruddelyd ſhepe rubus bremble rubus caninus wylde eglantyne bryar ructo belke breake wynd vpwarde ructor tari idem ructare crapulam ſauoure moche drynke ructiro tare breake wynde often ructuatio idem quod ructus ructus belkynge breakyng wynd vpward rudens ti cabell ſhyppe ruderarium raungynge ſyue rudero rare lay olde ſtones rubbel alſo daube lay morter ruderatus ta tum moch rubbiſh lyeth rudetum place lyeth moche rubbyſhe rubbell alſo lande whyche hath lyen leye newely put tylthe rudiae diarum old towne apulia poete ennius borne rudiarij whyche dyſcharged ſightynge ſwordes whyche callyd gladiatores openly faught one nother anymate romaynes ſheddyng theyr bloude alſo bodgers amenders olde garmentes ſeuiars maker ſyues rudicula potte ſtycke rudimentum fyrſte teachyng chyldern rudio dire teache one whiche vnlerned rudis rodde yarde whyche gyuen ſworde player whan came lx yeres olde token ſet lybertie ſometyme lybertie labour rude donari diſcharged attendance properly warres rudem accipere hath ſame ſygnification rudis de rude vnperfect newe vnwrought taught late rudis ruderis ſhardes piece ſtones broken ſhattered tubbell rubbyſhe old houſes ruditas rudeneſſe lacke lernynge wytte rudo rudi rudere braye lyke aſſe ſometyme ſpoken man ſometyme woman rufeo rufeſco ſcere ſomewhat redde rufo fare make redde rufuli certayne captayns made conſule afterwarde callyd rutuli rufus um ſomewhat redde ruga wrynkle playte rugio giui gire roore rugitus roorynge rugo gare playted wrynkled rugo xi gere belke rugoſus um full playtes wrynkles ruina ruyne extreme decay ruinoſus um ruynouſe decay rulla ſtaffe wherwith plowghmanne clenſeth culter ruma olde wryters callyd teate alſo throte bolle ruma goddeſſe whome paynyms dydde ſuppoſe beneficiall woman breſtes ſuckynge chylderne rumen dew clap breaſte alſo place bely panche rumentum braſtynge apoſteme braſteth fleſhe rumigare chewe cudde rumigero rare cary tydynges ruminatio chewyng cudde beaſt dothe alſo delyberation aduyſement ruminalis ficus fygge tree vnder ſuppoſed wolfe gaue ſucke romulus remus rumino ruminor ari chewe cud alſo call efteſones remembraunce rumex icis ſorrelle alſo weapon lyke ſpeare rumifero rumigero rare beare brynge tydynges rumigerulus tellar tydynges rumis teate rumito beare tydynges rumo gyue teate chylde rumor oris tydynges rumour bruyte rumpi porum tranſomes rumpo rupi pere breake make weary rumpere moras make haſte rumpere ſilentium kepe longer ſilēce rumpotinus bouſſhe whyche growethe fraunce columella wryteth corne ſhulde ſowen within twenty fote thereof rumpotinetum place ſuche buſhes growe rumuſculus lyttell rumour bruite rumula lyttell teate runa weapon ſomtyme vſyd fraunce runca ſawe wherwith tymber ſawen runcatio weedynge runcina whypſawe wherewith tymber ſawen alſo buſheſythe bylle cutte buſſhes runcino ſawe tymber runco care weede pull vp runſor oris one name pluto called god helle ruo rui ruere falle powre deceyued ſubuerte make playn pluck vp breake ſonder throwe downe ruere ouerthrowe runne forth hedlynge quo moriture ruis maiora que uiribus audes whyther runneſt thou headlynge ſlayne attempteſt thynges aboue thy puyſſaunce alſo lyfte vp et ruit atram ad coelum picea craſſus caligine nubem beynge thycke lyfted vp heauen cloude blacke pytche ſometyme ſygnyfieth make great noyſe ruit arduus aether hyght ſyrmamente rumbled made great noyſe ruit imbribus rayned ſoore rupes hylles bankes rockes ſoo ſteepe downe man may clymme rupicapra wylde goote rupicias damnum dederis thou ſhalt pay yelde damage ruptus ta tum broken braſt weryed torne rente ruralis le ruſticall vyllage rureſtris ſtre countrey cytie towne ruricola huſbande man rurigena borne countrey cytie great towne ruro rare countrey facion ruro raris rari dwelle countreye citie rurſus rurſum eftſones backewarde parte ru ruris countrey citie huſebandry vſed exercyſed ruſcum reade bruſcum ruſcinū ruſſilion perpignian fraūce ruſpor ari ſerche diligently properly ſhrape henne dothe whan ſhe ſekith meate ruſſus ruſſeus um redde ruſtica byrde lyke partriche hath longer byll ruſticanus na num rruſticall countrey vyllage ruſticè ruſtically vncourteyſly rudely ruſticane idem ruſticarius um perteynynge huſbandry ruſticatim ruſtice aduerbe churlyſhly ruſticitas tati carlyſhenes ſometyme fearefulneſſe et ſi ruſticitas non uetat ipſa rogat folyſhe baſhefulnes lette ſhe maketh requeſte ruſticor caris cari dwell countreye exerciſe huſbandry ruſticus ca cum ruſticall vplandyſhe homely without curteſy ruſticus alſo proper name man rutheni people beyonde liuonia countrey nowe called ruſsia alſo people fraunce toures ſo called ruta rewe called alſo herbe grace amonge lawyer dygged grounde ſtone cole leade mettall ruta caeſa albeit mutius doth ſay rutis caeſis thoſe thynges faſte grounde parte buyldynge couerynge houſe perchaunce mought name moueables rutabulum coole rake make cleane ouen rutaceus um rewe rutatus ta tum made rewe rutatio rutus ructatio belkynge rutellum lyttell mattocke rutilo lare ſhyne ruto tare ructo • ke breake winde vpwarde rutor idem rutrum mattocke rutum idem rutuba trouble id poſtea uiderimus nunc ſumus rutuba wyll afterward ſe nowe trouble rutuba riuer liguria runnynge mountaygne callyd apenninus rutubatri men dygge mattockes rutuli auncient people italy whome turnus kynge whome aeneas dyuell callyd bycauſe aduerſary chriſte alſo ſo euer cōtrary peace called satanas satarchae people scithia whiche excluded vſe golde ſyluer satellis litis one retayned garde mannes perſone alſo catchepoll bayliff doth attache men satellitium garde offyce ſuche perſon offycer saterona beaſte dothe lyue ſomtyme water ſometyme lande satias ſacierie fulneſſe wearyneſſe moche vſynge thynge ſommetyme ſygnifieth aboundance hi ſaltibus occupatis externorum agros inuaſêre frumenti que ex inopia graui ſatias facta gotten woodes forreſtes inuaded landes borderer ſcarſitie corne hapned haue fylle abundance satiabilis le whyche maye eaſylye ſatisfied satie ſatietas satietas tati ſacietie fulneſſe rerum omnium ſatietas tedyouſeneſſe thynges satin ſatiſne satin ſana • e arte thou well eaſe satin ſaluae thynges well satio tionis acte ſowyng corne satio tiare ſaciate fylle whiche hath relation onely bodye ſences alſo mynde satis ynough moch doth nede ſufficient satis acceptio couenaunt wherby man bounden ſureties hym satiſaccipere take ioynt ſureties satis iam uerborū eſt thou haſt ſayd inough satis habere content satis habeas nihil etiam tecum de tui fratris iniuria conqueri content haue alſo layd charge wronge brother hath done satiſdatio ſatiſdatum dati ſuretie bonde wherby men bounden perfourmance couenaunt couenaunter ſureties hym satiſdator bounden performance ſpoken hath principall reſpect scordion hath leaues lyke germander moche larger ſtalke foure ſquare hath ſome part ſauour garlike whiche forme declareth neyther ranſoms yet ſaulce alone scordotis idem scoria refuſe mettall tried fyre ſometyme ſygnifieth care grefe scorodon garlyke scorpena fyſſhe whyche keepeth ſelfe one make scorpiones croſſebowes well ſhoote arrowes ſtones scorpionarij whyche doo ſhote croſſebowes scorpites ſtone colour ſcorpyon scorpiuros herbe whyche hath ben ſuppoſed herbe callyd ruddes marygoldes curioſitie late phiſytions wyl ſuffre marigoldes ſo named bicauſe ſome part colour floure agreeth old deſcription withſtāding reſydue forme propreties vertues repugne hath ben proued scorpiuros may marygouldes colour floures ſundry cuntreis haue ben founde ſomewhat vary likewyſe quantitie faſcion leafe wherin doubt many deceiued ſuperfluous curioſitie iudgyng herbes scrofularia ſome thynketh blynde nettyll herbe called dioſcorides chelidonium minus scorpius ſcorpio oni venymous worme callyd ſcorpyon whyche ſtryketh tayle neuer ceaſſeth ſearche may haue occaſion ſtryke alſo ſygne fyrmament alſo croſſebow ſome men take arke buſhe alſo whyp hauyng plummettes leade endes cordes alſo herbe whiche hath ſedes lyke ſcorpyons tayle scortea whyche lether scortei nummi lether money scortes codde man beaſt scorteus tea teum whiche made ſkynnes scortor aris ari haunte companye harlottes scortum harlotte ſtrumpette alſoo hyde beaſte scotia scotlande parte britania ryuer twede catanes scoti scottes scottyſhemen whome ſayncte hierome writeth wyſe quid loquar de caeteris nationibus quū ipſe aduleſcentulus gallia uiderim scotos gentem britannicam humanis ueſci carnibus quum per ſyluas porcorum greges armentorum pecudum que reperiant paſtorum nates foeminarum papilla ſolere abſcindere ſolas ciborum delitias arbitrari ſhall ſpeake nation ſens whan boy ſawe fraunce scottes people brytayne eate mennes fleſhe whan founde foreſtes herdes ſwyne beaſtes cattalle wolde cutte buttockes boyes whyche kept alſo woman pappes toke moſt deyntie delycate meate scotos greke darkenes aptely callyd northerne tungue myrke scotoma ſcotomia dymneſſe ſyght scranteum ſkynne wherin arowes put may called ſheafe scraptia worme whiche founden leaues alſo vyle ſtynkyng harlotte driuelyng queane screabile whiche may ſpette retched lungues ſtomakes screator reacheth ſpytteth screatus tus ſpettynge retching ſpitte screo reache ſpettynge scriba secretary notary ſcribe clerke offycer scribello lare old wryters vſed scribo scriblita delycate meate made paſte ſtuffed wounden lyke rope thynke ſuche fertes portyngal scribligo ginis vntrue fourme ſpeaking writinge callyd alſo soloeciſmus scribo ſcripſi ſcribere write alſo make ſometyme paynte scribere nummos alicui deliuer money exchaunge banke supplimentum legionibus ſcribere performe make vp legion number ſouldiours scrinarius keper ſecrete letter scriniolum caſket forſar scrinium coffer lyke place wherin iewelles ſecrete thynges kepte euidences recordes iudgementes inrollementes scriptio inſcription wryting scriptor toris wryter scriptorius um apt wrytyng scriptum whiche wrytten scriptura wrytyng ſomtyme ſtyle alſo recknynge baylyffe whyche byeth ſelleth cattell hym whyche ought paye certayne reuenewes whyche hathe hyred scripturarius writeth thynges whyche commonly done bokes recknynge baylyffes reues clerke scrobs ſcrobis dyche furrowe scrobulus lytell dyche furrowe scropha ſowe hath pygges scrotum codde ſkynne wherein ſtones man scrotum alſo lytell ymages made paſte whyche wonte giuen chyldren scrupuloſus um ſcrupulouſe doubtfull lyghte thynges ſometyme ſygnyfieth dyffuſe dyfficulte scrupuloſa re thyng wherin ſemeth ſome dyfficultie scrupulatim ſmalle piece scrupulus lyttell ſharpe ſtone whiche ſometyme hapneth falle mannes ſhowe hurte hele alſo taken moch ſollicitude alſo dyffycultie ſpyced conſcience alſo poyſe whyche thyrde parte dramme alſo written scrypulus scrupulum inijcere bryng mannes mynde doubte carefulnes thought scrupulū eximere put away dout care scrupus lyttell ſtone piece ſtone scrupeus um ſtonye scruta olde garmentes horſeſhoen ſuche baggage ſolde neceſſitie alſo lyttell ymages made paſte ſolde people scrutarius ſelleth old ſtuffe maketh ſuche ymages scrutinium ſerche scrutor aris ari ſerche scrutellus bely ſwyne farced ſtuffed sculna olde wryters vſed ſcuttula scutuca ſkourge scutula rounde fygure ſuche ſpynners ſpyders warke alſo veſſell whyche contayneth viii ounce alſo ſtaffe wherwith flaxe beaten scutulatus ta tum rounde wrought fourme copwebbe scutulata ueſtis garment ſylk wherin wrought figure like round copwebbes scutulatus colour ſuppoſe wachet scutulum lyttell ſhielde scutum tergat ſhielde bucklar scylace citie grecia scylla dangerouſe rock ſea sicile alſo lady daughter niſus kyng megarenſis whiche loue minois hir father ennemy ſtale pourple heare father head whiche cauſed hym vanquyſhed ſhe beyng forſaken minois threwe ſelfe ſea transfourmed • nto byrde name alſo kynde fyſhe ryuer liris campania alſo herbe hathe rote lyke oynyon apothecary callyd squilla scylliticus um herbe scyllaceum towne furthermooſte parte italy fyrſte buylded inhabyted men athene scylleta place wherin taken fyſhe called scilla scylleum promontorie hyll parte grecia nowe called morea scyllis name greke whiche ſwymmynge vnder water dyd cut ſunder cable ſhyppes perſians scyllus iuntis towne achaia scylutus name man whiche hauynge foure ſcore ſonnes whan dyed called afore hym delyuered eueriche ſhefe arrowes comaundyng breake ſheafes incontinente whiche whan mought toke ſheafes one arrowe brake lyghtely declaryng therby vnto ſons continued agreed well together ſhulde puyſſaunte varied diſſeuered ſhulde feble ſhortely diſtroyed countrey whiche ſtretcheth eaſt ryuer tanais hath ſouth parte sacos sogdianos people vnder kynge perſia northe parte countreyes vnknowen deſerte nowe vnder dominion great cane cataye scitha man woman burienge sepultus ta tum buried hyd alſo lyke deade sepum talowe sepatius um talowe sequana ryuer fraunce called sein sequani burgonions highe burgoyne sequā que ſeorſū quan que euery womā apart serenitas fayreneſſe wether drythe sereniſsimus terme appropried nowe adayes kynges onely vſurped moſte famous moſte renoumed sereno make fayre clere serenus um fayre clere without cloudes seres people aſia hauynge great plentye ſylke sericae ueſtes ſylken garmentes sereſco ſcere fayre drie alſo tourned whay seria erneſte wordes graue ſad seria erthen veſſell whiche longe sericarius weauer generall name cichory endiue rede intybus seriphus yle grecia ſea called aegeum serius um erneſt graue importaunce sermo monis ſpeche fourme ſpeking ſometyme oration alſo communication sermocinor aris ſedes ſetteth herbes sertum garlande floures sertus ta tum ſet flowres garlande sertula compana herbe called melylote seruo kepe preſerus poſſede dwelle place seruare fidem kepe towche faythfulle delyuereth one harme seruaueris take good hede thou doſte seruilis le perteynynge ſeruice bellum ſeruile warre whiche ſeruantes romaynes made agayne theyr lordes seruiliter lyke bondman ſlaue seruio uiui uire ſerue seruire auribus flatter seruire alicui rei intende vpon one thyng aetati ſeruire accommodare hym ſelfe age one petitioni ſeruire nothynge elles attende ſatiſfie deſyre scoenae ſeruire accordyng tyme requireth romori ſeruire go gette great name valitudini ſeruire prouyde helthe seruitium ſeruyce seruitia bondemen seruitus bondage serum laſte parte day euenlide alſo whay mylke serus um late ſometyme great serum arbor tree whiche bryngeth forth leaues late serum lumen almoſte nyghte serae frondes leaues whiche doo fall verye late serum omnia full ſorowe heuyneſſe serum bellum great warre seruus ſeruant properly whiche compelled ſerue bondman apprentyſes done ❀seruum poecus prouerbe applyed hym whiche ſpeakynge wrytynge dare digreſſe mannes ſteppes fourme wrytynge seſama aſſured agaynſte theym callyd sophiſtae apollo queſtyon beyng demaunded wyſeſt man lyuynge aunſwered socrates mayſter plato xenophon xenocrates greatteſt phyloſophers tyme lyuynge beſydes excellencye vertue knowledge rare meruaylous nature moughte ſuſtayne heate colde labour hunger thyrſte aboue man tyme alcibiades declareth plato affyrmed alwaye hym ſpyryte ſpirytuall power callyd daemonium whyche often meuyd doo thynge conuenyent neceſſarye ſpyryte towched hym dydde prohybyte hym doo vnder ſharpe mery tauntes fourme argument called induction cauſed menne perceyue theyr ignoraunce thoughte theym ſelues wyſe fynallye beynge enuyed theym whyche dydde beare chyefe rule athene accuſed anytus melyſſus poete lycon oratour ſpake agaynſt theyr goddis corrupted chylderne peruerſe doctryne contemnyng deth wolde ſuffer man ſpeake hym ſoo drynkynge poyſon ioyouſe countenaunce ſay • nge anytus brynge good lucke dyed incontynent ſoone people ſo ſoory death accuſers ſomme ſlewe ſome sputor tari ſpytte sputum ſpyttell ¶s ante q squalla olde wryters vſed ſqualida squalleo lui lêre fylthye ſluttiſſhe ſoyled ſtayned ſom vnclene thing▪ squallent arua fieldes full wedes squallide yll fauouredly squallidae re thynges vnpleaſaunt squallidus da dum ſluttyſhe fylthy cauſyng one abhorre ſyght therof ſometyme ſygnifieth ſpotted alſo carrayn leane squallidus ager grounde tylthe alſo ſhynynge squallor loris ſluttyſhnes fylthynes squalido dinis ſqualliditas ſame squalus fyſſhe squama ſkale fyſhe squamatim facion ſhales squammoſus ſkaly squatina ſoole fyſſhe roughe ſkynne wherwith fletcher doo make theyr arrowes ſmoothe squaroſus um rough ſharpe lyke thynge whiche ſkaly squilla fyſhe callyd ſhrympe alſo herbe rede scylla squinitij people italye callyd sabelli samnite ¶s ante st voyce hym commaundeth ſylence ſay englyſhe huſht whan wolde haue one holde peace stabilimentum whyche kepeth thynge ſtedfaſte stabilio liui lira make ſtedfaſt ſtable stabilis le ſtable ſtedfaſt stabulariae mulieres woman whyche keepe vyttaylynge howſes refreſſhe wayfarynge men stabularius inholder alſo hath charge houſe cattall kept stabulari dama aut ceruos falowe deere redde dere lodged harborowed stabulo bulare ſtande cattalle dothe ſtable stabulatio ſtandynge lyenge cattell alſoo harbourynge lodgynge dere stabulum ynne men lodge bait alſo general name place cattell doo abyde whan come paſture alſo ſtable wherin horſes mule kepte stactis ſtacte whiche called commonly storax liquida stacteus um gummy stadiodromos place ordeyned runne stadiodromus rounneth courſe runnynge stadium place wherin runnyng exercyſed well men horſes stadium alſoo quantytie meaſure grounde whereof cenſorinus writeth three ſortes one italye conteyned dcxxv fete cxxv paſis ſeconde called olympicum dc fete cxx paſis thyrde called pythicum whiche conteyned thouſande feete whiche two hundred paſis peraduenture gotten plinius solinus whan wrate deſcription sicilia maketh variaunce betwene diodorus siculus stadium called italica italy viii doo make italion myle conteynynge thouſande paſe euery paſe beinge fyue fete haue none name gyue furlonge stagma oyntemente stagno properly water ſtande flowe stagnum ſtandynge water poole alſo certayne mettall called tynne staloginum thyng hange one eare egyptian haue sta men cloth whan lome frame alſo threde stanneus um tynne stannum mettall called tynne stapes ſtyroppes staphyle vyne staphylus dyd fyrſte myngle water wyne staphis kynde vynes hath black ſtemme ſtraight hath fruite lyke lyttel bladder grape whiche grene within whiche kernell thre cornered staphilinus wylde parſenepe staphis agria stafſagre stata ſacrificia ſacrifyce cuſtomably done certayne dayes olde ordinance statae matris ſimulachrum ymage whiche ſette vp people euery ſtrete rome status ta tum fyrme ſtable alſo ordeyned decreed statarius um ordinarie stater teris certayne coygne whiche value foure drammes foure grotes viii ounce statera beame way without balance staticulum certayn wanton meuyng danſynge ſometyme lyttell carte stati dy dayes ordinarie dayes banke apparaunce party plede statilinus called priuate god whiche men ſuppoſed alwaye statina yle staticulum lyttell ymage statiuncula idem lyttell reſtynge place statius noble poete statim anon conſtantly continually statio oni place eyther menne warre ſhyppes abyde reſte certayne tyme stationalis le whiche ſtandeth faſte abydeth stationarii milites ſouldyours whiche aſſygned abyde ſtyl one place kepe towne fortreſſe march countreye statiua ſtatiuum certayne place fortyfyed men warre laye ſiege fortreſſe stator toris ſeruaunte whiche alwayes redye attendynge aboute officer commaundement wherfore worde included purſeuauntes poſtes ſergeauntes baylyffes catchepols alſo iupiter called iupiter ſtator romulus bycauſe ſuppoſed made romayns tary whan fledde samnite purſuynge theym statua ymage mettall yuorye ſtone tymber statuaria crafte grauynge yettyng ymages statuarius carueth yetteth image statuarius um perteynynge ymages statuere ex aequo bono iudge determyne accordynge equitie leſſe rigour lawe wolde require statuere pretium ſette pryce thinges vendible statumen mini whiche ſet vp ſuſteyne beare thynge proppe statumino proppe vp vnderſet make ſure statuo tui tuere ordeyne determyne iudge eſteme ſet faſte ſtable thynge dedicate beate one thynge sublimen illum arriperem caput primū terram ſtatuerem ut cerebro diſpergam uiam wolde lyfte hym hyghe beat heade ground mought ſcatter brayne abrode hyghe waye apud animum ſtatuere determine mynde exemplum ſtatuere aliquo puniſhe one ſuche wyſe may take enſaumple therby statuere aliquem exemplum idem statuere aliquem make ordynaunce agaynſte one mercedem ſtatuere aſſigne one wage ſhall haue modum ſtatuere appoynte rule statuere quanti hoc putetis quam multo redemiſſe thynke worthe howe moche coſte statuam ſtatuere alicui ſet vp one ymage statura ſtature man staturus um participle future ſto ſtas ſtare ſtande status tus ſtate among oratours lawyer caſe whiche riſeth contention wherin matter reſteth whiche muſte replyed vnto eyther denyed confeſſed trauerſed tullie called conſtitutio cauſae status ſtata ſtatum fyrme stati dy dayes appoynted stati redditus rente certayne steatoma gatherynge greace fatte ſome place agaynſte nature stechades thre lyttell yle marſiles stega cabyn ſhip alſo cote cotage stegnae febres feuers whiche manne may haue neyther ſiege vrine ſweat none euacuation stele lyttell pyllars stella ſterre alſo ſterrcfyſhe alſo name poete stella crinita blaſynge ſterre stellatus ta tum full ſterres stellatura extortion capitaynes takynge ſouldiours portion vyttayle apoynted vnto thē emperour stellio beaſte lyke lyſarde hauynge backe ſpottes lyke ſterres sentor toris man whiche voice loude xx men stephanoma euery herbe ſerueth garlandes stephanoplocus maker garlandes stephanus greke crowne stercoratio dungynge stercorarius ria um perteynynge dounge maſculus sterto tui tere route whan one ſleapeth steſichorites noumber eyght dyſe ſo called ſepulchre steſichorus poete whiche made fygure lyke eyghte dyſe steſichorus famouſe poete whome wrytten whan infaunt cradell nyghtyngale ſatte mouthe dyd ſinge ſignifienge ſhoulde ſweteſte poete euer afore hym alſo • ounde fyrſte ſinginge ſounges daunſe stibadium chayre couche made herbes wounde together stigma matis marke made fyre hotte yron somtyme ſignifieth infamy reproche obiected openly stigmatici perſones infamed stilla droppe stilbo philoſopher vide ſtilpo stilbon ſterre mercuri stillicidium droppynge houſe stillo droppe stilpo philoſopher borne citie megara greece whiche counireye beinge bourned wyfe chyldren loſte fyre eſcaped departing alone whan kynge demetrius aſked loſte thynge aunſwered haue loſte nothyng al myne carie meanynge therby vertue proper goodes wyſe man may taken hym toke waye hym stilpones dwarfes stimulo pricke stimulatio prickinge feruente mouinge thynge stimulator pricketh stimuleus um whiche done pryckynge stimulus gode wherwith ox dryuen stingo ſtinguo guere put lyghte stipa ſtupa towe stiparius um perteynynge ſtoppynge beatynge harde together stipatores whiche doo frayte ſhyp laye ſuch fardelles burdeynes caryed alſo whiche kynges garde alwaye perſon stipatus enuyroned men defended prince theyr garde stipendialis le perteyninge wage stipendiarius um whiche payeth tribute ſome called contributary fyndynge army defence countrey stipendiatus taketh wage stipendioſus hath ben oftentymes hyred retayned warres confectis ſtipendijs whan tyme ſeruiſe stipendior diari hyred retayned warres stipendijs duobus two fyrſt yeres stipendium wage properly gyuen ſouldyours alſo ſubſidie paide princis stipendia facere ſerue warres ſouldioure stipe pitis ſtake alſo ſticke stipo ſtop chynkes clyftes properly ſhyppes botes towe pitche alſo enuirone intent defende one stips uel ſtipis pi wage men hyred alſo money gyuen beggar stipem confert bringeth gayn stipem pergere ſowe money amonge people giue largeſſe stiptica medicamenta medicine doo bynde reſtrayne stipula holme erige ſtrawe apt thatch houſes ſome taken huſke cloſeth ſtrawe stipulatus tus ſtipulatio bargayn promyſe obligation pay moneye perfourme thynge whiche required stipulor aris ari make bargayne promyſe effectually required hath bothe actiue paſſiue ſygnification stipulor ab te require required stiria yſikle droppe yſe stiria countrey ioynynge auſtria carinthia eſte parte germanye full mountaynes ſauinge littell parte bordryng hungary people rude woman haue ſo full duſte boſe hic corpus ſolidum inuenies hic ſtare papilla pictor marmoreo marble ſtone ſhalte thou fynde paynted body founde pappes imboſed alſo immouable alwaye certayne sic ſtat ſententia ſo commaunded promiſsis ſtare abyde promyſe stare firmum ſtande faſte stat per per te per illum whanne cauſe thynge done si poterit fieri ut ne pater per ſtetiſſe credat quo minus hae fierent nuptiae uo lo wold may father ſhuld thinke long mariage toke none effecte stat myne opinion stat apud te fides parum thou arte ſmalle credence acie ſtare fielde durynge battayle statur ſtande stoecades foure ſuche robe alſo maye called honourable stolidè folyſhely lewdely stoliditas folyſheneſſe lewdenes stolidius folyſhely stolidus da dum foolyſhe lewde condition odiouſe stolones braunches whiche ſprynge alſo whiche called ventriculus whervnto haue none name ſtomake ſometyme ſignifieth indignation vehement wrathe hatrede abhorrynge thyng lyketh v ſome tyme facilitie gentylneſſe stomatichus hath ſore mouth storax racis ſwete incenſe gumme alſo called ſtyrax wherof two kyndes one called storax calamita called ſtorax liquida storea thynge ſpred ground alſo matte strabo looketh ſquynt gogle cied alſo bed stratum al layd bed alſo horſe harneyſe ſtrete caulſay paued ſtone strebula olde tungue vmbri piece fleſh offered ſacrifice strena newe yeres gyfte preſente strenué valyantly quickly boldely strenuitas tati actiuitie strenuus um valiaunt prompt actife bold strepito tare make noyſe often strepitus tus noyſe made handes fete strepo pui pere make great noyſe properly goinge clappynge handes ſome tyme generally strepſiceroti certayne beaſtes affrike hauynge croked horne stria rabat ſmall furrowe made ſtone tymber chamferynge striata alſo creuiſes ſmall line whiche ſene herbes stribligo ginis viciouſe fourme ſpeaking wordes agree partes ſpeche order striblita breade made lyke rope cordes wounden stricte ſtraightly strictim ſhortely towched one strictim referre reporte moche fewe wordes strictim attondere clyppe strictior tiu ſtraight strictiſsimus um moſte ſtraite strictiuella foule ill fauoured harlot strictiuae oliues gathered man hande stricturae ſparkes whiche iſſue frome mettall whan taken fyre beaten hammer strideo duo dére ſtrido dis dere craſhe make noyſe lyke cordes whan drawen stridon towne dalmatia ſaincte hierome borne striga rewe thynges whan layde lengthe alſo ridge lande wherof commeth ſtrigatus ager striges ſhrycheoules alſo woman whiche ſuppoſed come nyghte houſes ſucke bloudde chylderne ſome calle hegges strigia wyde garmentes made lether vſed warres strigil gilis horſecombe alſo thyng wherwith wraſtlers bounde theyr bodyes whan wraſtled alſo certayne veſſell strigiles rubbing combes made ſwete wod wherwith india men rubbed exerciſe alſo kerchifes wherwith wraſtlers theyr labour wyped theyr body alſo certayne veſſels alſo piece fyne golde founde mynes vnmyxte matter alſo lyttell fyſhes moſte commonly taken wynter tyme strigilecula diminutiue ſtrigil strigillo ſtraine harde strigium ſpaynyſhe garment strigmenta fylthyneſſe whiche commeth frō mannes body whan waſſhed alſo corruption oyle strigo gonis well pight man well compacte studioſus ſtudiouſe diligent conſtant addict feruently diſpoſed alſo fauoring nother studioſè ſtudiouſly deſprouſely studium ſtudy ſometyme exerciſe wyll appetite deſyre diligence fauour loue scinditur incertum ſtudia contraria uulgus vnſtedfaſte people diuyded dyuerſe opinion stultitia foly knowen foure thynges hath remēbrance ſhulde haue hath dothe retayn doth folowe good councell dothe approue yll councell affection stultior moricho neglecteth owne buſyneſſe home applieth men abrode alſo prouerbe touchyng whiche thynges cauſe theym laughed ſcorne stultior choroebo prouerbe applyed foles wyll aſſaye thynge aboue theyr wyt lernynge choroebus felowe aſſayed nūber wawes ſea whan hym ſelfe coulde tell number aboue fyue stultè folyſhely stultiloquentia ſtultiloquium foolyſſhe babblynge stultiloquus talketh ſpeaketh foolyſhely stultior ſtultius folyſhe stultiſsimus mum moſte folyſhely stultius folyſhely stultorum feria tyme moneth februarie fooles kepte holye fooles holyedaye stultus dothe thynge vnabuiſedly without diſcretion stupa towe courſe parte flaxe stuparius malleus hammer wherwith calkers beate towe ſhyps bootes stupefactus aſtonyed stupefio aſtonyed abaſhed stupeo ſtupeſco pui pere aſtonyed diſmayde ſometyme meruayle stupefacio cere make aſtoned cauſe meruayle abaſhed stupentia uel ſtupida membra membres whiche haue loſte theyr ſence felinge stupiditas abaſhemente stupidus diſmayed abaſſhed alſo feleth nothynge lacketh ſences stupor poris abaſhement ſodayne priuation ſence felynge stuprè diſhoneſtly ſhamefully stupro commytte aduoultrie elyſius whiche paynyms ſuppoſe place pleaſure wherein reſted ſoules good men stylobata trough tymber wherin water runneth conuayed ceſterne stylus ſtile whiche qualitie wordes ſpeakynge ſometyme harde ſometyme eaſy ſometyme meane alſo elegant fourme order writinge ſpeakynge stymphalus ryuer arcadia stymphalide coppe fethers whiche ſtandeth heade byrde larke heron peacocke stipticus ca cum ſtoppeth bindeth ſtraineth eaten drounken alſo whiche taſtyng ſemeth ſtraine tunge quince red wyne styrax racis ſoote gumme called ſtorax wherof two kyndes one called ſtorax calamita ſtorax liquida whiche stacte styx ſygnifieth ſorowe heuyneſſe poetes fayne fenne whiche helle ¶s ante v svada called greke pitho called goddeſſe eloquence dylectable ſpeche suadela perſuaſion fayre ſpeche suadeo ſi dêre suapté owne nature suarius ſwyne herde suaſibiliter aduerbe ſignifienge maner perſwade suaſio exhortation mocion perſuaſiō suaſor ſoris doth exhorte suaſum euery colour maye tourne colour suauiatio poculum ille bibit caput ponit cum dormiſcit ei ſubduco anulum laſte dranke great draught layd downe heade whyles ſlept ſtale rynge hym tempus eſt ſubducere hinc tyme get henſe lac agni ſubducere ſucceſſe good yll succida woulle vnwaſhed succidaneae hoſtiae beaſtes ſacrifice whyche kylled ſeconde place nexte fyrſte succidaneus um whyche foloweth fyrſte succidia pyece flyche bakon ſalted alſo larde succido cidi cidere felle cutte downe alſo falle vnder succiduus um whyche dothe ſuccede folowe alſo lowe redy fall downe succidus da dum moyſt full iuyſe succingo xi gere gyrde alſo enuyronne cui ſuckynge mylke succus iuyce humour whiche bodye receyueth meate drynke alſo generallye maner iuyſe succuſſarius ſuccuſſor trottynge horſe succuſo ni idem succuſſatio ſuccuſſura ſuccuſſatura ſterres whiche doo appere xii calendes iune callyd succulae hiades sudarium napkynne sudes certayne ſpeare whyche burned ende sudo dare ſweate labour ſoore haue moche sudor doris ſweate sudum clere parte fyrmamente betwene cloudes alſo clere fyrmament cloudes suefacio ſuefio fieri wonte suere aliquid capiti gette ſhrewde tourne metuo lenonem ne quid ſuo ſuat capiti aferde bawde leſt get ſhrewde tourne sueſco ſueui ſueſcere wonte sueui people hygh germany sueuia chiefe countrey germany fertilitie holſomnes beautyfull perſonages hath eaſt bauiere weſt halſate ryuer rhene ſouth mountaynes alpes north frankelande ſometyme called alemania wherof germany callyd almayn duche nowe callyd swaue suffarcinatus ta tum laded truſſed suffarcino nare laade bourdeyne truſſe vp suffarraneus caryeth meale flowre place ſelle lyttell quantitie suffectus whiche offycer beyng dead remoued ſette place suffes amonge carthaginenſes conſule rome suffibulum artyre whyche nunnes veſta dydde weare theyr heades whan dyd ſacrifyce suffero ſufferre ſuſtayne putte vnder ſuffer sufficio feci ficere ſuffyſe indure mynyſter ſubſtitute ſtayne sufficit ſuffyſeth suffimentum perfume fumigation suffio fiui fire perfume suffiſcus codde ramme whyche made purſe conteyne money suffitio ſuffitus tus perfume fumigatiō suffitor toris bloweth fyre suffitus ta tum perfumed sufflamen wherwith whele retayned ſtopped courſe sufflatio blowynge sufflator oris bloweth sufflatus ta tum blowen sufflo blowe suffocatio ſtranglynge suffocator ſtrangleth suffoco care ſtoppe breath ſtrangle suffodio foſsi dere dygge vnder suffoſſus equus ſtumblynge horſe suffragatio declaration conſent fauor suffragator toris ſupporter maynteyner suffragium voyce people aſſemblyd gyuing conſent alſo helpe ſuccour alſo wrecke ſea suffragines ioyntes hynder legge beaſte callyd howx ſometyme dothe ſygnifie paſternes alſo yonge ſprynges vynes suffraginoſi equi horſes whych haue peynes ſcratches suffragor gari gari beare fauour suffrutex ticis thynge whyche groweth hauynge forme meane betwene herbe whiche frutex suffulcio cij cire proppe vp suffulcior cire propped vp vnderſet suffundatum vnderlayde suffundo dere caſt downe powre lykour thynge caſte abrode suffundo dare buylde ſette vppon foundation suffuror rari ſteale pryuyly suffuſio webbe eye suffuſus um ſprynkled indewed suggero geſsi gerere mynyſter gyue thynge ſende forthe thynges whereof plenty suggerere ſumptus allowe expenſes suggeſtus uel ſuggeſtum pulpytte hyghe place whiche oratours capytaines made propoſitions vnto people suggrundia euys howſe whyche deſendeth walles rayne suggrundaria buryals yonge infantes suggrundatio eueyſynge houſe suggillo lare make blacke ſpotte ſkynne beatynge alſoo ſkorne detracte infame reproue condempne suggillatio marke vyſage blacke blewe made ſomme ſtroke mocke detraction infamation behynde oone condemnation suggillatus ſpotted mocked detracted infamed condemned sugo ſugeo ſuxi ſugere ſouke suinus um ſuillus um ſowe sulcatim furrowes sulco care falowe sulcus cu furrowe serere tertio quarto quinto ſulco ſow thyrd fourth fyfthe falowe sommetyme put dyche alſoo maner cuttynge earthe proprely ſygnifyeth thyng longe ſharpe edged biſulum animal beaſte hath feete clouen two talon sulla cruell tyrant romanyns callyd alſo sylla sulmo monis towne countrey peligna ouidius poete borne sulmonenſis man woman citie
