dioſcorides calleth rhus alſoo callyd ro ſyriacus manardus lib epiſt 4 sumanus alway taketh sum e thou art eſt sū amphytrionis amphitriōs ſeruāt sunt mihi bi ſeptē praeſtanti corpore nymphae haue fouretene maydens excellent beaultie sum mora illi make hym tary sum moetu aferde sum noxia put blame sum olde wryters vſed eum hym sit ueſtra benignitas ad audiendum pleaſeth sunt ſeptem dy ſeuen dayes agone sumanalia great cake made lyke whele ſuche made bridales church goinges sumen mini made pappes ſow cut daye ſhe hath varowed powdred ſalt sumo ſumpſi ſumere take vppon oone take generally hyre conſume borow alſo ſpende beſtowe one quod enim peruentum quo ſumpta nauis eſt non domini nauis eſt ſed nauigantium vntylle comme place whyther ſhyppe hyred ſhyppe owner theyrs whyche paſſagers mala uxore que inimico ſi quid ſumas ſumptus eſt ſhrewd wyfe ennemye ſo euer thou beſtoweſt waſt sumere aquamè puteo drawe water welle sumere confidentiā truſt take corage sumere mutuum borowe sumere obſequium animo reioyce take comfort sumere operam fruſtra labour vayne sumere optionem chuſe sumere perſonam counterfayt sumere ſupplicium punyſhe summa collection thynges wordes alſo princypall poynt matter concluſyon thynge summa aetas later age sūmates chief perſons realme citie summatim ſummatè compendiouſely euerye parte matter ſummarily ad ſummum duo two moſte summè excellently chyefly summenianae uxores hores kepte ſtede wyues summenium place baudry kepte without walles towne summiſsi murmurer summiſsim ſummiſſe ſoftly lowde summiſſus um baſe lowe summitas heyght hyghenes summitudo dinis heyght thynge summitto miſi mittere conuey priuyly alſo ſuffre growe summittere barbam let bearde grow let departe summoenius nia nium whyche vnder walles summo make hygheſt summus um hygheſt extreme greatteſt commendable excellent summum moſte summo iure agere take rygour extremitie lawe ſuite summum faſtigium imponere fynyſhe thyng perfitly bring matter poynt summam manum addere idem ſignificat sumptifacio cere ſpende sumpti ſumptus plurali numero sumptuarius um whiche doth pertayn expenſes sumptuariae leges lawes made reſtraynyng outragious expences sumptuoſè ſumptuouſely chargeably sumptuoſus um ſumptuouſe sumptus ta tum taken choſen sumptus tus expenſe sunium promontory elbowe countrey attica suo ſui ſuere ſowe ioyne make faſte togyther suopte ingenio owne propre wytte sup ſuper aboue supellectilis le ſupellex houſeholde ſtuffe thynges mouable within houſe supellecticarius bondeman ſlaue whiche accompted chatell super ſupra vppon aboue super garamantas indos proferet imperium ſhall aduaunce empyre beyonde garamantians indian super coenam ſupper super haec moreouer super euclionis filiā euclions doughter super priamo ſuper hectore priamus hector hac ſuper te ſcribā ad te rhegio matter write vnto frō regiū super propter nec ſuper ipſe ſua molitur laude laborem taketh peyne prayſe super ualdè accenſa ſuper thoſe wordes ſhe beyng kendlyd ſtyred superaddo dere putte adde superbè prowdely superbiter idem superbia pryde superbio ire prowde superbiloquens ſuperbiloquus ſpeketh proudely hautely superbiloquentia proude haute wordes superbos old writer vſed mortuos dead bycauſe pompe whyche buryenge faciam ego hodie te ſuperbum niſi hinc abis wyll kyll yf thou get henſe superbus proude ſomtyme magnifyke noble alſo hyghe ornate garnyſſhed ryche wycked superbum bellum vniuſt vnhappy warre supercido dere falle supercilioſus ſowre countenaunce supercilium ouerbrowe ſometyme ſygnifyeth pryde grauitie alſo haunce whyche ouer doore supercilium attollere ſtately proude supercilium ponere laye aparte pryde ſtately countenaunce supercreſco ſcere ouergrowe supercubo bare lye ouer superduco cere put lay superedo dere eate thynge supereſsit ſupererit ſhall lyue left lyue supereſt lyueth lyue supereſt plenty thā inough alijs quia defit quod amant aegre eſt tibi quia ſupereſt dolet bycauſe lack thynge loue dyſcontent thou arte ſoory thou haſte thanne thou nedeſt supereſſe reſte reſydue porro auſculta quod ſupereſt fallatiae yet heare reſydewe crafte deſceyte defende pleade one cunctari ſe ne ſi ſupereſſet eriperet legibus reum wolde tary leſte yf came ſpake hym ſhulde delyuer offender superexto tare remayne ouer superficiarius hath houſe buylded man ground payeth therfore quyte rent superficiariae aedes howſes buylded lande nother man buylded superficies ouermoſt part thyng superfoetatio one conception chylde nother superfluo fluxi fluere abounde ſuperfluouſe superfluè ſuperfluouſely superfluo idem superfluus um ſuperfluous superforaneus um idem superfundo dere powre vppon supergredior gredi go aboue supera ſupra superiacio ieci iacere caſte lay superijcio ieci ijcere caſte vppon laye vppon superi whyche ben heauen superincido dere falle superior hygher superior aetas tyme age paſſed superlachrimo wepe droppe vpon supermeo go ouer ſlyppe ouer supernato natare ſwymme ouer supernati whych haue hynder part thyghes next buttockes cut away supernè hygh aboue supernia inward parte hindermoſt part thyghes next buttockes cut supernus na num highe ouer superna regio hygh countrey supernumerarius ſurpluſage aboue true number supero rare go ouer alſo vanquyſhe ouercome alſo ouerlyue ſometyme kyll quod ſuperat whiche lefte ſurpluſage superpondium ouerweyght whyche added iuſt weyght superſedeo dêre omyt leue thing superſedeas hoc labore itineris take peyne come nowe forbeare peyn takyng iourney superſede iſtis rebus let theſe thynges alone superſede iſtis uerbis let theſe wordis paſſe holde thy tungue superſedi ſcribere forbare wryte left vnwrytten superſtes ſtitis ouerlyueth remayneth aliue dead alſo aliue ſometyme preſente olde wryters callyd superſtites wytneſſes superſtes ſaufe deos quaeſo ut ſis ſuperſtes beſech god ſaue lōg mought lyue alſo preſente superſtitem utrun que monui ne inuiſi abeant aduyſed theym bothe ſhoulde departe diſpleaſure superſtitio ſuperfluous vayne relygion deuotion honouring ought honoured vayn reuerence feare toward thynge wherin efficacye power illuſyon dyuell dyuination crieng flyeng byrdes obſeruation tymes dreames lyke vanity superſtitioſi whiche tymorous without cauſe fearynge god dyſpleaſed none offence done fyrſt ſoo callyd bycauſe contynually prayed offered goddis preſerue theyr chylderne mought ouer lyue fynally euery vndyſcrete vnreſonable deuocion religion maye callyd ſuperſtytion superſtito ſtitare make hoole recouer deathe superſto ſtare ſtande vppon superſtruo ſtruxi ſtruere buylde superſum ſupereſſe abounde remayne vanquyſhe ſuperfluous indure superuacaneus um ſuperfluous superuacuus um neceſſary superuagnea auis dyuynoures ſouthſayers called byrde whiche cryed toppe thynge superuenio nire come vnloked come vpon thynge superuiuo uixi uiuere recouer peryll deathe whan man ſemeth dead superus um hygheſt ouermoſte superum mare ſea called mare hadriaticum wherin ſtandeth citie venyce supinus na num vpright bealy vpward ſometyme ſignifieth hyll hyghe place▪ alſo ydell supina aure audire gyue dull eare suppar almoſte euen supparaſitor taris tari folowe flater mannes dyner supparium clothe curtayne hanged vppe enterludes playde supparus uel ſupparum ſmocke alſo topſayle ſhyppe suppedaneum fote ſtole suppedito tare ſubdue miniſter ſufficiently alſo oppreſſe endure ac ſtomachonon queo labori ſuppeditare ſtomake wyll lette indure laboure alſo furnyſhe expenſes gyue moche man wolde haue nam ſi illi pergam ſuppeditare ſumptibus menedeme mihi illaec uero ad raſtros re redit surely menedemus wolde gyue hym moche wolde ſpende thynge wolde bring poynte rake lyuynge suppeditare ſubdue treade vnder nunc uideo iudicio mecum contendere non uis ubi ſuppeditari turpiſsimum ſupperare pulcherrimum eſt nowe perceiue thou wylte contende iudges great ſhame ſubdued verye moche honeſtie haue better suppetiae ſuppetias ayde ſuccours suppetias ire go ſuccour ayde one suppetias uenire come ſuccour suppetias occurrit came forthwith ſuccours suppeto tij tere aſke priuily craftely suppetit redyneſſe suppetior ari ſuccour ayde suppetunt dictis data aut facta non ſuppetunt dictis data perfourmeth promyſed vtinam quae dicis dictis facta ſuppetant wold god thou woldeſt thou ſayeſt wold god thy dedes agree thy wordes suppetit lucrum gayne ſufficiente re ita ſuppetit matter ſo requireth suppetias mihi brynge ſuccoures ayde suppetias adueni come helpe suppetias ferre ayde ſuccour suppilo ſteale vnderhande craftely supplanto tare put vnder fote ouer throwe ſupplante deceyue preuentynge one hynderance dammage vnderplante ſet tree vyne supplaudo ſi dere reioyſe priuily supplementum whiche ſupplieth maketh vp whiche lacketh quantitye number suppleo plere make vp whiche lacketh make euyn supplex plicis deſyreth thynge knelynge proſtrate supplicatio prayer requeſte supplicaſsis pro ſupplicaueris supplicans ti deſyreth thynge suppliciter humbly knelynge supplicium peyne tourment erecution deathe ſometime ſupplicia prayer supplitia pendere put execution supplico care beſeche humbly supplimentum makynge vp number whiche lacketh miniſhed supplodo ſi dere ſtampe make noyſe fete alſo reiecte caſt away supploſio ſtampynge noyſe made feete suppono ſui nere put vnder put place ſette falſe fayned thynge place whiche true thynge supportare brynge cary priuily suppoſitio puttynge ſettynge fayned falſe thynge place thynge ſelfe one chylde suppoſtrix ſhe committeth falſehod suppoſitus partus whan chylde one womanne laide woman mother thoughe ſhe hadde borne suppraedes counterſuerties whiche bounden ſureties ſaue thē harmles suppreſſus um drowned beaten vnder victi perſi naues confugerunt ex quibus multae ſuppreſſae multae captae perſians fledde vnto theyr ſhyppes whereof many drowned many taken alſo hyd conceled supprimo preſsi primere kepe downe kepe ſecrete kepe ſilence supprimere iter ſtaye omyt iourney suppromo pſi mere drawe drynke suppromus butlar bono cella ſuppromo credita ſeller buttrie commytted good butlar suppudet halfe aſhamed thou arte half aſhamed halfe aſhamed suppurantia ſuppuratio matterynge ſoore suppuratorius um whiche perteyneth impoſtumes make ſore matter suppuro rare matter impoſtume suppuratio impoſtume ſore hathe matter supra aboue ouer supra quam ſupra id quod supremè hygheſt aboue supremus um hygheſt greatteſte supus olde wryters vſed ſupinus sura caufe legge ſometyme hole ſhanke legge frome kne downe surculaceus ſurcularis bringeth forth yonge ſettes ſprynges trces surculus yonge ſet ſlyppe nurſegarden alſo ſlyp trec yonge graffe surcus ſtake surculoſus um full ſlyppes surdaſter ſomewhae deafe surdé deafely surdeo duo dêre deafe surdeſco ſcere waxe deafe deafe surditas deafeneſſe surdo dare make deafe surdus da dum deafe alſo hath ſauour surrentum towne campania surrentinus na num towne surregit olde writer vſed ſurgit whereof commeth ſurrectio ryſynge surrepo pere crepe vnder surreptitius um whiche doone ſtelthe none man knoweth surgo ſurrexi ſurgere riſe alſo growe ſprynge surrigo xi gere lyfte vp surrigere aures laye eare thynge harken surripio pui pere ſteale take away priuilie alſo lift vp hye preuente surripere operam clanculum abij legione operam hanc ſurripui tibi departed priuyly hoſte tyme haue borowed pleaſure surripere ſe ſtele away vt ſurripuiſtite mihi dudum de foro howe dyddeſte thou ſteale awaye late market surpiculus baſket hamper surrogo gare ſubſtitute put nother mannes place surrogatio ſubſtitution surſum aboue surſum uerſum vpwarde surſum deorſum vp downe suſ ſurſum suſcio ſcire ſcio ſcire knowe suſcipio pere take suſcipere liberos get child womā suſcipere fidem promyſe quas partes impleturum te ſecundum ſuſceptam fidem confido whiche parte truſte thou wylte suſcito tare awake one ſlepe call one warke sus ſuis ſowe sus mineruam prouerbe applyed vnto hym whiche preſumeth teache correcte one rather oughte taught corrected suillus la lum ſowe suſ que de que fero ſuſ que de que habeo force recke care suſae arum great citie perſia suſcitabulum prouocation ſterynge suſcito tare ſtirre prouoke suſpecto tare beholde aboue ſometyme ſe benethe loke downe suſpendeo dere hanged ouer hye alſo appere lyttell suſpendioſus hanged suſpenſus douteth ſpeake suſpenſus um hanged vp suſpenſa manu timerouſly doubtefully suſpenſo gradu haec ubi ego audiui ad fore ſuſpēſo gradu placidè ire perrexi whan harde thoſe wordes wente doore fayre ſoftely suſpendium hangynge suſpenſio idem suſpendo dere hange vp doubteful ſorowefull suſpenſus animo hauynge doubte beinge adrad suſpicio ſpexi ſpicere loke vp alſo honour anſwere suſpicans hath ſuſpicion ſuſpectinge suſpicor cari haue ſuſpicion ſuſpec alſo ſuppoſe suſpectus ta tum ſuſpected suſpicio oni ſuſpicion suſpicioſus ſuſpeciouſe suſpiratus tus • yghe suſpirium idem suſpirioſus ſhorte wynded whiche fetcheth brethe paynefully suſpiro ſighe alſo deſyre feruently suſsilio lira ſubfilio suſtendere inſidias lay watche suſtentaculum whiche ſuſteyneth beareth vp thynge suſtento tare ſuſteyne beare vp ayde helpe suſtineo nui nere holde vppe ſuffer forbeare fede refrayne suſtollo tuli tollere lyfte vp suſtollere animos proude haue hyghe courage suſtollere aes alienum paye dettes suſtollere puerum bringe vp chylde suſtulit properly father peperir mother suſtuli haue haue brought vppe haue lyfte vp suſurrario whyſterynge suſurro whyſter suſurro ronis whyſterer alſo falſe ſecrete report maketh diſſention betwene men suſurrus ſuſurrium whyſterynge ſofte murmuringe ſuch noyſe tree make wynde ryuer vocabularie abundantly properly declared expreſſed englyſhe ¶s ante syades ſterres called alſo hyades ſeuen number syagros wylde bore sybaris citie grecia sybarita man citie sybaritica menſa prouerbe people north parte worlde sycaminus mulbery tree sychaeus mannes name sycion fyrſte founde garlandes sycomorus great tree lyke fyg tree hath abundaunce mylke whoſe fruite cometh toppes bowghes fygges oute ſame boughes ſwete lyke wylde fygge graynes therof leſſe graynes fygges neuer rype excepte ſcraped inſtrument yron sycophanta falſely accuſeth innocent alſo bearer tale complayner sycophantia falſe accuſation deceyte sycophantias ſtruere deuyſe inuent falſehode sycophantor tari idem sycophantiſſo idem sycophantioſe deceytefully crafte sycon olde writer called fygge sycoſis diſeaſe fundement maketh warte lyke fygge sycoſis within eye lydde groweth lyttell warte lyke thynge sydera plurell number ſydus syderatio ſpyce fallynge euyll men tree taken blaſtynge sydiae rindes pomegranades sydus ſyderis ſterre syene citie confynes egypte ethiope sygeum promontorye troye syla mountayne lucania wod sylla great tyraunte rome whiche vnſaciable crueltie syllaba ſyllable syllabatim ſyllables syllabicus ca cum perteynynge ſyllables syllanion famouſe maker image whiche neuer taughte syllepſis fygure plurell number ſynguler ioyned together socijs rege recepto syllogiſmus perfyte argument hath neceſſary concluſion sylphium reade laſerpitium sylua woode place ouergrowen wodes alſo matter haſtely wrytten without ſtudy syluanus called god woodes syluaticus ca cum perteynynge woodes syluecula ſyluula lyttel foreſte wodde sylueſco ſcere waxe growe woodes buſhes sylueſter ſylueſtris tre wodde foreſte woddy wylde syluicola dwelleth foreſte wod syluius mannes name whiche borne foreſte syma citie aſia symbolum collation alſo token gyuen one vpon certayne appoyntmentes generally ſigne marke knowe thinge symbolus ſignet ſeale ſigne manuell symbulus wyſe good counſaylour symmachia ayde battayle leage made amonge men ſondry countreys fighte agaynſte parte symmachus mannes name symmetria conuenient agremente member partes thynge aunſwerynge euerye parte ſeparate vnto proportion hole figure arme hande legge fynger foote membres hauynge reſpecte hoole body ſemblably thynges sympathia mutual combination thynges natural operation power qualyties water coldeneſſe doth participate erthe moyſture ayre ayre fyre heate water moyſture symphiton petraeum herbe called bugle symphitum reade conſolida maior symphitum magnum comfrey symphonia conſent tunc alſo armony symphoniaca symphonia herbe whiche apuleius ſaithe henbane called hyoſciamus symphoniaci ſerui whiche ſhyppe played drounſlades fyfes ſtyrre ſouldiours fyght aigrelye symphonio agree accorde one symphoneſis colyſion vowelles sympinatice womenne addicte ceremony deuotion sympinium cuppe ſeruynge wyne ſacrifice symplator frende hym maryed whiche accompanieth hym feaſtes symplega warkes whiche wraſtlers whiche contende fyghtynge beholden symplegades two yles grekyſh ſea symplegma imbracynge together sympo • iaſtes maketh feaſt bāket sympoſium banket aſſembly drynking sympotria woman whiche kepeth company drynkynge symniſta ſecretarye oone pryuye councell sympſalma concorde ſyngynge symptoma ti greeke worde vſed amonge phiſitions lacke latine worde conuenient thynge whiche ſignifieth certayne affecte folowyng ſyckneſſe lyke cauſe dothe procede ſickeneſſe ſenſible griefe ioyned ſicknes sympudearia funeralles playes wherein playes made synada citie aſia synaereſis contraction two wordes bigae brjugae synagoga congregation ſpecially iewes synalephe colliſion vowelles synanche ſickeneſſe throte called ſquynce barbarouſe men ſquinantia syncere purely vncorruptly syncerus um ſincere pure vncorrupted ſymple without diſſimulation synchronos one tyme synciput ſyncipitis foreparte head alſo ſwines heade ſowſed syncopa syncope fygure letter ſyllable taken awaye compoſtus compoſitus alſo ſoundynge debilitie vitall ſpirites • synecdoche fygure part vſed hole hole parte syndicus aduocate syndipnium ſuppynge gether synechon continent synephites ſtoone whiche called alſo leucongra syngrapha ſyngraphus ſyngraphum wrytynge deede made ſygned hande hym maketh bargayne couenaunte synochitides ſtone wherwith nigromancers call vp diuelles synodus aſſemblye menne generall councill synonimum whiche diuerſe wordes ſygnifieth thinge enſis gladius bothe ſignifie ſword occidit interfecit necauit ſignifie kylled synopis ſinoper red leade synſtratiotes companion together warre syntagma treatiſe ordinaunce syntaxis order conſtruction alſo tribute ſumme money diſtributed ſundry company alſo volume gathered diuerſe warkes eraſmus vſeth ſacrament aultare ꝙ recte aut appoſite alij uiderint syntexis lacke weakeneſſe whiche hapneth longe ſickeneſſe syntereſis pure parte conſcience synthema token gyuen ſouldiours syntheſis ſhorte cote ierkyn alſo veſſell made many veſſelles syntomon circumciſum sypharium curtayne hanged mynſtrelles whan ſynge syphax kynge numidia syracuſae citie sicile nowe called sarragoſa olde tyme meruaylouſe renoume ſtrength rich moreouer ſcituate daye longe ſunne neuer ſyghte clowde keuereth syracuſius ſyracuſanus citie syria great realme aſia whiche hath eaſte ryuer euphrates weſt myddell ſea realme egypt northe cilicia cappadocia ſouthe arabia syria called alſo aſſyria great countrey eaſt hauynge northe parte armenia weſt meſopotamiā ſouthe suſianam eſte mediam alſo conteyneth phoeniciam paleſtinam babyloniam syriacum kynde ſwete radiſhe syriacus ca cum syria syriaſis inflammation partes brayne pannicles whiche happeneth infantes syrictae people whiche receyue theyr meate oten redes syricum colour myxte ſinoper ruddel syrium wyne boyled thyrde parte syrinx pype recorder syris corne kepte hole grounde couered chaffe syriſca woman syria syriſſus um siria syrma ti traine womannes gowne syrnia ſhriche oule syrophoenix ſea coſte syria syrtes quycke ſandes ſhelpes water made dryfte ſande grauell syrtites lyttell ſtone founde bladder wulfe syrupus ſyrupe syrus man siria alſo ilande belongynge grece syſsitia feaſtes companyes aſſembled feaſtes syſimbrium ſuppoſe horeſmynte syſimbrium cardamine water creſſes syzigiae ſynewes whiche come frome brayne eye ſo cometh frome lyfte ſyde gothe ryghte eye commeth right ſide gothe lyfte eye ſo ſynewes croſſe eche ¶t ante tabanvs fly whiche hath foure wynges byteth man beſt bloud foloweth tabefacio ere corrupt tabella lyttell table tabellarius caryer letter auditour tabellio lionis ſcriuener writeth commune inſtrumentes dedes taberna euery vyle habitation alſo ſhop tauerne ware ſolde al thinge vendible wyne oyle thynge taberna meritoria ynne tabernaria fabula comedy ēterlude wherin baſe perſonages perſons dygnitie ſtate tabernaculum pauyllion halle tabernarius ſelleth maner ware alſo tauerner tabes bi corruption bodye alſoo extreme leanneſſe longe conſumynge ſickneſſe alſo matter corrupt bloudde myxte together alſo impoſtume lunge procedinge humoures deſcendyng frome head ſtomake ſo wondynge corruptynge lounge tabeſco bui ſcere languiſhe conſume extremely leane corrupted tabidus da dum corrupted conſumed tabificabilis le whiche maye corrupted fall conſumption tabificus ca cum whiche maketh one corrupted conſumeth body tablinū wynter parlour wherin painted table bokes ſtories tabo conſumption waſtyng putrifaction thynges tabor mountayne countreye galilea chriſte tranſfigurate tabula table plurell number tabulae doth ſignifie teſtamente commune inſtrument writinge alſo tabula table playe diſe cheſſe men tabulae nouae whā detters conſtrayned paye theyr dettes dyd owe olde obligation diſſolued newe made whiche ſhulde newely borowed tabularia place euidences writynges layde tabularium cheſte whiche euydences recordes put tabulata walles made ſquare ſtones burded alſo boughes tree buſhes grow ſtreight forthe vpwarde tabulatus ta tum made bourdes tabulo make thynge bourdes ioyne bourdes together tabulatio ioynynge cloſynge bourdes together taburnus hyll campania wherein doo growe many olyue tree tace egomet conueniam iam ipſum let alone ſelfe wyll cōmune tacenda thoſe thynges whiche ſpoken taceo cui cêre kepe ſilence reſt quiete ſure taciturnitas tati ſylence tacitus holdeth peace ſecrete tacito pede ſoftely ſtelthe tacitum eſt worde ſpoken tacitus citius audies ſtyll thou ſhalte ſoner tacitè ſpeakynge one worde tactus tus feelynge tactus fulmine burned blaſted lyghtnynge taedet weryeth yrketh wery taedium werynes heuynes mynde taedulus olde dotarde men wery taenarus darke place foote hill called malea citie ſparta whiche ſuppoſed entry hell taenia edge fyllette alſo womannes fyllet whiche nowe call rolles properly kerchefe maydens weare theyr heades alſo whyte ſtoone whiche water ſheweth long lyke kerchiefe alſo village betwene micenas corinthum taenon citie laconia arcadia tagaſta citie affrike tagax acis felon whiche happeneth mann fynger tages whiche taughte fyrſte thuſcanes crafte diuination called aruſpicium tago gere olde writer vſed tango tagrus hyll portyngale wrytten mare doo conceyue wynde tagus riuer spayne whiche diuydethe caſtile portugall wherein hath bene founde grauell golde taigete name one ſeuen ſterres whiche ſo appiereth maye ſcantelye perceyued whiche ſterre alſo callyd maia electra talaria ſhowes whiche mercurius weare wheron ſet whynges talaris whiche commeth downe ancley toga talaris longe gowne ancley talarius ria rium perteynynge dyſe lex talaria lawe agaynſte dyſe plaienge talaſsio ſonge contryned certayne verſes ſungen weddynges alſo certayne exclamation erie vſed maryages begynnynge wherof beganne whan romulus romaynes rauyſſhed maiden sabine among one excellent beauitie whan many sabine wold haue reſcued whiche caried toward romulus thintent ſhe ſhulde taken cried talaſsio whiche name noble prynce sabine wold haue broughte hym meane eſcaped broughte romulus afterwarde vſed mariages crye talaſsio talea ſtocke ſette erthe wheron men graffe alſo truncheon ſtaffe byllet talentum accompted ſommetyme poyſe weyght therof ſundry ſortes one called atticum minus commune whiche conteyned lx poundes athene weyght called mina mnae troye weygh lxii pound halfe called talentum atticum maius whiche conteyneth lxxx mnas troye weyghte lxxxiii li foure ounce alſo called euboicū called talentum haebraicum whiche conteyned hundred mnas whiche troy weyghte ciiiili two ounce talentum syrum whiche xv mnas troye weyght xv pounde vii ounce halfe diodôrus writeth commune talent xlli nameth thre ſortes one called ptholom aicum whiche conteyneth cclxxiili ſeconde conteynynge cxxvli thyrde hundred pound talentum alſo accō ted valuation atticum minus uel commune value lx mina whiche money accomptynge hundred grotes euerye mina hundred pounde ſterlynge euery pounde beinge thre ſcore grotes withſtandynge iuſte value talentum leſſe fyneſſe baſeneſſe weyght englyſhe grote talenrum atticum maius accompted lxxx mina whiche ſterlynge money cxxxiiilivisviii pen talentum haebrai cum ſanctuarij conteyned hundred mnas hebraicas wherof euery one lx sicli euery siclus beinge iiii ſterlynge grotes ſo talentum money ſterlynge ccccli talentum haebraicum uulgare halfe ſo moche videlicet cc li talia blade onyon chiboll talio oni equall peyne recompence hurte cuttynge man hand loſe hande puttinge eye loſe eye talior ari cut properly ſpoken wodde whiche nowe cal talling wood talipedo dare go paſternes talis tale ſuche taliter ſuche wyſe talitrum fylyppe gyuen one fynger nayle talpa molle want talpa caecior blynder molle prouerbe applyed whiche lacke iudgemente thinges playne talum reponere refourme whiche negligently done diligence talus ancle aboue foote alſo paſtern bone beaſt alſo dye dice tam well alſo ſo tam bonus good tam ſum amicus republicae quam qui maximè ſo frendely moche frende publike weale moſte tama whan moche trauaile bloude commeth downe legge cauſeth ſwell tam magi tanto magi tamerindi fruite growynge india tree whereof lyke palme date tree fruite ſower lyke grene damſyns whiche medicynable aſſwagynge heate cholere tamaritae people aſia ſarre frome ſea called caſpium tamarix ricis tree vulgarly called tamariſcus reade myrice ſome cal whitbeame tamen withſtandynge alſo yet tamen à malicia non diſcedis yet wylte thou depart thy malyce ſomtyme ſignifyeth forthwith laſte ſo quod potero faciam tamen ut pietatem colam wil maye ſo withſtandyng omytte duetie father tameſis noble ryuer tamyſe englande tametſi albeit alwaye taminea vua dioſcor li 4 ſaythe herbe whiche called bryonia nigra cornelius celſus li 3 ſayth whiche grekes called stauis agria whiche thought falſe plinius li 26 ca ſuppoſeth wyld vyne called labruſca ſame affyrmed ruellius tam ne olde writer vſed eouſ que vntyll tanager riuer lucania betwene campania calabria tanagra towne perſide tanais greatte ryuer northe parte worlde whiche diuideth europa frome aſia tanaquil wyfe tarquinius priſcus kynge romaynes tanaus kynge siria tandem laſt ſometyme leaſtway alſo vneth withſtandynge tandiu ſo longe tango tetigi gere touche meue vnderſtande perceyue come deceyue tangere ulcus rub galde place ſpeake one thynge whiche greueth hym tetigit aures meas came myne care tanis principall citie egypte moyſes dyd ſhewe meruayles tanos ſtone kynd emeralde grene blacke tanquam lyke tantalides progeny tantalus tantali horti prouerbe ſignifieng good thynges hande whiche withſtandynge man maye vſe tantalus ſon iupiter plota kynge phrygia poetes doo write bicauſe diſcouered counſail goddes hel tourmented wyſe ſtandeth fayre ryuer hauynge hym tree laded pleaſaunte apple yet alwaye thurſty hungry often ſtoupeth drynke holdeth vp handes gather appuls water tre withdraw ſoo frome hym touche tanti ſo moche worde doth perteine byenge ſellynge tantidem price tanti aeſtimo tantifacio tanti pendo ſet ſo moche ſo moche eſteme tantillus la lum tantulus um dyminutiue tantus tantiſper ſo longe tantopere ſo moche ſo vehemently tantum onely tantum non almoſte tantum ſat habes arte thou content tantummodo onely tantundem periculum ſo great daungier tantò aduerbe ſignifienge ſo moche tanto magi ſo moche tanto peior ſo moche worſe tantum abeſt ſo taphnii taphos greke ſepulchre tumbe tapinoſis figure wherby great thynge baſely deſcribed tapoſiris citie egipte taprobanē yle indian ſea ſome old writer ſuppoſed contrarye parte worlde agaynſte v therfore called worlde lyeth poynte betwene eaſte weſt quantitie thereof dyuerſelye deſcribed ſundry author strabo writeth lengthe viii thouſande furlonge whiche myles plinius martianus solinus doo affirme lengthe vii furlonge whiche viiiclxxv myles breadeth v furlonge whiche dcxxv myles parte extendeth beyonde equinoctiall lyne ſouth hath northeſt laſſe inde called samotra vnder ſubiection great cam gouerned foure kynges exquiſite fourme iuſtice withſtandyng people idolatours hunt tygers olyphantes pantheres whiche great plentye alſo founden carbuncle ſaphires isrinctes topaces ruby granates gret number groweth cinamome cauell benioyme ſwete tree great aboundaunce haue moneye golde ſyluer braſſe ſame waight value auncient coyne romains alſo founden plenty greate orient perles tapſus barba • u herbe reade phlomos verbaſcus tapſus yle sicile far frō siracuſe tapulla lawe made feaſtes tapyri people parthia whiche vſe giue theyr wyues maryage men haue hadde foure fyue chyldren taraconia countrey called nowe aragon taracon chiefe citie therof tarandrus beaſte body lyke great oxe hauynge heade lyke harte horne full branch heare roughe coloure beare ſuppoſe rayne deere tarandulus beaſte called buffe whiche lyke oxe hath berde lyke gote tarantula kynde beaſtes called stelliones lyke lyſarde whoſe bytynge man dieth onely ſtonyeth hym bytten tara ſonne neptunus buylded tarentum taraxacon herbe called souſiſtell reade cicerbita sonchus taraxis whan eyen bolne moch redde tarbeli citie tarbes gaſcoyne tarcheſius myſcheuouſe kynge people called albani tarchon duke hethruria whiche alſo great diuinour ſouthſayer tardatio tarienge tarde ſlowe late tardigradus whiche hath ſlowe paſe gothe ſlowely tardiloquentia ſlowe ſpeche tardiloquus draweth ſpeche lengthe tardior ſlower tardiſsimus moſte ſlowe ſloweſt tarditas tarditudo tardicies ſlowneſſe tardius ſlowely tardiuſculè ſomewhat ſlowely tardiuſculus ſomewhat ſlowe tardo dare tary beſlowe tardus ſlowe rude ſuperbus laſte kynge romayns expelled rome pryde crueltie taracina towne campania called alſo anxur tarſus chiefe citie cilicia ſaynct paule borne tarſis region india ſometyme takē carthage tartaria countrey incomparable greatneſſe boundeth weſt vppon ruſſia extendeth eaſte deſcription laſte card aboue mdc duch myles whiche italion myles vi thouſande iiii hundred mile bredth ſouthe north vncertayne marcheth ſouth vppon perſiam indiam northe moche parte deſert coldeneſſe barenneſſe therof people haue city townes elles fewe lye pauillions vnder carte whiche doo remeue ſundry partes tyme yere dothe requyre dryuyng theyr cattel theym whome eate fleſhe moche parte rawe drynke mylke bloude people fierce cruell therwith vyle beaſtly theyr lyuyng vnder ſubiection great chaam yet haue many puiſſaunt pryncis whiche vſe wonderfulle obedyence towarde theyr emperour beleue one god creatour thynges chryſtened ar ſo populouſe hardy fierce great kynges whiche marche vpon haue moche doo reſyſte great kyng ruſſi kynge perſia sophias alſo one theyr prynces toke playne battayl pazaietes great turke beynge bounden chaynes gyues golde incloſed cage yron caryed aboute hym vntyl dyed battaile ſlayne two hundred thouſande turkes captayne tartariens named tamberlane theyr emperour chaam beſydes tartariam hath alſo ſubiect vnto hym leſſe inde royalmes yles eaſte ſoutheaſte part worlde nameth hym ſelf ſtyle ſonne god rede chaam moche tartaria countray whyche ſometyme callyd scythia tartareus ea eum helle tartarum lee wyne tartarus depeſt place helle alſoo tartaryan tartarinus rina rinum bulle ſometyme ſtronge oxe alſo one xii celeſtyall ſygnes taurus great famous mountayne whiche begynneth indian ſea ryſyng north paſſeth aſia vnto fenne mere called maeotis bordereth vpon great numbre royalmes alſo hyll callyd caucaſus parte therof tautologia fygure oone thynge twyſe ſpoken tax ſounde ſtroke whyp taxon kynde bayes laurell wherewith herbars made taxatio ſettynge taxe ſubſydy taxatores whych rebuke one another taxim ſoftely ſcantly touched taxi olde wryters vſed tetigeris thou ſhalt touche taxilli ſmalle dyſe taxo ni gray brocke badger taxo touche often alſoo taxe ceſſe leonicenus ſuppoſeth whiche arabian calle cali ant muſa ſuppoſeth rather kynde anthyllis dioſcorides dothe deſcribe haue ſtalke leaues lyke purſlan euery leafe hauinge lyke two wynges vii viii branch cōmynge one rote full blue leaues thycke tender hath flowres yelow white therfore ruellius ſuppoſeth herbe ſome name fabam inuerſam ſome craſſulam minorem telephus ſonne hercules whiche nouryſhed hynde telepnium herbe aetolia callyd orpyn telina certayne garment telo lonis inſtrument warre wyſe great poſte hygh ſet faſte ouer cometh longe beam whiche runneth pyn ſo one ende hauynge poiſe cauſeth lyghter ende ryſe ſuch bere brewer london drawe vp water telonarius relo lonis collectour gatherer tribute teloniū place taſkes tribute ar payde telos greke ende honour legyon tribute pēcion alſo name ile oyntment callyd telina made telpuſſa cytie arcadia tellus li man name wyſe solon iudged fortunate ryche kynge creſus tellus luris earthe telum thynge whiche maye throwen caſt hande ſtone wod yron alſo generall name wherwith man doth fyght called weapon ſometyme taken ſworde telyphonon idem quod aconitum temerarius um hardye nede wyſedome requireth foolchardye ſometyme dredefull dradde temeritas tati temeritudo folehardines temere vnaduyſedly foolyſſhely aduenturouſely ſometyme ſygnifieth almoſte alſoo without cauſe temerius foolyſhe vnaduiſedly temero rare vyolate temetum wyne temulentus ta tum drunke wyne temulentia drunkenneſſe temno tempſi temnere ſette lyttell temo monis beame whyche contayneth yoke tempe place theſſalia wonderfull pleaſaunt hauynge tree medowes meruaylous delectable wher byrdes dyuers kyndes ſynge contynually excellent melody therof pleaſaunt woodes haue name tempe temperamentum moderation temperanter temperatly temperantia temperance firme moderate gouernance reſon againſt ſenſualitie vicious affection mind temperantior temperantius temperate temperatura temperance moderation mynglynge thynges togyther temperies temperatenes proprely heate colde ſometyme vſurped temperamentum temperantia temperior oris tymely tempero temper moderate order meaſure temperamus ſtylum calamum appetitum whan kepe wryting mean forme eate nedefull temperare alicui ſpare oone forbeare hym temperare animis moderate affection refrayne doinge thynge caedibus temperare refrayne manſlaughter victoriae temperare neuer prowder victory tempſa cytie countraye callyd nowe calabria tepeſtas tati ſygnyfieth ſometyme ſame tyme ſometyme tempeſte ſometyme wether ſometyme fayre wether tempeſtiuus ua uum whiche done conuenyent tyme tempeſtiuitas tati ſeaſon tyme conuenyent oportunitie tempeſtiuè ſeaſon tyme conuenient tempeſtum olde wryters vſed tempeſtiuū tempeſtuoſum tempeſtuous ſtormy templum temple churche ſometyme ſygnifyeth heauen alſo principall became houſe alſo ſepulchre temporalis le whyche dureth vntylle certayne tyme temporaneus um whiche done ſodaynly tyme temporarie temporanie temporaliter vntyll tyme temporarius ria rium whiche dureth contynueth tyme alſo whyche pertayneth tyme temporius aduerbe ſygnifieth tyme tyme tempus poris tyme alſoo ſtate tyme ſometyme temple head tenacia tenacitas hardenes ſparynge expenſes nygardſhyp perſeueraunce retaynynge kepynge tenatior tenaciſsimus comparatiue ſuperlatiue degree tenax tenaciſsimae memoriae moſte ſure remembraunce tenaciter faſtely ſurely tenaſmus teneſmus deſyre go often ſtoole may nothynge burnynge ſometyme blouddy ſyege tenax nacis whyche holdeth faſte glewe ſometyme ſparynge nygarde moche conſtant harde moued tendicula nette ſnare take byrdes beaſtes tendines tendones greate ſynewes edrdes bodye tendo tetendi tendere extende ſtretche lay ſnare dwell go alſo lyft vp pretende pytche pauylyons alſo aſſay holde vp paruum que patri tendebat iulum held vp lyttell iulus vnto father alſo prepare go towarde place tendere alicui inſidias lye awayte hurte one tendere plagas pytche hayes nettes tendere ad aluora aſſaye clymme higher tendere aduerſus repugne tendunt diuerſum ſententiae opynyons repugnant one nother tendutes olde wryters callyd theym whyche great tethe tenebrae lacke lyght darkenes tenebreſco ſcere darke tenebricor aris ari make darke tenebricoſus um maketh darke tenebriones lyars crafty knaues alſoo whyche wylle ſeene abroode day tyme tenebroſus um darke tenedos yle ſea callyd aegeum betwene mitelene helleſpontum farre troy ❀tenedia bipennis aut ſecuris quycke ſharpe axe prouerbe applyed iudges whyche haſtye cruelle theyr ſentences tenellus um tender teneo tenui tenere holde apprehende poſſede holde keepe couer vnderſtande keepe backe perfourme tenes quid dicam vnderſtandeſt ſaye tene tibi take thou per duas noctes ac diem unum tenuit dured two dayes one nyght verecundia teneri aſhamed tenere ſe loco departe oute place argumentis teſtibus teneri vanquiſhed bothe reaſons wytneſſes tenere conſilium council praecipe ut teneat conſilia noſtra gyue hym aduyſe may counſayle tene tene tarye tarye redi quo fugis nunc tene tene tourne agayne whyther runneſt thou nowe tary tary ten • conſenſum agree conſente vnto tenet amor loue meueth moche tenêre inſaniam sed hoc primum expurgare tibi uolo inſaniam ne que tenere neque mi eſſe ullum morbum niſi quod ſeruio firſt wyl declare ſelf vnto neyther wytte haue ſpeknes bonde tenêre ius knowe lawe tenere legem vnder lawe tenere memoria remembre tenere medium kepe meane tenere modum kepe meaſure tenere ſe take hede hym ſelfe tenere aliquem mendatij take one lye tene tibi take thyne owne tenere cauſam vanquyſſhe recouer agaynſte one matter teneri deſyderio deſyre moch feruētly teneri ludo take pleaſure game teneri furti gyltie felony tenera aetas youthe teneris annis yonge yeres teneor neris neri bounden beholden one tener ra rum tender mercyfulle alſoo geldyd man teneraſco ſcere tender mercyfull teneritas tenerrtudo tendernes tenere teneriter tenderly louyngly tenni olde writer vſed tenui tenitae called goddeſſes lotte tenontes great ſtronge ſynewes whiche kepe necke vpryght alſo broode ſynewe whiche goth hamme heele tenor noris order contynuaunce thynge tenos yle greke ſea one theym whyche callyd cyclades tenta ſtretched tentamentum temptation tentigo tiginis ſtyffenes tentipellium ſhoe yron ſoole wheron ouer lether ſtretched tento tare attempte aſſay proue tempte one euyll morbo tentari vexed ſicknes caput tentare trouble head tentorium tent pauylyon tentum man priuy member tentyra citie egypte tentyri uel tynteritae venymous beaſt yle ryuer nilus whoſe voyce • ockodryll dothe feare tenuè tenuiter poorely ſymply tenunculus la lum ſymple lyttell eſtymation tenuis nue lyttell ſymple eſtymation ſmalle quantitie poore thynne leane tenui filo ſmalle threede applyed ſtyle wrytynge whyche elegaunte playne tenuitas tati ſmalleneſſe pouertie tenuiter ſcantely poorely barely tenuo make ſmalle make leane feeble tenus ni ſnare beynge aduerbe hit ſygnyfyeth vnto tenus urbem tendit extendeth vnto citie noo thanne citie tenus prepoſition ſygnifieth nyghneſſe vntyll thynge titulo tenus tytle oonely wordes without effecte tepifacio cere make warme tepefio fieri warme tepeo tepeſco tepui peſcere warme hotte tepidarium veſſell wherein water made temperate alſo chamber wherinto men go bayne tepidus da dum meane betweene hotte colde warme alſo koolid frome heate ſometyme noyſull vnprofytable tephrites ſtoone whiche hathe fygure newe moone colour blacke aſſhe colour tepidior colder tepidiſsimus um mooſte warme tepidulus tepidula tepidulum dyminutiue tepidus tepocon fourme wrytynge downwarde tepor oris tepiditas ternarius ternus terna num thyrde innumbre terdenus na num thyrtenthe terebellum wymble percer terebratio booryng wymble terebrae ſiue terebrum augour wherwith hole bored terebro brare bore make hole rounde lyke tree pyllar teretrum inſtrument wherwith thynge made rounde tergemini three chyldren borne one burden tergeſtes citie italy tergeſtum towne slauony nowe called trieſte terginus na num whiche made beaſtes hyde tergiuerſatio nonſuite lawe whan pleyntife gyueth ouer ſuite tergiuerſor aris ari tourne backe deny lawe ſygnifieth nonſuite tergo tergeo terſi tergere wype make cleane tergum backe man beaſte thynge ſomtyme ſignifieth hyde beaſte terga dare rune away proprely batayle tergus tergoris hyde beaſte terma matis extremitie ende thynge alſo ſole foote termentarium lynnen clothe wherwith body couered termentum detrimentum termes braunche plucked tree fruite alſo worme whiche eateth fleſh termile mountaygne lycia callyd alſo chimaera ter milies thre thouſande tymes termillum potte wyne whiche alway ſet table euery man mought take moche wyne wolde terminalia certayne holy day later ende yere terminalis lapis mere ſtone laide pyghte ende ſundry men landes termino nare ende fynyſhe terminus ſygne whych declareth one man lande one countrey territorie frome nother alſo ſignyfieth buttynge terminus deus ydolle whyche ſuppoſed haue preeminence ouer boundes lande whoſe temple wherin two partes leade one tynne tertio thynge thyrde tyme make thyrde tylthe earynge tertio conſul two haue bene conſules hym tertium conſul hath ben thryſe conſul tertio ſignifieth thyrd order place two going afore tertium ſygnifieth tyme twyſe gothe afore lyke secundo quarto numbres tertio pedato thyrde retourne comynge agayne tertius um thyrde tertius decimus thyrtenthe tertullianus great female teſtillor idem teſticulus knowen ſygnification teſtificatio wyenes bearynge teſtificator teſtificatrix ſhe beareth wytneſſe teſtificor caris cari • beare wytneſſe teſtimonium teſtatio wytneſſe borne thynge done teſtis beareth wytneſſe sine teſte dolere ſorowfulle withoute ſemblaunt teſtes alſo man genytours teſtor aris ari beare wytneſſe calle wytneſſe pray god teſtu olde wryters vſed teſta wolde bourne within piece tymber hadde great hoke yron end piece mought plucked backe putte forthe ſtrength men therwith plucke ſtones walles townes beſyeged alſo roufe vaulte houſe teſtus ſtus panne wherein tartes lyke thynges paſte baken tetanicus morbus idem quod tetanos tetanothra medycine wherwith face man woman made ſmothe withoute wrynkles tetanos whan ſynites ſtyffe ſoo man bowe ſome part arbuſtum thanatos mors latyn thapſus yle sicile thapſia herbe lyke fenell hath yelowe flowre flatte rounde ſede tharia pyckelle wherein fyſſhe ſalted kepte tharſos cytie cilicia thaſia almonde thaſia nux called alſo graeca thaſij men yle callyd thaſus egypt thaſium certayne wyne egypt tha •• greke meruayle myracle theatralis le theatricus ca cum whiche pertayneth theatrum theatridium diminutiue theatrum theatrum place made halfe rounde wherein people aſſembled beholde playes ſundrye exercyſes ſometyme ſygnifieth multitude beholdeth thebae arū theba bae thebe be name city wherof one egypt builded buſirides boeotia builded cadmus nother cilicia andromaches wyfe hector borne thebaice thebaides date beſt ſorte thebais idis ido countray egypt alſo name boke made statius poete thebanus na num man thebe theca caſe ſhethe ſcaberde boxe theleboae people yle callyd capreae whyche lyeth agaynſt naples theleboij idem thelephus kynge whyche camme ayde troyanes ſlayne achilles theligonium herbe whyche hath bearies lyke olyue thelphuſa citie arcadia thelphuſsium uel thelphoſsion citie boeotia pyndarus prayſed bacchus thelypteris ſheferne female ferne thema matis thynge purpoſed dyſputed reaſoned alſo fygure wherin aſtronomers doo wryte ſtate heauen placynge ſettynge planettes ſuche ſygnes degree tyme man natiuitie whan thyng ſhall happen ſerche thembinacha countray callyd alſo nemia theme olde towne yle cypre braſſe fyrſt founde themis one ſyſters iupyter ſhe callyd goddeſſe whiche commanded men aſke whyche lefulle woman called themis callyd alſo carmentis ſometyme taken fa lefull themiſcyra cytie capadocia afterward callyd caeſaria themiſones people licia themiſtius phyloſopher whiche wrate commentary ariſtotles warkes themiſtocles noble capytayn athenienſes whiche expellyd countrey commen xerxes kyng perſia ſent hym great army agaynſt athenienſes whan perceyued countrey peryll dyſtroyed dranke poyſon chaſe rather dye eyther vnfaythfull xerxes el dyſtroye countrey although vnkynde towarde hym thenſa halowed carte charyot theocritus poete grecia whyche wrate bucolica contention herdmen theologia dyuinitie theomenia wrath god theonino dente rodere rebuke manne ſhamefully theophraſtus noble phyloſopher excellent eoquence theos greke god theotocos mother god theorema ſpeculation theoria ſpeculation vnderſtandynge theopolis chiefe citie syria callyd alſo antiochia thera cytie athene theramnum cytie theſſalia theriace ce ſeu theriaca tryakle thereotrophion place wylde beaſtes kepte foreſt parke therioma ſoore priuy member wherby partes theraboute corrupted therof iſſueth blacke ſtynkynge humour theriſtrum thynne vayle woman paleſtina dyd weare thermae bathe hotte water thermefacio cere chaufe make one hote outragious eatynge drynkynge hote thynges thermopolium place meates drynkes ſolde wherewith menne made hotte warme colde wether thermodoon ryuer cappadotia thermodonticus ca cum pertaynynge ryuer thermopoto tare drynke hotte warme drynke thermopylae mountayne whyche paſſeth grece hauynge narowe entrye paſſage two thouſande lacedemonyans theyr capytayne leonidas faught agaynſte fyue hundred xxviii thouſande perſyans reſyſted two dayes vntyll ſayde lacedemoniens ſlayne therpſichore one muſes therſites prynce camme grekes ſiege troy whiche perſone condytions mooſte defourmed theſaurizo gather treaſure theſaurus theſaurum treaſure theſeus ſonne egeus kynge athene ſtronge man valyant companyon hercules famous actes nexte vnto hym whiche moch defaced brekynge fayth whiche promyſed ariadne doughter minois kynge creta whome lefte deſerte yle calyd naxus whiche vergyle wryteth perpetually tourmented wheele helle theſiphon ti citie parthia far seleucia great citie aſſyria theſis clauſe wrytynge ſpeakyng whiche contayneth ſentence theſmophoria ceremonyes cere goddeſſe grayne theſmophoros name cere theſpia fre towne boeotia theſpis towne boeotia hyll called helicon theſpiades muſes theſſalia region grece called alſo aemonia ſometyme pandora ſometyme pyrrhea ſome pelaſgia homere argopelaſgicon inuironed foure great famouſe hilles caſt mountaines pelion oſſa north olimpꝰ weſt pindus ſouth othrys marcheth macedoniam eſte people valiant men horſebacke inuincible battayle polybras writeth iniuſte theyr promyſe woman beinge wonderfulle wytches tranfourmed men fygure beaſtes theſſalicus ca cum theſſalia theſſalonica citie macedonia thetis tidis mother achylles theucitis ruſhe growyng nabachia whiche hath taſte ſharpewyne theoſitas ſodalitas theutones theutonici people germany called duchemen thirromachus one ſonnes hercules megara thi • ſias burſte broken ſtoones thideus name father diomedes thyeſtes ſonne pelops hippodamia aſpyring kyngedome mycenae commytted auoutry wife elder brother atreus therfore ſlewe chylderne thyeſtes cauſing roſted made brother eate theym vnwares thieum ſuccinum aumbre thita praefigere condemnare thymelici player enterludes hereby wold place corrected digeſtes 〈◊〉 de qui notantur infamia temelici wolde put thymelici alſo common dauncers thoa one nymphes thoas name two kynges one taurica lemnos thoes wulfes ethiope arrianus dothe call tygres india tholos ſcochen ſmall tergate alſo ſildynge houſe rounde houſe thomices lyches hempe wherwith halter made alſo lyttell bo • ſters whiche men weare whan cary burden fretynge theyr neckes ſhulders cordes rope thon ni fyrſte broughte phyſike fourm ſciens among egiptians thoota daughter phorcus whome neptunus gate polyphemus thoracatus weareth curette breſt • plate thorax racis properly hole bulke man necke myddell alſo curette breſt plate ſome tyme ſignifyeth towre thou duke troye thracia region eurupa ioynynge vnto macedoniā myſiā hath north ryuer called donow eaſte ſea called pontus ſouthe ſea called aegeū therin citie conſtantinople thraceas uel thraſsias northweſt wynde thraſimedes ſonne neſtor thraſomenus ryuer italy nyghe peruſia thrax acis man thracia threces idem quod gladiatores threnodia mournynge ſonge threnos lamentacion whiche vſed buryenge threſſa woman thracia throni one ix order angel thronus ſeate chayre emperour kynge thrulla truell whiche maſons tiler pargettours vſe layenge morter thrulliſſo laye morter thryallis herbe called roſecampyne thryps mowthe thule yle beyonde scotlande thunnus fyſhe called tuny thuribulum ſenſar thuringia thuryn fraunce thurini people italye thuriferus ra rum whiche beareth frankynſence thurifico make perfume ſence thurius um incenſe thus thuris frankyncenſe thuſcana citie italye tuſculani people rome tuſculanum place fer rome wher tullius cato varro diuerſe noble senatours rome manour place thuſculum diminutiue thus alſo citie latium thyas woman whiche offereth ſacrifice bacchus thyaſus daunce dedicate bacchus thyella ſtorme thymbra herbe called ſauery thymele le woman whiche fyrſt taught daunſynge open place thymelici maye called daunſers moriſdaunces thymiama matis ſwete perfume thymus herbe called tyme thymum wart gret beane thynnus fyſhe called tuny thyridion wycket lyttell dore thyrſus ſtalke lettyſe herbes whiche maye eaten ſomme take ſpeare ſharpe heade boughes leaues yuy wrapped aboute ſuche ſpeares dydde bacchus flocke drunken harlottes beare theyr handes lucretius poete taketh thyrſum fury ardent mocion ſome name longe ſteme ſtreyghte ſuche • eſyll ſuche growe fennes hauynge blacke knappes rounde ¶t ante tiara ornament whiche woman perſia weare heades whiche rounde couered onely hynder parte theyr heades princis priſtes vſed alſo weare tiatura citie countray miſia tibareni people scithia beinge aſia tiberias citie galilea tiberis riuer called tiber italy whiche commynge mountayne called apen ninus diuideth ethruriam vmbria tibia leg properly ſhanke ſhyn bone alſo inſtrument called ſhalme tibialis le perteynynge ſhalmes tibiale li pluraliter tibialia legge harneys called greaues tibicen tibicina ſhe bloweth trumpette ſhalme tibicen alſo thynge wherby ſuſteyned ſhore proppe tibi tibicis riuer scythia tibin baſkette coffyn made wyckers bull ruſſhes barke tree ſuche oone moyſes put daughter pharao tibiluſtria dayes whan men wente trumpettes proceſſion aboute theyr lambes tibini tune made ſhalmes tiburtes people italy nyghe rome ticinum citie lumbardye nowe called pauia tigillus rafter tignarius faber carpenter maketh houſe tymber tignus tignum rafter houſe beareth roufe • alſo generally timber whiche ſerueth houſe tigrane riuer countrey medium tigranes proper name kynge medium greatter armeny tigris beaſte wonderfull ſwyftnes alſo one foure ryuers commeth paradiſe called gion paſſethe armeniam mediam tigurini people germanye whiche inhabyte fourth parte heluetia swizerlande tile yle beyonde scotlande called alſo thule tilia tree whiche ſome ſuppoſe birche withſtandynge byrche doth beare fruite great beane rounde longe lyke yuy beries ſedes lyke arage ſede theophraſtus writeth tilium citie weſte parte sardinia ſea ſyde tilos yle indian ſea wherin plenty perle tree dyuerſe fruites leaues tree growynge neuer fall alſo wolle groweth tree whiche beare gourde gretnes quince beinge rype open whiche appiere wolle wherof made fyne preciouſe clothes place doth begynne mountayne caucaſus whyche dothe paſſe throughe great parte worlde timalos herbe flower growynge water called commonlye apothecaryes nenufer timaeus noble philoſopher pythagoras ſecte timanus ryuer italy beſides aquilia timens feareth tyme timidus alwaye feareth called tymorouſe timeo mui mère feare dreade timeo te feare myne ennemy leſte thou ſhalte harme timeo tibi aferde frende leſte thou ſhuldeſt haue harme timeo mihi ab te afrayde thou wylte harme timeo furem pomis afrayd one wyll ſteale myne appulles timeo moriatur aferde wyll dye timidèè fearefully timiditas feare timiopôlae ingroſſers regraters market whiche bye moche corne vyttayls together make ſcarſe dere timor moris timos feare ſome euyll commynge timotheus name noble capitayn athenienſes good fortune battayle paynted lienge ſlepe hauynge hym nette pitched wherin fortune taken alſo cunnynge muſitian whiche vſed take ſcholers lerned double ſalarie toke whiche neuer lerned ſayeng toke double labour ſaye make forget whiche lerned afore teache perfytely tin olde writer vſed eum tina tinia great bolle whiche full wine euery man mought drynke therof moche lyſted tinctor toris dyer tinctilis le whiche dyed tinctura dyenge tinea mothe alſo wormes bealy alſo wormes bredynge bee ſtalles tineoſus um full mothes tinge promontorie elbowe affrica tingitana parte mauritania barbaria agaynſte spayne tingo xi gere deepe thynge lycour dye colour tinnio nire rynge make ſound mettall dothe ſometyme mannes eare tinnimentum ryngyng eare man tinnunculus byrde maketh ſharpe ryngynge noyſe kynde haukes ſome place dothe brede houſes whiche voyce dryueth awaye hawkes therfore byrdes hym kepte erthen pottes couered clay hanged vp douehouſes cauſeth culuers meruaylouſly loue theyr houſe tinnulus la lum ſharpe ſounde whiche made beatynge mettall tintinaculus beateth roddes tranſgreſſour lawe tintinabulum lyttell bell tintino nare ringe lyke bell tiphernum towne italy tiphis excellent carpenter foūd fyrſt meane gouerne ſhyppe alſo rother tipula worme whiche runneth water wormes lande hath ſyxe feete tireſias poet thebe finding twoadders ingēdring togither ſtriking thē ſtaffe forthwith turned form woman leuen yeres lyke wiſe finding two ſerpentes together alſo ſtrake became eftſones man iupyter iuno contendynge gether whether man woman prone vnto lechery chaſe tireſium arbytre whiche experience bothe kyndes whoo gaue ſentence iupiters parte wherwith iuno beinge angry toke ſyghte hym iupiter comforte hym blyndeneſſe gaue part diuinitie know al done ſhoulde happen reaſon wherof great honour aunſweres eſtemed equall theym apollo tirius ryuer grecia alſo countreye hercules borne peloponeſſo nowe called morea tirinthius ſurname hercules tirinthis famouſe olde citie grecia ti tui genitiue caſe tu tiſiphone one fury helle whiche ſuppoſed tourment homicide ſleers men titanis titanidos daughter titan called alſo latona taken alſo mone titan titanus brother saturn taken ſonne tithymalus herbe called ſpourge whereof vii ſortes hauynge mylke ſharpe bytynge reade cataputia lathyris ricinum titillo ticle prouoke meue pleaſauntely titio oni fyrebrande wod whiche hath ben fyre titiuillitium ſignifyeth nothynge titubantia ſtammerynge titubo ſtacker ſpeakynge goinge man beinge drunke ſycke titubanter ſtameringly titulotenus title titulus title inſcription warke acte ſometyme dignitie alſo monument remembraunce titus name man titus liuius mooſte excellente hyſtorien wryter ſtories fountain mylke pure eloquence titonus ſonne laomedon kyng troy whome aurora tooke huſebande therfore ſhe poetes called titoni coniux tityus ſonne erthe whome poetes fayned ſlayne apollo bycauſe wolde haue rauyſſhed latona syſter therefore lyeth hell hauynge egle alwaye eatynge lyuer alſo ſayd bodye lengthe nyne furlong wytneſſe tibulle whiche poete alſo greatte louer therfore coulde lye tlepolemus kynge rhoodes whiche came battayle troye nyne ſhyppes ¶t ante tmolus mountayne lidia wheron dyd growe great plenty ſaffron vynes alſo lyttell buſhe whiche beareth floures ſaffron colour ¶t ante todi lyttell byrdes ſuppoſe byrde whiche called titmouſe toga common garment men woman called gowne bycauſe romaynes ſpecially weare garment tyme peace toga taken peace arma warre toga praetexta garmente whiche romaynes dydde afore age xvi yeres afterward worn whiche auctoritie toga polymita garment made thredes ſondry colour motley bauldekyn gata comoedia commedye enterlude wherein maners romaynes expreſſed togata gallia countraye nowe called lumbardye toga candida garmente whiche dyd weare ſued greate offyce citie rome togati apparayled gownes togatus weareth gowne tolerantia ſufferaunce toleranter pacientely toliapis ile tenet kente tolles waxynge kernell tolleno nonis wherin thyng put layde drawen vp ſometyme bucket wherwith water drawen vp tollenon engine drawe vp water hath great poyſe one ende tolero rare ſuffer endure beare lyue poorely nyghely tolerare uitam lyue maynteyne lyfe tolerabilis rabile whiche maye ſuffer beare tollo ſuſtuli ſeu tetuli tollere lyfte vppe ſette vp take away nouriſhe deferre prolonge haue chyld womā tollere clamorem crie ❀tollere criſtas ſet vp creſt applyed proude arrogant doo ſtretche vp theyr browes diſdaynefull countenaunce tolle digitum holde vp thy fynger confeſſe thy ſelfe vanquiſhed tollere gradum ſette forthe marche forthe tolle hanc patinam take awaye dyſhe verum quod erit natum tollito ſo euer borne put nouriſhynge omnes tollo ex hoc die alium diem put one day tollere mina thretten menace animos tollere proude cachinnum tollere laugh meaſure coelum tollere prayſe excedyngly toloſa citie guyen called tolouſe tolutarius tolutaris equus aumblynge horſe tolutiloquentia ſwyfte faſte ſpeche tolutim amblynge pace tolutim loqui ſpeake faſte one worde tomaculae tomacula tomacla certayne ſorte pouddynges properly ſwynes pouddynges tomentum floxe whiche ſhor • e wollen clothe alſo locke clypped whyte wolle tomices hempen cordes alſo colers whiche put carthorſes hurtynge theyr neckes tomos taken volume dyuerſe warkes oone author ſeuered ſundrye partes alſo citie countreye pontus tomyris noble queene maſſagetis scithia agaynſte whan cirus great kynge perſia came ſlayne ſonne ſhe pitchyng fyld agaynſt purpoſe hauyng great plenty vyttayles pauilions lyttell ſkyrmyſhe ſhe hoſte fledde whan cirus whyle folowed chace blowen retraicte came campe fynding greate plenty vyttayle people dyd ſo moche fylle ſelfes therwith fallynge ſleape taken queene ſlayne ſhe cauſynge great veſſell fylled bloude cirus pertians dyd caſte heade therinto ſaying bloudde thou haſt thyrſted nowe drynke therof thy fyll tonarion certayne ſhaulm ſoft ſoūd whiche old tyme ſome oratours vſed haue playe theym whan pleaded tune ſhaulme theoratour moughte moderate order pronunciation tondeo totondi tondere clyp ſheare toneſco tonui toneſcere thunder tongri duchy brabant tonimus tonamus tonitrus tonitru tonitruum thunder tonitus idem tonitruo thunder tono nare thunder make gret ſound noyſe ſpeake loude tonſae ſhepe whiche ſhorne clypped alſo ore botes ſhyppes tonſilis le whiche ſhorne clypped tonſilla poſte hauynge one ende armed yron whiche pitched erthe ende ſhyppes botes maye tyed therat tonſillae plurali diſeaſe within chekes mouthe lyke great kernelles tonſi monte hylles without woddes tonſor ronſtrix tricis ſhe clippeth ſheareth tonſorius um perteynynge clyppynge tonſtrix tricis woman barbar tonſtricula idem tonſtrina place vſe clyp barber ſhoppe tonſus um ſhorne clypped tonus tune accente alſo ſpace dyſtaunce whiche betwene erthe moone toparcha hath gouernaunce charge one countrey toparchia rule one countrey topazion topazius preciouſe ſtone colour golde tophus kynde ſtone whiche ſone reſolued ſande topiarium warke made tree buſhes brier herbes pleaſure conteyned place ſytte walke vſed box eglantine iacymine like tree thornes flexible wyll wounden topiarius maketh ſuche warkes topiaria warke topica warkes parte logike declareth place whiche argumentes maye inuented moſte properly perteyneth oratours topographia deſcription place countrey citie topper olde writer vſed ſone ſhortely quickely toral • oralium plurali numero toralia euery thynge lyeth bed ſheetes blankettes couerliddes olde tyme certayne floures ſwete herbes wounden together rope hanged place men dyd lye like nowe vſe london mydſommer hange afore theyr dores torcular aris torculare torculum preſſe wyne ſider vertiuyce torcularius um belonginge preſſe toreuma matis tereumatum warke imbored mettall ſtone toreutis grauer toreutice ce crafte grauynge tormen mini frettynge tourmente bealy guttes tormina idem tormentum tourmente engyn tourmente men generally ordinaunce perteynynge warre torminoſus hath tourmentes frettynge guttes tornacum towne called tornay tornatilis le whiche tourned whele torniamen maye nowe taken tournayment iuſtes torno torne warke whele tournours done tornus inſtrument wheele torpedo dinis ſlouthefulneſſe alſo fyſſhe whiche takynge maketh handes drawe aſtonyed deade tyme torpeo torpeſco pui torpere▪ uel torpeſcere aſtonyed ſlowe torpor poris debilitation feblinge mynde vnaptnes thynge torporo rare aſtonie make aſtonyed torquatus ringe doue ſtocke doue alſo weareth colar chayne torqueo torſi quêre wynde whirle lyke whiele ſuſteyne beare vp tourment ſpynne torquere telum throwe darte iauelyn runne rounde torquere ſaxa tourne great ſtones oculum torquere loke ſyde torque colar chayne bye golde ſiluer ſuche worne knyghtes eſquyers theyr neckes torrefacio cere broyle roſt fyre heate ſonne torrens ti ſtreame commeth downe hylles whiche cauſed moche raygne ſnowe torrens participle ſignifiethe flowynge great ſwepe torrentior flowynge greatter violence torreo rui rere idem quod • orrefacio torreſco broiled roſted dryed torridae zonae ar two girdels imagined fyrmament euery ſyde equinoctiall lyne vnder whiche gyrdels people inhabite burned ſeruente heate ſonne bycauſe ſonne abydeth longeſte thoſe ii place alſo named tropicus cancri tropicus capricorni torridus da dum dryed burned tortilis le whiche bente bowed torris ſticke fyre tortiuum uinum wyne laſte preſſe torto tare tourment vehemently tortor toris tourmentoure caſteth ſtone ſlynge tortum engin throw great ſones tortuoſus um wounden tourned many wayes tortus ta tum croked toruè toruum torua toruiter properly beholdynge ſowerly grymly toruinus apparayle woman heade torus bedde ſometyme made herbes wounden together torus brawnes armes legges fleſhe myxte ſinewes toroſus um mighty ſtronge brawnes legges armes torſio oni theodorus gaza longolius ſuppoſed ſturgion paulus iouius contrary opinyon torulus lyttell bedde toruè ſturdily loke toruitas tati ſturdines toruus ua uum cruell ſturdy lokinge toſtus ta tum toſted roſted totidem verily ſo many euen many tot many toties ſo many tymes totus ta tum hole euery whit toxicum venym poyſon ¶t ante r trbales certayne tourment trabalis le perteynynge beame trabalis clauus yron pin greate nayle wherwith beames mode faſt rafter trabea kyrtell worne kinges vnder mantelles aſtate trabica nauis ſhip made great bemes trabs trabes beame houſe trachale ouer parte fyſhe called murex purple colour made trachea weſon pype lunge trachelum myddell parte ſayle ſhyppe trachelus chine man beaſte frome heade haunche trachida trachina trachurus ſuppoſe banſtikle trachinia kynde roſes perfytely red lyke call frenche roſes traconia roughnes within eye lyddes traconitis countrey syria ioynynge arabia tractabilis treatable maye intreated tractare handell tractim length longe tyme ſpace tracto tare intreate haec arte tractabat uirum handled man craftelye ſorte alſo vſe exercyſe order gouerne tractare rationes meddell reckeninges accomptable tractorium wyndlas drawe vppe heuy thynges tractus u ſpace▪ countrey trado didi dere delyuer alſo teach commytte truſte man more opibus tradere ſet richeſſe honour per manus tradere leaue one prouinciam tradere gyue charge memoriae tradere put writynge traditio tradition traduco duxi ducere brynge frome oone place bringe ouer tranſlate one language ſometyme diſhonour traducere tempus paſſe tyme bringe vp nouriſhe traduces vynes tree trāſlated place place tragacantha thyng lyke gumme vulgarly call dragaganthum tragelaphus beaſte parte lyke harte parte lyke gote tragemata whiche commonly called bankettynge dyſhes tragice cruelly maner tragedy tragicum tueri loke grymly tragicus wryter tragedyes tragoedia tragedy whiche enterlude wherin perſonages repreſent ſome hyſtory fable lamentable crueltie myſery therin expreſſed tragoedus exercyſeth ſome parte tragedye tragonis ſiue tragion tree growynge candye lyke iunyper iuyce wherof lyke mylke waxethe thycke lyke gumme tragum lyke tyzan made weate alſo fyſhers nette called dragge tragonia herbe nowe called taragon late ſene realme whiche hath taſte lyke gynger whiche herbe layde lefte ſyde conſumeth ſplene tragopa byrde ethiopia greatter egle hath hed horne lyke gote tragopogus fyſhe called barbell tragoriganon herbe whiche ſuppoſe called peniroyal growynge wylde tragula iauelyn barbyd heade tragurium ile ſea called hadriaticū tragulam inijcere practiſe deceyte traha dray ſled drawen without wheles trahax acis couetous perſonne whiche draweth thynges vnto hym traho traxi trahere drawe leade deferre delaye extende remoue prolonge tary liue que egomet adeo cum illis unà ibidem traho ſelfe taryed longe et uos ut tutam tranquillam que fortunam traheretis mea perfeci uigilantia vygilancye broughte paſſe ye ſhoulde lyue ſure quiete proſperitie trahere diem noctem tempus paſſe daye nyght tyme rubiginem trahere waxe ruſty pallorem trahere pale diuerſum trahere bringe doubt trahere religionem make conſcience thynge traijcio ieci ijcere leade ouer carye ouer brynge ouer ſrike traiectitia pecunia moneye caried ouer ſea traiectus tus paſſage traiectio idem trallis citie lidia phrigia trallianus man citie tralucidus da dum clere man maye loke throughe trama vn vnder garmente trames mitis croſſe waye trano nare ſwymme ouer tranato tare idem tranquillè ſoftly without noyſe tranquillitas tranquillitie reſt quietnes tranquillo lare make quiete tranquillus la lum quiet reſt peaſyble tranquillum eſt fayre wether tranquillus locus good place reſt place quietnes trans ouer one place tranſactio agrement vpon communicatiō tranſactus ta tum paſſed longe agone acheued tranſalpina gallia fraunce ſyde mountaynes tranſalpinus um ouer mountaynes alpes tranſcendo dere go ouer excede traſcindo ſcidi ſcindere cut ſonder tranſcribo ſcripſi ſcribere wryte copy ſomtyme tranſlate gyue delyuer alſo tranſpoſition poſſeſſion one turne tot incaſſum fuſos patiere labores et tua dardaneis tranſcribi ſceptra colonis wylt thou turnus ſuffer thy labour loſt thy realme gyuen inhabytauntes troye tranſcurro rere runne forthe tranſcurrit aeſtas ſommer paſſed tranſcurſus u courſe tranſcurſu paſſynge forthe tranſenna loupe loke alſo wyndowe caſemente alſo rope ſtretched ſnare trappe tranſeo ſiui ſire go forthe paſſe ouer paſſe tranſire domum go home tranſeunter paſſynge ouer transfero tuli ferre cary brynge one place tranſlate oone language one poſſeſſion others tranſlatus ta tum participle transfigo xi gere thruſte tranſfuga departeth frome owne people capytayne vnto parte ennemyes ſuſpected time truce transfodio dere dygge throughe transfoſſus um digged ſtriken transfiguro rare tranſfourme turne fygure transfretatio paſſage ouer ſea transfreto tare paſſe ouer ſea transfugio gere flee place place transfugere ad hoſtes go yelde hym contrary parte transfugium yeldynge ennemies transfulgeo gere ſhyne throughe transfundo fudi fundere poure oute one veſſell alſo tranſlate frō one libentius omnes meas laudes ſi modo ſint aliquae meae laudes ad te transfuderim haue wyllyngly tourned prayſe haue prayſe vnto tranſgredior deris di paſſe go ouer beyonde excede tranſgreſſe lawe commaundemente transgreſsio fygure retoryke man leaueth princypall matter entreth thynge retourneth matter commonly call digreſſion tranſgreſſus u paſſynge ouer ſea tranſigere uitam paſſe theyr lyfe tranſigo egi igere dryue forthe treat mater agree condeſcende come poynte hapneth betwene men whiche contende ſomewhat perfourme tranſilio ſiliui ſilij ire leape ouer tranſiluania countrey beyonde hungarye wherof people ſomtyme called getae tranſitio paſſinge ouer going forth tranſitus idem transitorius um ſhortly paſſeth tranſlatio tranſlation bryngynge frome one place translego gere rede ouer tranſluceo cere ſhyne throughe tranſmarinus na num commeth beyonde ſea tranimigratio departynge goinge frome one place dwell tranſmigro grare go dwelle tranſpoſe dwellynge tranſmiſsio goinge ſendynge ouer tranſmitto miſi mittere ſende frome one place go runne quickely ſend ſhortly quickely paſſe ouer water tranſmittere mare paſſe ouer ſea tranſmittere tempus paſſe tyme tranſmittere diſcrimen eſcape danger tectū lapide tranſmittere throw ſtone houſe bellum tranſmittere commyt charge battayle one tranſmitere literas paper ſoketh inke letter maye perceyued ſyde tēpus tranſmittere paſſe forth time tranſmoueo êre remoue one place tranſnato ſwym ouer tranſnomino nare chaunge name tranſpadanus um ſyde ryuer called padus italy tranſpareo rêre ſene thinge tranſpicio ſpexi ſpicere loke throughe tranſquietus ta tum quiet reſte frome henſeforthe tranſtra tranſoms whiche go ouerwharte houſe alſo ſeates wheron ſyt whiche rowe ſhyppe bote tranſtyberinus na um whiche dwelleth beyonde riuer tiber tranſuado tranſuador ari wade ouer ſhalowe place ryuer tranſueo uexi uehere cary ouer tranſuerbero ſtrike throughe tranſuerſus um ouerthwarte ſtraight directe tranſuerſum agere tourne haſtely away purpoſe whiche man went ❀tranſuerſum unguem non diſcedere go nayle bredth prouerbe ſignifienge lyttell diſtaunce tranſuerſum digitum idem tranſuerto cere turne awrye ryght facion waye tranſuideo dêre ſe clere thinge tranſulto tare leape ouer tranſumptum whiche written recorde approued vnder kynges ſeale ſignynge iudge common lawe call exemplification ſom alſo call tranſumpte tranſumptio figure called alſo metalepſis wherby one ſignifycation gathered anther nox atra blacke nyghte gathered nox tenebricoſa darke nyght tranſuolo flee ouer leape ouer go runne beyonde place tranſumo ſumpſi ſumere take remeue one tranſuo ere ſowe throughe trapetes petum myl wherin oyle made trapeza table wheron exchaunger doth tell moneye tunici herbe whiche ſome ſuppoſe whiche bryngeth forth gylofers tunico care put iackette tunicatus weareth iacket tuopte ingenio thyne owne wytte tuor eri beholde worde vſe tura • ius ſtrete rome turbatio trouble turba multitude aſſēbly people quid illaec turba eſt numnam ego perij multitude yonder vndone euer alſo ſygnifieth trouble propter eam haec turba que abitio euenit ſake trouble dyſſencion turbaſis ſterche turbella lyttell trouble turbidè troublouſely turbidus troublous clere turbinatus ta tum rounde ſharpe lyke toppe turbino nare make ſharpe ende turbiſtum thynge myxt lykour wherewith woulle dyed whyche maketh dye ſynke woulle whereby colour made perfyte turbit thynge moche vſed nowe dayes purge fleume yet men vncertayne whatte verye turbit actuarius ſaythe rote pityuſa manardus affyrmeth turbit wherof meſue maketh mencion ſecond kynde tithymalus callyd dioſcoribes myrſinites turbit wherof serapio maketh mencion thought ſome men tripolium deſcription dioſcorides turbo bare trouble ſtere turbo binis boyſtouſe wynde whyche doth blowe downe tree howſes alſo toppe wherwith chyldren playe generally thynge whiche round brode aboue ſharpe beneth turbulentia trouble turbulentus troublous angrye fulle contention turcae people callyd turkes whiche inhabyted countray ioyned ſea callyd caſpium hylle callyd caucaſus ſome theym accompted amonge people scithia whome pomponius mela maketh mencyon dcc xxv yeres paſſed wandryng vagabunde robber waſted deſtroyed dyuers countrayes afterwarde valyaunt proweſſe chryſtyan princis tyme godfray de boloigne theyr puiſſaunce abated afterwarde yere lord mccc one othomanus tenthe solymanus nowe great tyraunt turkes ploughemans ſonne valyant ſubtylle wyt gatherynge great army vagabundes wan great countrey aſia leſſe ſo ſucceſſiuely euery one ſenſe hath increaſed domynion hauynge nowe vnder ſubietion aſiam laſſe syriam mediam meſopotamiam aegyptum greciam illiriam eueryche theſe contaynynge many greate famouſe royalmes beſides hungary yle rhodes many yles ſometyme chryſtened calle turchiam proprely named aſia minor ſomme name natoliam turdetania countray nowe callid granado turdetani turduli people countray turdus kynde byrdes ariſtotle ſayth thre ſortes one greatneſſe pye callyd greke ixiboron ixiophagon eater miſſelden leſſe quantitie thruſh greke callyd trichas thyrde lyttell greeke callyd tyla athenaeus wryteth plinius ſayth turdus ſommer ſommewhat redde wynter waxeth blacke alſo ſommer necke dyuerſe colour winter one colour maketh neſt claye toppe tree ſome doo ſuppoſe byrde whyche callyd ouſell black byrde turdus alſo fyſhe callyd greke cichle lyuing among ſtones rockes leſſe foote length hath iiii fynnes beſydes hyndermoſte fynne fygure lyke tenche colour ruſſette hauyng bealye whyche beareth towre elephant turritus ta tum hygh alſo towred fulle towres alſo name ydolle whyche callyd mother goddis turtur turis byrde callyd turtell alſo fyſhe callyd trigon turundae pellettes chaumber hauynge windowes thre partes therof receyue heate ſonne zenith word belongynge coſmography ſignifyeth poynte firmament directely ouer crowne mannes heade ſo euer zereth hebrewe meaſure whiche handbrede zeugma fygure wherby many ſentences ar ioyned together one verbe ne que e catlina ut te aut pudor à turpitudine aur metus à periculo aut ratio furore reuocarit ne thou art ſuche man catilyne call egiptians wander euery realme horrible theues zigarum countrey whenſe ſayde people come zizania cockle w •• che groweth corne zinziber gynger ¶z ante zodiacus cercle 〈◊〉 heuen wherin 〈◊〉 xii ſygnes zographia pyctur •• beaſtes zoilus poete enu •• homerus therfore enuiers well ••• ned men called zoili zoelicum certayne flaxe commet •• 〈◊〉 spayne wherof threde made n • tt • take byrdes zomos gruell zona gyrdell zonatim compaſſe aboute zopiſſa pitche taken ſhyppes whiche tempred waxe ſalte efficacie pitche zopyron herbe whiche ſome ſuppoſe pulyol mountayne zopyrus manne whiche phiſnomye knewe euery mannes condicions whan beholdyng socrates iudged hym vnthrifty therfore ſcorned many men socrates anſwered zopyrus deceyued dede ben ſuche one ſayth philoſophy ſubdued nature alſo zopirus noble perſian ſeruaunt darius whiche whan citie babylon rebelled agaynſt king darius made longe warre▪ could ſubdue vnwares man cutte owne noſe wounded ſelfe fled babylon ſayinge kynge ſoo diſfygured hym bycauſe perſwaded hym haue peace babylonian whiche herynge made theyr chiefe capitain lyttel lyttel declaring ſtrength kynge howe mought indudure long agaynſt laſte cauſed ſubmit ſelues kynge receyue citie wherfore darius wont ſaye hadde leauer haue one zopyrus twenty babylon zoroanda ryuer whiche great water tigris maketh one ſyde mountayne taurus zoroaſtes fyrſte fynder magike ¶z ante v ¶zura bearies white thorne ¶z ante ¶zygia pipe wherin men dyd play weddynges zythus drynke made barley ſodden may taken ale biere ☞ finis dictionarii ❧ lvcrecia romana thomas bertheletvs ❧ londini ❧
